Title: Data Analyst
Description:
In a nutshell.

You'll be a key person in unravelling complex analytical questions, from feature validation to fraud detection and more. Working together in a small team of data professionals, you'll transform raw data into actionable insights, present them to stakeholders and drive business change.

The role.

Check was founded to make cities more liveable by offering the easiest way around town. Our entirely in-house built platform offers more than half a million users in more than 15 Dutch cities access to thousands of mopeds and cars. To improve our offering, make our operations more efficient and to identify other opportunities to improve the value created at Check, we base our decisions on data.

As a Data Analyst you will be an essential actor in supporting and enabling these data-driven decisions, using various tools & techniques.

You'll be part of Check's Product Team. The Product Team builds and maintains Check's entire platform. This includes the user facing apps, internal tools and the Check Data Platform. You'll be working on analytical requests that are prioritised by the Product Owner. You'll work together with an experienced Data Engineer who will mentor and support you.

You're core responsibilities will be:


Identify, measure and report on key business metrics (KPIs) that help monitor performance of Check and support decision-making
Give actionable insights to complex problems, including statistical analyses for all business departments, such as Finance, Growth or Public Affairs
Present results in a comprehensive, attractive and understandable way
Improve data literacy at Check by sharing best practices and improving data quality and accessibility


Requirements.

What you will bring:


0-2 years experience as a Data Analyst or a comparable position
Experience with SQL is a prerequisite, working with a modern data warehouse (Redshift, BigQuery, Snowflake or similar)
Basic programming knowledge (Python)
Knowledge of statistical analysis
Knows how to present results using tools like Tableau, Superset, PowerBI or similar


Nice to haves:


Experience with Python-based dataframe libraries (Polars, Pandas, etc)
Knowledge of dbt or willingness to learn


Sponsorship possibilities.

Check offers a visa sponsorship for non-EU applicants. This ONLY applies to applicants that are already residing in The Netherlands.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Join a dynamic consultancy at the forefront of leveraging data to drive impactful insights and innovations across various sectors. As a Data Analyst at our clientâ€™s company, you will play a major role in transforming raw data into actionable strategies for some of the most influential organizations in banking, government, and non-profit sectors in the Netherlands. Their work spans from enhancing financial security to streamlining governmental processes and empowering non-profits to maximize their outreach.




Your Role




As a Data Analyst, you will harness your expertise in data analysis and visualization to uncover critical insights from customer data. Your responsibilities will include




Developing clear and insightful visualizations to facilitate decision-making.
Collaborating closely with clients to understand their needs and deliver tailored solutions.
Proposing enhancements to data quality and infrastructure to sustainably maximize data value.
Engaging with both business stakeholders and IT teams to ensure alignment and effectiveness of data initiatives.




Ideal Candidate




A minimum of 2 years in complex data environments.
Proficiency in tools like Tableau, Power BI, Oracle BI, Python, and/or R.
Strong familiarity with SQL and data-related concepts such as ETL, data modeling, and data visualization.
A degree in a relevant field and a passion for turning data into actionable insights.
Dutch speaker




The good part




A competitive salary starting from â‚¬3500 gross per month, depending on experience
Monthly & Annual performance bonuses
Pension plan.
Mobility allowance or company car
Up to 27 days of vacation annually
A lovely work environment where your ideas directly impact success of the company
Opportunities for career advancement and personal development in a flat organizational structure




Do you see yourself in the job description?




Apply directly or send your CV at g.apostolou@jeffersonfrank.com

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst (CRM Specialisation)




As Data Analyst with CRM Specialisation, you will contribute to the success of the Sales & Marketing teams of Everfield's portfolio across Europe:

Use your experience in Sales & Marketing analytics to present actionable insights to our Sales & Marketing teams (HQ & Portfolio).
Work with implementation partners and portfolio companies to ensure CRM systems are implemented in alignment with Everfield standards.
Cooperate with Data Engineers to create sustainable data pipelines from various CRM systems.




The company:

Everfield is a platform with a mission in acquiring, building and operating vertical market and specialist software companies, focused on European businesses. We invest in and provide support and best practices to software companies in order for them to live up to their full potential by offering a very established approach to promote growth.




Everfield seeks to deliver innovation and growth to its acquired companies by providing best practices and operational support to help identify opportunities and install proven methodologies to accelerate customer and market share. Everfield is located throughout Europe, with offices in UK, Germany, the Netherlands, France, Poland, Spain, and Latvia.




The team:

You will join the Business Intelligence (BI) team as the fourth member. Currently the team consists of two Data Engineers and a hands-on team lead. The BI team creates value for various stakeholders (CEO, Finance, COO, Sales, Marketing, and Everfieldâ€™s portfolio companies), by creating insights, delivering analysis, automating reporting processes and improving data quality.




The team builds pipelines with Synapse to ingest the data into our data platform, uses Databricks for data transformation and Power BI for data visualization. For analytics the team also uses SQL.




The scope of the team is expected to scale with the companyâ€™s growth and maturity level. Everfield will scale from 16 portfolio companies currently, to approximately 90 companies in the next 4 years.




Responsibilities:

Requirements gathering

Align with key stakeholders to understand reporting requirements
Create feature development and communication plans

Data Analysis

Perform Sales & Marketing analysis such as Cohort, Funnel, Pipeline coverage analyses, Revenue forecasting, etc.

Data Visualization

Design proof of concept solutions to showcase new features with shortened feedback loop
Create and maintain Power BI reports used by hundreds of users

Data Ingestion, Verification and Validation

Extract raw data from upstream sources
Improving data quality and efficiencyâ€‹

Data modelling and Transformation

Build data systems and pipelinesâ€‹ based on a medallion architecture

Structure sales processes

Go beyond the data and work together with Everfieldâ€™s Sales Lead to structure sales processes in the portfolio companies
Support portfolio companies in implementing Everfieldâ€™s suggested data structure on CRMs and ensure consistency of definitions across the portfolio




Ideal candidate profile:

The position requires a self-starting personality, that fits into an environment that is characterised by entrepreneurship and has a customer centric approach.
The candidate will have at least 3 years of experience within an international or complex environment and the right drive and ambition to make the difference.
Experienced with Sales analysis and business partnership with sales teams.
Relevant experience with Synapse or Azure Data Factory and Databricks is a plus-point.
Knowledge and hands on experience with Python (PySpark, Pandas).
Experienced with data modelling.
Experience with working in a DevOps team, following a structured, iterative Agile development process.
Fluent in English.
Above all, a great colleague, enthusiastic, approachable, honest, committed, result focused, a team player who wants to achieve the best results together.




Whatâ€™s in it for you?

Grow your career in a fast-paced and growing organization.
Enable exponential growth by designing a world class data platform.
Working with the latest Data Analytics & Data Visualisation technologies.
Long term career opportunities.
Working closer to leadership teams within the Head Quarters and Portfolio.
Flexible work environment with offices around Europe (Netherlands, UK, Spain, France, Poland, Germany).




Continue the conversation

Interested? We would love to hear from you!




Apply now with your CV and if you are selected our Talent Acquisition colleague will contact you to schedule the 1st call and start our hiring process.

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
Job Description: In this role, you will be the key link between Commercial and Finance teams. You will be the Subject Matter Expert responsible for Sales Force Metrics and Performance & KPI tracking. You will also coordinate contract management in collaboration with Sales, Legal, and the EMEA contract management team. Your role involves providing sales, volume, and financial analysis to evaluate business opportunities and generate market intelligence presentations for internal and external use. Occasionally, you may join customer meetings as a consultant. You should possess strong business acumen, combined with analytical and local thinking, to translate data into actionable commercial strategies and reports.




Responsibilities:

Act as the local admin and champion for Salesforce (SFDC).
Gather and share market data and insights (GFK) to detect and share market opportunities.
Conduct commercial customer analysis on category, channel, distribution, and product.
Provide in-depth analysis for Strategic Partner Accounts.
Coordinate and follow up on contract management.
Process third-party sell-out data and update the Customer Performance Dashboard (Excel).
Collaborate closely with National Sales Managers (NSMs) to support SFDC KPI metrics and performance reporting.
Provide volume and financial analysis to evaluate financial results.
Create toolkits for field sales representatives to enhance business opportunities.
Analyze the market for new products and trends, identifying opportunities and potential threats.
Support and implement regional and local strategies with the Benelux commercial team.
Work with Marketing on campaign processes, registration, and tracking.
Handle customer contract administration with local Key Account Management and regional headquarters to ensure a smooth contract process.
Manage and maintain the CRM system as the admin for Salesforce (territory management, user setup, data validation, managing sales reps, reporting, and dashboards).
Handle customer segmentation from a finance perspective, in consultation with the regional manager.
Consult with the EMEA team about data quality and make necessary changes (Cognos, SFDC, Oracle).
Produce ad-hoc reports as needed.




Candidate Profile:

Start as soon as possible, with a one-year contract and potential for permanent hire.
36-40 hours per week.
1-3 years of experience;
Strong knowledge and experience with Excel are a must.
Experience with Salesforce, SQL, and/or Tableau is a plus.
Reports to the Business Controller.
Salary between â‚¬45,000 and â‚¬65,000 depending on experience, with an annual performance bonus of approximately 10%.
30 vacation days.
Background in economics/finance.
Team player who enjoys being in the office, proactive, good at data interpretation and presentation, and enjoys interacting with colleagues and stakeholders.
Fluent in Dutch.
Hybrid work model: 3 days in the office, 2 days at home.
Affinity with medical devices is considered a plus.




Qualifications:

Hard Skills:

Experience with Business and financial analysis
Superior Excel skills (pivot tables, macros, lookups, sum if, complex link files)
Database management (Cognos and preferably Tableau)
Project management
Computer skills (word processing, spreadsheet, database tools, design tools, and presentation/chart applications)
Salesforce
Forecasting and statistical modeling
Advanced database and Excel skills
Cognos reporting and Hyperion (training can be provided)
Relevant degree (business/management/economics/finance)

Soft Skills:

Effective communication across all levels
High accuracy and attention to detail
Fluent in Dutch and English
Commercial mindset
Excellent analytical skills
Ability to work under pressure and meet deadlines
Ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously
Teamwork and collaboration
Proactive and self-motivated
Adaptability and flexibility




Desired Skills and Experience

Excel (pivot tables, macros, lookups)

Salesforce (SFDC)

SQL

Tableau

Cognos

Oracle

Hyperion

Title: Product Data Analyst
Description:
Catch the Goodhabitz sparkle

Welcome to GoodHabitz, one of the fastest-growing international Ed-Tech companies in Europe. Our mission? To make learning as accessible, engaging, and fun as binge-watching your favorite series, scrolling through your news feed, or watching your team score a winning goal. How do we do it? We craft unique training experiences now available in 20 countries worldwide, all produced in-house at the GoodHabitz Studios. But we're not all work and no play. We invest in fun outings and events, ensuring our team has the time of their lives.

Behind the scenes, we're a team of goal-driven individuals who thrive on mutual inspiration and support. We're positive, creative masterminds always looking on the bright side, eager to tackle every challenge that comes our way.

The challenge

Welcome to the world of data insights at our dynamic organization! As a Product Data Analyst, you're not just crunching numbers; you're steering the ship by deciphering the intricate details of our product. Ready to dive into the heart of strategic decision-making? Let's break down your journey:

What You'll Do ðŸŽ¯


Data Discovery: Dive into colossal datasets, unraveling the magic behind our SaaS product metrics. Create dashboards that tell tales of user behavior and product performance. Provide actionable insights and recommendations to drive product strategy and decision-making.
Data Guardian: Your mission? Ensure the harmony of information from our platform data and CRM data, and every nook and cranny. You're not just a data guardian; you're the one setting the standards, making data integrity a company-wide anthem
Teamwork Trailblazer: In your journey, you're not alone. Engage with Product Managers, Designers and Developers. Be the storyteller, presenting insights that resonate with data aficionados and rookies alike
Continuous Thrills: Being a perfection seeker, you'll spot areas for improvement. Recommendations based on data revelations? That's your specialty. Stay ahead of the curve with the coolest data tools and industry best practices



Requirements

This role is a perfect match for you because ...


Your Toolkit: Hold a Bachelor's or Master's degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Business Management, Computer Science, or a related field. It's your academic armor!
Experience Expedition: Navigate the data landscape with at least three years of data analysis experience in a product environment, preferably in the SaaS realm. You've got a trail of insights behind you.
SQL Sorcery: Speak the language of data with proficiency in SQL. Tableau is your go-to Business Intelligence tool for day to day analytics.
Analytical Jedi Skills: Your analytical lightsaber is sharp, coupled with critical thinking and problem-solving prowess. You have a good understanding of Google Analytics.
Communication Charisma: Your ability to narrate the data story is unparalleled. Excellent communication and presentation skills are your secret weapons
Language Proficiency: Fluency in English. You speak the global language of insights. Bonus points if you are acquainted with Dutch
Solo Explorer and Team Trailblazer: Whether wandering the data wilderness alone or part of a cross-functional team, you're a force to be reckoned with



Benefits

Join us, and you'll become a valued part of a lively and dynamic team. We nurture a flexible and supportive work culture that strikes the perfect balance between your professional life and your well-deserved downtime. Step into our magical office space (yes, it even features a campfire!), fully equipped with all the tools and resources to empower you. Prepare for unforgettable team-building experiences and company events that will leave you inspired. And, of course, we've got your back with complimentary coffee and snacks to keep you energized.

Here's a glimpse of what's waiting for you


A competitive salary package that rewards your hard work
25 paid vacation days. And if that's not enough, you can add up to 10 more
A world of growth and development opportunities to enhance your skills. You'll have unlimited access to our treasure trove of GoodHabitz resources and MyAcademy
Access to mental coaching through our partner, OpenUp, to keep your mind in top shape
An annual do-good-day, fully paid, so you can contribute to a cause you're passionate about
Travel and expense reimbursement because we've got your journey covered
Pension and disability insurance, securing your financial well-being in the long run
A hybrid way of working
A work from anywhere policy after your first year;
Working in a company that welcomes artificial intelligence and uses it to improve internal processes and push AI-powered features quickly
No non-technical managers! Have a manager who gets it, who inspires and leads the way as a champion for engineering excellence
MacBook Pro


Ready to take the next step in your career and join a team that's as vibrant as it is supportive? We can't wait to have you on board!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst

Haarlem/Hybrid




As a Data Analyst/Engineer, you work with customer data to uncover valuable insights. Your goal is to visualize and present these insights in the most comprehensible way, ensuring that even those unfamiliar with data can understand. Your contributions drive the success of strategies and aid companies in their growth and innovation.




You propose improvements to the data landscape and data quality, aiming to create sustainable value in both the short and long term. You foster connections within the client's organization, engaging with both business and IT sectors. You swiftly identify which data analyses will be valuable, producing realistic and actionable insights.




If you thrive in a data-rich environment and enjoy extracting value from vast datasets, this role will suit you perfectly.




You have:

At least 2 years of experience as a Data Analyst in complex data environments.
A keen eye for detail and a passion for accuracy.
Strong communication skills and the ability to understand customer needs.
Experience with data analytics and visualization tools such as Tableau, Power BI, Qlik, Oracle BI, Python, and R.
Familiarity with ETL, data modeling, data quality, and data visualization.
Proficiency in SQL.
Fluency in Dutch.




We offer a career with growth prospects within a vibrant community of enthusiasts. Your work directly impacts both our organization and our clients, giving you significant responsibility in a challenging role where passion and the opportunity to enhance the 'Customer Experience' through data analysis are key. We are a flat organization where everyone knows each other and fun is a priority.




We offer:

24 vacation days per year (increasing to 27).
A monthly performance bonus.
Eligibility for an annual bonus.
A solid pension plan.
A company car or mobility scheme.
An annual trip abroad!

Title: Data Visualization Analyst
Description:
Company Overview

Join WorldACD, a thriving and dynamic company on the forefront of the air cargo industry. We are expanding and seeking highly motivated individuals to be part of our growing team. As a Data Visualization Analyst, you will play a crucial role in our data team. Based in the vibrant center of Amsterdam, WorldACD operates in a fascinating international environment, collecting, analyzing, and publishing market data about air cargo worldwide. As the world's largest air cargo market database manager, we are ambitious to further grow our benchmark information services and product portfolio, serving customers on all continents and engaging with diverse cultures.Â 




Position Overview

We are looking for a skilled Data Visualization Analyst who is passionate about transforming complex data into actionable insights through compelling visualizations. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in data analysis, visualization tools, and storytelling, with the ability to communicate effectively with stakeholders across all levels of the organization.




Responsibilities

Clean, prepare, and analyze large datasets to extract meaningful insights.
Design and develop interactive dashboards, reports, and visualizations using tools such as Tableau and Power BI including using DAX and/or VizQL.
Translate business requirements into intuitive and visually appealing visualizations that convey key insights.
Stay up-to-date with industry trends and best practices in data visualization and analytics.

QualificationsÂ 

Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Statistics, or a related field, is preferred.
Enthusiastic and intrinsically motivated, Creative thinker.
Eye for detail, and passionate about design.
Excellent visual skills, including demonstrable design knowledge, such as layout, colour and design.
Structured, analytical approach to problem-solving and a high attention to detail.
Proven experience as a Data Visualization Analyst or similar role.
Proficiency in data visualization tools such as Tableau/Power BI including sheet swapping and other advanced techniques.
Strong analytical skills with the ability to translate complex data into actionable insights.
Excellent communication and storytelling abilities, with a keen eye for design and aesthetics.
Experience of programming in languages such as C#/Javascript and/or experience with database queries and SQL is a bonus.

Â 

Benefitsâ€¯Â 

Active in a fascinating & dynamic international environment.
Competitive salary and benefits package.
Serving customers on all continents, dealing with a wide variety of cultures.
Ambitious to further grow its benchmark information services and products portfolio.
Office in the city center of Amsterdam.




How to Apply

If you are passionate about data visualization and thrive in a dynamic, collaborative environment, we encourage you to apply for the Data Visualization Analyst position at WorldACD. Please submit your resume and a (short) cover letter outlining your relevant experience and why you are a good fit for the role. We look forward to hearing from you!

Title: Marketing Data Analyst
Description:
Description

Ring Europe is looking for a talented marketing analyst, capable of discovering new data insights, designing key KPIs, creating impactful data visualization and bringing our marketing analytics to the next level.

As our Marketing analyst, you will be responsible for key analytical projects and business intelligence in the marketing domain. You will have hands-on experience in digital marketing platforms such as Google, Meta and Bing and are knowledgeable about the latest developments in SEO and digital ads in the industry. You are a marketer at heart but you are also a data expert, writing complex database queries to explore internal / external data sources in order to validate business hypotheses.

This role resides in the BI and Analytics team. You will closely co-work with the Marketing and Business Development teams, along with other business stakeholders, ensuring that Ring optimises its marketing investment to achieve the best return.

Key job responsibilities

Working closely with the marketing, web analytics and business development teams, you will solve unique analytical problems and find answers to questions that require tenacious problem-solving skills and creativity.

What You'll Do


Enhance existing marketing measurement and design KPIs to best measure marketing effectiveness and budget efficiency
Collaborate closely with the marketing team to dive deep into areas such as SEO, funnel analysis and attribution models that will enhance marketing performance using data analytics; then make actionable recommendations
Research industry best practices, the latest tracking trends (such as cookies) and analytical measurement tools
Create and maintain marketing-related Tableau dashboards
Work with the data engineering team to maintain and enhance the internal marketing data platform and data models
Explore and review internal and external marketing data sources to ensure data quality; devise mechanisms and tools to monitor data integrity on a large scale
Conduct ad hoc research and root cause analyses in fields such as user behaviour and web traffic
Assist with preparing quarterly business review documents
Coordinate & facilitate data supply to CMO


Basic Qualifications


Experience in tax, finance or a related analytical field
Experience in Excel (including VBA, pivot tables, array functions, power pivots, etc.) and data visualization tools such as Tableau
Experience in business or financial analysis
Bachelor's degree or equivalent
Experience defining requirements and using data and metrics to draw business insights
Experience with Excel
Experience with SQL
Experience making business recommendations and influencing stakeholders


Preferred Qualifications


Experience in financial/business analysis


Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy_page) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.


Company - Ring of Security B.V.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data (Marketing) Analyst-Betting Company- SaaS- Hybrid- Amsterdam- 60k




My client is the premier destination for sports betting and the ultimate online (live) casino experience in the Netherlands. As pioneers in the industry, they are committed to reshaping entertainment while maintaining responsible gambling. Their goal is to create an environment where players can enjoy themselves responsibly without losing control.




Keywords: SQL, Python, GCP, Marketing Mix Models, B2C, Stakeholder Management, Analytical Skills.




An exciting opportunity awaits a Data Analyst to have a significant impact on attracting more consumers through online marketing campaigns in an Amsterdam-based online betting company. Collaborate closely with the Head of Data Analytics, who is enthusiastic about sharing knowledge with you.




In this role, you will be responsible for analyzing dashboards and data to understand where the customers are coming from and how to retain them. You will work on marketing mix models and marketing touch attribution to optimize our marketing strategies and improve player engagement.




The IT infrastructure is state-of-the-art, utilizing all that Google has to offer, including Google Analytics, cloud resources, and data warehousing. Your responsibilities include analyzing, building, and automating new solutions.




Requirements:

3+ years of experience in data analysis (SQL & Python)
Strong analytical mindset
Good communication skills and stakeholder management
Preferably experience working in a B2C environment




Benefits

Salary up to â‚¬60k
Travel allowance
27 vacation days
Hybrid work environment
Flat organizational structure
Social drinks and lunch events




Interested? Contact me via glenn@doghouse-recruitment.nl




Unfortunately, No Visa Sponsorship / Client is not IND registered yet

Title: Junior Data Analyst - MeMoÂ²
Description:
We go beyond the obvious, using intelligence, passion and creativity to inspire new thinking and shape the world we live in.

To start a career that is out of the ordinary, please apply...

Job Details

Junior Data Analyst (MeMoÂ² - Groningen)

Do you have experience with Python for data analytics and want to learn more about marketing and media effectiveness studies?

Then come join a young team of data professionals that provides MeMoÂ² (a Kantar Company) with marketing and market research insights!

The team youâ€™ll be joining is responsible for data analytics within MeMoÂ². MeMoÂ² is a marketing and media consulting company that offers streamlined, fully integrated, and highly automated brand and cross-media effectiveness measurement products to a large number of Dutch and international brands, such as Uber, Asics and Heineken.

As a (Junior) Data Analyst, youâ€™ll utilize our custom Python data analytics framework and packages to conduct analyses and visualize findings. We are looking for a pro-active and curious person, who will not only support with the analyses, but will also actively participate in refining and enhancing our data analytics framework to boost efficiency, accuracy, and overall productivity.

Please note that this position is based in Groningen.

Your Responsibilities


Conduct analyses in Python using our custom data analytics framework.
Visualise data using PowerBI dashboards and revamp existing ones for optimal functionality.
Improve the data analytics framework to decrease error rate and increase productivity.
Become an expert in Python data analytics and our custom data analytics framework and packages.
Provide our internal stakeholders with marketing and media effectiveness insights.


Your profile


Experience with Python for data analytics and relevant packages (pandas, NumPy, etc).
Demonstrable technical affinity and ability or background (e.g. through school/study, work experience or personal projects).
Experience with data visualization tools is a plus (PowerBI or similar).
Fluent in English and/or Dutch.


Our offer


Small and cozy office at a canal in the city center of Groningen with a view of the Martini Tower.
Extensive lunch is taken care of at the office (and drinks on Friday).
Full-time contract.


Interested?

Send us your application including your CV and motivation letter. For any additional questions you can reach out to Jeroen Turksema (+ 31 6 48 09 70 98) or to our recruiter Anne-Lise Bosmans (Anne-Lise.Bosmans@Kantar.com).

Location

Amsterdam, AmsteldijkNetherlands

Kantar Rewards Statement

At Kantar we have an integrated way of rewarding our people based around a simple, clear and consistent set of principles. Our approach helps to ensure we are market competitive and also to support a pay for performance culture, where your reward and career progression opportunities are linked to what you deliver.

We go beyond the obvious, using intelligence, passion and creativity to inspire new thinking and shape the world we live in. Apply for a career thatâ€™s out of the ordinary and join us.

We want to create an equality of opportunity in a fair and supportive working environment where people feel included, accepted and are allowed to flourish in a space where their mental health and well being is taken into consideration.

We want to create a more diverse community to expand our talent pool, be locally representative, drive diversity of thinking and better commercial outcomes.

Kantar is the worldâ€™s leading data, insights and consulting company. We understand more about how people think, feel, shop, share, vote and view than anyone else. Combining our expertise in human understanding with advanced technologies, Kantarâ€™s 30,000 people help the worldâ€™s leading organisations succeed and grow.

Title: Data Analyst
HTML:
• Collaborate with Data Engineers and Integration Engineers: Serve as a crucial link between business needs and technical execution, engaging with both organisational stakeholders and engineering teams;
  • Understand, document, and communicate stakeholder requirements. Use strong communication skills to translate business needs into actionable insights;
  • Manage the Jira backlog, including epics and user stories. Refine stories, make design decisions, and develop action plans to ensure successful delivery;
  • Maintain effective communication with geographically dispersed teams in Romania and Spain through daily stand-ups and regular updates;
  • Qualify data requests, collaborate with data engineers to extract and model data, and develop dashboards using tools such as Tableau or PowerBI. Design reports and visualisations that meet organisational needs.
Functie-eisen
  • Extensive knowledge of SQL;
  • Experience with PowerBI or Tableau;
  • Ability to interact with both the business and engineers;
  • Able to create Relational diagrams;
  • Experience of Dimensional modelling; 
  • Experience with extracting data from various sources (ETL/ELT) and able to read/understand queries;
  • Able to take ownership but also to set boundaries;
  • Fluent in English and the willingness to learn Dutch.  
Arbeidsvoorwaarden
  • Salary up to 5.500 gross a month based on experience and 40 hours a week;
  • 28 holidays;
  • Hybrid working possibilities;
  • 8,3% holiday allowance;
  • Professional coaching and access to our learning platform. 
Sollicitatieprocedure Wil je meer informatie of heb je vragen over deze vacature neem dan contact op met Fabian Joosten via fabian.joosten@experis.nl of bel 0031628931837.Bedrijfsomschrijving

This enterprise focuses on HR solutions that they provide to various organizations. They aim to become more data-driven, and you, as a motivated and enthusiastic Data Analyst, will help achieve this goal.

As a Data Analyst, you will join a data team of 10 people who work closely with colleagues in Spain, Romania, and Latvia. In these countries, you'll primarily collaborate with Data Engineers and Integration Engineers. Here you'll serve as a critical link between business needs and technical execution, engaging significantly with both organisational stakeholders and engineering teams.

You will spend about 40% of your time interacting with stakeholders to understand, document, and communicate their requirements. This requires strong communication skills to translate business needs into actionable insights.

Another 40% you are interacting with engineers by managing the Jira backlog, which includes epics and user stories. You'll refine these stories, make design decisions, and develop action plans to ensure successful delivery. Effective communication with geographically dispersed teams in Romania and Spain is crucial, facilitated through daily stand-ups and regular updates.

The rest of your duties involve creating dashboards using tools like Tableau or PowerBI. You will qualify data requests, collaborate with data engineers to extract and model data, and then develop dashboards from this structured information. This includes designing reports and visualisations that meet organisational needs.

Title: Business Data Analist
Description:
Business Analist Controlling

Een baan waarbij je direct in de kern van het bedrijf zit, kunt werken met Big Data en mooie dashboards. Wij hebben een vacature voor een Business Analist Controlling op de afdeling Commercial Control, Margin Control & Pricing waarbij al deze aspecten aan bod komen. En nog veel meer!







Dit ga je doen

De focus van je job ligt op business en data analyse betreffende de omzet van DHL eCommerce Benelux op totaal en op detail niveau. Het mooiste aan je werk? Je werkt mee om het bedrijf financieel nog sterker te maken. Dat doe je door:

â€¢ Beoordelen van de kwaliteit van beschikbare data en informatie vanuit de bronsystemen en platformen en het signaleren van afwijkingen.

â€¢ Ontwikkelen en verbeteren van dashboards en rapportages met betrekking tot de volledigheid en kwaliteit van de omzet en ter ondersteuning van het management.

â€¢ Vertalen van de aanwezige data en informatie naar (voor Finance relevante) intelligence.

â€¢ Beoordelen van de kwaliteit van de tarifering van onze producten.

â€¢ Doen van voorstellen om de geconstateerde issues op te lossen en te voorkomen. Hiertoe zet je acties uit bij sales en facturatie.

â€¢ Medeverantwoordelijk voor informatievoorziening van de afdeling CMCP, en daarmee indirect voor de belangrijke stakeholders zoals Sales, Finance en General management.







Jouw nieuwe werkplek

Je rapporteert rechtstreeks aan de Director Commercial Control. Het team bestaat met jou erbij uit 15 personen. Een divers team van business controlling, analyse en pricing specialisten, dat nauw samenwerkt met diverse stakeholders, onder andere met de afdelingen sales en product development. Je begeeft je in een data-intensieve wereld waarbij jij het verschil kan maken!




Jij bepaalt zelf waar je jouw laptop openklapt. Er is altijd plek voor je op een van de locaties of op het hoofdkantoor. In ieder geval, waar je ook werkt: we luisteren Ã¡ltijd naar wat je te zeggen hebt. Hoe meer perspectieven en meningen we horen, hoe beter we daar allemaal van worden. Zo hebben we als organisatie dit jaar het certificaat Great Place to Work gekregen. Deze certificering is 100% gebaseerd op feedback van medewerkers.




Dit ben jij

Het omgaan met complexe vraagstukken/ analyses is voor jou een uitdaging en data analyse is jouw ding! Jij bent initiatief nemend en streeft ernaar om continu verbeteringen door te voeren. Daarnaast heb jij alle vrijheid om nieuwe ideeÃ«n en initiatieven in te brengen en te ontwikkelen. Dit wordt dan ook volop gestimuleerd. Je beschikt over organisatiesensitiviteit en kan goed inschatten wat de perspectieven van andere belanghebbenden zijn. Je bent klantgericht en het onderhouden van management relaties is een kracht van je. Je hebt affiniteit met het transformeren van data tot informatie (data warehouse) en als je ervaring hebt met Dashboarding en Business Intelligence is dat zeker een pre.




Verder heb jij:

â€¢ Een afgeronde hbo of wo opleiding (bij voorkeur richting bedrijfseconomie / Finance);

â€¢ 1 a 2 jaar relevante werkervaring, bij voorkeur in een Finance omgeving;

â€¢ Uitstekende taalvaardigheid in het Nederlands en Engels;

â€¢ Gedegen ervaring met MS Office met nadruk op Excel en ervaring met SQL en MS Power BI is een pre.










Dit krijg jij

Een uitdagende rol, binnen een sterk groeiende organisatie. Bouw jij de komende jaren mee aan de verdere ontwikkeling van DHL eCommerce? Dan bieden wij jou:

â€¢ Een startsalaris tussen â‚¬ 3200,- en â‚¬ 3600,- bruto per maand, afhankelijk van jouw kennis en ervaring;

â€¢ Standaard 23 vakantiedagen en een cao a la carte, waarbij je een je extra budget kunt inzetten voor vrije dagen, salaris of opleiding;

â€¢ En andere aantrekkelijke voorwaarden, zoals een bonusregeling, pensioen- en ziektekostenregeling, een fietsplan en korting bij onze klanten;

â€¢ De mogelijkheid om flexibel en thuis te werken te werken, waarbij de standplaats ons hoofdkantoor in Utrecht zal zijn;

â€¢ Kansen en mogelijkheden voor ontwikkeling en doorgroei, zowel nationaal- als internationaal!







Solliciteren?

Bij interesse ontvangen we graag je CV en motivatiebrief. We zullen daarna zo snel mogelijk contact met je opnemen.

HTML:
Business Analist Controlling

Een baan waarbij je direct in de kern van het bedrijf zit, kunt werken met Big Data en mooie dashboards. Wij hebben een vacature voor een Business Analist Controlling op de afdeling Commercial Control, Margin Control & Pricing waarbij al deze aspecten aan bod komen. En nog veel meer!



Dit ga je doen

De focus van je job ligt op business en data analyse betreffende de omzet van DHL eCommerce Benelux op totaal en op detail niveau. Het mooiste aan je werk? Je werkt mee om het bedrijf financieel nog sterker te maken. Dat doe je door:

â€¢ Beoordelen van de kwaliteit van beschikbare data en informatie vanuit de bronsystemen en platformen en het signaleren van afwijkingen.

â€¢ Ontwikkelen en verbeteren van dashboards en rapportages met betrekking tot de volledigheid en kwaliteit van de omzet en ter ondersteuning van het management.

â€¢ Vertalen van de aanwezige data en informatie naar (voor Finance relevante) intelligence.

â€¢ Beoordelen van de kwaliteit van de tarifering van onze producten.

â€¢ Doen van voorstellen om de geconstateerde issues op te lossen en te voorkomen. Hiertoe zet je acties uit bij sales en facturatie.

â€¢ Medeverantwoordelijk voor informatievoorziening van de afdeling CMCP, en daarmee indirect voor de belangrijke stakeholders zoals Sales, Finance en General management.



Jouw nieuwe werkplek

Je rapporteert rechtstreeks aan de Director Commercial Control. Het team bestaat met jou erbij uit 15 personen. Een divers team van business controlling, analyse en pricing specialisten, dat nauw samenwerkt met diverse stakeholders, onder andere met de afdelingen sales en product development. Je begeeft je in een data-intensieve wereld waarbij jij het verschil kan maken!


Jij bepaalt zelf waar je jouw laptop openklapt. Er is altijd plek voor je op een van de locaties of op het hoofdkantoor. In ieder geval, waar je ook werkt: we luisteren Ã¡ltijd naar wat je te zeggen hebt. Hoe meer perspectieven en meningen we horen, hoe beter we daar allemaal van worden. Zo hebben we als organisatie dit jaar het certificaat Great Place to Work gekregen. Deze certificering is 100% gebaseerd op feedback van medewerkers.


Dit ben jij

Het omgaan met complexe vraagstukken/ analyses is voor jou een uitdaging en data analyse is jouw ding! Jij bent initiatief nemend en streeft ernaar om continu verbeteringen door te voeren. Daarnaast heb jij alle vrijheid om nieuwe ideeÃ«n en initiatieven in te brengen en te ontwikkelen. Dit wordt dan ook volop gestimuleerd. Je beschikt over organisatiesensitiviteit en kan goed inschatten wat de perspectieven van andere belanghebbenden zijn. Je hebt affiniteit met het transformeren van data tot informatie (data warehouse) en als je ervaring hebt met Dashboarding en Business Intelligence is dat zeker een pre.

â€¢ 1 a 2 jaar relevante werkervaring, bij voorkeur in een Finance omgeving;

â€¢ Uitstekende taalvaardigheid in het Nederlands en Engels;

â€¢ Gedegen ervaring met MS Office met nadruk op Excel en ervaring met SQL en MS Power BI is een pre.




Dit krijg jij

Een uitdagende rol, binnen een sterk groeiende organisatie. Bouw jij de komende jaren mee aan de verdere ontwikkeling van DHL eCommerce? Dan bieden wij jou:

â€¢ Een startsalaris tussen â‚¬ 3200,- en â‚¬ 3600,- bruto per maand, afhankelijk van jouw kennis en ervaring;

â€¢ Standaard 23 vakantiedagen en een cao a la carte, waarbij je een je extra budget kunt inzetten voor vrije dagen, salaris of opleiding;

Title: Marketing Data Analyst
Description:
Data (Marketing) Analyst-Betting Company- SaaS- Hybrid- Amsterdam- 60k




My client is the premier destination for sports betting and the ultimate online (live) casino experience in the Netherlands. As pioneers in the industry, they are committed to reshaping entertainment while maintaining responsible gambling. Their goal is to create an environment where players can enjoy themselves responsibly without losing control.




Keywords: SQL, Python, GCP, Marketing Mix Models, B2C, Stakeholder Management, Analytical Skills.




An exciting opportunity awaits a Data Analyst to have a significant impact on attracting more consumers through online marketing campaigns in an Amsterdam-based online betting company. Collaborate closely with the Head of Data Analytics, who is enthusiastic about sharing knowledge with you.




In this role, you will be responsible for analyzing dashboards and data to understand where the customers are coming from and how to retain them. You will work on marketing mix models and marketing touch attribution to optimize our marketing strategies and improve player engagement.




The IT infrastructure is state-of-the-art, utilizing all that Google has to offer, including Google Analytics, cloud resources, and data warehousing. Your responsibilities include analyzing, building, and automating new solutions.




Requirements:

3+ years of experience in data analysis (SQL & Python)
Strong analytical mindset
Good communication skills and stakeholder management
Preferably experience working in a B2C environment




Benefits

Salary up to â‚¬60k
Travel allowance
27 vacation days
Hybrid work environment
Flat organizational structure
Social drinks and lunch events




Interested? Contact me via glenn@doghouse-recruitment.nl




Unfortunately, No Visa Sponsorship / Client is not IND registered yet

Title: Transportation Data Analyst (Citymapper)
Description:
At Citymapper (powered by Via), weâ€™re on a mission to help make complex cities more accessible to everyday users. Our application transports millions of people in hundreds of cities around the world by giving them access to the most current and sophisticated transportation options available. We make getting around your favorite city easy, so that you can enjoy the ride.

As a Transportation Data Analyst at Citymapper, you will be managing the data that is the backbone of our applicationâ€™s success. Y our work directly impacts our user experience, and is the difference between a user seeing a bus drive away, or reaching it just in time. Millions of users around the world trust our application to be on time for work, a job interview, or a date - and we take great responsibility in fulfilling that need.

This job can be done remotely if you're based in England, the Netherlands, Germany or Bulgaria. If you prefer hybrid, we have offices in London, Berlin, Paris, Amsterdam, and Sofia.

What You'll Do:


You will help to manage the timetable data that powers the Citymapper application. Using proprietary tools and methods, you will transform often messy transit schedules into shiny and reliable user information.
You will build, validate and ship data to production on a daily basis.
You will manage data in a range of cities and across different formats.
You will work with our engineers to build for scale by improving tools and automating tasks.
You will ensure data quality in our web and mobile products so that users continue to love and trust Citymapper.


Who You Are:


You have a passion for public transportation and cities, and an interest in how public transportation networks operate.
You are comfortable dealing with large data sets, and have an eagerness to learn new data skills.
You take a hands-on, practical, pragmatic attitude to your work.
You have exceptional attention to detail, and an ability to communicate those details to other collaborators.
You have up to 3 years of experience working with data, Python and/or common transit data formats (GTFS, TransXChange, Siri, Hafas, etc).


Compensation and Benefits:


Becoming part of Via, a company that was awarded for its commitment to social good
Joining the team working on the industry-leading mobile app that is loved and trusted by millions of users
State of the art hardware for you to perform your work worry free
Ongoing support and training to ensure you have the resources you need to thrive and progress in your career
A hybrid or remote work model. Remote work is possible if you're based in one of these countries: England, Germany or Netherlands
Competitive compensation
Monthly health stipend
25 vacation days


Weâ€™re Via, and we build technology that changes the way the world moves. We pioneered the TransitTech category to ensure that the future of transportation is shared, dynamic public mobility â€” the kind that reduces carbon emissions across congested cities, minimizes reliance on private cars, and provides everyone with accessible, efficient, and affordable ways of getting around.

We created the first end-to-end TransitTech solution for cities and transit agencies, offering world-class software, service design, and operational expertise to fundamentally improve the way the world moves.

Via was founded with the guiding principle that we go further when we go together. We are dedicated to building a diverse, inclusive and authentic workplace. If youâ€™re excited about this role but your past experience doesnâ€™t align perfectly with every qualification in the job description, we encourage you to apply anyways. You may be just the right candidate for this or other roles. All backgrounds, identities, and voices are welcomed and celebrated at Via.

Ready to join the ride?

Via is an equal opportunity employer.

Title: Data Analist
Description:
Dit is zijn wij.

MyParcel is een energiek, snelgroeiend bedrijf dat innovatieve online software ontwikkelt die het logistieke proces voor online ondernemers gemakkelijker maakt. Daarnaast helpen we onze klanten bij uiteenlopende logistieke en e-commerce gerelateerde vraagstukken, zodat zij weer door kunnen met waar ze goed in zijn: ondernemen. We houden het simpel. Maken het slim. Dit doen we samen. Wij zijn MyParcel en wij gaan beyond delivery. Meer weten over MyParcel? Klik hier. Wat je in ieder geval moet weten is dat de markt waarin wij ons bevinden dynamisch en continu in ontwikkeling is. Wij dus ook! Klinkt dat jou als muziek in de oren? Dan zoeken we jou.




De functie.

Als Data Analist heb je een centrale plek binnen MyParcel. Je zorgt ervoor dat alle afdelingen, ons management team en onze klanten voorzien worden van de juiste inzichten en rapportages. Je leert hierdoor het hele bedrijf kennen, van Finance tot Customer Service. Daarnaast vertaal je de beschikbare data naar waardevolle inzichten voor onze klanten.

Je hebt de beschikking over meer dan tien verschillende databronnen die allemaal zijn aangesloten op ons datawarehouse in Snowflake. Op basis hiervan maak je uitgebreide analyses. Vervolgens visualiseer je deze in de BI-tool Looker, om de verschillende afdelingen te adviseren en MyParcel datagedreven te laten functioneren.




Wat vragen wij van jou?

Je werkt met tientallen miljoenen datapunten.
Je maakt betekenisvolle rapportages met Looker.
Je beheert de dashboards voor onze 40.000 klanten in het platform met Luzmo.
Je bewaakt de datakwaliteit in Snowflake.
Je koppelt nieuwe databronnen door middel van Fivetran.
Je modelleert brondata door middel van SQL en dbt.
Je voert experimenten en analyses uit in Python.
Je denkt mee met verschillende afdelingen om problemen inzichtelijk te maken en processen te vergemakkelijken.




Profiel.

Je hebt een relevante opleiding afgerond en/of relevante werkervaring.
Je hebt kennis van SQL, kennis van dbt en Snowflake is een prÃ©.
Je hebt interesse in e-commerce.
Je toont initiatief en vindt het leuk om ergens helemaal in te duiken.
Je hebt zin om in een team nieuwe inzichten te creÃ«ren voor een snelgroeiend bedrijf.
Je bent 32 â€“ 40 uur per week beschikbaar.
Je bent op zoek naar een uitdagende werkomgeving.




Voldoe je niet aan alle functie-eisen, maar heb je andere ervaringen, kwaliteiten of competenties die jou zeker geschikt maken voor deze rol? Dan zien we jouw sollicitatie, waarin je ons daarvan overtuigt, alsnog graag tegemoet!




Wij groeien en jij groeit met ons mee.

We streven er continu naar de beste en meest persoonlijke service te bieden voor onze klanten in een professionele maar ongedwongen werksfeer, waarin we altijd openstaan voor nieuwe ideeÃ«n. Benieuwd naar wat wij jou kunnen bieden?




We bieden een ambitieuze en ook leuke werkomgeving waar volop ruimte is voor persoonlijke ontwikkeling.
Passend salaris en genoeg doorgroeimogelijkheden binnen ons functiehuis.
Mogelijkheid om (gedeeltelijk) thuis te werken.
25 vakantiedagen per jaar.
Baan voor 32-40 uur per week.
Kans op een eindejaarsgratificatie o.b.v. onze doelstellingen.
Je hebt verschillende opleidingsmogelijkheden.
Een NS-Business Card die al jouw reiskosten dekt.
Elke dag vers fruit en een lekkere lunch.
Macbook van de zaak.




Werken als Data Analist in Hoofddorp?

Stuur direct je CV en motivatie naar vacatures@myparcel.nl onder vermelding van de functietitel. Voor eventuele vragen over de functie en de procedure kun je mailen naar vacatures@myparcel.nl.

Voldoe je niet aan alle functie-eisen, maar heb je andere ervaringen, kwaliteiten of competenties die jou zeker geschikt maken voor deze rol? Dan zien we jouw sollicitatie, waarin je ons daarvan overtuigt, alsnog graag tegemoet!


Wij groeien en jij groeit met ons mee.

We streven er continu naar de beste en meest persoonlijke service te bieden voor onze klanten in een professionele maar ongedwongen werksfeer, waarin we altijd openstaan voor nieuwe ideeÃ«n. Benieuwd naar wat wij jou kunnen bieden?


  • We bieden een ambitieuze en ook leuke werkomgeving waar volop ruimte is voor persoonlijke ontwikkeling.
  • Passend salaris en genoeg doorgroeimogelijkheden binnen ons functiehuis.
  • Mogelijkheid om (gedeeltelijk) thuis te werken.
  • 25 vakantiedagen per jaar.
  • Baan voor 32-40 uur per week.
  • Kans op een eindejaarsgratificatie o.b.v. onze doelstellingen.
  • Je hebt verschillende opleidingsmogelijkheden.
  • Een NS-Business Card die al jouw reiskosten dekt.
  • Elke dag vers fruit en een lekkere lunch.
  • Macbook van de zaak.


Werken als Data Analist in Hoofddorp?

Stuur direct je CV en motivatie naar vacatures@myparcel.nl onder vermelding van de functietitel. Voor eventuele vragen over de functie en de procedure kun je mailen naar vacatures@myparcel.nl.

Title: Data-analist
Description:
Will you be the data analyst who leads Viking to new insights and are you looking for a varied job where your insight and expertise really make a difference? Then Viking is looking for you!




Job description

The purchasing & assortment insights team plays a crucial role in translating the available data into insightful management information. Think for example of root-cause analyses where giving appropriate advice is also desirable.




Do you want to work for a leading expert in the field of suitable workplaces? This multinational offers everything for optimal workplaces and prides itself on its innovative and collaborative culture.




The purchasing & assortment insights team at Viking is looking for reinforcement in the form of a data analyst. Together with two other colleagues you will mainly be problem solving in a dynamic adhoc environment, where your analytical skills play a crucial role.




For the most part, you will arrive at new and keen insights through data. You will be expected to be both reactive and proactive with this. You do all this for about 200 stakeholders, so no day will be the same!




Curious about more? Then contact us soon!




Job requirements

The position involves:

- HBO working and thinking level;

- Several years of relevant work experience or related study with internship experience;

- Good knowledge of SQL skills, PowerBI is desirable;

- Good knowledge of the English language, in speech and writing.




Are you unsure if you fit the stated profile? Then contact us without obligation!







Employment conditions

At Viking, you can count on a comprehensive primary and secondary benefits package. Some of their conditions include:




- Competitive salary between â‚¬3,000 and â‚¬3,800 based on 40 hours;

- Directly on contract with Viking;

- Enjoy no less than 36 days of leave per year;

- Flexible working hours and the ability to work from home;

- Full travel reimbursement and good accessibility by public transportation.

- Attractive pension plan with minimum employee contribution.

- Access to unlimited digital learning opportunities through the GoodHabitz learning platform.

- Discounts on various products, insurances, sports activities and much more.




Join Viking and discover the benefits of working in a dynamic and supportive environment!




Culture

"It's all about our people"

Title: Data-analist
HTML:
Bij Roompot Landal GreenParks geloven we dat data de sleutel is tot nieuwe kansen en een katalysator voor innovatie. Door deel te nemen aan ons vooruitstrevende team, zullen jouw inzichten een cruciale rol spelen in het vormgeven van onze strategische initiatieven en het stimuleren van zakelijke groei. Als je enthousiast bent om jouw analytische expertise toe te passen in een dynamische omgeving, is deze rol op maat voor jou gemaakt.


De Data Analist bevordert data-gedreven besluitvorming door het analyseren, construeren en publiceren van inzichten met behulp van geavanceerde Business Intelligence-tools voor analyse, dashboards en rapportage. Deze rol fungeert als een brug tussen business en IT, vertaalt zakelijke vereisten naar IT (BI) oplossingen met behulp van diverse analyse- en rapportagetools. De Data Analist begrijpt en benut Landal-datasets, stelt standaarden en sjablonen vast en promoot de oplossingen bij de business en key users. De Data Analist rapporteert aan de Team Lead IT Application Development.


Daarnaast ontdekt en verkent de Data Analist kansen voor nieuwe inzichten door projectmatige samenwerking met de business, en zorgt zo voor verbeterde data-geÃ¯nformeerde besluitvorming. Deze positie omvat zowel ontwikkelings- als adviesrollen.

Verder ben je verantwoordelijk voor:


  • Het verfijnen van user stories met betrekking tot de inzichten en rapporten die nodig zijn voor Landal Business Users, met focus op zowel strategische als tactische niveaus. De Business Users omvatten de Raad van Bestuur en afdelingsmanagement;
  • Het opstellen van rapporten en dashboards met behulp van geavanceerde tools om de nodige inzichten te bieden, volgens de agile werkwijze van het team;
  • Het adviseren van de Business Users over het gebruik en de interpretatie van analytische tools en resultaten;
  • Het promoten en uitleggen van dashboards en BI-oplossingen aan Business Users en Key Users;
  • Het introduceren en gebruiken van sjablonen en standaarden voor de Landal rapportage- en analyseomgeving;
  • Het identificeren en verkennen van kansen voor nieuwe inzichten;
  • Het mede verantwoordelijk zijn voor de optimale inrichting, efficiÃ«nt gebruik en continue ontwikkeling van onze data- en analyseomgeving;
  • Het fungeren als schakel tussen IT en de business om nieuwe kansen te ontwikkelen en te implementeren.


Wat vragen wij:

  • Bachelor- of masterdiploma in een kwantitatief georiÃ«nteerd vakgebied zoals Informatica, Business Information Management, Computer Science, Engineering of een verwant vakgebied van een gerenommeerde instelling in Nederland of daarbuiten;
  • Kennis en ervaring met SQL, Data Modeling (Kimball) en Semantic Models is een harde eis;
  • Aantoonbare expertise als Data Analist, met een sterke achtergrond in het opvragen en analyseren van uitgebreide datasets;
  • In staat om effectief te communiceren met zowel business als IT, de behoeften en prioriteiten van beide te begrijpen en de communicatiekloof tussen hen te overbruggen. In staat om zakelijke behoeften te vertalen naar BI-oplossingen;
  • Bekwaam in het begrijpen en analyseren van kritische (complexe) data en vraagstukken door logisch redeneren, het identificeren van oorzaken, het leggen van verbindingen, het overwegen van verschillende perspectieven en het onderscheiden van hoofd- en bijzaken;
  • Sterke expertise in het bieden van analyse en rapportage met behulp van tools zoals Power BI, DBT, Databricks, Power Apps of vergelijkbaar;
  • Ervaring met het verbinden en benutten van data voor dashboarding, met begrip van dataverhoudingen;
  • Ervaring met het creÃ«ren van uitgebreide bedrijfsrapporten en dashboards.


Wat wij bieden

  • Een jaarcontract met een proeftijd van een maand, met mogelijkheid tot vast dienstverband;
  • Bonusregeling;
  • 27 vakantiedagen, met de optie om 10 extra dagen bij te kopen;
  • Flexibele werktijden en mogelijkheden voor remote werken;
  • Thuiswerkvergoeding van â‚¬2,35 per thuiswerkdag;
  • Reiskostenvergoeding van â‚¬0,23 per kilometer, of volledige dekking voor openbaar vervoer;
  • Uitgebreide trainingsmogelijkheden, zowel online (150+ e-learnings) als offline;
  • Deelname aan het Recreatie Pensioenfonds, pensioenleeftijd 67 jaar, met premies gelijk verdeeld;
  • Betaald aanvullend ouderschapsverlof en zwangerschapsverlof;
  • Diverse collectieve verzekeringen, waaronder een doorlopende reisverzekering voor jou en je gezin;
  • Gunstige werknemerskorting op boekingen.


Roompot Landal GreenParks

Wij zijn Roompot Landal GreenParks, de marktleider in de vakantieparken- en recreatiebranche. Met meer dan 300 prachtige vakantieparken in 11 landen, bieden we een breed scala aan accommodaties, van vakantiehuizen en bungalows tot campings. Onze gezinsvriendelijke parken beschikken over uitgebreide recreatieve voorzieningen, sportactiviteiten, entertainment en eetgelegenheden. Ons doel is om gasten een onvergetelijke vakantie-ervaring te bieden in een prachtige, natuurlijke omgeving.

Title: Data-analist
Description:
Data Analist bij Tremoot

Bij Tremoot zijn we op zoek naar een ervaren Data Analist met uitgebreide ervaring in Power BI. Als je gepassioneerd bent over data visualisatie en graag werkt in een dynamische omgeving waar kwaliteit en privacy/security hoog in het vaandel staan, dan is deze rol perfect voor jou.




Waarom Tremoot?

Platte Organisatie: Geniet van directe en duidelijke communicatie.
Cultuur: Maak deel uit van een nieuwsgierig, betrokken en persoonlijk team. Voel je thuis!
Ontwikkeling: We benadrukken groei en ondersteunen voortdurende certificering en kennisdeling.
Plezier: Doe mee aan leuke teamuitjes en regelmatige bijeenkomsten die de teamgeest versterken!
Diversiteit en Inclusie: Ervaar een levendige mix van culturen met ons team van expats en externe medewerkers.
Gemeenschap: Bij Tremoot ben je meer dan alleen een medewerker - je bent een essentieel onderdeel van onze levendige gemeenschap.




Wat bieden wij?

Contract: Een vaste rol binnen een vooruitstrevend team.
Salaris: Competitief salaris dat past bij je ervaring en vaardigheden.
Reiskostenvergoeding: NS-businesskaart voor je reisbehoeften.
Vakantiedagen: 25 vakantiedagen om te ontspannen en op te laden.
Technologie: Je ontvangt een bedrijfslaptop voor professioneel gebruik.
Leren: Profiteer van een jaarlijks budget van â‚¬1000 voor professionele ontwikkeling.




Jouw Rol als Data Analist:

Ontwikkelen en onderhouden van datavisualisaties en rapportages met Power BI en Power BI Report Builder.
Samenwerken in Agile/Scrum teams om projecten te realiseren die voldoen aan de hoogste normen van kwaliteit en privacy/security.
Analyseren van data om inzichten te verschaffen die strategische besluitvorming ondersteunen.




Wat heb je nodig?

Minimaal 2 jaar ervaring.
Ervaring met data analyse en visualistie met PowerBI en PowerBI Report Builder.
Bekend met Agile en Scrum en kunt dit in de praktijk toepassen.
Nauwkeurig werkend, met oog voor kwaliteit en privacy/security aspecten.
Beheersing van de Nederlandse taal in woord en geschrift.
HBO werk- en denkniveau.




GeÃ¯nteresseerd?

Ben je klaar voor een nieuwe uitdaging en wil je deel uitmaken van een vooruitstrevend team? Solliciteer nu bij Tremoot! We kijken ernaar uit om je aan boord te verwelkomen en zien uit naar jouw bijdrage aan onze gemeenschap!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst (100% Remote - EU)

Remote Working (within EU)

12-Month Fixed-Term Contract

Up to â‚¬65,000 per annum

I am partnering with a leading Bioscience client in the Netherlands who is committed to revolutionizing healthcare through cutting-edge research and innovation. They are seeking a talented Data Analyst to join their dynamic team and contribute to impactful projects that drive their mission forward.

Key Skills And Responsibilities

As a Data Analyst, you will play a crucial role in transforming data into actionable insights. You will work remotely within the EU, collaborating with cross-functional teams to support data-driven decision-making processes. Your expertise in Power BI, BigQuery, Looker, and SQL will be essential in developing and maintaining dashboards, performing complex data analyses, and providing strategic recommendations.


Develop, design, and maintain interactive dashboards and reports using Power BI, BigQuery, and Looker.
Conduct in-depth data analyses to identify trends, patterns, and insights.
Collaborate with stakeholders to understand business requirements and translate them into analytical solutions.
Ensure data accuracy and integrity through rigorous validation and quality checks.
Optimise and streamline data processes for efficiency and effectiveness.
Communicate findings and recommendations to non-technical stakeholders clearly and concisely.


Must-Have


Minimum 2-3 years of experience in Data Analytics within a highly driven environment.
Proficiency in Power BI, BigQuery, Looker, and SQL.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
Fluent English (written/spoken)
Ability to work independently and remotely while managing multiple tasks and deadlines.
Experience in the Bioscience or healthcare sector is a plus.


If you are passionate about data analytics and eager to make a difference in the Bioscience sector, I would love to hear from you! Please submit your CV detailing your experience and fit for this role as soon as possible. Only EU candidates need apply-100% Remote for EU Candidates only.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Your data management skills have an impact on our 9.5 million customers.

You and your job

As a Data Analyst working on SPOT you are the primary contact with our stakeholders, which are mostly consumers of the data in your data warehouse. You guide consumers in the usage of the data, validate new requirements of the business stakeholders and guide the (IT-) implementation of new initiatives. The Data Analyst represents customer and end-user concerns by gathering input from stakeholders to understand the problem to be solved. You may also help to identify potential areas of automation and support or advise the business in re-engineering the underlying business process.

Practical examples


You will take responsibility for data elements for their end-to-end usage across the enterprise
You do not involve just a single role but include a network of people with accountabilities for ensuring that all aspects of an effective data environment are being accomplished
You will tackle various data related issues and you will work on global and cross functional change projects to improve our processes and systems


Facts & figures


36 per week as standard (other options can be discussed)
43,822 Rabobank colleagues around the world


Example Responsibilities


You monitor, validate and where needed correct the data provided by your data warehouse.
You focus on ensuring BCBS239 compliancy.
You define data requirements and give input to project scope/objectives through research, fact finding and elicitation with a solid understanding of business, systems, and requirements.
You provide high impact (strategic and tactical) advice for the Product Owner.
You participate in testing of changes against requirements.
You represent the department and your team and act as a liaison between regulator and/or business needs, and the actual data.
You develop and maintain knowledge of business analysis and business requirements.
You continuously work to increase knowledge of and to be familiar with best practices.
You work with business users to ensure they can understand the data model and can use it to meet their needs


Together we achieve more than alone

Collaboration is at the heart of everything we do. Our team brings talented people together from various nationalities and backgrounds. As our colleague you will tackle various data related issues and play a role in global and cross domain efforts to improve our processes and systems.

We believe in the power of difference. Bringing together people's differences is what makes us an even better bank. So we are very curious about what you can bring to our team within Chapter Data.

Joris, Data Analyst: â€œWorking as a Data Analyst for our teams in on our new data warehousing means working with data in an international environment during a large strategic transition. This involves the implementation of regulatory requirements, adherence to compliance and data management standards. Next to that accurately and timely processing of the data is key for meeting the reporting deadlines of our stakeholders.â€

Our chapter brings a diverse, talented group of people to manage and develop the financial data platform of Rabobank. Working together is the way we work; as 1 data-minded team at Rabobank.

Talking of Rabobank: We are a Dutch bank that operates in 38 countries for over 9,5000,000 customers. Together with these customers, our members and partners we stand side by side to create a world in which everyone has access to enough healthy food. In the Netherlands we work to create a country in which people are happy with how they live, work and do business.

You and your talent


You have at least a Masters degree in Economics, Finance, Business Administration or a related (quantitative) field
You have knowledge of a range of banking products, preferably demonstrated by an industry qualification such as CFA or FRM
You have 3+ years of relevant banking experience within the financial industries sector
You have strong analytical and conceptual skills (databases, data warehouses and SQL)
You have knowledge of databases, data warehouses and SQL
You have knowledge of data management principles and how to implement them
You have strong communication skills in English, both spoken and written


This Is What We Offer You


a gross salary between â‚¬ 3.711 and â‚¬ 7,307.58 (scale 8, 9 or 10 depending on experience)
thirteenth month's salary and 8% holiday allowance
an extra budget of 11% of your gross salary to be used at your discretion. Buy extra holiday hours, add more to your pension savings or ask for part of the extra budget to be paid out
a pension scheme to which you contribute 5.5%


This is a selection of the terms of employment for a Data Analyst based on a 36-hour working week. You can find all terms of employment on rabobank.jobs/en/conditions-of-employment.

You and the job application process

We look forward to your response to the vacancy of Data Analyst at Rabobank.


Any questions about the job content? Contact: Ryan Bartlett, Chapter Lead via Ryan.Bartlett@rabobank.com. Any questions about working at Rabobank and the process? Contact: Lex Verwayen, Recruiter via Lex.Verwayen@rabobank.nl
You can find answers to the most frequently asked questions on rabobank.jobs/nl/veelgestelde-vragen.
A security check is part of the process.
We respect your privacy


#rabobank #data

Title: Senior Analyst - Consumer Data
Description:
Who We Are:

Since 1906, New Balance has empowered people through sport and craftsmanship to create positive change in communities around the world. We innovate fearlessly, guided by our core values and driven by the belief that conventions were meant to be challenged. We foster a culture in which every associate feels welcomed and respected, where leaders and creatives are inspired to shape the world of tomorrow by taking bold action today. At New Balance, We Got Now.

This role will leverage our customer data warehouse, providing analytics solutions to a range of stakeholders including eCommerce, marketing, retail, planning and allocation, and strategy. Working alongside a digital analytics specialist, this role will identify new segmentation opportunities and help execute deployment across the marketing technology stack. The Sr Analyst will also be responsible for demand reporting within DTC channels and identify opportunities to improve the flow of data between systems, onboarding new sources and tools where necessary and coordinating with privacy and legal to ensure GDPR compliance.

JOB MISSION:

The Senior Analyst, Consumer Analytics will be responsible for analytics projects and customer data initiatives that leverage first-party consumer insights to drive regional business operations.

This role will leverage our customer data warehouse, providing analytics solutions to a range of stakeholders including eCommerce, marketing, retail, planning and allocation, and strategy. Working alongside a digital analytics specialist, this role will identify new segmentation opportunities and help implement deployment across the marketing technology stack. The senior analyst will also be responsible for demand reporting within DTC channels and finding opportunities to improve the flow of data between systems, onboarding new sources and tools where necessary, and coordinating with privacy and legal to ensure GDPR compliance.

MAJOR ACCOUNTABILITIES:


Conduct analyses of existing first-party customer data to deepen our connection with consumers and drive segmentation opportunities.
Work with regional partners and a global IT team to improve capabilities of customer data capture, data warehousing, and actionability of data strategy.
Create automated reporting solutions that enable more efficient ways of working for regional eCommerce teams (trading, marketing, operations).
Validate and coordinate data flows within the marketing technology stack including data warehouse, CDP, and CRM systems.
Identify new opportunities to solve regional challenges with existing customer data, and roadmap solutions to incorporate new customer data where necessary.
Translate complex analytics principles into concise, clear, and actionable outcomes.


REQUIREMENTS FOR SUCCESS:


Several years of professional experience in consumer insights, digital analytics, or business intelligence.
Strong analytical, financial, and problem-solving skills. Highly comfortable with demonstrating data to drive decisions and tell a story.
Foundational knowledge of predictive and statistical modelling techniques to segment customer data and experience using Python or R for statistical analysis.
Experience with PowerBI and DAX/M to create dashboards and reports.
Command of SQL and principles of database architecture required, with experience in Snowflake and BigQuery preferred.
Experience with a modern digital marketing technology stack.
Experience working with partners at multiple levels within an organization (operations, marketing, finance, privacy, etc.).
Willing to take action self-starter who can set strategy and drive execution with a â€œroll up the sleevesâ€ approach.
Ability to translate business challenges into analytics projects and communicate insights to key partners.
Bachelorâ€™s degree, preferably in Business Analytics, Economics, Computer Science, Mathematics, Marketing, or a related field.
Passionate about the brand with a deep appreciation for the product and understanding of the customerâ€™s experience.


BENEFITS:


Discretionary Bonus Opportunity
Discount on the health insurance
8% holiday allowance
Flexible Working Hours
Pension Scheme
25 days Annual Leave per year
Up to â‚¬250 travel allowance each month
Hybrid working
Employee Discount
Work from-home allowance
Home working equipment
Sports subscription via OneFit
Opportunity to work abroad for four weeks per year
Wellbeing and Mental Health Benefit (24/7 Employment Assistance Program & Support)


Equal Opportunity Employer:

New Balance is committed to equality of opportunity for all current and prospective associates regardless of age, disability, race, religion or belief, gender, sexual orientation, pregnancy and maternity, marriage and civil partnership and gender reassignment. We are an equal opportunity employer and support a culture of diversity and inclusion.

If you have not already done so, please let us know if you require any support so we can make the right adjustments and considerations should they be required.
