Title: Senior Analyst - Consumer Data
Description:
Who We Are:

Since 1906, New Balance has empowered people through sport and craftsmanship to create positive change in communities around the world. We innovate fearlessly, guided by our core values and driven by the belief that conventions were meant to be challenged. We foster a culture in which every associate feels welcomed and respected, where leaders and creatives are inspired to shape the world of tomorrow by taking bold action today. At New Balance, We Got Now.

This role will leverage our customer data warehouse, providing analytics solutions to a range of stakeholders including eCommerce, marketing, retail, planning and allocation, and strategy. Working alongside a digital analytics specialist, this role will identify new segmentation opportunities and help execute deployment across the marketing technology stack. The Sr Analyst will also be responsible for demand reporting within DTC channels and identify opportunities to improve the flow of data between systems, onboarding new sources and tools where necessary and coordinating with privacy and legal to ensure GDPR compliance.

JOB MISSION:

The Senior Analyst, Consumer Analytics will be responsible for analytics projects and customer data initiatives that leverage first-party consumer insights to drive regional business operations.

This role will leverage our customer data warehouse, providing analytics solutions to a range of stakeholders including eCommerce, marketing, retail, planning and allocation, and strategy. Working alongside a digital analytics specialist, this role will identify new segmentation opportunities and help implement deployment across the marketing technology stack. The senior analyst will also be responsible for demand reporting within DTC channels and finding opportunities to improve the flow of data between systems, onboarding new sources and tools where necessary, and coordinating with privacy and legal to ensure GDPR compliance.

MAJOR ACCOUNTABILITIES:


Conduct analyses of existing first-party customer data to deepen our connection with consumers and drive segmentation opportunities.
Work with regional partners and a global IT team to improve capabilities of customer data capture, data warehousing, and actionability of data strategy.
Create automated reporting solutions that enable more efficient ways of working for regional eCommerce teams (trading, marketing, operations).
Validate and coordinate data flows within the marketing technology stack including data warehouse, CDP, and CRM systems.
Identify new opportunities to solve regional challenges with existing customer data, and roadmap solutions to incorporate new customer data where necessary.
Translate complex analytics principles into concise, clear, and actionable outcomes.


REQUIREMENTS FOR SUCCESS:


Several years of professional experience in consumer insights, digital analytics, or business intelligence.
Strong analytical, financial, and problem-solving skills. Highly comfortable with demonstrating data to drive decisions and tell a story.
Foundational knowledge of predictive and statistical modelling techniques to segment customer data and experience using Python or R for statistical analysis.
Experience with PowerBI and DAX/M to create dashboards and reports.
Command of SQL and principles of database architecture required, with experience in Snowflake and BigQuery preferred.
Experience with a modern digital marketing technology stack.
Experience working with partners at multiple levels within an organization (operations, marketing, finance, privacy, etc.).
Willing to take action self-starter who can set strategy and drive execution with a â€œroll up the sleevesâ€ approach.
Ability to translate business challenges into analytics projects and communicate insights to key partners.
Bachelorâ€™s degree, preferably in Business Analytics, Economics, Computer Science, Mathematics, Marketing, or a related field.
Passionate about the brand with a deep appreciation for the product and understanding of the customerâ€™s experience.


BENEFITS:


Discretionary Bonus Opportunity
Discount on the health insurance
8% holiday allowance
Flexible Working Hours
Pension Scheme
25 days Annual Leave per year
Up to â‚¬250 travel allowance each month
Hybrid working
Employee Discount
Work from-home allowance
Home working equipment
Sports subscription via OneFit
Opportunity to work abroad for four weeks per year
Wellbeing and Mental Health Benefit (24/7 Employment Assistance Program & Support)


Equal Opportunity Employer:

New Balance is committed to equality of opportunity for all current and prospective associates regardless of age, disability, race, religion or belief, gender, sexual orientation, pregnancy and maternity, marriage and civil partnership and gender reassignment. We are an equal opportunity employer and support a culture of diversity and inclusion.

If you have not already done so, please let us know if you require any support so we can make the right adjustments and considerations should they be required.

Title: Supply Chain Data Analist
HTML:
Voor Abbott zijn wij op zoek naar een Supply Chain Data Analist


De functie

Je bent gedreven in het maken, analyseren en omzetten van data sets naar samenhangende informatie en dashboards. Met deze informatie worden overzichtelijke en heldere strategische rapportages, adviezen en presentaties gemaakt voor senior leadership, Corporate en Commercial. Je maakt gebruik van geavanceerde Excel bestanden, Power BI-dashboards en -oplossingen die continue door jou worden verbeterd en gedocumenteerd. Daarnaast optimaliseer en ontwikkel je nieuwe analysemethoden en modellen. Je hebt een nauwe samenwerking met de Business Modellers en Program Managers. Ook het periodiek aanvullen van databases met data, behoort tot Ã©Ã©n van jouw taken. Je levert een bijdrage aan verschillende projecten, waaronder de centralisatie van data-informatie en de overgang naar een nieuw softwarepakket. In deze software transitie zal jij onder andere de huidig gebruikte Excel files omzetten naar nieuwe formats. Je rapporteert aan de Director Sourcing & Capacity Planning.


Jouw profiel

Je bent een creatieve data cruncher, die grote data sets kan omtoveren tot bruikbare sturingsinformatie waarmee trends, scenarioâ€™s en relaties inzichtelijk kunnen worden gemaakt. Je wordt uitgedaagd door het creÃ«ren van geavanceerde Excel files. Excel en Power BI hebben geen geheimen voor jou. Van nieuwe methoden en tools (machine learning /Microsoft AI) maak jij gretig gebruik. Uiteraard vind je het prettig om nauw samen te werken met jouw collegaâ€™s en stakeholders. Als zelfsturende data professional krijg je vrijheid en ruimte om deze functie naar jouw eigen hand te zetten.

  • Een afgerond HBO- of WO-opleiding is een vereiste, bijvoorbeeld richting Supply Chain, Wiskunde, Engineering, ICT, Econometrie;
  • 3 â€“ 6 jaar ervaring met analysetechnieken en data-management in bij voorkeur een complexe internationale (supply chain) omgeving;
  • Excellente kennis en ervaring met Excel en Power BI (DAX is prÃ©);
  • De Engelse taal beheers je uitstekend.


Over Abbott

Abbott is een wereldwijd opererende â€˜health care companyâ€™ die toonaangevend is in het ontwikkelen van voedingsproducten, diagnostiek en medische- en farmaceutische producten. Abbott Nutrition is een van de divisies van deze multinational en heeft haar hoofdkantoor in Chicago. De afdeling Sourcing and Capacity Planning ondersteunt de business en senior management met samenhangende en inzichtelijke informatie, waarmee mogelijke scenarioâ€™s nader kunnen worden beoordeeld en toekomstige beslissingen kunnen worden ondersteunt.


Het team bestaat uit 9 medewerkers van Business Modelers, Program Managers, een Projectmanager en een Supply Chain Data Analist die verspreid over de kantoren in Zwolle, Chicago en Ohio werkzaam zijn. De vacature is ontstaan in verband met promotie van de huidige Supply Chain Data Analist. Het betreft een functie voor 2 jaar.


Aanbod

Voor een ambitieuze professional met potentie ligt bij Abbott de mogelijkheid om een (inter)nationale loopbaan uit te zetten in een mondiaal, solide en sterk groeiend concern. Het bedrijf kent een open, informele cultuur waar collegialiteit en teamwork hoog in het vaandel staan. Abbott biedt daarnaast de mogelijkheid om deels vanuit huis te werken. Abbott heeft een gedegen inwerktraject en je wordt vanuit de organisatie begeleid door een ervaren collega.


Je wordt via HAED gedetacheerd bij Abbott. Hier horen uiteraard een goed arbeidsvoorwaardenpakket bij als tegenprestatie:

  • Bruto maandsalaris afgestemd op jouw ervaring en kennis;
  • 25 vakantiedagen en 12 ATV dagen;
  • 8,33% vakantietoeslag;
  • 13e maand;
  • Bij Abbott is het mogelijk om 1 dag per week remote te werken;
  • contract voor 2 jaar.


Informatie

Voor aanvullende informatie kun je contact opnemen met Annegreet van Wier van HÃ†D (06) 1075 1991, vanwier@haed.nl, die namens Abbott de sollicitatieprocedure coÃ¶rdineert.

Je belangrijkste taken omvatten het gebruik van SQL (T-SQL), PowerBI en Microsoft Azure. Je creÃ«ert visueel aantrekkelijke rapporten en dashboards die gemakkelijk te begrijpen zijn voor belanghebbenden op alle niveaus van de organisatie en externe stakeholders.

Title: Data Analyst .
HTML:
What are you going to do?

As a Data Analyst, you will be part of the Analytics Team. This team works with development teams to provide overviews of the various applications hosted within the Nedap Tech Platform, advises them on specific insights gained from the data analysis and visualisations created, and focuses on the operability of the platform. To do this, we work with the teams and business unit management (e.g. BU leads, tribe leads, developers) to ensure that the platform supports their needs and requirements and removes complexity.

Your passion for complex datasets and ability to transform this into actionable insights play a crucial role in supporting the organisation's data processing and analytics needs.

Responsibilities

 Your responsibilities

  • Use monitoring tools such as Datadog to ensure the performance, reliability and availability of data pipelines;
  • Helping teams identify and address bottlenecks, performance issues and optimise data processing workflows;
  • Visualising dashboards to quickly understand running applications, highlight risk areas and provide detailed information for deployment and support teams during upgrades;
  • Helping teams gain insight into their applications and how to make best use of available data;
  • Collaborate with development teams to understand the application and what can be seen as critical support information;
  • Collaborate with support teams to understand recurring issues and workflows;
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand data requirements;
  • Provide technical expertise and guidance to team members on data analytics best practices;
  • Share knowledge by giving demos and workshops to the various teams;
  • Have the opportunity to grow into AI and Machine Learning skills in the future as the team expands in this area.

Your team

The Nedap Tech Platform focuses on supporting development teams within the Nedap business units with all aspects of the software development process such as tooling, frameworks, deployment and insights. We believe that combining the various domains into a cohesive product offers development teams a seamless experience, allowing them to focus on what matters most to them: delivering business value.

You will join our Analytics Team. This is a small and enthusiastic team which is currently still in its start-up phase. As a result, there is plenty of room for your own input and there are plenty of career opportunities in the future towards roles such as, for example, data engineer, data scientist or machine learning specialist. These experienced and enthusiastic data fanatics understand better than anyone that data must first be turned into information, are happy to provide advice and thus enable the Nedap business units and their teams to quickly gain insight into any application and/or proposition.

Our offer

As a Data Analyst at Nedap, you will make a valuable contribution to our goal: making people happier and more successful in their professional lives. In addition to your salary, you are entitled to a thirteenth month, a good pension scheme, and profit sharing with the opportunity to become a shareholder of Nedap. At Nedap, everything revolves around trust and autonomy. You determine your own working hours and vacation days. We also highly value personal and professional growth. You will receive a comprehensive introduction, and we encourage you to continuously develop yourself.

Curious about all our terms of employment? Read more here .

Required

 Required experience and skills

For you as a Data Analyst, it is important to be able to see the big picture. You will be in contact with different development teams, each with their own challenges. This means you must have excellent problem-solving and communication skills and be able to translate business requirements into technical solutions. Furthermore, you recognise yourself in the following:

  • You have 3-5 years' experience as a Data Analyst or in similar roles such as BI Developer, Data Engineer and Data Specialist;
  • You have mastered the Python language and have applied it within the context of data analysis;
  • You have experience in a communicative role, where you have experience with various stakeholders and/or internal customers;
  • You have experience in building reports and dashboards.

Title: Data Analyst | Talent Program
HTML:
Letâ€™s talk talent

You have talent. Ready to make impact. We know. We also know that making impact starts with that first contact between like-minded people who have the same drive to shape their future. We see you, with your skills, personality and dreams. Now letâ€™s take it to even greater heights by means of one of our talent programs for masterâ€™s and PhD graduates.

We are Mploy Associates, a talent-focused consultancy firm ready to make not only our clientsâ€™ teams successful but also you. Your talent, our focus.


More specifically?

We are a consultancy firm specialized in the areas of data, finance, and analytics and work on a variety of projects like investment analyses, data engineering, quant modelling and much more. Our clients are banks, insurance companies, and asset managers and we are still expanding.


We help our clients build successful teams by providing the right skills, talents and know-how at the right place and time and developing ourselves continuously to stay successful. We believe that investing in talent through proven methods always pays out. Today we are proud to say that we are an international-driven company with more than 100 people and many top-tier clients who share the same vision.


How do you fit into this vision?

You will work as a Data Analyst for one of our clients with a special focus on your own development through one of our Talent Programs. Our Talent Programs are designed to accelerate your career from entry-level to medior+ level within 24 months. By means of certified training courses, coaching and intervision sessions our employees follow an above-average steep career curve. Successful graduation in our Talent Programs usually results in a permanent medior+ or senior position at one of our clients or where it becomes your responsibility to keep the team successful.


Your activities as a Data Analyst

As a data analyst, your main responsibilities will include collecting, aggregating, cleansing and interpreting large datasets. Your day-to-day responsibilities include:


  • Discussing data requirements for different quantitative models or business reports;
  • Making an inventory of the relevant databases within the organisation and gaining access to them;
  • Merging tables and aggregating data in SQL, SAS and/or Python;
  • Developing and applying relevant data quality analyses (e.g. trend, missing value, and extreme value analyses);
  • Visualizing data through the development of interactive dashboards;
  • Interpretation of the data by means of pattern analyses and descriptive statistics;
  • Documenting the data sourcing process and descriptive statistics whilst discussing these with your stakeholders.


On average you work 36 hours a week on a client project and you spend 4 hours a week on your own personal, professional and technical development in one of our Talent Programs.


What do we offer?

We offer the opportunity to become an expert in data analysis, in an environment where we train you to excel as a high-end professional. In addition, good working conditions are equally as important to us.


By offering free lunch at the office and regular fun team activities like escape rooms and fun dinners, we ensure a connected and social workplace. Also important; we will provide you with a public transport card and/or (electric) bike. All on us of course. Furthermore:


  • A salary of â‚¬3,616 for master's graduates and â‚¬4,083 for PhD graduates, including holiday allowance and 13th-month salary;
  • Challenging work and projects for one of our top 200 clients;
  • 25 days of paid annual leave;
  • Half-day a week in-house professional and technical training combined with personal coaching;
  • Besides in-house training opportunities, an external development budget of â‚¬2,000 per year to obtain relevant certifications as FRM or CFA;
  • An international working environment with driven and ambitious colleagues from all over the world;
  • The opportunity to take your next career move as a medior at the client or Mploy Associates after successfully completing your development program;
  • Pro bono technical projects at socially relevant NGOs.


What are we looking for?

We are looking for graduates with different data-related backgrounds, experiences, and passions. It speaks for itself that you are ambitious, self-reflective and dare to be confident in an authentic way.

Furthermore, you are energized by stakeholder management and are well adept at gathering reliable information. You use this in combination with a consultive mindset to make our clients more successful. Last but not least, you are eager to develop yourself on a personal, professional and technical level with our personalized in-house Talent Programs. To make this more specific:


  • You have 0-3 years of work experience and want to learn everything about data analysis;
  • You want to put into practice your skills that you have acquired during your masterâ€™s or PhD in Business Informatics, Data Science or another data related study;
  • You are proficient with big data processing in SQL, Python or another relevant coding language;
  • You do not hesitate to use your analytical skills to solve complex problems creatively and logically.


Interested?

For more information about our different positions and Talent Programs you can visit our website www.mployassociates.com. Want to know more about the vacancy? Use the apply button above or email us at careers@mployassociates.com from the moment you start your masterâ€™s so we can help you prepare for your dream career. We will be in touch.


Please note that unfortunately there is no point in applying when you do not live in the Netherlands or if you have more than 3 years of work experience. These applications will not be processed.


Are you interested in multiple positions at Mploy Associates? Apply for one position and mention the other position(s) in your motivation message. Together we will find the best match for you.

Title: Investment Data Analyst
HTML:
Skill Farm Members are invited to apply for the following role:

Responsibilities:

Collecting, validating and delivering accurate and timely market data throughout the bank to value trading positions such as Interest Rate or FX derivatives, commodity and credit products;

Discussing with traders in hubs such as Hong Kong, London, New York or Sao Paulo what the best setup for their valuation instrument is;

Looking for continuous improvements of processes by automation or simplification.

You drive change in the team by focusing on implementing new technology that can help make our processes more efficient.

Skills & Qualifications:

You hold a master's degree with a focus on Finance, Economics or Econometrics or a degree in another discipline but with a keen interest in the financial sector;

You can demonstrate your knowledge on financial products that are valued at fair value;

You have a tangible interest in IT related systems and processes;

You have a tangible interest in the management of data

You are able to clearly express your ideas in English both orally and in written form;

CFA, FRM, PRM or equivalent is considered an asset or willingness to work towards one;

Title: Data-analist
Description:
Onze opdrachtgever is een ambitieuze organisatie met hart voor mens en milieu. Deze organisatie verzorgt voor negen gemeenten het beheer van afval- en grondstoffen en het beheer van de openbare ruimte. Het werkgebied telt totaal ruim 470.000 inwoners. Verspreid over zeven locaties werken ruim 850 mensen voor deze organisatie. Ze verduurzamen de woon- en leefomgeving.




Voor onze opdrachtgever wordt gezocht naar een Data-analist die houdt van complexe opgaven, goed overzicht houdt, niet bang is voor deadlines, maar tegelijkertijd in een heel gezellig en leuk team wil werken.




Veel dingen verlopen volgens duidelijke processen, maar er moet ook het nodige worden aangepast en verbeterd. Voor deze functie zoeken wij iemand die scherp meedenkt hoe het beter en slimmer kan. Bij voorkeur heb je zeer goede computervaardigheden, aangezien het IT-landschap continu verandert.




Wil je meewerken aan een duurzamere, sociale wereld en hou je van het ordenen van complexe administratieve stromen? Dan hebben wij de perfecte kans voor jou!




Functie:

Je bent verantwoordelijk voor een juiste registratie van alle logistieke stromen binnen de organisatie. Deze data wordt verzameld in zogenaamde massabalansen. - Je zorgt dat de logistieke stromen binnen de organisatie aansluiten met de financiÃ«le administratie. - Je bent verantwoordelijk voor juiste verwerking van werkorders van diverse uitvoerende afdelingen.




Taken:

Je verwerkt financiÃ«le en logistieke data tot een complete massabalans.
Je verricht periodieke controles op juist-, volledig- en tijdigheid van financiÃ«le en logistieke data
Je verzamelt, registreert en controleert financiÃ«le en logistieke data
Je signaleert tekortkomingen in procedures en rapporteert deze binnen de afdeling
Je verricht voorkomende werkzaamheden binnen de afdeling Finance & Control




Eisen:

MBO 3 of 4 werk- denkniveau
1 â€“ 2 jaar ervaring in een soortgelijke functie
Zelfstandig, nauwkeurig, analytisch en resultaatgericht
Kennis van Exact, Excel, AfvalRIS, Crystal Reports, Qlik/ PowerBI




Aanbod:

â‚¬4000 - â‚¬4600 bruto obv 40 uur
13,44% Persoonsgebonden Budget
Hybride
Uitdagende en afwisselende baan tussen de 32-40 uur per week in een ambitieuze organisatie
Uitgebreide pensioenregeling bij het ABP.
Veel ruimte om je te ontwikkelen met o.a. training en opleidingen
Tegemoetkoming in een collectieve ziektekostenverzekering en een sportvergoeding
Een actieve personeelsvereniging met leuke (familie)uitjes en activiteiten

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
Heb je een passie voor het ontwerpen en creÃ«ren van krachtige en inzichtelijke rapporten en APIâ€™s? Wil je werken met de nieuwste BI-technologieÃ«n en samenwerken met een toegewijd team van experts op het gebied van HRM & Salarisadministratie? Dan ben je mogelijk de perfecte kandidaat voor de positie van BI Analist bij Peple.




Wat houdt de rol van Business Intelligence Analyst in?

Als BI Analist word je onderdeel van het Business Intelligence en Data Analytics team, waar je rapporteert aan de BI Team Lead en hoogwaardige rapportage oplossingen levert met behulp van AWS-technologieÃ«n.

In deze rol speel je een cruciale rol, door verantwoordelijk te zijn voor het analyseren, creÃ«ren en transformeren van grote datasets om actiegerichte zakelijke inzichten te genereren. Je houdt toezicht op het ontwerp en de implementatie van een schaalbare en geÃ¯ntegreerde rapportage architectuur, zorgt voor naadloze gegevensintegratie en nauwkeurigheid in de rapportage. Je inspanningen zullen gericht zijn op data-analyse, het creÃ«ren van rapporten en het verbeteren van onze API.

Je hebt intensief contact met onze gebruikers en interne belanghebbenden, waaronder consultants, ontwikkelaars en onze productmanager, om hen verder te helpen en proactief feedback te verzamelen om onze software continu te verbeteren en optimale oplossingen te vinden door middel van data-analyse. Vanwege deze verantwoordelijkheden is het essentieel dat je uitstekende communicatieve vaardigheden bezit, waarbij je je comfortabel voelt bij het spreken en schrijven in het Engels. Het is een uitdagende rol waarin je een significante bijdrage zult leveren aan de verdere ontwikkeling en het succes van onze BI-software.




Wat vragen we van je?

Uitstekende communicatievaardigheden met het vermogen om complexe taken te vereenvoudigen en deze te vertalen naar praktische zakelijke inzichten en oplossingen
Je bent analytisch, hebt oog voor detail en een sterke voorkeur voor het creÃ«ren van uitstekende documentatie.
Je werkt goed samen met anderen, samenwerkend met interne teams om oplossingen te vinden maar hebt ook geen probleem met het zelfstandig oppakken en voltooien van taken.
Je hebt het vermogen om technische gegevens inzichten te vertalen naar gemakkelijk begrijpelijke informatie voor zowel technische als niet-technische doelgroepen.
Je bent gretig om de kennis die je hebt opgedaan uit je analyses te delen met het team en de rest van de organisatie, inclusief klanten
Sterke ervaring met gegevensopslag, gegevensmodellering en analytische technieken, het creÃ«ren van complexe rapporten en dashboards
Ervaring met rapportagetools zoals Amazon Quicksight, Power BI, Tableau
Je hebt het vermogen om zakelijke rapportage behoeften te verzamelen, te interpreteren, hiaten te identificeren en te vertalen naar rapportage oplossingen, dashboards, rapporten en inzichten voor onze klanten
Ervaring met het ontwikkelen en optimaliseren van SQL queries is wenselijk maar niet essentieel
Bijdragen aan strategische besluitvorming voor het verbeteren van efficiÃ«ntie en klantervaring
Bekend met hoe APIâ€™s werken en het vermogen om functionele API-vereisten te creÃ«ren is wenselijk maar niet essentieel.




Over Peple

Bij Peple staat het principe van "mens eerst" centraal, een overtuiging die diep geworteld is in onze identiteit en weerspiegeld wordt in onze naam. We erkennen de immense kracht van mensen, wat onze toewijding leidt aan zowel onze medewerkers als klanten. Onze missie is om complexe organisatorische taken om te zetten in gebruiksvriendelijke software toegankelijk voor iedereen. Bij Peple ontwikkelen we niet alleen HR- en salarisadministratietools; we creÃ«ren oplossingen die bedrijven en de maatschappij verrijken door meer te bereiken met minder moeite.




Wat bieden we je aan als Business Intelligence Analyst?

De Product Ontwikkelingsorganisatie binnen Visma.net HRM en Salarisadministratie bestaat uit acht internationale teams. Als Business Intelligence Analist word je onderdeel van deze prachtige organisatie en sluit je je aan bij het Business Intelligence en Data Analytics team. Je bevindt je in een no-nonsensecultuur, waar je wordt gezien als een persoon, waar elkaar helpen en ondersteunen centraal staat: â€œSamen bereiken we meer dan alleenâ€. Het Productontwikkelingsteam staat voor vele uitdagingen in een groeiende markt, waar we samen slimme keuzes maken. Je krijgt de mogelijkheid om je taken onafhankelijk vorm te geven en uit te voeren en ons te helpen slagen in het leveren van rapportagemogelijkheden aan onze klanten. Binnen Peple zijn er veel mogelijkheden voor verdere ontwikkeling, doorgroei en groei in een verscheidenheid aan rollen. Op bepaalde dagen is de optie om op afstand te werken beschikbaar, aangevuld met de mogelijkheid om naar kantoor te komen.




Locatie: Amersfoort, gemakkelijk bereikbaar met openbaar vervoer en auto
Dienstverband: 32-40 uur
Volop kansen voor professionele en persoonlijke ontwikkeling.
Bovengemiddelde arbeidsvoorwaarden met een salaris tussen â‚¬ 4.500 - 6.000 bruto per maand, afhankelijk van ervaring.

HTML:
Heb je een passie voor het ontwerpen en creÃ«ren van krachtige en inzichtelijke rapporten en APIâ€™s? Wil je werken met de nieuwste BI-technologieÃ«n en samenwerken met een toegewijd team van experts op het gebied van HRM & Salarisadministratie? Dan ben je mogelijk de perfecte kandidaat voor de positie van BI Analist bij Peple.


Wat houdt de rol van Business Intelligence Analyst in?

Als BI Analist word je onderdeel van het Business Intelligence en Data Analytics team, waar je rapporteert aan de BI Team Lead en hoogwaardige rapportage oplossingen levert met behulp van AWS-technologieÃ«n.

In deze rol speel je een cruciale rol, door verantwoordelijk te zijn voor het analyseren, creÃ«ren en transformeren van grote datasets om actiegerichte zakelijke inzichten te genereren. Je houdt toezicht op het ontwerp en de implementatie van een schaalbare en geÃ¯ntegreerde rapportage architectuur, zorgt voor naadloze gegevensintegratie en nauwkeurigheid in de rapportage. Je inspanningen zullen gericht zijn op data-analyse, het creÃ«ren van rapporten en het verbeteren van onze API.

Je hebt intensief contact met onze gebruikers en interne belanghebbenden, waaronder consultants, ontwikkelaars en onze productmanager, om hen verder te helpen en proactief feedback te verzamelen om onze software continu te verbeteren en optimale oplossingen te vinden door middel van data-analyse. Vanwege deze verantwoordelijkheden is het essentieel dat je uitstekende communicatieve vaardigheden bezit, waarbij je je comfortabel voelt bij het spreken en schrijven in het Engels. Het is een uitdagende rol waarin je een significante bijdrage zult leveren aan de verdere ontwikkeling en het succes van onze BI-software.


Wat vragen we van je?

  • Uitstekende communicatievaardigheden met het vermogen om complexe taken te vereenvoudigen en deze te vertalen naar praktische zakelijke inzichten en oplossingen
  • Je bent analytisch, hebt oog voor detail en een sterke voorkeur voor het creÃ«ren van uitstekende documentatie.
  • Je werkt goed samen met anderen, samenwerkend met interne teams om oplossingen te vinden maar hebt ook geen probleem met het zelfstandig oppakken en voltooien van taken.
  • Je hebt het vermogen om technische gegevens inzichten te vertalen naar gemakkelijk begrijpelijke informatie voor zowel technische als niet-technische doelgroepen.
  • Je bent gretig om de kennis die je hebt opgedaan uit je analyses te delen met het team en de rest van de organisatie, inclusief klanten
  • Sterke ervaring met gegevensopslag, gegevensmodellering en analytische technieken, het creÃ«ren van complexe rapporten en dashboards
  • Ervaring met rapportagetools zoals Amazon Quicksight, Power BI, Tableau
  • Je hebt het vermogen om zakelijke rapportage behoeften te verzamelen, te interpreteren, hiaten te identificeren en te vertalen naar rapportage oplossingen, dashboards, rapporten en inzichten voor onze klanten
  • Ervaring met het ontwikkelen en optimaliseren van SQL queries is wenselijk maar niet essentieel
  • Bijdragen aan strategische besluitvorming voor het verbeteren van efficiÃ«ntie en klantervaring
  • Bekend met hoe APIâ€™s werken en het vermogen om functionele API-vereisten te creÃ«ren is wenselijk maar niet essentieel.


Over Peple

Bij Peple staat het principe van "mens eerst" centraal, een overtuiging die diep geworteld is in onze identiteit en weerspiegeld wordt in onze naam. We erkennen de immense kracht van mensen, wat onze toewijding leidt aan zowel onze medewerkers als klanten. Onze missie is om complexe organisatorische taken om te zetten in gebruiksvriendelijke software toegankelijk voor iedereen. Bij Peple ontwikkelen we niet alleen HR- en salarisadministratietools; we creÃ«ren oplossingen die bedrijven en de maatschappij verrijken door meer te bereiken met minder moeite.


Wat bieden we je aan als Business Intelligence Analyst?

De Product Ontwikkelingsorganisatie binnen Visma.net HRM en Salarisadministratie bestaat uit acht internationale teams. Als Business Intelligence Analist word je onderdeel van deze prachtige organisatie en sluit je je aan bij het Business Intelligence en Data Analytics team. Je bevindt je in een no-nonsensecultuur, waar je wordt gezien als een persoon, waar elkaar helpen en ondersteunen centraal staat: â€œSamen bereiken we meer dan alleenâ€. Het Productontwikkelingsteam staat voor vele uitdagingen in een groeiende markt, waar we samen slimme keuzes maken. Je krijgt de mogelijkheid om je taken onafhankelijk vorm te geven en uit te voeren en ons te helpen slagen in het leveren van rapportagemogelijkheden aan onze klanten. Binnen Peple zijn er veel mogelijkheden voor verdere ontwikkeling, doorgroei en groei in een verscheidenheid aan rollen. Op bepaalde dagen is de optie om op afstand te werken beschikbaar, aangevuld met de mogelijkheid om naar kantoor te komen.


  • Locatie: Amersfoort, gemakkelijk bereikbaar met openbaar vervoer en auto
  • Dienstverband: 32-40 uur
  • Volop kansen voor professionele en persoonlijke ontwikkeling.
  • Bovengemiddelde arbeidsvoorwaarden met een salaris tussen â‚¬ 4.500 - 6.000 bruto per maand, afhankelijk van ervaring.


Ben je geÃ¯nteresseerd in de positie van Business Intelligence Analist, solliciteer dan nu.

Als je vragen hebt, neem dan contact op met Amparo Severins via Amparo.severins@visma.com.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
regel jij dat 300 miljoen artikelen in 500 winkels aankomen?

Ben jij een data-liefhebber die graag orde schept in de chaos en inzichten weet om te zetten in concrete acties? Zoek je een dynamische omgeving waar je impact kunt maken? Dan is dit jouw kans om deel uit te maken van het Supply Chain team bij HEMA!




maak onalledaags veel impact!

Als Data Analist in ons Supply Chain team speel je een cruciale rol in het optimaliseren van onze processen. Jouw analyses zorgen ervoor dat onze producten altijd op de juiste plek en op het juiste moment beschikbaar zijn.

Ons Supply Chain team bestaat uit 74 collega's. Samen streven we ernaar om net zo tech-savvy en data-gedreven te worden als de besten in de industrie. Dit betekent dat we continu verbeteren en innoveren om voorop te blijven lopen.




De uitdaging die voor je ligt? Momenteel hebben we een data fundament voor HEMA in de cloud met Athena en PowerBI. Dit fundament moet de komende jaren worden uitgebouwd zodat alle stakeholders state-of-the-art inzichten en rapportages hebben om hun werk meer data-driven te doen. Dit doe je niet alleen: je zal nauw samenwerken met ons centrale data & analytics team.




dit ga je doen bij HEMA

Verzamelen, analyseren en interpreteren van grote hoeveelheden data om trends en patronen te ontdekken.
Helpen inrichten van ons data domein en ownership pakken binnen het team.
Actief samenwerken met data counterparts, data scientists en data engineers om prioriteiten te bepalen en technische vragen te vertalen.
Opstellen van dashboards en rapportages die onze teams helpen om snel en gefundeerde beslissingen te nemen.
Proactief signaleren van verbetermogelijkheden en hierover adviseren, waarbij je ook weerstand kunt bieden en overtuigend kunt zijn.




dit haal je bij HEMA

Een salaris van â‚¬ 3.500 tot â‚¬ 5.500 bruto op basis van 40 uur werken per week.
Natuurlijk vakantiegeld van 8%, maar mogelijk ook een jaarlijkse variabele beloning van maximaal 14% afhankelijk van de bedrijfsdoelstellingen en - resultaten
Een vaste eindejaarsuitkering van 4% en een netto maandelijkse onkostenvergoeding van â‚¬65
15% korting op al je HEMA-favorieten
Een goede pensioenregeling
Reiskostenvergoeding van 0,21 ct per km vanaf 10km met een maximum van 30km.
30 vakantiedagen op basis van 40 uur per week
Kortingen via het platform Benefits at work




dit neem je mee naar HEMA

Je hebt aantoonbare ervaring in een soortgelijke omgeving en rol. Hierdoor weet jij als geen ander hoe je complexe data omzet naar bruikbare inzichten.
Technische skills: je bent specialist in SQL, Excel en Power BI. Kennis van Python of R is mooi meegenomen.
Initiatief en verantwoordelijkheid: je hebt ook PO-skills om prioriteiten te bepalen en de samenwerking met andere teams te coÃ¶rdineren. Je bent proactief en neemt graag initiatief.
Analytisch en praktisch: je hebt een scherpe analytische blik en een pragmatische instelling. Je ziet het grote geheel, maar hebt ook oog voor detail.
Flexibiliteit en overtuigingskracht: je kunt effectief samenwerken met verschillende stakeholders en weet hoe je weerstand kunt bieden en anderen kunt overtuigen van jouw ideeÃ«n.

Title: Product Data Analyst
Description:
Mendix â€“ The Leading Low-code Application Development Platform

The Mendix Platform uses visual modeling to abstract long-form coding out of application development. Our customers use Mendix to create and deploy better software for the enterprise, faster. Mendix enables collaboration between business users and developers to work together throughout the development process.

Read our Customer Stories to learn more about the wealth of software and solutions global organizations have built with the Platform.

At Mendix we strive to maintain a diverse, open, and safe working environment where people can be their true selves. We value every voice, celebrate individuality, and appreciate the diversity of thought and experience. People who work here are driven, smart, and really good at what they do.

As this market evolves, we encourage people of all skill levels to work with the platform, both for clients and candidates. Apply today to discover how you can make a meaningful impact with Mendix.

Product Analyst at Mendix

At Mendix, we help our users and customers bring their ideas to outcomes.

Not only by delivering the best low code platform to them, but also by guiding them in the best ways to use our platform in the most effective and efficient way.

Improving our product means we need to understand how our product is actually being used by our users and customers, how well do (new) features perform, what are opportunities for improvement based on that.

Questions around these topics do constantly live in the heads of our product teams and product managers who are responsible for growing the happy userbase and customers of our platform.

Besides our research teams who focus on qualitative user research, the product analytics team at Mendix is taking the quantitative angle.

We are responsible for creating and sharing product insights to support and guide those teams and product managers in making the right decisions, which are based on facts and data coming from our platform.

But we do not only operate at product team level, we also operate at a more tactical and strategic level, to make sure the different departments/teams look at the same numbers on how our platform performs and again make decisions based on that.

Your Role

As a medior/senior product analyst, you will pick up requests for insights/reports, etc. coming in from the different teams and provide answers to them based on data we process from our platform.

But since you work closely with the teams that build the Mendix platform, you also play an important role in supporting and guiding the teams to implement the right event/data triggers across the platform to generate enough insights.

You will not only define, plan, conduct, and share descriptive, diagnostic, predictive, and prescriptive analytics. But also prepare requirements for new data, assist management in translating insights into action and drive the teams to become increasingly data-driven.

A handful of activities that you can expect to be working on throughout a normal work week:


Scoping and challenging analytics requests from the business.
Brainstorming about new product feature ideas with product management, design, development and leadership.
Helping the business define, build and operationalize their KPIs.
Building operational and management level dashboards in Power BI.
Retrieving & transforming data using SQL or Python, support the data engineer in our team in creating the right pipelines and data structures for new and existing data.
Designing and doing in-depth research with large raw datasets.
Applying statistical techniques to metrics and hypotheses to prove significance of results.
Presenting your findings and actionable recommendations or analytics products to the business.
Coming up with enablement strategies for analytics products.
Growing your data & analytics skills be learning from other analysts, but also sharing your knowledge and experience.


Technical Requirements


5+ years of experience in data analytics roles and strong numerical and analytical skills.
Understand data models and being able to extract, clean and transform data.
Definition, creation, target setting, forecasting and operationalization of KPIs and OKR structures.
Experience in data processing languages or scripting languages (SQL mandatory) and R or Python.
Experience creating production grade PowerBI reports and datasets (or comparable tools such as Power BI, Tableau, QlikSense, or BI dashboard creation using languages such as Python or Shiny).
Good understanding of Machine Learning concepts and able to identify business opportunities where ML can make the difference.
Experience with building and deploying these ML models to production.
Being able to bring a data & analytics project from begin to end, from research/hypothesis testing, exploratory data analysis, converging towards conclusions, presenting those to stakeholders while maintaining great documentation and code version control.
Understanding of AWS, Athena, Docker, etc. is a pre.
Research and hypothesis design should have no secrets for you.


Business Requirements


Experience with presenting analytics solutions or actionable insights from research to management and high-level executives.
Experience with presenting your outcome in a non-technical and appealing way to colleagues.
Experience with defining requirements for data capturing in the data lake and making sure data is organized and cleaned.
Experience with advocating data literacy among the entire organization.
Experience with collecting requirements from the business.
Experience with challenging business partners to uncover the right requirements and clearly scope requests or ideas.
Experience with quickly learning about and familiarizing yourself with different business domains.
Experience with stakeholder management between different business units and management levels.
Experience with mentoring and/or guiding subject matter to colleagues.
Experience with low code(app) development is a plus.
Experience with product-led growth is a plus.
Able to speak proficient English.


Personal Character Traits


Curious and analytical approach: you have the natural drive to find out how stuff works and interrelates, so you have a good understanding that help you in building(data)models/doing analysis.
A good understanding of business needs and the ability to act accordingly, taking measured risks into account and the ability to take the organization to a next maturity level.
The ability to remain fully functional by adapting to changing circumstances(environment, procedures, people). Absorb new information readily and to put it into practice effectively.
Assertiveness; the ability to bring oneâ€™s views across clearly without damaging the relationship with stakeholders.
Creativity; the ability to come up with original and innovative ideas and solutions, to adopt points of view outside the usual parameters.
The ability to ask further with the ambition to deeply understand other perspectives and views in order to generate support.
Ability to collaborate effectively across disciplines, roles, and geographical and time zone boundaries.


Whatâ€™s in it for you?


Competitive salary with regular reviews and opportunities for advancement.
30 days PTO.
Hybrid work environment.
Work from anywhere up to 4 weeks per year.
Career development training and opportunities.
Regular team events and outings like skiing trips.
Excellent daily lunch at the office.
Flexible working hours to accommodate a healthy work-life balance.
A dedicated training budget for professional development.
Various modes of travel to and from the office are covered by Mendix.


This is a hybrid working position, which means you will have the opportunity to work in a hybrid environment, with the flexibility to work from home as well as from our office located in Rotterdam.

We expect the successful candidate to be present in the office at least 3 to 5 days a week, as we believe that in-person teamwork is essential for building a cohesive team and delivering high-quality work.

If you see this job description and think, â€œIâ€™d be Perfect for thatâ€ but your experience doesnâ€™t align perfectly with the qualifications â€“ donâ€™t let that hold you back. Weâ€™re always eager to hire hard-working, passionate candidates â€“ so give it a try and apply.

Working for Mendix and with our Customers means your reliability has to be beyond any doubt, and therefore every employment is subject to an onboarding screening and the condition precedent a Certificate of Conduct is provided that demonstrates you did not commit any offences that are relevant to the performance of your function.

If you see a job description and think, â€œIâ€™d be perfect for thatâ€ but your experience doesnâ€™t align perfectly with the qualifications â€“ donâ€™t let that hold you back. Weâ€™re always eager to hire talented, passionate candidates â€“ so give it a try and apply.

Equal Employment Opportunity Statement

Mendix/Siemens is an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer encouraging diversity in the workplace. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to their race, color, creed, religion, national origin, citizenship status, ancestry, sex, age, physical or mental disability unrelated to ability, marital status, family responsibilities, pregnancy, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender expression, gender identity, transgender, sex stereotyping, order of protection status, protected veteran or military status, or an unfavorable discharge from military service, and other categories protected by federal, state or local law.

EEO is the Law

Applicants and employees are protected under Federal law from discrimination. To learn more, Click here .

Pay Transparency Non-Discrimination Provision

Siemens follows Executive Order 11246, including the Pay Transparency Nondiscrimination Provision. To learn more, Click here .

California Privacy Notice

California residents have the right to receive additional notices about their personal information. To learn more, click here .

Title: Financial Intelligence Specialist - Power BI
Description:
SystemsAccountants is currently recruiting a Financial Intelligence Specialist to join a tech start-up based close Amsterdam.




The employing company has created a business intelligence solution that links powerful performance management tooling with PowerBI, that help optimise reporting and dashboarding capabilities. Since it recently established, the organisation is now in 16 countries delivering solutions to nearly 40 clients.




The role offers hybrid working; international projects; the opportunity to work in cutting edge financial intelligence technology; as well as career growth in a fast growing international business.

Potential candidates should apply if they have:




Expert user of Power BI (2 plus years)
A strong understanding of finance and accounting process.
An analytical mindset and the potential to grow into a business consultancy role.
Dutch speaking is a preference.
Interest in technology, ideally with exposure to BI, reporting, dashboarding or analytics related tooling




For more information on this and other financial systems. data or analytics roles, please contact Johnny@systemsaccountants.com

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Juni who? ðŸ‘‹

Weâ€™re Juni. Born on the West Coast (of Sweden). Built for flexible working. And busy building a future where digital commerce is free from financial barriers. Want to be a part of it all?

What We Do ðŸ¤”

Juni gives online businesses the tools they need to save time, scale up and succeed. Our platform helps financial leaders take control of their cash flow, make better decisions and unlock the full potential of digital commerce. We even offer working capital to help them achieve their goals and dream up new ones. And thatâ€™s just for starters.

How & why we do it ðŸš€

We give our people the same thing weâ€™re building for our customers: freedom. Freedom to be 100% yourself. Freedom to explore your potential and whatâ€™s more â€“ make the most of it. We truly believe weâ€™re making the world a better place for online businesses, and we want you to be a part of that mission.

Summary ðŸ¤¸â€â™€ï¸

Join our data team on a mission to elevate Juni's data maturity, transforming it into an organization where comprehensive data is widely and easily utilized by all teams. We are seeking a talented and motivated Data Analyst to join our dynamic data team. As a Data Analyst, you will be working with a cross-functional team to identify key metrics, analyze and interpret data, create reports and dashboards, and provide valuable insights to enhance business performance and contribute to the overall data maturity of our organization.

Responsibilities ðŸ‘

In this role, youâ€™ll:


Analyze data from various sources to identify trends, patterns, and insights that drive business objectives.
Develop and maintain clear, informative reports and dashboards tailored to each business area. This includes building dashboards to track KPIs specific to each team (e.g., financial crime metrics, onboarding flow efficiency).
Work with cross-functional teams to understand their data needs and provide analytical support to optimize processes and improve performance.
Communicate data-driven insights to stakeholders in a clear, concise, and impactful manner.
Actively participate in the management of data pipelines for different departments, ensuring data quality and consistency.
Proactively identify and implement data-driven solutions to improve operational efficiency across the business.


Tooling âš™ï¸

We primarily use SQL and Python for programming. Our data platform is built on Google Cloud, AWS, and Airflow.

Qualifications ðŸ‘‘

What we need to see


Strong analytical skills and a passion for data.
Proficiency in SQL and experience with data extraction and transformation.
Experience with statistical analysis and data visualization tools (e.g., Metabase, Looker Studio).
Excellent communication skills and the ability to present complex data insights in a clear and concise manner.
Ability to work independently and manage multiple projects simultaneously.


What weâ€™d love to see


Experience within the financial services industry or a comparable field (highly valued).
Hands-on experience with CRM and marketing data.
Familiarity with data warehousing and ETL processes.
Experience with cloud-based data platforms (e.g., AWS, Google Cloud).


Your people ðŸ‘¥

We practice people-first culture. Weâ€™re real. We never wait. We care deeply about building a better future for our customers and each other. Here, you can work with people at the top of their game and who didnâ€™t get there by playing games. You can help us create a whole new category in financial services.

Your benefits ðŸ˜

Weâ€™re freedom-first. Transparent. Caring. Empowering. So our benefits are too.


We work hybrid. We'll see you in one of our offices at least two days per week.
Swap 2D for 3D. Meet all Junis IRL at the company onsite each year.
Diversity is at our core. We're part Swedish. Part Canadian. Part French. Part Indian. Part Italian. Part British. Part Portuguese. You get the idea.
Great players can stay great players. Progress your career whether you choose to manage people or not.
Stock options. We canâ€™t promise youâ€™ll make a fortune. But weâ€™ll give it our very best shot.
Vacation days. 30 days contractually. Unlimited in policy. Awesome.
Global health insurance. You know. Just in case. Therapy & massage included.
Get sick? No stress. Feel better with unlimited paid sick leave.


The process ðŸ“…

CV screening > Get to know us call > Team interview(s) > Values interview > Offer (for some roles weâ€™ll include a task, but weâ€™ll notify you if this is the case)

Collaborate with the business to understand their use cases related to responsible wage practices, create solutions, and implement them.

Reporting using Power BI
Building solutions with Power Apps

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Join our friendly and open minded team! You'll be able to contribute to the company's development as well as a sustainable future. Together we will work for a better tomorrow!




Join Greenely's mission to pioneer Europe's energy transition, where we strive to reduce household energy bills to zero. By optimizing energy consumption and enabling virtual power generation, we're navigating families through the complexities of electricity with our innovative platform. As part of this ambitious journey, we're in search of a Data Analyst with a passion for data-driven insights and a mastery of Tableau to join our mission-driven team.




What youâ€™ll be doing :

Utilize Tableau, Google Analytics, Amplitude, and Mixpanel to develop and maintain insightful dashboards and reports, tracking key performance indicators, and revealing data-driven stories that inform business strategies.
Collaborate with teams across the company to identify their data analysis needs, delivering tailored insights that support diverse objectives, from product development to customer engagement.
Ensure the integrity and accuracy of data through meticulous quality checks, while also championing the adoption of best practices in data management and analytics.
Stay ahead of the curve on the latest analytics trends and technologies, bringing innovative approaches to enhance Greenely's data-driven decision-making processes.




What you'll need to succeed :

Bachelorâ€™s degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, or related field.
At least 2+ years of hands-on experience in a data analysis role, with a proven track record of expertise in Tableau and comprehensive knowledge of Google Analytics, Amplitude, and Mixpanel.
Solid understanding of SQL and familiarity with Python or R.
Exceptional analytical, organizational, and communication skills.




We'll be really impressed if you :

You're a data wizard, adept at transforming raw data into clear, actionable insights, with a robust analytical toolkit that includes advanced proficiency in Tableau.
Expert knowledge of Google Analytics, Amplitude, and Mixpanel is crucial, as you'll leverage these platforms for comprehensive event tracking and analytics across our digital products.
Your technical skill set is rounded out with SQL proficiency and experience with data analysis programming languages such as Python or R.
Excellent communication skills define you, enabling you to demystify complex data findings and translate them into strategic insights for both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
You're known for your problem-solving prowess, keen eye for detail, and the ability to juggle multiple projects in a dynamic, fast-paced environment.
A genuine interest in the energy sector and a commitment to Greenely's mission to empower households in the energy transition would make you an ideal fit.




By joining Greenely, you'll be at the heart of a team dedicated to creating a sustainable future, leveraging your analytical skills to make a tangible impact on our mission. Here, your work will not only contribute to optimizing energy consumption but also play a crucial role in driving the energy transition forward.




What we can offer you ðŸ¢ðŸ‘©â€ðŸ’» :

Flexibility: Enjoy the flexibility of working remotely two days a week while collaborating in our vibrant Stockholm office for the rest, conveniently located in the heart of Stockholm at Vasagatan 40.
Growth: Elevate your career with opportunities for skill development, challenging projects, and advancement within our forward-thinking organization.
Influence and Impact: Your voice matters. Shape the future of energy by contributing your ideas, expertise, and playing a key role in decision-making.
Innovative Environment: Thrive in an ever-changing industry, working on cutting-edge projects and staying ahead of the curve in a dynamic and pioneering work atmosphere.




About Greenely

Greenely is on a mission to create the best customer experience for the modern energy consumer through technology. As a digital energy provider, we help people reduce their electricity costs by optimizing their home and car's electricity usage with our smart app. Supported by Nordic venture capital companies, we aim to enable households worldwide to connect, control, and optimize their energy usage. We believe that the best electricity is the one that is never used - a win-win for both wallets and the environment!




WE ARE bold and push the limit.

WE BELIEVE THAT fast is better than slow.

WE think like owners.

WE lead with knowledge.




If you have questions or concerns, please contact charlotte.englund@greenely.se. We do not accept applications via email as we protect your privacy. Please note that we have carefully selected recruitment agencies for this opening and kindly request that other agencies refrain from contacting us regarding this position. Thank you for your understanding.

Title: Data Analyst at Financial Crime Intelligence, Investigations & Analytics (FCIIA)
Description:
Job ID:Â 24580Â 

Â 

About Us

Â 

At Nordea, we are dedicated to making a positive change in the world by building the next-generation platform to prevent money from flowing into illegal activities such as terrorist financing, corruption, drug smuggling, tax evasion, and human trafficking. We are seeking talented individuals who are passionate about leveraging data to combat financial crime and drive meaningful impact.

Â 

About this opportunity

Â 

As a Data Analyst within the data science unit of Financial Crime Intelligence, Investigations & Analytics (FCIIA) at Nordea, you will play a crucial role in aiding cross-jurisdictional special investigations and coordinating operational and strategic intelligence through the analysis of data. You will leverage your expertise in data interpretation, visualization, and statistical analysis to turn data into actionable insights.

Â 

Key Responsibilities:

Collect, clean, and analyse large datasets to identify patterns and trends related to financial crime.
Develop and maintain dashboards and reports using visualization technologies such as Qlik Sense, Power BI, or similar tools to monitor key performance indicators and detect suspicious behaviour.
Collaborate with stakeholders to understand business requirements and provide data-driven recommendations.
Conduct ad-hoc analyses and present findings to support decision-making processes.
Demonstrate the ability to think on your feet, adapting quickly to changing circumstances and requirements.
Ensure data accuracy and integrity through rigorous validation and testing.

Who you are

Â 

Collaboration. Ownership. Passion. Courage. These are the values that guide us in being at our best â€“ and that we imagine you share with us.

Â 

Requirements:

Proven experience in data analysis, preferably within the financial services industry or related fields.
Bachelor's or Master's degree in statistics, mathematics, computer science, economics, or a related field.
Proficiency in data manipulation and analysis using tools such as SQL, Python, R, or similar.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with attention to detail.
Clear communication skills to convey complex findings to stakeholders.
Experience with visualization technologies such as Qlik Sense, Power BI, or similar tools.
Fluency in English.
Experience working with Cloud Technologies is a plus.

How to Apply

Â 

If you are passionate about leveraging data to prevent financial crime and thrive in a dynamic, collaborative environment, we want to hear from you! Please submit your application detailing your relevant experience and why you are interested in joining Nordea's Financial Crime Intelligence, Investigations & Analytics unit.

Â 

Make your mark on something bigger at Nordea! Join us today.

Â 

Next steps

Submit your application no later than 21/07/2024. For more information, youâ€™re welcome to contact Aleksander Tsvetanov Kitov.

At Nordea, we know that an inclusive workplace is a sustainable workplace. We deeply believe that our diverse backgrounds, experiences, characteristics and traits make us better at serving customers and communities. So please come as you are.

Â 

Please be aware that any applications or CVs coming through email or direct messages will not be accepted or considered.Â 

Â 

For candidates in Sweden only -Â For union information, please contact finansforbundet@nordea.se or SACONordea@nordea.com.

As a Data Analyst within the data science unit of Financial Crime Intelligence, Investigations & Analytics (FCIIA) at Nordea, you will play a crucial role in aiding cross-jurisdictional special investigations and coordinating operational and strategic intelligence through the analysis of data. Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
Om tjÃ¤nsten

How do we best source energy for fossil-free electricity sales?

Providing our customers with fossil-free electricity at competitive prices means we need to understand their needs and the market and be able to handle the attached risks. The Commodities Intelligence department is currently looking for a Business Intelligence Analyst to join us on our journey.

As a Business Intelligence Analyst, you will belong to the Commodities Intelligence department which is responsible for the Financial Risk Management, Power Pricing and development of our BI-tools for our Sales segments. The team work with all customers and segments in the Nordic countries and you will have colleagues in both Sweden and Finland. Besides your team colleagues, you will work closely with Portfolio managers, Business control, Vattenfall IT and lots of other people.

Your main responsibility as a Business Intelligence Analyst is to develop and take responsibility for the teams data tables and BI tools, which are crucial for our financial risk management, business analysis and reporting.

The main focus of this position is to build, develop and secure quality in new or existing Power BI reports. You will work with the reports from start to finish, from ordering raw data from the Source systems to publishing a user-friendly power BI report that meets the stakeholder's demand for follow-up, risk management, analysis and decision-making.

To be able to apply the correct business logic in the data transformation, it is important to have or gain a deep understanding of the electricity market and electricity Sales business. It is also important to be able to work in a cross-functional environment where stakeholders has different requirements and needs.

Our ambition is that your work will form the basis for improved risk management and increased quality in our analysis and reports.

Din bakgrund

To be successful in this role, we believe that you have the following:


University degree in engineering, finance, mathematics or other similar field of education
Experience of SQL- programming, preferably Azure / Databricks
Experience of data modelling and data management
Good command of written and spoken English


ItÂ´ll be beneficial if you also have:


Experience working in the electricity market
Experience working in sales and marketing settings
Experience from Power BI
Additional programming knowledge, preferably Python.
API management
Experience in financial derivatives
Experience working in a scrum team and have related skill set
Good command of written and spoken Swedish


As a person you have an analytical mindset and the ability to quickly assess and understand relations between involved systems and tools. YouÂ´re customer-focused and business-minded, as well as a good team player with good communication skills.

Mer information

We offer a challenging and international work environment and the possibility to work with some of the best in the field. You will be working in interdisciplinary teams and you can always count on support from committed colleagues as â€˜Ask and Shareâ€™ concept is essential for the way we work. We offer attractive employment conditions (smart working, flexible working hours and a good-work-life balance) and opportunities for personal and professional development. Click here for further information.

Location: Solna.

We welcome your application including cover letter and CV in English via the link below. Last day to apply is August 13th 2024. The advertising period has been extended due to summer holidays and weÂ´ll review all applications when the application has closed.

WeÂ´re using tests in this recruitment process and an online test will be sent to all applicants as a first step in the recruitment process when the application has closed.

For more information about the position you are welcome to contact hiring manager AndrÃ© HellstrÃ¶m, andre.hellstrom@vattenfall.com. If you have questions regarding the recruitment process you are welcome to contact recruiter Jennifer WikstrÃ¶m, jennifer.wikstroem@vattenfall.com.

Trade Union Representatives, to be reached through Vattenfallâ€™s switchboard, +46 (8) 739 50 00, are Rolf Olsson (Akademikerna), Simon Salomonsson (Unionen), Mikael Mukka (SEKO) and Cecilia Bodin (Ledarna).

At Vattenfall we are convinced that diversity contributes to build a more profitable and attractive company and we strive to be a good role model regarding diversity. Vattenfall works actively for all employees to have the same opportunities and rights regardless of gender, ethnicity, age, transgender identity or expression, religion or other belief, disability or sexual orientation. Click here for further information.

Om oss

Vattenfall is one of Europeâ€™s largest producers and retailers of electricity and heat. Our main markets are Sweden, Germany, the Netherlands, Denmark, and the UK. The Vattenfall Group has approximately 20,000 employees. We have been electrifying industries, powering homes and transforming life through innovation for more than 100 years. We now want to make fossil free living possible and we are driving the transition to a sustainable energy system.

Providing our customers with fossil-free electricity at competitive prices means we need to understand their needs and the market and be able to handle the attached risks. The Commodities Intelligence department is currently looking for a Business Intelligence Analyst to join us on our journey.

As a Business Intelligence Analyst, you will belong to the Commodities Intelligence department which is responsible for the Financial Risk Management, Power Pricing and development of our BI-tools for our Sales segments. The team work with all customers and segments in the Nordic countries and you will have colleagues in both Sweden and Finland. Besides your team colleagues, you will work closely with Portfolio managers, Business control, Vattenfall IT and lots of other people.

Your main responsibility as a Business Intelligence Analyst is to develop and take responsibility for the teams data tables and BI tools, which are crucial for our financial risk management, business analysis and reporting.

The main focus of this position is to build, develop and secure quality in new or existing Power BI reports. You will work with the reports from start to finish, from ordering raw data from the Source systems to publishing a user-friendly power BI report that meets the stakeholder's demand for follow-up, risk management, analysis and decision-making.

To be able to apply the correct business logic in the data transformation, it is important to have or gain a deep understanding of the electricity market and electricity Sales business. It is also important to be able to work in a cross-functional environment where stakeholders has different requirements and needs.

Our ambition is that your work will form the basis for improved risk management and increased quality in our analysis and reports.

Din bakgrund

To be successful in this role, we believe that you have the following:

  • University degree in engineering, finance, mathematics or other similar field of education
  • Experience of SQL- programming, preferably Azure / Databricks
  • Experience of data modelling and data management
  • Good command of written and spoken English

ItÂ´ll be beneficial if you also have:

  • Experience working in the electricity market
  • Experience working in sales and marketing settings
  • Experience from Power BI
  • Additional programming knowledge, preferably Python.
  • API management
  • Experience in financial derivatives
  • Experience working in a scrum team and have related skill set
  • Good command of written and spoken Swedish

As a person you have an analytical mindset and the ability to quickly assess and understand relations between involved systems and tools. YouÂ´re customer-focused and business-minded, as well as a good team player with good communication skills.

Mer information

We offer a challenging and international work environment and the possibility to work with some of the best in the field. You will be working in interdisciplinary teams and you can always count on support from committed colleagues as â€˜Ask and Shareâ€™ concept is essential for the way we work. We offer attractive employment conditions (smart working, flexible working hours and a good-work-life balance) and opportunities for personal and professional development. Click here for further information.

Location: Solna.

We welcome your application including cover letter and CV in English via the link below. Last day to apply is August 13th 2024. The advertising period has been extended due to summer holidays and weÂ´ll review all applications when the application has closed.

WeÂ´re using tests in this recruitment process and an online test will be sent to all applicants as a first step in the recruitment process when the application has closed.

For more information about the position you are welcome to contact hiring manager AndrÃ© HellstrÃ¶m, andre.hellstrom@vattenfall.com. If you have questions regarding the recruitment process you are welcome to contact recruiter Jennifer WikstrÃ¶m, jennifer.wikstroem@vattenfall.com.

Trade Union Representatives, to be reached through Vattenfallâ€™s switchboard, +46 (8) 739 50 00, are Rolf Olsson (Akademikerna), Simon Salomonsson (Unionen), Mikael Mukka (SEKO) and Cecilia Bodin (Ledarna).

At Vattenfall we are convinced that diversity contributes to build a more profitable and attractive company and we strive to be a good role model regarding diversity. Vattenfall works actively for all employees to have the same opportunities and rights regardless of gender, ethnicity, age, transgender identity or expression, religion or other belief, disability or sexual orientation. Click here for further information.

Om oss

Vattenfall is one of Europeâ€™s largest producers and retailers of electricity and heat. Our main markets are Sweden, Germany, the Netherlands, Denmark, and the UK. The Vattenfall Group has approximately 20,000 employees. We have been electrifying industries, powering homes and transforming life through innovation for more than 100 years. We now want to make fossil free living possible and we are driving the transition to a sustainable energy system.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Hej, Truecaller is calling you from Stockholm, Sweden! Ready to pick up?

Our goal is to make communication smarter, safer, and more efficient, all while building trust everywhere. We're all about bringing you smart services with a big social impact, keeping you safe from fraud, harassment, scam calls or messages, so you can focus on the conversations that matter.


Top 20 most downloaded apps globally, and worldâ€™s #1 caller ID and spam-blocking service for Android and iOS, with extensive AI capabilities, with more than 400 million active users per month.
Founded in 2009 with an impressive year-on-year growth with high profitability, listed on Nasdaq OMX Stockholm, Large Cap.
Founded in 2009, listed on Nasdaq OMX Stockholm and is categorized as a Large Cap. Our focus on innovation, operational excellence, sustainable growth, and collaboration has resulted in consistently high profitability and strong EBITDA margins.
A team of 400 people from ~35 different nationalities spread across our headquarters in Stockholm and offices in Bangalore, Mumbai, Gurgaon and Tel Aviv with high ambitions.


As a Senior Data Analyst in Identity, you will be working with a cross-functional team. You help the team understand user verification trends, analyze usage patterns and participate in the product discovery process to help build the right features that deliver value.

The Impact you will create


Create and analyze verification and fraud management metrics to identify opportunities for growth and cost optimization.
Utilize data to inform and help direct the product design process by providing a clear data narrative and a deep understanding of user needs.
Design and develop reports and dashboards to track user account verification and fraud management metrics.
Create and manage ETL pipelines.
Analyze the impact of changes to product design and AB tests and communicate results to stakeholders.


What you bring in:


Natural drive to uncover the â€œwhyâ€ behind data trends, understanding underlying business problems and finding solutions
At least 4 years of experience doing quantitative analysis
Expertise in business intelligence visualization tools, such as Google Data Studio, Looker, QlikSense, Tableau, PowerBI, etc
Experience in using SQL to extract, transform and analyze data
Experience in CI/CD and Git
Work closely with stakeholders across the business to identify and act on opportunities to generate business value.
Ability to communicate results of your analysis in a clear and effective manner
Good applied statistics skills, such as distributions, statistical testing, regression, etc.
Ability to initiate and drive projects to completion with minimal guidance
Good communication skills in English


It would be great if you also have:


Good scripting and programming skills
Experience with Python, Spark and Airflow
Experience with data from mobile applications


Life atTruecaller - Behind the code: https://www.instagram.com/lifeattruecaller/

Sounds like your dream job?

We will fill the position as soon as we find the right candidate, so please send your application as soon as possible. As part of the recruitment process, we will conduct a background check.

This position is based in Stockholm, Sweden.

We only accept applications in English.

What we offer:


A smart, talented and agile team: An international team where ~35 nationalities are working together in several locations and time zones with a learning, sharing and fun environment.
A great compensation package: Competitive salary, 30 days of paid vacation, flexible working hours, private health insurance, top-up parental leave, pension contribution, Udemy membership to keep learning and improving, and free gym membership (SATS).
Do it your way: We work in-office on Tuesdays, Wednesdays and Thursdays with flexibility on the other days. You can enjoy 2 weeks working remotely from anywhere you want per year.
Office life: Enjoy your days with a daily free breakfast, a wide range of yummy snacks and beverages, or have fun with your colleagues at the playroom! As well, exciting company parties and team activities such as Lab days, Running team, Geek lunch!


Come as you are:

Truecaller is diverse, equal and inclusive. We need a wide variety of backgrounds, perspectives, beliefs and experiences in order to keep building our great products. No matter where you are based, which language you speak, your accent, race, religion, color, nationality, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, etc. All those things make you who you are, and thatâ€™s why we would love to meet you.

The team's responsibilities will span across several key areas, including the collection of business and functional requirements, including the sourcing, mapping, profiling, and modeling of data, as well as the development of a data hub/repository. Furthermore, the team will be tasked with creating an automated ETL process and a reporting engine and mechanism to comply with DORA requirements.

Joining Sii Sweden means gaining access to the perks of a seasoned IT consulting company. From training sessions and webinars to collaborative knowledge-sharing sessions with colleagues, we offer a comprehensive compensation package that includes insurance, pension plans, and wellness benefits. We can't wait to have you on board!
