Title: BI Developer
Description:
Sambla Group is a fintech company with a clear goal â€“ to make loans better for all. We need you, your ambition and your skills on our journey. We have become the fast-growing fintech company that we are today - bridging the gap between borrowers and lenders - thanks to all the 300+ amazing people who work here.

Our success is the result of the commitment to deliver the best customer journey and consumer finance products in the industry. Our vision is to democratize lending and empower customers to improve their personal finances. Through our well known brands such as Sambla, Advisa, Rahalaitos, Omalaina, Rahoitu and DigiFinans we support customers in consolidating and getting the best terms on their loans.

We are now looking for our next BI Developer! At Sambla Group, we thrive on data-driven decisions to propel our mission forward. We are dedicated to fostering a culture of innovation and empowerment. Our team is looking for a diligent and creative Business Intelligence (BI) Developer to join us in transforming complex datasets into actionable insights. The successful candidate will work together with an aspiring Data team within the Architecture and Reporting function on a broad variety of projects providing strong career development opportunities.

Amongst Other Things, You Will Work With


Stakeholder Engagement
Data Translation and Communication
Data Modeling
Visualization Creation
Data Transformation



For this position, we see that you have at least a couple of years of experience within BI Development and business analytics. This positions puts an emphasis on understanding business needs and creating key data visualizations to drive our work forward with data driven decision making.

Must Have


At least 3 years of theoretical education, preferably computer science
At least one year work experience within BI Development and business analytics
Advanced knowledge in SQL
Experience from BI and analytics tools, specifically development in Power BI (DAX, data modeling, report building)



A Bit Of Extra Credit If You Also Have


Experience in marketing analytics, for instance in campaign follow up, econometric modeling, customer segmentation and attribution modeling.
Possess some experience in software development and be familiar with technologies such as Python, R, Git.
Knowledge in advanced statistics and math (range from doing reporting to Data Science modeling and analytics)
Experience in other BI and Analytics tools such as Qlik/Tableau/Looker.



What We Offer


Business in mind & people at heart â€“ we deliver results together and celebrate our achievements.
A varied and challenging role in a multinational and highly innovative company, where we value the development of our employees
We are strong believers in creating a fun workplace where people enjoy coming to work.
A friendly culture with openness and respect for one another, with the possibility to influence and make a difference on society and peopleâ€™s everyday lives.



Please note!

As part of our efforts to foster an unbiased recruitment process, we kindly encourage you to not include picture, gender, ethnicity, religion, disability, sexual orientation or age in your CV.

Sambla Group is the new generation of brokers. Our ambition has always been the same - to challenge the banksâ€™ offers so that our customers, regardless of the conditions, should always have the same opportunity to obtain the best possible loan solution. Sambla Group has grown to over 350 employees, established itself in Sweden, Norway, Finland and Denmark with offices in Sweden, Finland and Denmark.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Join us in building the data platforms of the future and shaping how Accenture will become the best in Sweden in AI!

We are a well-established team of data and AI engineers in Accenture's specialist group for data and artificial intelligence, and we need additional wise and committed minds to join our team! As part of Accenture's Data & AI community, you will help build data solutions as well as our internal professional environment within the field.

In our projects, you use a range of skills. We work with data engineering, data architecture, machine learning and Generative AI. You yourself will have an influence on everyday work based on what you want to work with. At Accenture, you are in the driver's seat for your future technology career, regardless of whether you want to become a technical expert or a manager with a broad technology background. Accenture is a career school where we guide and learn from each other.

Who are we looking for?

We are looking for experienced data and AI engineers to join our team. People who have ambitions and courage to become part of our active and forward-looking professional environment. In this professional environment, we work with the latest technology in AI and Cloud, organize workshops internally and in customer projects, support technology sales and develop high-quality solutions for our customers.

You are solution-oriented, curious, and like to familiarize yourself with new issues where you share your knowledge. You must be happy to work in a team, while also being able to work independently with demanding tasks for our customers.

We are looking for you who:



Minimum of a bachelorâ€™s degree


3 - 5 years of relevant work experience


Fluent Swedish and English


A burning interest in data engineering and artificial intelligence


Experience with system development, frontend or backend


Experience with Azure, Google Cloud Platform or AWS data platforms


Practical experience with AI/ML and relevant technologies


Experience with Python, SQL and at least one other coding or data manipulation language


Experience with data bricks and similar technologies is an advantage


Experience with RPA is an advantage


Previous experience in consulting


Stockholm based



Here are descriptions of working for Accenture form some of our super stars:

Simon: â€œI joined Accenture as a Data Engineer in Data & AI. Prior to joining Accenture most of my experience was built within startups, so joining Accenture was a bit different to what I was used to. Since joining I have spent most of my time in a large transformation project where I have held several roles and responsibilities. This has varied from business and data analysis to data engineering and report development.

Working at Accenture is a lot of fun! The pace is fast, and you are surrounded by skilled and driven people, meaning if you have questions it's super easy to reach out to someone for help or expertise. Furthermore, as an employer Accenture prioritizes development and encourages further education. This produces an environment where you can have a significant impact on your own career journey, with lots of opportunities to try new things and grow.

Besides project work there is a vibrant Accenture community which you can get involved with in many forms. Our own Data & AI hosts events and teambuilding activities, and we often combine events with other teams. These, along with the many Accenture wide communities and events make it easy to network and meet more people to collaborate with and learn from.â€

Yasmin:

â€œI started my Accenture adventure in Paris, in 2018, as a data science intern. I was hands-on with deep learning and computer vision projects, developing prototypes and proofs of concept that contributed to our clients' innovation. With the industry's shift towards data-driven approaches, I moved into data engineering, focusing on cloud modernization and migrations. This shift provided me the opportunity to master various cloud technologies and scripting languages. In 2023, I relocated to Accenture Sweden, a country that had always intrigued me due to my previous Erasmus experience in Lund. My responsibilities expanded beyond client work to include co-leading our Data & AI community in Copenhagen and MalmÃ¶, hosting workshops/conferences/hackathons and engaging with our global Innovation and Ventures department.

What I appreciate most about Accenture is the opportunity to engage with various teams globally, which sets the opportunity to expand my horizons beyond my primary domain. Whether you are interested in sustainability, UX/UI, Gen AI, social initiatives, customers life trends, etc. there is something for each one of us.

If you are someone that is driven by curiosity and innovation, it is for sure one of the best places to be. In essence, my life at Accenture is an exciting journey, allowing me to explore new frontiers, much like an explorer charting new territories (just like my dream of setting foot on Mars). It's a role that demands technical skill, sustains continuous learning, and values community engagement.â€

NGLISH

Title: BI & Analytics Developer
Description:
This inclusive employer is a member of myGwork â€“ the largest global platform for the LGBTQ+ business community.

Our talented Data & AI team is made up of globally recognized experts and there's room for more analytical, innovative, client-driven data professionals! If you're passionate about helping clients make better data-driven decisions to tackle their most complex business issues, let's talk. Take your skills to a new level and launch a career where you can truly do what matters.

Come join us

If youâ€™re passionate about helping clients make better data-driven decisions to tackle their most complex business issues, letâ€™s talk. Take your skills to a new level and launch a career where you can truly do what matters.

Skills And Experiences


You have extensive experience in database development mainly in SQL and working knowledge from T-SQL
Knowledge of Power BI to enhance better data visualizations to the clients
You have some experience in ETL tools and tabular/in-memory databases
You have experience in analytical applications and dimensional data modelling
You are experienced in both Azure and on-prem Microsoft platforms you are comfortable with DevOps
You have worked with solution development (and design) either in an in-house role or as a consultant
You speak fluently Swedish and English


About You

Characteristics that can spell success for this role:


Collaborative, curious, client-centric
Resilient, adaptable, flexible
Passionate about tech


What You'll Do

As a BI and Analytics Developer you will:


Translate business requirements to technical solutions leveraging strong business acumen
Work with a team maintaining and developing an end-to-end enterprise data warehouse including integrations, data modelling, analysis tools and automated reports
Work closely with the customer where mostly the solutions that the team is responsible for are business critical
Take ownership of your own development tasks while collaborating with your team members
You'll be working occasionally with Application Management, we work in a DevOps setup, mixing development and operations
Work with and be specialized in Microsoft tools


Learn more

Do you recognize yourself in this vacancy and would you like to meet us? Then apply today, we can't wait to hear from you!

Even if you don't feel a complete match for this role, we would encourage you still to apply! We are constantly looking for new team members to join our growing Data & AI team.

Enjoy your career

Some Of The Best Things About Working At Avanade


People-first culture that supports innovation and encourages people to move forward
Knowledge development is our focus, and we ensure this both by offering formal training opportunities as well as informal evenings where peers share their knowledge
With your passion, you can use the latest Microsoft technology to make a difference for our customers in the Enterprise market
We have a strong focus on the career and development opportunities of all our people. Everyone has a career adviser who will work with you to create a plan and guide you in choosing from the many training opportunities we offer
Working in a hybrid/flexible model


A great place to work

As you bring your skills and abilities to Avanade, you'll get distinctive experiences, limitless learning, and ambitious growth in return. As we continue to build our diverse and inclusive culture, we become even more innovative and creative, helping us better serve our clients and our communities. You'll join a community of smart, supportive collaborators to lift, mentor, and guide you, but to also lean on your expertise. You get a company purpose-built for business-critical, leading-edge technology solutions, committed to improving the way humans work, interact, and live. It's all here, so take a closer look! We work hard to provide an inclusive, diverse culture with a deep sense of belonging for all our employees.

Title: Senior Customer Insight Analyst
Description:
Job ID:Â 24990Â 

Â 

Would you like to help Nordea drive customer-centric decision making? We are looking for a senior customer insight analyst with a flair for behavioural data and data analysis to support us in delivering some of the major customer satisfaction surveys at Nordea.

Â 

We are creating a work environment where we develop and adapt to what we observe, in order to keep the customer voice at the core of the business and grow together. To help with this objective, we need your ideas and unique background!

Â 

At Nordea, we see that the world is changing fast â€“ and we want to help our customers to succeed by providing them with the financial solutions of tomorrow.Â 

Â 

About this opportunity:

Welcome to Customer Behavioural Insights, a truly Nordic team working across all four Scandinavian countries to deliver strategic customer insights based on both qualitative and quantitative methods, often in collaboration. We support internal departments ranging from strategic marketing, communication and branding, to business development, service- and product- strategy teams. The team is responsible for delivering overall key performance indicators of customer satisfaction at Nordea, together with other satisfaction measures such as brand perception.Â 

Â 

What youâ€™ll be doing:

Support our team in delivering existing recurring customer surveys
Implement and test surveys in our survey tool
Continuously improve existing processes, methods and data outputs
Transform your findings into tangible business insights and simple, to the point visualizations
Communicate and present your insights to key stakeholders

Youâ€™ll join a team driven by curiosity and exploration, with team members from a broad range of academic backgrounds. All of us have a keen interest in learning new methods and to build upon each otherâ€™s areas of specialization. The position is based in Helsinki or Stockholm.Â 

Â 

Who you are:

Collaboration. Ownership. Passion. Courage. These are the values that guide us in being at our best â€“ and that we imagine you share with us.

Â 

To succeed in this role, we believe that you:

Are more interested in what the numbers tell you than the numbers themselves. You have a sense for how to translate large data sets into actionable insights. Can think both analytically and intuitively to uncover user needs
Have a technical and mathematical mindset with attention to detail but do not lose focus on the overall goals
Are naturally curious and efficient minded, and whilst being meticulous you also constantly search for ways to improve processes and deliveries
Like to collaborate with others and thrive on feedback and continuous improvement
Build relations professionally across the organisation to improve your own work

Your experience and background:

Proven track record and experience working with quantitative research methods, including conducting and analysing surveys
Hands-on knowledge in applying data science and statistical methods to survey data - prior work with sampling and weighting methods is a plus
Working knowledge with statistical tools, especially R and/or willingness to learn R
Experience with content analysis of open comments is an advantage
Experience with presenting and communicating results to diverse audiences
Experience using Qualtrics is an advantageÂ 
Fluency in one local Nordic language is also an advantage

Â 

Â If this sounds like you, get in touch!

Â 

Next steps

Â 

Submit your application no later than 26/07/2024. Please be aware that any applications or CVs coming through email or direct messages will not be accepted or considered.

Â 

For more information, youâ€™re welcome to contact recruiting manager Mats Leifler mats.leifler@nordea.se or Katrin Werner katrin.maren.werner@nordea.com Vacations during week 27-31. Interviews can start from week 32.

Â 

At Nordea, we know that an inclusive workplace is a sustainable workplace. We deeply believe that our diverse backgrounds, experiences, characteristics and traits make us better at serving customers and communities. So please come as you are.

Â 

Only for candidates in Sweden:Â For union information, please contact finansforbundet@nordea.se Â or SACONordea@nordea.com

We are creating a work environment where we develop and adapt to what we observe, in order to keep the customer voice at the core of the business and grow together. To help with this objective, we need your ideas and unique background!

 

At Nordea, we see that the world is changing fast â€“ and we want to help our customers to succeed by providing them with the financial solutions of tomorrow. 

 

About this opportunity:

Welcome to Customer Behavioural Insights, a truly Nordic team working across all four Scandinavian countries to deliver strategic customer insights based on both qualitative and quantitative methods, often in collaboration. We support internal departments ranging from strategic marketing, communication and branding, to business development, service- and product- strategy teams. The team is responsible for delivering overall key performance indicators of customer satisfaction at Nordea, together with other satisfaction measures such as brand perception. 

 

What youâ€™ll be doing:

  • Support our team in delivering existing recurring customer surveys
  • Implement and test surveys in our survey tool
  • Continuously improve existing processes, methods and data outputs
  • Transform your findings into tangible business insights and simple, to the point visualizations
  • Communicate and present your insights to key stakeholders

Youâ€™ll join a team driven by curiosity and exploration, with team members from a broad range of academic backgrounds. All of us have a keen interest in learning new methods and to build upon each otherâ€™s areas of specialization. The position is based in Helsinki or Stockholm. 

 

Who you are:

Collaboration. Ownership. Passion. Courage. These are the values that guide us in being at our best â€“ and that we imagine you share with us.

 

To succeed in this role, we believe that you:

  • Are more interested in what the numbers tell you than the numbers themselves. You have a sense for how to translate large data sets into actionable insights. Can think both analytically and intuitively to uncover user needs
  • Have a technical and mathematical mindset with attention to detail but do not lose focus on the overall goals
  • Are naturally curious and efficient minded, and whilst being meticulous you also constantly search for ways to improve processes and deliveries
  • Like to collaborate with others and thrive on feedback and continuous improvement
  • Build relations professionally across the organisation to improve your own work

Your experience and background:

  • Proven track record and experience working with quantitative research methods, including conducting and analysing surveys
  • Hands-on knowledge in applying data science and statistical methods to survey data - prior work with sampling and weighting methods is a plus
  • Working knowledge with statistical tools, especially R and/or willingness to learn R
  • Experience with content analysis of open comments is an advantage
  • Experience with presenting and communicating results to diverse audiences
  • Experience using Qualtrics is an advantage 
  • Fluency in one local Nordic language is also an advantage

 

 If this sounds like you, get in touch!

For more information, youâ€™re welcome to contact recruiting manager Mats Leifler mats.leifler@nordea.se or Katrin Werner katrin.maren.werner@nordea.com Vacations during week 27-31. Interviews can start from week 32.

 

At Nordea, we know that an inclusive workplace is a sustainable workplace. We deeply believe that our diverse backgrounds, experiences, characteristics and traits make us better at serving customers and communities. So please come as you are.

Title: Finance BI Analyst
Description:
Are you skilled at translating financial data into clear, actionable insights for all stakeholders? Are you ready to be an important contributor to optimizing financial performance and supporting strategic decision-making? If so, GlobalConnect wants you on our team!

You can be located in any of our headquarters in Copenhagen, Stockholm, or Oslo.

About the Role:

As a Finance BI Analyst at GlobalConnect, you will be at the heart of our financial data operations. You will design, develop, and maintain robust financial models and reporting mechanisms that translate complex financial data into clear, actionable insights. Your work will focus on P&L, Cash Flow, Capex, Projects, Sales, and related KPIs. You will also implement and optimize front-end reporting solutions using tools such as PowerBI to create dynamic and interactive financial dashboards.

Your typical day will involve collaborating with cross-functional teams to define financial data requirements, ensuring reports are aligned with strategic targets, and providing value-added analysis to stakeholders. You will also evaluate and ensure the integrity of master data within BI platforms and proactively identify opportunities for process improvements.

Joining our team means you will have the opportunity to work with a senior group of professionals who value social events and teamwork. With a focus on data-driven decision-making, you will be supported in exploring new advancements like AI and other innovations in financial analysis and reporting.

Key Responsibilities:


Design, develop, and maintain robust financial models and reporting mechanisms.
Implement and optimize front-end reporting solutions.
Manage and ensure the integrity of master data within BI platforms and Systems
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand and define financial data requirements.
Proactively identify and implement process improvements to enhance efficiency and accuracy.


Why Choose GlobalConnect?

GlobalConnect is one of the leading suppliers of digital infrastructure and network services in the Nordics. As a modern, fast-paced company growing into a pan-Nordic organization, we offer exciting opportunities for professional growth. Our team is committed to supporting the management and the organization with insightful analysis and robust financial reporting. We believe in the power of data to support strategic decisions and are committed to building an environment where innovation thrives.

To Succeed We Think You Need:


Understanding of financial dataflow and processes, such as P&L and Cashflow
Experience in financial modeling and data analysis.
Some experience in coordination and project management skills.
Proficiency in BI tools such as PowerBI.
Ability to manage large datasets and ETL processes, and quickly understand interconnected systems.
We do welcome young professionals with the right education and some relevant experience.


Ready to Join Us?

If you are excited about transforming financial data into actionable insights and being part of a dynamic team that values innovation and teamwork, we want to hear from you. Apply today and take the next step in your career with GlobalConnect!

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
About Redeploy Insight

At Redeploy Insight, we specialize in building modern cloud data platforms to serve clients across the Nordics to enable enterprise-scale analytical capabilities. Our core focus lies in delivering cutting-edge solutions, including consulting expertise, managed services, and SaaS Data & AI platforms. We take pride in our strategic partnerships with industry leaders such as Microsoft & Databricks, positioning ourselves at the forefront of technological innovation.

Redeploy Insight has successfully delivered large-scale and innovative data platforms to Electrolux, Coop, Folksam, PostNord, and Handelsbanken to name a few. Our dedicated team is passionate about enabling enterprise-scale analytical capabilities, empowering our clients to gain profound insights and make informed, impactful decisions.

The demand for cloud based analytical platforms is constantly growing and we are now looking for a Data Engineer to join our growing team in Stockholm or Gothenburg. You will work in a fast-paced environment where you will collaborate with some of the most brilliant minds in the field and contribute to the evolution of our platforms with your expertise Data Engineering.

About The Role

As a Data Engineer in our backend team, you will help to ensure that data pipelines and data stores are high-performing, efficient, organized, and reliable, given a specific set of business requirements and constraints. You will deal with unanticipated issues swiftly and minimize data loss. You will also design, implement, monitor, and optimize data platforms to meet the data pipeline needs.

In this role we see that you have knowledge of data processing languages, such as SQL, or Python, and an understanding of parallel processing and data architecture patterns.

To be considered for the role, we see that you come with the following experiences and skills:


University degree in Computer Science, Information Technology or Engineering.
1-3 years of experience as Data Engineer or similar role
Familiar with Microsoft Azure Data lake, Databricks, SQL database and data warehouse solutions.
Experience in designing, implementing, and supporting enterprise-scale ETL / ELT pipelines.
Ability to integrate data from a variety of sources using integration and orchestration tools (e.g. Azure Data Factory).
Fluency in Swedish and English with good communication skills.


You are


A Social team-player with drive and positive attitude
Analytical, communicative, and driven
A flexible person with â€œCan-do mentalityâ€
Experienced in planning and executing in your projects


You would like to work with us if you


Want to work with the latest technology and projects within in Analytics and AI
Are motivated by customer challenges
Like to work in teams and are humble
Want to be in a workplace where your thoughts are valued, and your ideas make an impact


How To Apply

If you're ready to launch your career and make a meaningful impact on organizations through your passion for Data Engineering, then donâ€™t hesitate to send in your application by hitting the apply button.

We look forward to hearing from you!

Note: To be eligible for the role you need to be based in Stockholm or Gothenburg, or have plans to relocate to either of the locations.

Title: Staff Data Scientist
Description:
Hej, Truecaller is calling you from Stockholm, Sweden! Ready to pick up?




Our goal is to make communication smarter, safer, and more efficient, all while building trust everywhere. We're all about bringing you smart services with a big social impact, keeping you safe from fraud, harassment, scam calls, or messages, so you can focus on the conversations that matter.

Top 20 most downloaded apps globally, and worldâ€™s #1 caller ID and spam-blocking service for Android and iOS, with extensive AI capabilities, with more than 400 million active users per month.
Founded in 2009 with an impressive year-on-year growth with high profitability, listed on Nasdaq OMX Stockholm, Large Cap.
Founded in 2009, listed on Nasdaq OMX Stockholm and is categorized as a Large Cap. Our focus on innovation, operational excellence, sustainable growth, and collaboration has resulted in consistently high profitability and strong EBITDA margins.
A team of 400 people from ~35 different nationalities spread across our headquarters in Stockholm and offices in Bangalore, Mumbai, Gurgaon and Tel Aviv with high ambitions.







We, at the Data Science and Analytics Products team build centralized data products that serve the business and our customers. We collaborate across all of Truecaller, delivering products that require centralized ownership or where the competence to build the products is not present in the wider product organization.




As a Staff Data Scientist, you will be the right hand of the VP of Data Science and Analytics, you will take fuzzy business goals and transform them into data science products that can deliver value iteratively. Leading the data science work in the team, you will be responsible for structuring the work and ensuring that the outcomes match the business objectives. A significant part of this leadership will be coaching and mentoring other data scientists to guide and speed their development, as well as unblocking them and finding ways to make the team as happy and productive as possible.

Collaboration is a central requirement for this role, both when working with stakeholders, but also within the team to deliver results that cannot be delivered by one person on their own




The impact you will create:

Exploring the problem space and finding data science solutions that provide step increases in customer experience
Planning data science work for the team, with an emphasis on collaboration to achieve common goals
Gathering, collating, and understanding the data necessary to create data science products that delight the customers
Collaborating with stakeholders throughout Truecaller to find and build data science products that solve business and customer problems at scale.
Coaching and mentoring junior to senior data scientists to improve their technical skills and productivity




What you bring in:

Bachelor's or Master's degree in Data Science, Machine Learning, Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or a related field.
At least 5 years of experience in using data science and machine learning to solve real-world problems
A track record leading data science projects in a team, collaborating in planning, coding, and communication
Excellent programming skills in Python and SQL
Solid understanding and experience with the tooling for Python - IDEs, unit testing frameworks, and static code checks
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to present complex data and insights to non-technical stakeholders
Strong problem-solving skills and a results-oriented mindset
Customer obsession
Able to own and drive projects and products to production and iteratively improve them over time




It would be great if you also have

Understanding how to query very large data efficiently (we use BigQuery)
Experience collaborating with C-suite executives
Experience with data from mobile applications
Experience with data visualization and reporting tools, such as Tableau, Looker, or Power BI (we use Looker)
A solid understanding of the engineering requirements necessary to put machine learning solutions into production and scale them to hundreds of millions of customers




Life at Truecaller - Behind the code: https://www.instagram.com/lifeattruecaller/




Sounds like your dream job?

We will fill the position as soon as we find the right candidate, so please send your application as soon as possible. As part of the recruitment process, we will conduct a background check.




This position is based in Stockholm, Sweden.

We only accept applications in English.




What we offer:




A smart, talented and agile team: An international team where ~35 nationalities are working together in several locations and time zones with a learning, sharing and fun environment.
A great compensation package: Competitive salary, 30 days of paid vacation, flexible working hours, private health insurance, top-up parental leave, pension contribution, Udemy membership to keep learning and improving, and free gym membership (SATS).
Great tech tools: Pick the computer and phone that you fancy the most within our budget ranges.
Do it your way: We work in-office on Tuesdays, Wednesdays and Thursdays with flexibility on the other days. You can enjoy 3 weeks working remotely from anywhere you want per year.
Office life: Enjoy your days with a daily free breakfast, a wide range of yummy snacks and beverages, or have fun with your colleagues at the playroom! As well, exciting company parties and team activities such as Lab days, Running team, Geek lunch!




Come as you are:




Truecaller is diverse, equal and inclusive. We need a wide variety of backgrounds, perspectives, beliefs and experiences in order to keep building our great products. No matter where you are based, which language you speak, your accent, race, religion, color, nationality, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, etc. All those things make you who you are, and thatâ€™s why we would love to meet you.

Title: Senior SQL developer
Description:
Cint is a pioneer in research technology (ResTech). Our customers use the Cint platform to post questions and get answers from real people to build business strategies, confidently publish research, accurately measure the impact of digital advertising, and more. The Cint platform is built on a programmatic marketplace, which is the worldâ€™s largest, with nearly 300 million respondents in over 150 countries who consent to sharing their opinions, motivations, and behaviours.

We are feeding the worldâ€™s curiosity!



Job Description



Who we are looking forâ€¦

We are seeking a SQL Developer withexpertlevel knowledge in SQL - especially MSSQL. The successful candidate will need to work with several of our engineering teams as an SME for their database queries, assisting with creating new SPs or queries, debugging/tuning existing ones and troubleshooting functional and performance related issues in SQL code. The candidate should also have a deep understanding of several of RDBMS architecture, performance tuning, security, table maintenance, and ETL processes.

We are looking for seriously deep SQL coding expertise. We are not looking for DBAs, full-stack engineers, DevOps or backend skills for this role. Itis an opportunity to join an innovative company with global impact and build world-class infrastructure to scale our solutions. This is a senior level engineering role on mission critical systems running multi-terabyte databases that contain billions of records and thousands of queries, procedures and functions.

What you will doâ€¦

Create, improve and maintain SQL stored procedures, queriesand functions, acting as a technical expert for one or more product engineering teams
Support and monitor existing operations, understanding query and execution plans to be able to further refine and improve
Optimize existing functions by implementing performance tuning methodologies.
Identify, troubleshoot, and debug application defects in tandem with the engineering teams, and write technical documentation to share knowledge and expertise.
Work collaboratively with several other teams.
Collaborate with DBAs for architecture and performance work.
Train individuals andteams on best practices of coding in SQL.





Qualifications


Several years (probably more than 5) experience as a SQL developer or engineer, ideally with much of it using MS SQL Server
Experience working with mission critical databases containing millions (or more) of records
Demonstrable history collaborating with application engineers to create new, and improve existing SQL code
You will be expected to give several detailed examples ofroles that involvingquery analysis, in bothgreen field and legacy/maintenance environments
Experience mentoring, coaching and generally improving a team or an organisation's capability in the field through 1:1 or classbased coaching, and high quality documentation.
Fluent/Native/A1 level English (written and spoken)

Bonus points if you have

Relevant industry qualifications
Current blog/public content in the field


Additional Information



Our Values

Collaboration is our superpower
We uncover rich perspectives across the world
Success happens together
We deliver across borders.
Innovation is in our blood
Weâ€™re pioneers in our industry
Our curiosity is insatiable
We bring the best ideas to life.
We do what we say
Weâ€™re accountable for our work and actions
Excellence comes as standard
Weâ€™re open, honest and kind, always.
We are caring
We learn from each otherâ€™s experiences
Stop and listen; every opinion matters
We embrace diversity, equity and inclusion.


More About Cint

In June 2021, Cint acquired Berlin-based GapFish â€“ the worldâ€™s largest ISO certified online panel community in the DACH region â€“ and in January 2022, completed the acquisition of US-based Lucid â€“ a programmatic research technology platform that provides access to first-party survey data in over 110 countries.

Cint Group AB (publ), listed on Nasdaq Stockholm, this growth has made Cint a strong global platform with teams across its many global offices, including Stockholm, London, New York, New Orleans, Singapore, Tokyo and Sydney. (www.cint.com)

Title: BI Developer
Description:
Sambla Group is a fintech company with a clear goal â€“ to make loans better for all. We need you, your ambition and your skills on our journey. We have become the fast-growing fintech company that we are today - bridging the gap between borrowers and lenders - thanks to all the 300+ amazing people who work here.

Our success is the result of the commitment to deliver the best customer journey and consumer finance products in the industry. Our vision is to democratize lending and empower customers to improve their personal finances. Through our well known brands such as Sambla, Advisa, Rahalaitos, Omalaina, Rahoitu and DigiFinans we support customers in consolidating and getting the best terms on their loans.

We are now looking for our next BI Developer! At Sambla Group, we thrive on data-driven decisions to propel our mission forward. We are dedicated to fostering a culture of innovation and empowerment. Our team is looking for a diligent and creative Business Intelligence (BI) Developer to join us in transforming complex datasets into actionable insights. The successful candidate will work together with an aspiring Data team within the Architecture and Reporting function on a broad variety of projects providing strong career development opportunities.

Amongst Other Things, You Will Work With


Stakeholder Engagement
Data Translation and Communication
Data Modeling
Visualization Creation
Data Transformation



For this position, we see that you have at least a couple of years of experience within BI Development and business analytics. This positions puts an emphasis on understanding business needs and creating key data visualizations to drive our work forward with data driven decision making.

Must Have


At least 3 years of theoretical education, preferably computer science
At least one year work experience within BI Development and business analytics
Advanced knowledge in SQL
Experience from BI and analytics tools, specifically development in Power BI (DAX, data modeling, report building)



A Bit Of Extra Credit If You Also Have


Experience in marketing analytics, for instance in campaign follow up, econometric modeling, customer segmentation and attribution modeling.
Possess some experience in software development and be familiar with technologies such as Python, R, Git.
Knowledge in advanced statistics and math (range from doing reporting to Data Science modeling and analytics)
Experience in other BI and Analytics tools such as Qlik/Tableau/Looker.



What We Offer


Business in mind & people at heart â€“ we deliver results together and celebrate our achievements.
A varied and challenging role in a multinational and highly innovative company, where we value the development of our employees
We are strong believers in creating a fun workplace where people enjoy coming to work.
A friendly culture with openness and respect for one another, with the possibility to influence and make a difference on society and peopleâ€™s everyday lives.



Please note!

As part of our efforts to foster an unbiased recruitment process, we kindly encourage you to not include picture, gender, ethnicity, religion, disability, sexual orientation or age in your CV.

Sambla Group is the new generation of brokers. Our ambition has always been the same - to challenge the banksâ€™ offers so that our customers, regardless of the conditions, should always have the same opportunity to obtain the best possible loan solution. Sambla Group has grown to over 350 employees, established itself in Sweden, Norway, Finland and Denmark with offices in Sweden, Finland and Denmark.

Title: Data Engineer & Tech Lead
Description:
PostNord Group AB is a leading provider of communication and logistics solutions in the Nordic region. Committed to making everyday life easier and more sustainable, we are at the forefront of transforming the future data landscape for our data-driven journey. Join our Production organization and be a part of a dynamic, diverse, and innovative team shaping the future of logistics, mail, and parcel services.




Position Overview:




As a Data Engineer & Tech Lead in the Workforce Demand Planning (WDP) team at PostNord, you will play a critical role in optimizing our logistics and production processes, directly impacting our efficiency and service delivery. This role involves building and maintaining data pipelines in Microsoft Azure and Databricks, optimizing complex data structures, and supporting the team's efforts to deliver business-critical analytics.




To excel in this role, you should have extensive experience in advanced software development, enjoy remaining hands-on, and relish working on complex and challenging solutions. You should be familiar with the implementation of machine learning models and interested in the underlying mathematics, data science, and programming skills needed to develop and deploy forecasting models. Our technology stack focuses on Azure, including Azure Auto ML, Azure ML Ops, Azure DevOps CI/CD, Power BI, and more.




Key Responsibilities:

Collaborate with cross-functional teams to establish the future data landscape.
Play a crucial role in planning staffing needs through custom-built algorithms.
Build and maintain data pipelines in a data warehouse for workforce demand planning.
Work closely with data analysts, business analysts, and data scientists to enable new insights.
Develop and optimize complex data pipelines in Microsoft Azure and Databricks.
Ensure data security across end-to-end solutions and stay current with evolving tools and technologies.




Qualifications:

10+ years' experience in a data-heavy domain, including data warehousing, data engineering, or similar projects.
University degree in IT area or equivalent knowledge, Information Technology, or Computer Science. Certification in IT-/Information-/Business Architect education is desirable.
Solid experience in CI/CD work with Git, Bitbucket pipelines, and deployment/release processes.
Clear understanding of core cloud concepts, with experience in building and optimizing data pipelines and data lakes/warehouses â€“ in a cloud environment (preferably Azure).
Hands-on experience in Microsoft Azure, including designing, building, testing, and maintaining cloud applications and services.
Hands-on experience working with Azure Data bricks, Azure Functions
Experience in coding in Python, Apache Spark, Pandas
Strong understanding of core concepts such as Azure data storage, compute, data connections, APIs, and cloud security.
Experience in Agile project methodology and practice.
Effective communication skills in English, both written and verbal.
Proven experience in developing reports and dashboards.




Other Qualifications:

Ability to perform hands-on coding, mentor team members, and lead development processes.
Collaborate with stakeholders, team members, architects, and line managers to define competencies, processes, models, and technology needed for business requirements.
Backend work will be the main focus, but experience in working with visual reports, apps, dashboards in a BI tech stack, preferably Power BI, is a plus.
Excellent analytical thinking for translating data into informative visuals and reports.
Familiarity with implementation of machine learning models and interest in the underlying mathematics.
Curiosity to learn and evolve skill set in accordance with the latest industry trends.
Previous experience in software development on an advanced level.
Prior experience with linear programming is a plus.
Knowledge and experience with Docker and Kubernetes are beneficial.
Understanding and experience in real-time data handling is advantageous.




We Offer You:

Work in a Nordic and dynamic environment.
Wellness allowance & access to the officeâ€™s gym and health center (Solna).
Employee benefits through PostNordâ€™s own personnel foundation PostNord Plus.
Great occupational pension terms.
Great development opportunities and a continuous learning culture.
Employment in Solna.




How to Apply:

Welcome with your application. Selection is ongoing, so apply as soon as possible. In this recruitment, PostNord collaborates with Experis IT, which has extensive experience in recruiting IT specialists and managers. If you have any questions or need more information, please contact Recruitment Consultant Carina Eyoma at carina.eyoma@se.experis.com or +46 73-086 22 75.




About PostNord Group AB:

About PostNord Group AB We make everyday life easier! PostNord is the leading supplier of communication and logistics solutions to, from, and within the Nordic region. We ensure the provision of a postal service to households and businesses in Sweden and Denmark. We aim to make everyday life easier and more sustainable for everyone who lives and works in the Nordic region.




We are accountable, brave and committed, effectively leading change regardless if we lead ourselves or others. We emphasize teamwork, sincerity and positive relationships in the workplace. We build on our success and learn from both colleagues and mistakes. People with different backgrounds work with us. You will therefore be part of a workplace with great diversity, which contributes to better results for the business. Visit us at at www.postnord.com




We look forward to welcoming you to our team at PostNord Group AB.

Title: Infra- Database Engineer
Description:
Are you an ambitious Database Engineer eager to embark on a journey of managing complex database systems within a global technology ecosystem? We are looking for a skilled individual to join our team!

About Betsson Group's Product Development

Our Product Development organization operates on a global scale, with cross-functional teams spanning 6 Tech Hubs located in Malta, Budapest, Stockholm, Tallinn, Kyiv, and Athens. Our Product Development is comprised of nearly 600 dedicated professionals. Our talented Area Teams collaborate across geographical boundaries to drive innovation and deliver exceptional technology solutions.

What You'll Be Involved With


Working with cutting-edge technology enabling our Cloud Journey.
The Database team is responsible for building and managing Database hosting capabilities using Infrastructure as Code for all our platform needs. Database capabilities span from on-prem servers to cloud servers and DBaaS.
Building our Database Infrastructure Platforms with our developers and providing guidance and tooling to handle distributed systems.
Continuously improving, tuning, and optimizing our Database platform capabilities based on business needs. Analyzing, diagnosing, and solving issues of efficiency and performance.


We Are Seeking Individuals Who Possess


Proficiency in setting up and administering AWS database services, including SQL and NoSQL databases, both as DBaaS and Elastic Compute models.
Strong expertise in managing PostgreSQL and Microsoft SQL Server databases, including administration, optimization, and high availability configurations.
Familiarity with cloud providers, with a preference for AWS, and knowledge of cloud provider services such as Aurora, DynamoDB, and RDS.
Experience with scalable and distributed database infrastructure.
Excellent problem-solving skills, with the ability to analyze complex technical issues and provide effective solutions.
Adaptability to changing technologies and the ability to thrive in a fast-paced and dynamic work environment.
Support and implement the backup, recovery, and high availability strategies are crucial for data protection, with configurations for failover and replication.
DBAs monitor and fine-tune database performance, apply patches and updates, and automate routine tasks through scripting.
Capacity planning and disaster recovery planning ensure scalability and business continuity.


Also Meritorious Skills


Hands-on experience with Infrastructure as Code using tools like Terraform, with a solid understanding of Terraform modules and workflows.
Skill in version control to manage code changes effectively.
Familiarity with open-source monitoring tools like Prometheus and Grafana.
Proficiency in scripting languages such as Python, Bash, PowerShell, or similar.
Experience in using and managing Linux distributions.


If you're passionate about database engineering and thrive in a collaborative, fast-paced environment, we encourage you to apply and become part of our dynamic team!

What we offer

We can offer you an environment full of ambition and passion. One day is never like the other as the only constant is change, to the better, to the greater. We strive to be the best in whatever field we choose to play on, and we make sure to have fun along the way!


A friendly, open and humble working environment, where you will have the chance to work alongside with colleagues from all over the world
A chance to evolve your skills together with your colleagues with various programs and initiatives
Personal development through courses, in-house training and external certification
Freedom with responsibility


What else would you expect from a business of 75% millennial, 10% GenX, 70+ nationalities, equal opportunity employer where 40% of our workforce are women and growing. More than 2500 strong professionals spread across 13 offices.

Challenge Accepted?

By submitting your application, you understand that your personal data will be processed as set out in our Privacy Policy

Title: BI - Developer
Description:
FINN, Blocket, DBA, Bilbasen, Oikotie & Tori. Did you spot any familiar names? Then you already know a bit about Schibsted Marketplaces! Our team spans across the Nordics and Poland, united by a shared passion for our work and to foster a friendly and caring community. Curiosity, teamwork, problem-solving and continuous learning are the cornerstones of our culture.

Currently, weâ€™re embarking on an exciting journey to become a fully marketplace-focused company. Our mission is to empower people to make smart choices for themselves and future generations. To achieve this, we are committed to staying agile and proactive in the rapidly evolving digital landscape â€” shaping the future of digital marketplaces.

,

THE OPPORTUNITY IN A NUTSHELL

You? Are you a skilled BI developer with a passion for transforming data into actionable insights? Do you thrive in a dynamic environment where your analytical and data visualisation skills drive commercial decisions? Are you excited by the prospect of playing a crucial role in developing actionable analytics to optimise sales and advertising processes? If so, we have an exciting opportunity for you!

Role? As a BI Developer with a focus on reporting and visualisation within the new BI department of Sales Insights, you'll extract, transform, and analyse data from multiple sources to generate insights and develop dashboards using Tableau. You'll collaborate closely with stakeholders to understand their reporting requirements and translate them into data-driven solutions. Your work will include developing dashboards, performing ad-hoc analyses, and presenting findings to both technical and non-technical audiences.

Company? Nordic Marketplaces is a dynamic and innovative company committed to driving change through data. As a result of the Schibsted company separation, Sales Insights is creating its own BI department to develop actionable analytics and enhance revenue streams through optimised sales and advertising processes. FINN.no in Norway, Blocket in Sweden, Bilbasen and DBA in Denmark, Oikotie and Tori in Finland collectively form Schibsted Marketplaces, serving over 325 million monthly visits.

Why us?


Impact: Drive the optimization of our sales and advertising processes through data-driven insights.
Growth: Collaborate with various teams across the organisation, gaining broad experience and ample opportunities for professional growth.
Innovation: Thrive in a forward-thinking environment that embraces emerging technologies and industry trends.
Supportive Team: Join a team packed with smart, friendly, and motivated individuals who are passionate about what they do.


Sounds like your cup of tea? Check out the details below!

WHO ARE YOU?


Proven experience as a BI Developer preferably in a business intelligence or sales analytics role.
Expert knowledge using Tableau to build data visualisation and dashboard development.
Strong SQL skills for data extraction and manipulation.
Familiarity with CRM systems and advertising platforms is an advantage.
Proactive and self-motivated with a forward-leaning attitude.
Excellent analytical and problem-solving abilities.
Ability to communicate complex findings clearly and concisely.
Strong collaboration skills with the ability to work effectively in a team environment.
Detail-oriented with a focus on data quality and accuracy.
Enthusiastic about transforming data into actionable insights that drive business impact.


WHATâ€™S THE JOB LIKE?


Extract, transform, and analyse data from multiple sources to generate insights and reports using Tableau.
Collaborate with stakeholders to understand business requirements and translate them into data-driven solutions.
Design and develop story driven dashboards and reports to communicate key metrics and trends effectively.
Perform ad-hoc analysis to support business decisions and identify opportunities for improvement.
Present findings and insights to both technical and non-technical audiences in a clear and compelling manner.
Educate and train stakeholders on how to use dashboards effectively to gain insights and drive decision making.


What We Offer

We guarantee an engaging workplace where successes are celebrated, and colleagues support each other. Our benefits include various celebrations and plenty of opportunities to connect. Your well-being is a priority, supported by company benefits including physical and mental health support, flexible working hours, and on-site massage services. In our Oslo office, there's always cake to celebrate (which happens often), and in our Stockholm office, we cherish our Fika tradition.

GOT YOUR ATTENTION? Let us hear from you!

If you're looking for a workplace where you can share your knowledge, learn and grow, get inspired, be yourself, and make a difference, let us hear from you! We value diversity and welcome applicants from all backgrounds.

QUESTIONS?

Head of Business Intelligence of Sales Insight Micheal Zamayeri (micheal.zamayeri@schibsted.com) is happy to provide information about the daily work and answer any questions you may have about the role.

While we are continually reviewing CVs, please be aware that July is a traditional holiday period for us. We kindly ask for your patience as responses may be delayed until August. Thank you for your understanding!

Title: Data Analyst to support commercial data stewardship (Copenhagen)
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Job Description

Data Analyst to support commercial data stewardshipâ€¯(Copenhagen)

In Commercial Data & Analytics (CDA) we are more than +50 Analysts, Consultants, Engineers and Data Scientists working on transforming, tracking and improving the commercial results of Danske Bank.â€¯

We work with different types of behavioural data form Personal Customers.â€¯We are a global team working across the value chain from technical solutions and data, downstream towards the Business utilising BI and Data Science. Likewise we are part of the Forward â€™28 strategy on delivering great customer experiences which involves a focus on digital solutions and a more tailored and holistic advisory experience where data will be the key enabler.â€¯â€¯

You will be joining the Commercial Data team that consists of approx. 15 colleagues across Copenhagen, Vilnius and Bangalore, where we build and maintain data assets for a variety of use cases like BI and Data Science.â€¯

Your task will include:


Working closely with the whole data value chain ranging from System Owners over Business users and analysts to data engineers and data architectsâ€¯
Working with our Data Management framework and processes with a focus on critical data elements in the Businessâ€¯
Working on continuous improvement of data quality with the team and our Technology organisationâ€¯
Drive the escalation and remediation process for Customer related data issuesâ€¯
Assume responsibility of specific data assets within the commercial data domainâ€¯


About you:


Recently graduated with maximum of 2 years of experience
Experience with data modelling and ETL pipelinesâ€¯â€¯â€¯
Experience with Data Management Frameworks is beneficialâ€¯
Experience in a programming language like SQL and/or Pythonâ€¯
High analytical and problem solving skillsâ€¯
You like to proactively collaborate with people across the organisation and from different culturesâ€¯
Excellent written and spoken Englishâ€¯


A normal workday for our data analyst will consist of working with your team of data- and business experts ensuring our data assets are properly managed and documented. This will enable us to deliver on high quality customer journeys as well as enable us to become more digital cf. the Forward â€™28 strategy. Likewise, a big part of the job will make use of the analytical skills working with our databases and understanding our data models and linking that knowledge into the data framework.â€¯

Want to join our team?

Uniqueness is powerful-we welcome everyone in Danske Bank.â€¯Please note that responses to applications for this position may be delayed due to summer holidays. You can expect a response by the end of August. We appreciate your understanding and patience. If you have any questions regarding the profile, please reach out to Anders MÃ¼ller, ANDML@danskebank.dk in August or Max JÃ¸rgensen MAXJO@danskebank.dk in July.

We look forward to hearing from you!

  • High analytical and problem solving skillsâ€¯
  • You like to proactively collaborate with people across the organisation and from different culturesâ€¯
  • Excellent written and spoken Englishâ€¯

A normal workday for our data analyst will consist of working with your team of data- and business experts ensuring our data assets are properly managed and documented. This will enable us to deliver on high quality customer journeys as well as enable us to become more digital cf. the Forward â€™28 strategy. Likewise, a big part of the job will make use of the analytical skills working with our databases and understanding our data models and linking that knowledge into the data framework.â€¯

Want to join our team?

Uniqueness is powerful-we welcome everyone in Danske Bank.â€¯Please note that responses to applications for this position may be delayed due to summer holidays. You can expect a response by the end of August. We appreciate your understanding and patience. If you have any questions regarding the profile, please reach out to Anders MÃ¼ller, ANDML@danskebank.dk in August or Max JÃ¸rgensen MAXJO@danskebank.dk in July.

We look forward to hearing from you!

Title: Global BI Specialist
Description:
"Don't be a split end, join our team and let's make magic happen!"

"We're all about curling up with success. Come join our glamorous crew!"

"Life isn't perfect, but your hair can be! Join us and let's create beautiful hair together."

"Brush off the competition and style your career with us!"




Now we've had some pun together, let's talk about why you're really here. ðŸ¤©




Who We Are




At KEVIN.MURPHY, we care about the environment and make every effort to lessen our impact. Creating products with a conscience that are both kind to the hair and to the environment has been our guiding principle from the very beginning. THE CHOICES WE MAKE is our commitment to the environment and to social causes that we are passionate about.




Protecting the environment goes beyond just our products and packaging. Our sulphate-free formulas are created to use both the best in science and nature. We use packaging that is recyclable wherever possible, and our sleek, square bottles arenâ€™t just uniquely designed for looksâ€”they actually hold more product, use less plastic and more efficiency in shipping. Philanthropy is at the heart of our brand, and we are dedicated to supporting charitable causes through the support of our distributors, salon network and customers.




What We Do & Do Well




KEVIN.MURPHY has the same philosophy as skincare, KEVIN.MURPHYproducts are weightlessly designed to deliver performance, strength and longevity.

Combining hi-tech scientific knowledge with the best natural ingredients available, KEVIN.MURPHY products provide the tools to recreate high-fashion runway looks in the salon or at-home, while always remaining kind to the environment.




About The Role

Comprising of KEVIN.MURPHY, KMV, BELLUDIO ,BEAUTYSCOPE and SHOWPONY. Sold in over 65 countries and with a global workforce of over 350 passionate team members.




We are actively searching for our next Global BI Specialist, who will be a key member of the KEVIN.MURPHY global team, driving implementation and continuous improvement.




What Makes You Shine:

You possess exceptional strategic acumen and serve as the subject matter expert in all aspects of business intelligence. You promote ownership of Power BI, ensuring data is consistently current and accessible and excel in fostering strong stakeholder engagement.




Your top 5 Priorities for this role are:

Power BI product ownership with responsibility for ensuring data is current and available
Implement a common design and framework for all internal KM reports through Power BI
Work with each department and key stakeholders across the business to gather requirements, build and guide testing of Power BI reporting.
Work with ERP team to ensure all data, objects and updates are included in the reporting framework & work with vendors on continuous improvements
Develop user competence both in using but also building reports within Finance, Supply Chain, CSR & Sales.




Required Qualifications:

Bachelorâ€™s Degree: In Information Technology, Computer Science, Business Administration, or a related field.
Certification: Microsoft Certified Data Analyst Associate, particularly in Power BI, is advantageous.
Power BI Expertise: Extensive experience in developing and managing dashboards, reports, and data models.
Microsoft Dynamics Business Central: Hands-on experience, including data integration and reporting.
ETL Processes: Skilled in Extract, Transform, Load (ETL) to consolidate data from multiple sources.
Data Analysis and Visualisation: Strong abilities in data analysis, visualisation, and data storytelling.
SQL and DAX: Proficiency in SQL for database querying and DAX for complex calculations in Power BI.
Data Warehousing: Knowledge and experience in managing and optimising data warehouses.




Benefits as Impressive as You Are:

Generous PTO and paid holidays.
Comprehensive health insurance plans with employer contributions.
Employee discounts and product perks.




If you've read this far, it means you've really enjoyed the way I write job ads, or you tick all the boxes and we have you super intrigued - in that case, Hair-y on over and hit apply and let's start exploring a KEVIN.MURPHY future.

Title: Data Analyst - Vejle
Place: Vejle, Region of Southern Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Data Analyst - Vejle:

Do you thrive in a technology forward environment where everyone contributes towards the evolution of the team and business?

Then this could be your next role.

This business has been on an organic growth journey thanks to success year on year.

With a team of now 30+ across Vejle and Copenhagen, they have built a genuine development driven community where team members get to be autonomous and drive their own solutions.

After successfully adding new team members in software development, platform engineering and data engineering - we are now looking for our next data analyst.

As our new data analyst you will be responsible for the data within our data driven products, taking ownership of the solution. Helping to provide new insights and market trends to help the business with their proven success:

Key responsibilities:


Dive deep into big data sets to spot and explore trends
Craft detailed reports, insightful analyses, and dynamic dashboards to monitor the vitality of our business
Pioneer the creation of innovative leading indicators to empower our data driven products in shaping new forward facing data strategies
Stay ahead of potential risks through proactive risk management and deliver compelling reports that resonate with stakeholders


Key skills required:


Prior experience delving into data
Love to craft efficient and well-structured SQL queries
In-depth knowledge of statistical methods and data analysis.
In-depth knowledge of statistical methods and data analysis.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills, and fluent in English


Any experience with data lakes on S3 would also be welcomed!

If you think you know how to unlock value out of a fast paced data solution, then you could be what I am looking for!

Title: Data Engineer 12 Months Contract
Place: Ballerup, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
We are looking for a Data Engineer with 5+ years field experience-

Tech competencies:

Must have:


Python
SQL
Airflow.



Good to know:

Other AWS services (Appflow...).

Timeline: The estimated timeline for this project is 8-12 months, starting from August 2024. The specific milestones and deliverable dates will be determined in collaboration with the project team.

Project Overview: The objective of this project is to develop a data integration solution that brings together the data provided by IQVIA via the Snowflake marketplace, models and curates the data, and integrates it into the Salesforce CRM solution.

Scope of Work:

Data Integration: Extract data from IQVIA's data sources available on the Snowflake marketplace. Transform and cleanse the data to ensure its quality and consistency. Load the transformed data into the Salesforce CRM solution.

Data Modeling and Curation: Analyze the data requirements and design an appropriate data model for integration. Identify and resolve any data quality issues or inconsistencies.

Collaboration with the team, such as data architects, data engineers and business analysts.

Documentation and Reporting: Create relevant documentation of the data integration solution, including data mappings, transformations, and workflows.

Start date: August 2024

Timeline: 8-12 month

Location: Nearshore Denmark

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
Banking Circle is a truly international and vibrant company with more than 550 skilled and dedicated employees worldwide. We are a differentiator in the market who provides the stability of a Bank and the flexibility of a Fintech, in order to deliver a payments solution to our clients as we continue transforming the Banking and Payments industry for the new economy, that bypasses old, bureaucratic and expensive systems.




Are you a passionate and driven Business Intelligence, who wants to work with reporting and a strong data foundation for our reporting platform? And does working in a highly collaborative international organization seeking to change the payments industry landscape sound appealing to you? Then keep on reading.




About the team

You will join our newly established Pricing and Invoicing team, which is part of the Data & Reporting team where we build the data foundation for supporting the growth in a data driven organization.




The Pricing and Invoicing team has a strong commercial focus and is responsible for the end-to-end process of invoicing the bankâ€™s clients and reporting income figures. This includes creating a data foundation that ensures reliable, up to date and meaning full business data that, among other things, is used by our commercial teams, in management reporting, reporting to regulators and general client insights. Further, we have a close cooperation with the Sales team to ensure a smooth invoicing cycle on a monthly basis.

As part of a company that disrupts the banking industry, you will bring a mind-set where traditional solutions are challenged, and new ideas are welcome.




About the role

As a BI analyst you will have hands-on work with the tools, Databricks SQL and Power BI and you will be part of developing the data platform to deliver a high quality and well documented data foundation with a focus on pricing and invoicing elements.

You will facilitate new use based on requirements from e.g. product enhancements and sales initiatives and refine these requirements for our Data Engineering team and align technical solutions that are operational and can be handed over to the operational teams.

in cooperation with our stakeholders you will develop reporting solutions and dashboards that supports the growth in a data driven organization. You will implement new report and convert existing report to be based on our new data platform as this is developed.




What you will be doing

â€¢ Analyze, implement and document requirements for new reporting

â€¢ Identify data gaps related to reporting and ensure data enhancements

â€¢ Align solution and handle inquiries with relevant Group functions and stakeholders

â€¢ Ensure relevant processes are reviewed and established in order to support data requirements

â€¢ Define and handle test cases

â€¢ Develop and implement commercial dashboards

â€¢ Ensure a smooth operational process of the monthly invoicing cycle




What we are looking for

The ideal candidate for this position is experienced in working with data, has analytical skills and can take decisions on their own. The candidate is experienced with report creation and maintenance. Has strong SQL skills, Oracle or MS. Has experience in implementing data requirements in a business perspective and has an understanding of Python programming or equal is a plus.

We expect you to have knowledge of reporting tools, preferably Power BI or Tableau.

You are highly collaborative, with strong communication and interpersonal skills.




As a person you are a team player that shows initiative, takes responsibility, and works independently. You are solution-oriented in your approach to challenges, a confident decision-maker and a strong analytical problem solver with excellent communication skills. Finally, we expect you to be a knowledge sharing team-player who creates positive working relationships with others and has the ability to sustain delivering advice to a high standard in a fast-paced environment where projects and assignments will vary considerably in nature.

Since the Banking Circle is an international company itÂ´s a requirement that you are fluent in English, both verbally and in writing.




What we offer you

Banking Circle offers a hybrid work model for our employees to allow for flexibility and productivity. We furthermore offer a competitive compensation package and benefits and a dynamic and collaborative culture that values personal initiative and professional achievements.




Would you like to join us?

If this position has caught your interest and you have what weÂ´re looking for, then please send us your resume and application via the apply link. As we will be conducting interviews continuously we urge interested candidates to reach out as soon as possible. If you have questions about the position or what itÂ´s like to be a part of the Banking Circle do not hesitate to contact Svetlana Stetchi, from People team, via email: svst@bankingcircle.com. Please note that we do not accept applications by email.




Banking Circle is a fully licensed next generation Payments Bank that is designed to meet the global banking and payments needs of Payments businesses, Banks, and Marketplaces. Through our API, we deliver fast, low-cost global payments and banking services by connecting to the worldâ€™s clearing systems â€“ enabling our clients to move liquidity in real-time for all major currencies securely and compliantly.




To learn more about Banking Circle, visit us at www.bankingcircle.com

We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, colour, age, religion, sexual orientation, national origin or any other characteristics protected under federal, state or local laws, regulations and ordinances
