Title: Consumer Insights Consultant (Qualitative)
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Do you want to be part of an exciting journey, driving consumer centricity at the worldâ€™s largest jewellery brand? And are you passionate about working at the intersection of data, strategy, product and marketing to help give a voice to peopleâ€™s loves? Then this might be the opportunity you are looking for!

Play an active role in driving consumer centricity at Pandora

The Global Consumer Insights team is run out of our headquarters in Copenhagen and is part of the Global Business Unit which sits within Pandora Global Marketing. The team is the voice of the consumers within the organization ensuring that we keep them at the heart of everything we do. It is a team with an ambitious agenda that plays a key role in the companyâ€™s growth strategy, all rooted in deep consumer understanding.

As a Consumer Insights Consultant, you will have the unique opportunity to contribute to and accelerate the growth of the entire business. Reporting to the Consumer Insights Manager, you will support building the future of Pandoraâ€™s upcoming initiatives in a consumer-centric way and ensure we continue our successful growth journey.

Key responsibilities:


Drive qualitative and ethnographic research projects independently or with the team to identify actionable insights that can impact various business functions (e.g., Global Business Unit, Comms, Retail, Brand Strategy, Design). This can include understanding specific purchase occasions, evaluating different campaign routes, early assessments of new product ideas or identifying our customersâ€™ decision trees.
Independently manage (and assist the team in managing) all phases of the market research process for projects with a qualitative focus. This includes needs identification, project scoping and design, execution, analysis, and presentation of results.
Collaborate with commercial, innovation, design, and brand communication teams to incorporate insights into product and go-to-market concepts. Understand stakeholdersâ€™ business priorities and decision-making needs.
Support the framing of strategic and tactical insight topics.
Manage Pandoraâ€™s ongoing online consumer community, including identifying relevant topics, reporting, and analysis to drive consumer centricity in an agile way.
Support the social listening agenda, including identifying relevant topics, analyzing behavioral data, and reporting.
Develop relationships with external research vendors and moderators, interacting with them as needed.
Stay current with new market research techniques and implement innovative solutions.



Professional competencies:

We are looking for a talented individual with experience in qualitative research, a flair for numbers, and strong business acumen. The ideal candidate should have a proven track record in consumer insights and a genuine passion for understanding people. They should thrive in a dynamic, changing, and fast-paced environment.

More specifically, you come with:


Minimum 2-5 years of professional experience in similar roles, either at the client side and/or agency side.
Excellent knowledge and experience in scoping and executing a variety of qualitative methodologies, such as ethnography, consumer communities, social listening, IDIs, and focus groups.
Proven track record of utilizing various quantitative and qualitative research methodologies and sources to create impactful insights with clarity.
Excellent proficiency in identifying patterns and crafting compelling narratives grounded in solid argumentation based on qualitative and quantitative data.
Strong project management skills, capable of handling multiple projects simultaneously from scoping to planning, execution, and reporting.
Excellent proficiency in English (both written and spoken), with strong presentation and communication skills. Able to create clear, insightful PowerPoint presentations, internal briefs, and reports.
Proficiency in MS Office, particularly Excel, Outlook, and PowerPoint.
International experience preferred.
University degree (BSc or MSc in Anthropology, Ethnography, Cognitive Psychology, Cognitive Sciences, or a related field is considered advantageous)



Personal competencies:


Self-motivated with an entrepreneurial spirit, capable of proactively managing daily tasks and independently completing complex projects within agreed-upon timelines.
Highly adaptable in a dynamic, fast-paced environment, adept at managing multiple priorities and deadlines.
Curious about new opportunities and committed to generating insights with a continuous personal growth mindset.
A genuine team player, humble, honest, and trustworthy, with the ability to collaborate effectively across all organizational levels.



Additional Information

The role is in Pandora Global Office in Copenhagen, Denmark.

Travelling is highly dependent on the specific project, but 5-10 days of travel per year might be expected.

Did we get your attention?

We hope you got all your questions answered and feel confident applying for this position. If you see yourself in the position and would like to become a part of Pandoraâ€™s future, please do not hesitate to apply. We look forward to hearing from you!

We process applications on a continuous basis, which is why we encourage you to send your application as soon as possible. You can also read more about Pandora on our corporate site www.pandoragroup.com.

Icing on the cake

You will be working out of our beautiful Head Office in Copenhagen V, established in 2016 and designed to unite and inspire our teams. Besides our beautiful interior design we are also proud of our LEED Gold Certification for Energy and Environmental Design. This means that we use as few natural resources as possible and that we use them with respect. The result is a professional and dynamic space that is unique, comfortable and inspirational â€“ and delivers a true Pandora experience to anyone who works here or comes to visit.

About Pandora

Established in 1982, Pandora designs, manufactures and markets hand-finishedâ€¯jewelleryâ€¯made from high-quality materials at affordable prices. Pandoraâ€™s products are available in more than 100 countries on six continents through more than 6,500 points of sale, including around 2,500 concept stores.

Headquartered in Copenhagen, Denmark, Pandora employs 32,000 people worldwide and crafts itsâ€¯jewelleryâ€¯at two LEED certified facilities in Thailand, using mainly recycled silver and gold. The company plans to be carbon neutral by 2025 and has joined the Science Based Targets initiative to reduce emissions across its full value chain. Pandora is listed on the Nasdaq Copenhagen stock exchange and generated a revenue of DKK 28.1 billion in 2023.â€¯

At Pandora, we believe that creating an inclusive and diverse workplace and reflecting societal diversity in our customer engagement is essential to delivering on our company purpose: to give a voice to peopleâ€™s loves. We dedicate ourselves to fostering, cultivating and preserving a culture of inclusion and diversity where everyone feels respected and valued.

  • Excellent knowledge and experience in scoping and executing a variety of qualitative methodologies, such as ethnography, consumer communities, social listening, IDIs, and focus groups.
  • Proven track record of utilizing various quantitative and qualitative research methodologies and sources to create impactful insights with clarity.
  • Excellent proficiency in identifying patterns and crafting compelling narratives grounded in solid argumentation based on qualitative and quantitative data.
  • Strong project management skills, capable of handling multiple projects simultaneously from scoping to planning, execution, and reporting.
  • Excellent proficiency in English (both written and spoken), with strong presentation and communication skills. Able to create clear, insightful PowerPoint presentations, internal briefs, and reports.
  • Proficiency in MS Office, particularly Excel, Outlook, and PowerPoint.
  • International experience preferred.
  • University degree (BSc or MSc in Anthropology, Ethnography, Cognitive Psychology, Cognitive Sciences, or a related field is considered advantageous)


Personal competencies:

  • Self-motivated with an entrepreneurial spirit, capable of proactively managing daily tasks and independently completing complex projects within agreed-upon timelines.
  • Highly adaptable in a dynamic, fast-paced environment, adept at managing multiple priorities and deadlines.
  • Curious about new opportunities and committed to generating insights with a continuous personal growth mindset.
  • A genuine team player, humble, honest, and trustworthy, with the ability to collaborate effectively across all organizational levels.


Additional Information

The role is in Pandora Global Office in Copenhagen, Denmark.

Travelling is highly dependent on the specific project, but 5-10 days of travel per year might be expected.

Did we get your attention?

We hope you got all your questions answered and feel confident applying for this position. If you see yourself in the position and would like to become a part of Pandoraâ€™s future, please do not hesitate to apply. We look forward to hearing from you!

We process applications on a continuous basis, which is why we encourage you to send your application as soon as possible. You can also read more about Pandora on our corporate site www.pandoragroup.com.

Icing on the cake

You will be working out of our beautiful Head Office in Copenhagen V, established in 2016 and designed to unite and inspire our teams. Besides our beautiful interior design we are also proud of our LEED Gold Certification for Energy and Environmental Design. This means that we use as few natural resources as possible and that we use them with respect. The result is a professional and dynamic space that is unique, comfortable and inspirational â€“ and delivers a true Pandora experience to anyone who works here or comes to visit.

About Pandora

Established in 1982, Pandora designs, manufactures and markets hand-finishedâ€¯jewelleryâ€¯made from high-quality materials at affordable prices. Pandoraâ€™s products are available in more than 100 countries on six continents through more than 6,500 points of sale, including around 2,500 concept stores.

Headquartered in Copenhagen, Denmark, Pandora employs 32,000 people worldwide and crafts itsâ€¯jewelleryâ€¯at two LEED certified facilities in Thailand, using mainly recycled silver and gold. The company plans to be carbon neutral by 2025 and has joined the Science Based Targets initiative to reduce emissions across its full value chain. Pandora is listed on the Nasdaq Copenhagen stock exchange and generated a revenue of DKK 28.1 billion in 2023.â€¯

At Pandora, we believe that creating an inclusive and diverse workplace and reflecting societal diversity in our customer engagement is essential to delivering on our company purpose: to give a voice to peopleâ€™s loves. We dedicate ourselves to fostering, cultivating and preserving a culture of inclusion and diversity where everyone feels respected and valued.

Title: Senior Data Analyst B2C
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Job Description:


Location: Fully remote, EU timezone (CET +/- 2hours)
Start date: ASAP
Languages: English is mandatory; French is a plus
Our client: Cloud Computing / Distributed Systems / AI - European Saas



Objectives of this Role:


Analyze and interpret market and user data to drive business decisions and improve product offerings.
Develop and maintain robust data architecture for efficient data processing and analysis.
Present data insights in a clear, actionable manner to stakeholders across the company.
Understand and navigate the complexities of app marketing and related data restrictions.
Support product development and commercial objectives by providing data-driven insights and recommendations.



Responsibilities:


Design, implement, and manage backend data architecture to support analytics and reporting needs.
Collect, process, and analyze large datasets to extract meaningful insights about user behavior, product performance and growth roadmaps.
Create and maintain dashboards, reports, and visualizations to present data in an understandable and actionable way.
Collaborate with product, business, engineering and management teams to align data initiatives with company goals.
Stay up-to-date with the latest trends and best practices in data science, nalytics, and B2C app marketing and educate stakeholders on best practices.
Ensure compliance with data privacy regulations and best practices in data handling.
Augment the company with relevant Ai toolings to grow and scale with data insights.



Skills and Qualifications:


8+ years of proven working experience in data science, analytics, or a related field in tech/ cloud/ software domain.
Proficiency in programming languages such as Python, R, or SQL.
Experience with data visualization tools like Mixpanel, Domo or similar.
Solid understanding of backend data architecture and database management.
Ability to interpret complex data and present it in a clear, concise manner.
Familiarity with data privacy regulations and best practices.
Excellent problem-framing, problem solving and project management skills.
Excellent communication skills with proficiency in English.



Preferred Qualifications:


Experience in the B2C app companies, particularly with user data analysis.
Commercial acumen and the ability to align data insights with business objectives.
Understanding of app marketing strategies and associated data restrictions.
Knowledge of machine learning techniques and their application in business contexts.
Ability to work independently and collaboratively.
Fluency in AI-powered toolings to optimize productivity and efficiency.

Title: Consultant - Data & Process Analytics
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
We're Celonis, the global leader in Process Mining technology and one of the world's fastest-growing SaaS firms. We believe there is a massive opportunity to unlock productivity by placing data and intelligence at the core of business processes - and for that, we need you to join us.

The Team:

We're Celonis, the global leading Process Mining software company and one of the world's fastest-growing SaaS firms. We believe that every company can unlock its full execution capacity - and for that, we need you to join us as Consultant.

The Role:

As a Consultant in our delivery organization, you are part of our agile project teams to accelerate our customersâ€™ digital transformation and drive Celonisâ€™ international expansion. To generate high-value use cases, you work closely with our customers. You perform data transformations, develop analyses and derive business cases. You develop data-driven process insights and actions. You implement the newest features and functionalities of the Celonis software, such as Process Automation, Task Mining and Machine Learning.

The work youâ€™ll do:


Initiate:
Play a key role in the Celonis implementation project to ensure the optimal solution to tackle the customerâ€™s pain points
Design innovative analyses and execution apps and enrich them with Machine Learning algorithms or Task Mining to make the customerâ€™s processes transparent
Use our Celonis technology to identify process inefficiencies and understand the root causes, always in close collaboration with the customer

Implement:


Conduct value creation workshops and align measures to improve process inefficiencies
Quantify the business and financial potential and present the findings to the management
Implement our Process Automation technology to speed up the customerâ€™s processes, to drive value and to improve the process conformance rate


Adopt:


Implement the most relevant KPIs measuring the customerâ€™s success
Ensure the enablement of the customer to continuously improve processes
Set the foundation of the path to value to make the long-term customer success journey happen


The qualifications you need:


Min. 3 years working experience in IT-Consulting, Management Consulting, Process Improvement or a similar area
You are knowledgeable of data related languages (SQL required, other programming languages such as Python are a plus...)
Strong communication skills in Swedish/Danish and English and enjoy interacting with various customers to understand and interpret business processes
You are very dedicated and visionary and want to actively drive the Celonis Process Mining technology forward
Excellent analytical skills, well organised and known for being a quick learner
You search for a job with a steep learning curve in order to think outside the box and to continuously broaden your knowledge
Strong communication skills and enjoy interacting with various customers to understand and interpret business processes
Successfully completed your studies in Business Informatics, Computer Science, Information-oriented Business Administration/ Economics, Mathematics or a comparable degree program


What Celonis can offer you:


The unique opportunity to work with industry-leading process mining technology
Investment in your personal growth and skill development (clear career paths, internal mobility opportunities, L&D platform, mentorships, and more)
Great compensation and benefits packages (equity (restricted stock units), life insurance, time off, generous leave for new parents from day one, and more)
Physical and mental well-being support (subsidized gym membership, access to counseling, virtual events on well-being topics, and more)
A global and growing team of Celonauts from diverse backgrounds to learn from and work with
An open-minded culture with innovative, autonomous teams
Business Resource Groups to help you feel connected, valued and seen (Black@Celonis, Women@Celonis, Parents@Celonis, Pride@Celonis, Resilience@Celonis, and more)
A clear set of company values that guide everything we do: Live for Customer Value, The Best Team Wins, We Own It, and Earth Is Our Future


About Us

Since 2011, Celonis has helped thousands of the world's largest and most valued companies deliver immediate cash impact, radically improve customer experience and reduce carbon emissions. Its Process Intelligence platform uses industry-leading process mining technology and AI to present companies with a living digital twin of their end-to-end processes. For the first time, everyone in an organisation has a common language about how the business works, visibility into where value is hidden and the ability to capture it. Celonis is headquartered in Munich (Germany) and New York (USA) and has more than 20 offices worldwide.

Get familiar with the Celonis Process Intelligence Platform by watching this video.

Join us as we make processes work for people, companies and the planet.

Celonis is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. Different makes us better.

Accessibility and Candidate Notices
Show more

  • Conduct value creation workshops and align measures to improve process inefficiencies
  • Quantify the business and financial potential and present the findings to the management
  • Implement our Process Automation technology to speed up the customerâ€™s processes, to drive value and to improve the process conformance rate

Adopt:

  • Implement the most relevant KPIs measuring the customerâ€™s success
  • Ensure the enablement of the customer to continuously improve processes
  • Set the foundation of the path to value to make the long-term customer success journey happen

The qualifications you need:

  • Min. 3 years working experience in IT-Consulting, Management Consulting, Process Improvement or a similar area
  • You are knowledgeable of data related languages (SQL required, other programming languages such as Python are a plus...)
  • Strong communication skills in Swedish/Danish and English and enjoy interacting with various customers to understand and interpret business processes
  • You are very dedicated and visionary and want to actively drive the Celonis Process Mining technology forward
  • Excellent analytical skills, well organised and known for being a quick learner
  • You search for a job with a steep learning curve in order to think outside the box and to continuously broaden your knowledge
  • Strong communication skills and enjoy interacting with various customers to understand and interpret business processes
  • Successfully completed your studies in Business Informatics, Computer Science, Information-oriented Business Administration/ Economics, Mathematics or a comparable degree program

What Celonis can offer you:

  • The unique opportunity to work with industry-leading process mining technology
  • Investment in your personal growth and skill development (clear career paths, internal mobility opportunities, L&D platform, mentorships, and more)
  • Great compensation and benefits packages (equity (restricted stock units), life insurance, time off, generous leave for new parents from day one, and more)
  • Physical and mental well-being support (subsidized gym membership, access to counseling, virtual events on well-being topics, and more)
  • A global and growing team of Celonauts from diverse backgrounds to learn from and work with
  • An open-minded culture with innovative, autonomous teams
  • Business Resource Groups to help you feel connected, valued and seen (Black@Celonis, Women@Celonis, Parents@Celonis, Pride@Celonis, Resilience@Celonis, and more)
  • A clear set of company values that guide everything we do: Live for Customer Value, The Best Team Wins, We Own It, and Earth Is Our Future

About Us

Since 2011, Celonis has helped thousands of the world's largest and most valued companies deliver immediate cash impact, radically improve customer experience and reduce carbon emissions. Its Process Intelligence platform uses industry-leading process mining technology and AI to present companies with a living digital twin of their end-to-end processes. For the first time, everyone in an organisation has a common language about how the business works, visibility into where value is hidden and the ability to capture it. Celonis is headquartered in Munich (Germany) and New York (USA) and has more than 20 offices worldwide.

Get familiar with the Celonis Process Intelligence Platform by watching this video.

Join us as we make processes work for people, companies and the planet.

Celonis is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. Different makes us better.

Accessibility and Candidate Notices

Title: Data Engineer
Place: Ballerup, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Do you want to be part of an international team that drives technological innovation that saves lives and enhances patient care?

Do you want to gain the experience of being at the forefront of a digitalization tranformation journey?

Do you have a deepfounded passion in data engineering, cloud platforms and data management systems?

This could be your moment to shine. Apply today and embark on a career that keeps moving forward!

Local Role with Global Impact

In this role, you will be part of the Data and Analytics department at Ambuâ€™s headquarters. Our team is uniquely international, with members from around the world, and engages with business stakeholders globally. We are on a transformative journey, establishing a new foundation of processes, ownership, and technology, with a major focus on developing a cutting-edge Data Platform in the Microsoft Azure cloud.

As a Data Engineer, you will be at the forefront of automating business processes through digitalization and playing a pivotal role in our strategic initiative to enhance data-driven decision-making across the company.

In a collaborative and agile environment, we value open communication and a team-oriented approach to solving complex challenges. For new team members, we look for the eagerness to learn and adapt, rather than having detailed knowledge of or experience with every technology.

Your Day-to-day Work Will Involve


Designing, developing, and managing scalable data pipelines and architectures.
Ensuring data integrity and security, complying with the latest standards in data governance.
Collaborating with various business stakeholders globally to support data-driven decisions and innovations.
Leveraging new technologies to enhance the efficiency and capabilities of our data systems.


Suggested Candidate Profile

Setting you up for success is one of our cornerstones. We imagine you have a robust educational background in computer science, data science, or a related field, coupled with substantial experience in data engineering. As a person, you should be proactive, keen to learn new skills, and enthusiastic about sharing your expertise.

Experience Or Knowledge In The Following Is Highly Relevant


Microsoft Azure and other cloud services
ETL tools and processes
Data modeling and warehousing
Python, SQL, and other relevant data management technologies
Strong command of English, both written and spoken, is crucial for this role.


Apply for a career #ForeverForward

The Talent Attraction team will engage with candidates on an ongoing basis, hence we encourage you to not hesitate, and rather apply!

Questions? Reach out to Aike Baars, Head of Strategic Data Systems at aaba@ambu.com.

Title: Digital Analyst
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Weâ€™re a leading online reviews platform, free and open to all. Our mission is to be a universal symbol of trust. We are well on our way â€” but thereâ€™s still an exciting journey ahead of us. Do you want to join us at the heart of trust?

Trustpilotâ€™s growth has been exponential - from a successful IPO to building out new teams, we never stop working hard to fulfill our mission to create better experiences for everyone through our platform. But to do that, we need data! Thatâ€™s where Analytics comes in - youâ€™ll enable us to measure, uncover insights, and predict, to get data everywhere in Trustpilot. Weâ€™ve built a world-class analytics team that spans two continents and four cities - are you ready to join a fun, diverse global team?

As a Digital Analyst at Trustpilot, you will collaborate closely with Trusties in our Marketing teams and support CRO and customer acquisition activities across the board. You will spend your time enabling the collection of data from our various online channels, as well as digging through the data to uncover valuable insights. Youâ€™re keen to help your stakeholders use data to answer their toughest questions and you can proactively identify areas that need data support. Youâ€™ll be an internal data consultant, with loads of amazing data in our warehouse at your fingertips, working with tools like Google Analytics, BigQuery and Looker.

What Youâ€™ll Be Doing


Collaborate with Marketing, MarTech and Product teams to build a deeper understanding of visitor behaviour and optimize the conversion funnel of our website.
Perform and communicate in-depth analyses using website traffic, marketing spend and CRM data to help inform customer acquisition strategies.
Set goals and KPIs for conversion rate optimisation that assist with meeting the broader website and customer acquisition team goals.
Use Google Tag Manager and Segment to implement and deploy changes to website tracking.
Help to audit and troubleshoot website tagging and data layers to optimise our overall tracking architecture.


Who You Are


Solid understanding of the full spectrum of Digital Analytics, from tagging and tracking to creating reports and uncovering insights.
Deep knowledge of Google Analytics, as well as event tracking and tagging with Google Tag Manager and Segment.
Knowledge of web design languages such as HTML, CSS and Javascript, as well as good knowledge of SQL.
Experience with conversion rate optimisation (CRO) for websites and A/B testing.
Knowledge of reporting best practices and experience delivering actionable insights and preparing Monthly Business Reviews for senior leaders.
Experience using BI tools (such as Looker, Tableau).
Advanced written and verbal communication skills, especially when presenting ideas to senior management.


Whatâ€™s In It For You


A range of flexible working options to dedicate time to what matters to you
Competitive compensation package + bonus
25 days holiday per year, with an extra 5 days holiday allocated after your 1 year anniversary (prorated)
Two (paid) volunteering days a year to spend your time giving back to the causes that matter to you and your community
Rich learning and development opportunities supported through the Trustpilot Academy, LinkedIn Learning and Blinkist
Comprehensive health package, pension and full access to Headspace, a popular mindfulness app to promote positive mental health
Paid parental leave
Newly renovated central office with a laid back vibe and constant buzz of different languages being spoken everywhere you go Itâ€™s complete with a coffee bar, canteen and table tennis and has a wide variety of refreshments available - you can opt in for breakfast and lunch at an affordable price
Regular opportunities to connect and get to know your fellow Trusties, including company-wide celebrations and events, ERG activities and team socials
Opportunity to join the Trustpilot Social Club for a small monthly fee and attend regular social and leisure activities like go karting, cooking classes and escape rooms
Employee discounts to restaurants and shops
Tax Free Travel (DSB)


Still not sure?

We are Open to All, which means we want everyone to feel like they can see themselves at Trustpilot. We're keen to hear about your experiences as well as how you can help to create a fantastic culture for our amazing Trusties. So, don't worry if you're looking at this job description and feel like you don't meet all the requirements, we'd still really like to hear from you!

About Trustpilot

At Trustpilot, weâ€™re passionate about our mission to offer a free and open to all review platform, built on collaboration. For consumers, weâ€™re a place to connect with and influence businesses. For companies, weâ€™re a platform for progress; a way to improve and innovate by engaging and collaborating with consumers.

Weâ€™re driven by connection. Itâ€™s at the heart of what we do. Our culture keeps things fresh â€“â€“ itâ€™s built on the relationships we create. We talk, we laugh, we collaborate and we respect each other. We work across borders and cultures to be a tangible symbol of trust in an ever-changing world. With vibrant office locations all around the world and over 50 nationalities, weâ€™re proud to be an equal opportunity workplace with diverse perspectives and ideas.

Our purpose is a tall order, but we keep it real. Weâ€™re a great bunch of humans, doing awesome stuff, without fuss or pretense.

A successful Trustpilot future is driven by you â€“â€“ we give you the autonomy to shape a career you can be proud of. If youâ€™re ready to grow, letâ€™s go.

Join us at the heart of trust.

Trustpilot is committed to creating an inclusive environment where people from all backgrounds can thrive and where different viewpoints and experiences are valued and respected. Trustpilot will consider all applications for employment without regard to race, ethnicity, national origin, religion, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, neurodiversity, disability, age, parental or veteran status. Together, we are the heart of trust.

Trustpilot is a global company and our data practices are designed to ensure that your personally identifiable information is appropriately protected. Please note that your personal information will be transferred, accessed and stored globally as necessary for the uses and disclosures stated in our Privacy Policy.

Title: Quantitative Analyst
Description:
Join a world of energy as MFT Energy's new Quantitative Analyst

In MFT Energy we trade energy to make markets efficient and to facilitate the green transition. We are looking for a Quantitative Analyst to join our ambitious Intraday team with experienced colleagues, who strive to be the best every day.'




The job as Quantitative Analyst

As our new Quantitative Analyst, you will become part of a professional and dedicated algorithmic trading team. Our team contributes to developing autonomous trading strategies in the European intraday power market using cutting-edge technologies and trading methodologies.

The team consists of a highly diverse set of individuals, all with a common passion for data-driven trading and a goal to create the most sophisticated setup in the industry.

Your work areas will be within programming new trading strategies as well as supporting the improvement of our current trading setup. You will be reporting to our Head of Algorithmic Trading, Daniel Vibe.




Your key responsibilities

Research new market opportunities
Develop new trading strategies using machine learning and market knowledge
Contribute to existing trade signal and execution frameworks
Benchmark and evaluate external forecast providers
Optimize our active trade execution algorithms
Acquire and maintain data from external sources




Your qualifications and personal skills

Minimum 2 years of experience from a similar role or top of your university class
Quantitative background in Science, Economics, Engineering, Finance, or similar
Experience with Python and standard libraries such as Pandas, Numpy, etc.
Master machine learning and data-science fundamentals
Excellent communication skills and a proactive approach
Strong analytic skills and an eye for detail
The ability to work independently and structure your workload
A positive and competitive attitude, but at the same time a valued team player
Have a curious mind and the courage to take on a steep learning curve
Fluent in English, both spoken and written, as our company language is English




Working in MFT Energy

You will be part of a young, global, and vibrant working environment in the heart of Aarhus. MFT Energy is a transparent and flat organization with entrepreneurship at heart. We have 163 employees working out of our headquarters in Scandinavian Center in Aarhus C and from our international offices in Turkey, Australia, USA, and Singapore as well as several remote colleagues working from all over the world. Our mission is to empower entrepreneurs to become the best â€“ we believe that this is done via a fair organizational structure, with the most competent people, based on the right values.




We offer:

A competitive and entrepreneurial work environment
Professional and committed colleagues with great ambitions
Great employee benefits and a people-centered leadership approach
The chance to one day become partner
A celebrative work environment, a modern workplace, and an entrepreneurial, professional culture.




Make the most of your talent! Join us!

If you think there is a fit between our values and your aspirations, we will be looking forward to receiving your application with your CV and your diplomas. For questions, please contact career@mft-energy.com.




Start date: As soon as possible.




We will be screening candidates on an ongoing basis.

Title: Staff Data Engineer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Weâ€™re a leading online reviews platform, free and open to all. Our mission is to be a universal symbol of trust. We are well on our way â€” but thereâ€™s still an exciting journey ahead of us. Do you want to join us at the heart of trust?

Calling Trailblazing Staff Data Engineers!

Are you excited about problem-solving and experienced with keeping data landscapes optimised? Trustpilot is seeking an advanced Staff Data Engineer to join our vibrant team!

The Mission Awaits

As a Staff Data Engineer at Trustpilot, youâ€™ll be accountable for optimising the backbone of our data ecosystem. From developing new ingestion flows, optimising existing pipelines, or helping integrate trusted data with varied systems (reverse etls) - your skills will contribute to the success of our innovative team and pave the way for future innovations.

Your Role As a Staff Data Engineer


Act as a technical bar-raiser for the processing of data; raising the bar for data scientists, analysts, and analytics engineers.
Design long-term data processing architecture - including data models and tools leveraged to realise our ambitions.
Design and implement reliable, consistent, scalable data ingestion, transformation, and integration pipelines - defining our â€˜paved pathsâ€™ as a result.
Support the identification and approach to optimising existing data processing to minimise wastage (compute and spend)
Drive data ownership and accountability across engineering teams.
Perform data resource tagging and classification for granular analysis and optimisation opportunities.
Monitor and evaluate data usage patterns, identifying opportunities for optimization and efficiency improvements.
Automate data quality alerts and notifications to prevent outages and promote data quality.
Stay current on industry trends, emerging technologies, and best practices to improve and refine Data processes continuously.
Coach and mentor lower-level engineers on best practices


Ideal Qualifications


In-depth expertise in public cloud (AWS, GCP).
Proficiency with automation and scripting in languages like Python, CloudFormation, Terraform, or your language of choice.
Comprehensive understanding of data engineering tooling, including but not limited to BigQuery, Segment, Kafka, Airflow, Airbyte, and DataHub
Passion for finding and implementing efficiencies in data flows
Ability to work individually and facilitate initiatives with minimal oversight.
Great stakeholder management, communication, and teamwork skills.


Our Commitment To Diversity & Inclusion

At Trustpilot we want to create a strong feeling of belonging, for every Trustie, where you donâ€™t feel like you have to â€˜fit inâ€™, you can just be you, your really awesome self. A place where youâ€™re treated fairly, your perspective is valued, and youâ€™re empowered to do the best work of your life. Trustpilot is committed to this vision. We want to be a part of creating a more diverse, equitable, and inclusive world of work for all. Join us in breaking barriers and reshaping the tech industry!

Whatâ€™s In It For You


A range of flexible working options to dedicate time to what matters to you
Competitive compensation package + bonus
25 days holiday per year, with an extra 5 days holiday allocated after your 1 year anniversary (prorated)
Two (paid) volunteering days a year to spend your time giving back to the causes that matter to you and your community
Rich learning and development opportunities supported through the Trustpilot Academy, LinkedIn Learning and Blinkist

  • Stay current on industry trends, emerging technologies, and best practices to improve and refine Data processes continuously.
  • Coach and mentor lower-level engineers on best practices

Ideal Qualifications

  • In-depth expertise in public cloud (AWS, GCP).
  • Proficiency with automation and scripting in languages like Python, CloudFormation, Terraform, or your language of choice.
  • Comprehensive understanding of data engineering tooling, including but not limited to BigQuery, Segment, Kafka, Airflow, Airbyte, and DataHub
  • Passion for finding and implementing efficiencies in data flows
  • Ability to work individually and facilitate initiatives with minimal oversight.
  • Great stakeholder management, communication, and teamwork skills.

Our Commitment To Diversity & Inclusion

At Trustpilot we want to create a strong feeling of belonging, for every Trustie, where you donâ€™t feel like you have to â€˜fit inâ€™, you can just be you, your really awesome self. A place where youâ€™re treated fairly, your perspective is valued, and youâ€™re empowered to do the best work of your life. Trustpilot is committed to this vision. We want to be a part of creating a more diverse, equitable, and inclusive world of work for all. Join us in breaking barriers and reshaping the tech industry!

Whatâ€™s In It For You

  • A range of flexible working options to dedicate time to what matters to you
  • Competitive compensation package + bonus
  • 25 days holiday per year, with an extra 5 days holiday allocated after your 1 year anniversary (prorated)
  • Two (paid) volunteering days a year to spend your time giving back to the causes that matter to you and your community
  • Rich learning and development opportunities supported through the Trustpilot Academy, LinkedIn Learning and Blinkist
  • Comprehensive health package, pension and full access to Headspace, a popular mindfulness app to promote positive mental health
  • Paid parental leave
  • Newly renovated central office with a laid back vibe and constant buzz of different languages being spoken everywhere you go Itâ€™s complete with a coffee bar, canteen and table tennis and has a wide variety of refreshments available - you can opt in for breakfast and lunch at an affordable price
  • Regular opportunities to connect and get to know your fellow Trusties, including company-wide celebrations and events, ERG activities and team socials
  • Opportunity to join the Trustpilot Social Club for a small monthly fee and attend regular social and leisure activities like go karting, cooking classes and escape rooms
  • Employee discounts to restaurants and shops
  • Tax Free Travel (DSB)

Still not sure?

We want to be a part of creating a more diverse, equitable, and inclusive world of work for all. Weâ€™re excited to hear about your experiences as well as how you will contribute to our working culture. So, even if you donâ€™t feel you don't meet all the requirements, we'd still really like to hear from you!

About Trustpilot

At Trustpilot, weâ€™re passionate about our mission to offer a free and open to all review platform, built on collaboration. For consumers, weâ€™re a place to connect with and influence businesses. For companies, weâ€™re a platform for progress; a way to improve and innovate by engaging and collaborating with consumers.

Weâ€™re driven by connection. Itâ€™s at the heart of what we do. Our culture keeps things fresh â€“â€“ itâ€™s built on the relationships we create. We talk, we laugh, we collaborate and we respect each other. We work across borders and cultures to be a tangible symbol of trust in an ever-changing world. With vibrant office locations all around the world and over 50 nationalities, weâ€™re proud to be an equal opportunity workplace with diverse perspectives and ideas.

Our purpose is a tall order, but we keep it real. Weâ€™re a great bunch of humans, doing awesome stuff, without fuss or pretense.

A successful Trustpilot future is driven by you â€“â€“ we give you the autonomy to shape a career you can be proud of. If youâ€™re ready to grow, letâ€™s go.

Join us at the heart of trust.

Trustpilot is committed to creating an inclusive environment where people from all backgrounds can thrive and where different viewpoints and experiences are valued and respected. Trustpilot will consider all applications for employment without regard to race, ethnicity, national origin, religion, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, neurodiversity, disability, age, parental or veteran status. Together, we are the heart of trust.

Trustpilot is a global company and our data practices are designed to ensure that your personally identifiable information is appropriately protected. Please note that your personal information will be transferred, accessed and stored globally as necessary for the uses and disclosures stated in our Privacy Policy.

Title: Data Insights Consultant
Place: Kongens Lyngby, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
About Us

Topsoe is a leading global provider of technology and solutions for the energy transition. We combat climate change by helping our customers and partners achieve their decarbonization and emission reduction goals.

Based on decades of scientific research and innovation, we offer world leading solutions for transforming renewable resources into fuels and chemicals for a sustainable world, and for efficient and low-carbon fuel production and clean air.

We were founded in 1940 and are headquartered in Denmark, with over 2,800 employees serving customers all around the globe. To learn more, visitâ€¯www.topsoe.com.

Who Weâ€™re Looking For

Can you identify needs, build, and apply BI reports to support the business and for decision-making, or do you have an interest within this area? Do you like to work, and help colleagues from many different departments and cross functions? Then you might be the Data Consultant we are looking for!

Our team supports the business with tools and insights to make data-driven strategic and tactical improvements. We are a smaller team within the Business Finance organization with lots of ambitions, so there will be plenty of opportunity to make a difference and set the agenda together. Your role will be very diverse. One day you might be developing new insights reports, and the next day you will innovate existing analyses and reports â€“ and discuss next-level solutions with stakeholders or managers.

Your Tasks Will Include


Identifying and designing value-adding insights solutions
Interpreting business requests and clarifying data requirements
Assisting and advising on data models and scoping of new BI projects
Collaborating with highly skilled colleagues including Data analysts, Application Specialists, Business Partners, and Managers to service our clients coherently
Promoting new insights/reports (descriptive and prescriptive).


Our primary tools - knowledge to the tools is not a requirement:


SAC (SAP Analytics Cloud)
Excel and SAP Analysis
Eclipse IDE (Eclipse Modeling Tools)
Power Point and Think-cell.


Experience or not?

The preferred candidate has some years of experience from similar jobs, e.g., Business Analyst, BI Consultant or Data Analyst in either other companies or consultancy firms. It is a plus but not a requirement to have consultancy experience.

The right candidate could also be a newly graduated and hold a masterâ€™s degree within Economics or Data Science or equivalent. If this is the case, together we will find the right balance between tasks and responsibilities to match your profile.

Why join us

There are many reasons to join us. To mention a few, you will get:


A job with a purpose: We are on a mission to solve the worldâ€™s climate crises. We are using our cutting-edge technology for a better world, and we are well underway on our vision to become a global driver in carbon emission reduction technologies in 2024
A platform to grow from: We have personal and professional development high on our agenda, and we will provide you with tools and tasks to make you learn and grow
We care about you: We believe in the strength derived from diversity, and we strive to build trust in- and collaborate with one-another.


How You Can Apply

If you would like to be part of a team of skilled and professional colleagues in an informal organization, please submit your application and resume in English and enclose a copy of your references through our website www.topsoe.com.

Please contact Nicholas Olsen-Stryhn, Head of Data Insights at +45 28409350 or NIOS@topsoe.com if you want to know more about the position.

Application deadline

August 11, 2024.

Title: Serialization Data Analyst, Packaging Compliance & Master Data
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Do you have a flair and interest for data and supply chain and are you keen on working across various business areas to ensure compliance of Lundbeckâ€™s products? Then this is a great opportunity.

Your new role

In your new role, you will join the cross-functional serialization team. You will work alongside dedicated colleagues by handling various operational serialization tasks and maintaining the current processes. You will assist the organization in translating market-specific regulations into actions and ensure that Lundbeck is compliant with local regulations on serialization.

Your role will combine operational support, process ownership, and project management. You will be the focal point for our various business units and partners and support the organization in implementing serialization compliance initiatives globally while ensuring effective serialization processes cross-functionally.

You will be working on several activities within serialization, with the following focus areas:


Driving issue analysis and correction with production, IT, external partners, contract manufacturers, and solution providers - to support Supply Chain departments and Pharmaceutical Production
Data analysis and error trending on operations to identify improvement areas
Creating standard processes and guidelines in the Line of Business â€“ in collaboration with the Serialization team, Corporate IT, and consultants
Driving small and medium projects and activities independently, and in collaboration with colleagues â€“ with the possibility of driving larger projects further on



Your future team

You will join the Packaging Compliance and Master Data department which consists of 19 dedicated employees divided into 4 groups: Artwork, Master Data, Packaging Change Management, and Serialization. Together we ensure timely updates of artwork and master data for all Lundbeck products, as well as drive serialization for the whole organization and external partners.

Packaging Compliance and Master Data is a part of the division Pharmaceutical Production & Supply Chain, and we are based in Lundbeckâ€™s headquarters in Valby. The division consists of +550 employees, located in Denmark and France, and we are responsible for the production and distribution of Lundbeckâ€™s medical products.

As Serialization Data Analyst, you will report to the Senior Manager of Packaging Compliance & Master Data.

What You Bring To The Team

Our preferred candidate has the following professional qualifications:


A bachelor's or masterâ€™s degree in a relevant field (IT, engineering, supply chain management, business, or equivalent), and 0-3 years of experience
A structured approach to complex issues, with an analytic and goal-oriented mindset to independently establish solutions
Detail-oriented and deep understanding of data
Great communication- and stakeholder management skills
Experience in the Pharmaceutical industry (working with GMP and GXP), supply chain, and/or working with serialization is beneficial



Serialization is a niche, and while experience and knowledge within the field will be beneficial, it is not a requirement, and Lundbeck will provide thorough training. The most important thing is that you are willing to learn and have the desire to develop your competencies as well as having a desire to develop yourself and grow your area of expertise and responsibility.

You enjoy working with data and complex workflows. You are detail-oriented but also possess the ability to take the â€œhelicopterâ€ view of various ongoing projects and activities and naturally take the lead in solving complex challenges.

You are curious by nature; you are proactive, and you always try to find the best solution for our customers and Lundbeck overall.

You are a true team player and bring positivity to the office even in busy times. You enjoy having several different tasks (including day-to-day) and projects at the same time and are confident in communicating with colleagues on all levels in the organization.

Our promise to you

Lundbeck offers an inspiring workplace, passionate colleagues, and a culture characterized as collaborative â€“ a must to successfully bring our treatments through research and development all the way to commercialization and the people who need them. We offer a mix of exciting tasks and numerous development opportunities that are balanced with initiatives focused on your well-being.

You can also learn more about us at www.lundbeck.com or by following us on LinkedIn, Instagram (@h_lundbeck) or Twitter (@Lundbeck).

Apply now

Can you see yourself in this role? We want to hear from you. Does this sound like your dream job, but youâ€™re not sure if you meet all the requirements? We still want to hear from you!

Upload your CV and include a few lines about your motivation and reasons for applying. No separate cover letter is needed. We ask you not to include a photo or personal information that does not relate to your professional experience.

Please submit your application no later than the 5th of August 2024.

If you have questions or want to hear more, please feel free to contact hiring manager, Anne Katrine Irgens at AEIR@lundbeck.com or +45 22 76 98 27.

We need every brain in the game â€“ and that includes all brains and the different perspectives we bring to the table. At Lundbeck, we embrace the uniqueness of each employee, and we are committed to building a workforce that is as diverse as the people we serve. Read more about our commitment at www.lundbeck.com/global/about-us/our-commitment/diversity-and-inclusion.

#EveryBrainInTheGame

This job ad is intended for individuals seeking a career opportunity with Lundbeck. We engage with recruitment and search firms where needed on the basis of a written agreement, and we do not accept unsolicited requests of any kind. If you work as a recruitment consultant, you are kindly instructed to refrain from contacting Lundbeck or the hiring manager directly with suggested candidates. If you violate this policy, you do so at your own risk and for your own account, and Lundbeck will not assume any liability nor pay any associated fees resulting from such violation.

This job ad is intended for individuals seeking a career opportunity with Lundbeck. We engage with recruitment and search firms where needed on the basis of a written agreement, and we do not accept unsolicited requests of any kind. If you work as a recruitment consultant, you are kindly instructed to refrain from contacting Lundbeck or the hiring manager directly with suggested candidates. If you violate this policy, you do so at your own risk and for your own account, and Lundbeck will not assume any liability nor pay any associated fees resulting from such violation.

Title: Data Engineer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
LiveIntent is looking for an enterprising Data Engineer, full of ideas, with an interest in programming and large scale data processing, to join our highly competent development team in Copenhagen! Our team in Copenhagen is responsible for the development and deployment of the companyâ€™s next-generation technology closely collaborating with the companyâ€™s other branches in New York and Berlin.

LiveIntent Copenhagen started as a Danish start-up company in 2013 and was acquired by LiveIntent in November 2015. The team is led by people who have been with us since the start in 2013 and consists of a further approx. 30 new hires that have been added since the end of 2016. We develop and operate a very complex analytical data processing pipeline which is a basic component of all the company's products.

About The Job

The Compute Infrastructure team empowers data scientists and data engineers through a Scala data warehouse framework designed for data modeling and the creation of type-safe and easily testable batch jobs. Our team also orchestrates a compute environment that simplifies the execution of Spark jobs, facilitating the analysis of terabytes of data with ease and cost-effectiveness. The runtime environment is based on Hadoop clusters on EC2 spot instances, dynamically scaling up as required, ensuring high resource utilization and stability

What you will be doing as part of the compute infrastructure team:


Operate and implement new features in the framework and the services managed by the team
Engaging with data scientist and identify ways of improving their experience and productivity of using our framework and services
Identify and implement computational improvements
Making improvements and/or fixing bugs by submitting patches to open source projects that are in our stack. For example Spark, Hadoop, Airflow and many others.
Act as a office topic expert on Spark and Scala


Your Profile

You are interested in back-end technologies and architecture and are passionate about learning new things. You may also be interested in math, statistics, or adtech technology.

You Have a Degree In Computer Science, Software Engineering, Physics, Math, Or Chemistry. You Have Practical Experience With Actual Programming, And Preferably Also Have a Practical And/or Deep Theoretical Understanding Of Some Of The Following


Spark and/or other large scale data-processing framework
Programming in Scala or other JVM based language
Basic knowledge about Amazon Web Services (EC2, S3, Athena, etc)


You approach problems analytically and solutions pragmatically. You are full of good ideas, able to see opportunities and weaknesses in other peopleâ€™s ideas, and able to find ways to discuss ideas in a distanced and constructive manner. You love to go in depth with different topics and are curious about learning about things within new subjects. You want to understand and get involved with the problems the company is facing. You thrive in a dynamic environment where work priorities can change, and therefore tasks may not always be finished. You can hand over tasks, but prefer to finish them yourself. You are able to work independently and enterprisingly. When people come to you with a problem, bug or a question youâ€™ll want to help them immediately.

The Company

LiveIntent, one of the worldâ€™s largest people-based marketing platforms, connects 2,500 publishing and advertising brands with over 250 MM verified people every month across all types of media. With the anonymized email address at the center of its industry-leading identity graph, LiveIntent provides brands with solutions that help them monetize, acquire, and retain real people, even where cookies donâ€™t work. LiveIntent enriches a brandsâ€™ data, making it possible for them to deepen their understanding of their audiences, and more effectively market to people wherever they are present and paying attention. LiveIntent is home to over 250 people worldwide with offices in New York, Chicago, Berlin, and Copenhagen.

LiveIntent Copenhagen started as a Danish startup company in 2013 and was acquired by LiveIntent in November 2015. We develop and operate both an online, real-time service that receives billions of requests from all over the world and from other LiveIntent components, and an offline, batch-oriented analytical data processing pipeline that prepares data for the online service by processing billions of data points.

We Offer

You can look forward to being a key player in a challenging and dynamic developmental story where you will be part of a team with some of the industry's hottest talents. There will be rich opportunities to learn from others, and you will have the flexibility to dive into experiments on your own. We are passionate about new solutions, technologies and algorithms, but pragmatic in our choice of solutions.

We believe in freedom and flexibility under responsibility so that office hours can be adapted to your life as long as meetings are covered. If you need to work from home one day, it is completely fine, as long as you live up to what is expected. We are an international company, with frequent contact between the departments in Berlin and New York City. The position is located in our office in Copenhagen.

Does that sound exciting? If so, send us an application! We are a small office with a social atmosphere so your personal profile is just as valuable to us as your technical skills. A cover letter will therefore be greatly appreciated.


Show more

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Abacus Medicine is searching for a driven Data Engineer to join the Data Engineering team where you will play a pivotal role in building scalable and robust data solutions. Utilize your skills in Python, Apache Spark, Azure Databricks, Azure Data Factory, and Azure Data/Delta Lake, along with other cutting-edge technologies. We donâ€™t think it is mandatory to have experience with all tools, instead, we prioritize your eagerness to learn and grow within this role, as well as passion for the field of data engineering. Join us in driving our Data Engineering vision and explore the vast possibilities of a modern data tech-stack!




Your responsibilities as a Data Engineer:

Design, develop, maintain and optimize data pipelines that perform data extraction, transformation, and loading (ETL) processes from various sources, ensuring data quality and efficiency.
Work on projects in the field of data engineering that directly impact our data-driven initiatives. Relating to data integration solutions, data quality, storage optimization, upgrading our architecture, and more.
Stay up to date with emerging data engineering trends and technologies to further develop our modern data cloud platform.
Leveraging our scalable monitoring tool and cutting-edge data observability platform to monitor and troubleshoot data pipelines, identifying and resolving issues proactively and build solutions with the aim of reducing time to detection and time to resolution.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams and other data professionals and stakeholders throughout the business to gather requirements and design robust data solutions, merging the expertise from different domains to find the best solution for each data challenge.
Optimize big data storage and data retrieval processes.




The Tech-Stack

Some of the technologies and tools you will be working with are:

Azure Databricks
Azure Data Factory
Azure Data/Delta Lake
Python
PySpark
SQL
Azure DevOps
Monte Carlo, Data Observability Platform
Git
And more!




Are you the right candidate?

As a Data Engineer, you will play a vital role in our data infrastructure team, supporting the development, maintenance, and optimization of our data pipelines and platform. You will work closely with a talented group of data professionals, ranging from BI developers and data analysts to data scientists, gaining hands-on experience in data engineering best practices and cutting-edge technologies.

To succeed in the job, it is important that you are passionate, possess technical skills, and have a genuine interest in working with new cloud technologies. Your motivation to deliver high-quality data services, which serve as a foundation for impactful decision-making and advanced analytics across the organization, will be crucial to your success. You thrive in a dynamic and ambitious team environment and approach problem-solving with a creative mindset.

In Data & Analytics, we promote continuous learning and development and help our data engineers to expand their expertise and knowledge in various domains.




Qualifications and skills:

A Masterâ€™s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Data Science, or a related field.
Proficiency in Python programming.
Familiarity in working with source control such as git.
Basic knowledge of SQL.
Experience in data manipulation, data wrangling, and data cleansing techniques to ensure data quality and integrity.
Strong problem-solving skills with attention to detail.
Excellent communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work effectively in a team-oriented environment.
Proactive mindset with a continuous learning approach to keep up with evolving technologies in the data engineering field.
Good oral and written communication skills in English.




It is an advantage (but not a requirement) if you have knowledge or experience with:

Cloud platforms, such as Azure, AWS or GCP.
Azure Data/Delta Lake for efficient storage and processing of big data.
Apache Spark and Databricks for data processing and analytics.
Experience with PySpark.
Experience with Azure Data Factory, or familiarity with other similar data integration and orchestration tools.
Data governance and data modelling best practices
Understanding of CI/CD practices.

Join our team and be part of an exciting journey to unlock the power of data!




Your future colleagues

In the D&A department, we are responsible for developing and maintaining Abacus' datahub, as well as implementing our BI platform, facilitating data-driven projects, and developing advanced analytics models (ML). The team comprises 3 Data Scientists, 5 BI developers, 2 Data Analysts, and 4 Data Engineers, along with 3 team leads overseeing different areas of expertise.




Our team consists of individuals from diverse nationalities, expertise areas, educational backgrounds, and ownership responsibilities across our data platforms and services. This diversity creates a strong environment for collaboration, technical synergies, and support among units, all while maintaining a positive and motivating work environment.




In summary, our goal is to create innovative data-driven solutions for core business problems within a friendly and professional work setting.




Have we caught your interest?

If you wish to apply for the position, please use the apply link and attach your resumÃ©, cover letter and grade transcript. We do not accept applications by email.

Last application day is August 31st. Interviews will be conducted throughout the application period. The position is to be filled as soon as possible, and we process applications continuously.




If you have any questions, please feel free to contact Mariana Alves Monteiro, Team Lead for Data Engineering at mariana.monteiro@abacusmedicine.com.




We look forward to receiving your application!




Would you like to know more about us?

Follow us on Instagram and LinkedIn, to get an insight into everyday life at Abacus Medicine. For other job openings, check out our Career page.




Better Access. Better Healthcare.

At Abacus Medicine, our purpose is to improve global healthcare through better access to medicine. This has driven us to quickly become a global player in the parallel import industry and pharmaceutical services while not losing sight of our entrepreneurial mindset. Our company values; Innovative, Dedicated, and Caring, lead us on our way to continuously look for improvement and further ways to achieve our purpose. Join our 1,200 dedicated colleagues with more than 32 different nationalities in e.g. Denmark, Hungary, Germany, the Netherlands, the UK, Austria and Hong Kong.
