Title: Snowflake Data Engineer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
We are looking for an experienced Data Engineer who wants to work with the Snowflake Data Cloud. You want to work with the latest in data engineering and have the desire and skills to learn new languages and services. Experience within Azure / AWS, Snowflake, ELT/ETL, Python, and SQL is a plus.

Are you our new Snowflake Data Engineer?

As a Snowflake Data Engineer at Intellishore, you will get the opportunity to be innovative, create lasting impacts for a wide range of customers, and excel in a culture of collaboration. We are not an industry-specific consultancy, so you should thrive in learning new industries and bring a healthy dose of curiosity. Two projects are rarely the same!

You will get the opportunity to influence and drive the development of Intellishore to make sure we deliver value to our clients across different industries and business areas. Working at Intellishore means working together with people representing other competencies than yourself and we take great pride in the development of all our Intellishorians. We focus on bringing together a broad mix of people to build a unique combination of expertise and backgrounds. The personal edge of every Intellishorian is what creates our distinct collective power â€“ that is our belief!

If this sounds like something for you â€“ Then keep on reading below

What are we looking for?

We Realize That Few People Are Experts At Everything. But If You Can Nod Your Head At Some Of The Following Attributes Then You Could Be The Person We Are Looking For


Work experience as a Data Engineer, building and maintaining performant data platforms for reporting and analytics
Implementing ELT/ETL models is something you are all for and might even be passionate about
The cloud you love the most is the Snowflake Data Cloud â€“ also as an â€œend-userâ€
You worked with data engineering services on Azure or AWS and have been giving multiple high-fives for your work!
A big enthusiast and some might call a connoisseur when it comes to SQL
Good understanding of data modeling principles
Relevant background in computer science and engineering, mathematical modeling, or similar



It would be a plus if you have experience with making it snow in the Snowflake Data Cloud with security, access, integration, etc.

To Succeed In This Role, We Believe That You


Love to be a team and you are one that takes ownership, builds cross-functional relationships, and is all about sharing knowledge
Dig being part of different teams, projects, and challenges
Value the importance of a great environment where productive work is done by communication and contributing constructively
Want to be part of a journey that is bigger than yourself but you are an essential part of it!



Why work for Intellishore?

1 | Challenging projects

Exciting and challenging Consultant role in data-intensive and strategic client projects

2 | Entrepreneurial work environment

Dynamic and entrepreneurial environment with kind & ambitious colleagues

3 | Courses & training

We will provide you with access to the necessary courses and certifications within the newest technologies (i.e. AWS, Snowflake, & Azure)

4 | Strategic seminars

Annual Strategic Seminar where you get to socialize with your colleagues whilst building the company for the future (we've been to South Africa, Japan, India, China, Dubai, Iceland, and Germany)

5 | Sustainable consulting

A sustainable consulting career with high levels of flexibility and a great and informal work environment

6 | Exciting growth journey

We are on a mission to redefine the world of data & analytics and we are constantly expanding our team and scope

Any questions?

If you are interested in applying for this position, fill out the formula below. Applicants will be invited to interviews on a rolling basis.

We acknowledge that a change in career path requires careful consideration and that timing is crucial. Therefore, you are always welcome to reach out as you see fit.

For more information about the position, please reach out to David Andreasen Lyngh: dly@intellishore.dk / +45 28 59 42 76

At the moment, we are only accepting applications from applicants inside of the EU or the Nordics.

Who is Intellishore?

Intellishore was founded in 2013 with the idea of providing clients with a seamless combination of strategic and technical support. Today, we are more than 60 skilled, entrepreneurial, and passionate employees from many different backgrounds; engineers, economists, marketers, and we even have a rhetorician (with a degree in economics, but still).

We are Intellishorians; a family, a unique collective of passionate professionals who have jumped at the chance to be part of a larger journey.
Show more
HTML:
We are looking for an experienced Data Engineer who wants to work with the Snowflake Data Cloud. You want to work with the latest in data engineering and have the desire and skills to learn new languages and services. Experience within Azure / AWS, Snowflake, ELT/ETL, Python, and SQL is a plus.

Are you our new Snowflake Data Engineer?

As a Snowflake Data Engineer at Intellishore, you will get the opportunity to be innovative, create lasting impacts for a wide range of customers, and excel in a culture of collaboration. We are not an industry-specific consultancy, so you should thrive in learning new industries and bring a healthy dose of curiosity. Two projects are rarely the same!

You will get the opportunity to influence and drive the development of Intellishore to make sure we deliver value to our clients across different industries and business areas. Working at Intellishore means working together with people representing other competencies than yourself and we take great pride in the development of all our Intellishorians. We focus on bringing together a broad mix of people to build a unique combination of expertise and backgrounds. The personal edge of every Intellishorian is what creates our distinct collective power â€“ that is our belief!

If this sounds like something for you â€“ Then keep on reading below

What are we looking for?

We Realize That Few People Are Experts At Everything. But If You Can Nod Your Head At Some Of The Following Attributes Then You Could Be The Person We Are Looking For

  • Work experience as a Data Engineer, building and maintaining performant data platforms for reporting and analytics
  • Implementing ELT/ETL models is something you are all for and might even be passionate about
  • The cloud you love the most is the Snowflake Data Cloud â€“ also as an â€œend-userâ€
  • You worked with data engineering services on Azure or AWS and have been giving multiple high-fives for your work!
  • A big enthusiast and some might call a connoisseur when it comes to SQL
  • Good understanding of data modeling principles
  • Relevant background in computer science and engineering, mathematical modeling, or similar


It would be a plus if you have experience with making it snow in the Snowflake Data Cloud with security, access, integration, etc.

To Succeed In This Role, We Believe That You

  • Love to be a team and you are one that takes ownership, builds cross-functional relationships, and is all about sharing knowledge
  • Dig being part of different teams, projects, and challenges
  • Value the importance of a great environment where productive work is done by communication and contributing constructively
  • Want to be part of a journey that is bigger than yourself but you are an essential part of it!


Why work for Intellishore?

1 | Challenging projects

Exciting and challenging Consultant role in data-intensive and strategic client projects

2 | Entrepreneurial work environment

Dynamic and entrepreneurial environment with kind & ambitious colleagues

3 | Courses & training

We will provide you with access to the necessary courses and certifications within the newest technologies (i.e. AWS, Snowflake, & Azure)

4 | Strategic seminars

Annual Strategic Seminar where you get to socialize with your colleagues whilst building the company for the future (we've been to South Africa, Japan, India, China, Dubai, Iceland, and Germany)

5 | Sustainable consulting

A sustainable consulting career with high levels of flexibility and a great and informal work environment

6 | Exciting growth journey

We are on a mission to redefine the world of data & analytics and we are constantly expanding our team and scope

Any questions?

If you are interested in applying for this position, fill out the formula below. Applicants will be invited to interviews on a rolling basis.

We acknowledge that a change in career path requires careful consideration and that timing is crucial. Therefore, you are always welcome to reach out as you see fit.

For more information about the position, please reach out to David Andreasen Lyngh: dly@intellishore.dk / +45 28 59 42 76

At the moment, we are only accepting applications from applicants inside of the EU or the Nordics.

Who is Intellishore?

Intellishore was founded in 2013 with the idea of providing clients with a seamless combination of strategic and technical support. Today, we are more than 60 skilled, entrepreneurial, and passionate employees from many different backgrounds; engineers, economists, marketers, and we even have a rhetorician (with a degree in economics, but still).

We are Intellishorians; a family, a unique collective of passionate professionals who have jumped at the chance to be part of a larger journey.

Title: Analytics Engineer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Unlock the Future of Sustainable Energy with Data Analytics!

We are currently undergoing an exciting carve-out process, rebuilding our entire data infrastructure along with associated data products. We operate exclusively on cloud-based solutions and implement everything in Microsoft Fabric, adhering to best practice data platforms.




Our Ambition: Ignite a Data-Driven Revolution

Our grand vision? To supercharge CM Biomass with data! We're not just talking about fancy reports for the higher-ups; we're democratizing data to enhance transparency, accessibility, and data-driven insights across the entire organization.




Your Responsibilities:

As our new Analytics Engineer, you're not just part of the team â€“ you're the cornerstone of CM Biomass's data-driven future. You will be working closely with the business to understand their needs and enable their visions with data solutions.

Here's what awaits you:

You will develop and document our Lakehous, the backbone of our data solution.
You will develop and implement data models and utilize cloud-based technologies.
Alongside the rest of the team, you will assist the business with ad-hoc analyses and continuous data insights.

Your impact matters! Here are our success criteria:

Ensure data reaches the right hands at the right time.
Engineer our infrastructure to be as scalable as a rocket, ready for our meteoric growth.




The Ideal Candidate:

We envision the ideal candidate to possess a technical educational background. Additionally, you should have at least a couple of years of experience and preferably have worked in an international company, gaining an understanding of diverse professional tasks and national cultures. Proficiency in MS SQL, Python and a deep understanding of Power BI are essential. It's also a plus if you are skilled in Azure Data Factory, ,and other exciting Azure applications.




It will considered a plus, if you have one or more of the following certifications:

PL-300 Power BI Data Analyst Associate
DP-203 Azure Data Engineer Associate
DP-600: Implementing Analytics Solutions Using Microsoft Fabric




On a personal level, we're looking for a candidate who thrives on creating structures and efficient processes, works in a planned and organized manner, and enjoys tackling diverse tasks within a dynamic, international, and entrepreneurial culture.




Join Us for an Exciting Opportunity!

Joining our team means immersing yourself in a growth company with a vibrant and unique culture. Our flat hierarchy, swift decision-making processes, and calculated risk-taking foster an exciting and enjoyable work environment with a strong sense of community and accountability. We value our traditions, from savoring delicious freshly baked goods from Halima to wearing shorts in the summer. Our renowned Friday bar is a hit among employees. We offer you substantial autonomy to shape your role and pave your path for growth and development. Located in the exclusive and inspiring surroundings of Klubiensvej in Nordhavn, Copenhagen, you will find yourself in an ideal setting to thrive both personally and professionally. Our corporate language is English.




If you are curious to learn more about this opportunity or, even better, ready to apply, please follow the application link provided below. If you have any questions, you are more than welcome to reach out to August Godballe, Data Architect at + 45 73 83 19 27 .

We look forward to hearing from you!




Please be advised that response times for applications may be extended due to the summer holiday period.




About CM Biomass

CM Biomass is the largest independent trader of wood pellets and the 3rd largest producer/trader, employing more than 226 dedicated professionals in 12 countries. We work with a variety of clients across several markets, trading around 3.3 million tons of industrial or premium-grade wood pellets per year, striving to decarbonize power and heat production.

CM Biomass has its roots in the family-owned Copenhagen Merchants Group, which still remains a minority owner. CM Biomass's majority owner is United Shipping & Trading Company (USTC), represented in 40 countries across various sectors, including oil & energy, shipping & logistics, risk management, car activities, IT, sustainable energy, and environment & recycling.

Show more

Title: Business Intelligence Specialist (Student worker)
Description:
Candeno is currently looking for a Part-time Business Intelligence Specialist

Are you driven by the challenge of supporting a growing organisation's data analysis and visualisation? Do you thrive in an environment where innovation meets inspiration? Do you find motivation in designing and implementing dashboards that drive data-driven decision-making? If so, you might be our ideal BI Specialist.

The opportunity ðŸ¤©

At Candeno, we seek a thorough and solution-oriented part-time BI Specialist to strengthen our Finance and BI department. The focus will be on the presentation and visualisation of complex data through Plecto dashboards and reporting tools.

You will âœ…

Skills

As a BI Specialist, you will use your data-driven and analytical nature to develop and optimise our implementation of dashboards for reporting key performance indicators (KPIs) while using your communicative skills to convey data to internal and external stakeholders. You will report to our Finance & BI Manager and work closely with our Finance & BI team and other departments. You will also:


Develop and optimise organisational standards for data visualisation.
Create tailored financial dashboards and report tools for management and the board.
Ensure consistent reporting practices across the organisation.
Lay the foundation for data-driven decision-making in the organisation.
Extract, transform, and load data to build a robust semantic model.


You are ðŸ’™

We Are Looking For a Candidate With a Diligent And Result-oriented Approach To Managing Our Business Intelligence While Supporting The Finance Department With Other Tasks And Supporting Other Teams With The Function Of Operations. We Are Also Looking For a Candidate With


With a relevant education or experience in the field
Experience with MySQL and a solid understanding of databases.
The willingness to develop strong reporting skills.
The ability to analyse and communicate complex data convincingly.
Thorough and precise approach to task solving.
Proactive and solution-oriented approach.
Interest in driving projects within the BI field and identifying process optimisation opportunities.
Thrives in a role with many tasks simultaneously
The opportunity to work from our headquarters in Aarhus


We offer ðŸš€


15-20 hours a week, which will be tailored to match your studies, and large flexibility around exams and other important study-related deadlines
The possibility to work from home
A fun, informal and innovative environment
At Candeno, we value your well-being. We are committed to maintaining a healthy work-life balance and offer high flexibility. Your mental and physical health is important to us, and we strive to create an environment that supports it.
A balanced and delicious lunch from local Aarhus vendors ðŸ¥— and communal breakfast every Monday morning ðŸ¥ž
A Milestone program to celebrate our shared achievements ðŸ†
At Candeno, our passion is not just about what we do but also the heart of our strong social scene, which offers team-building activities, social events, and diverse company clubs ðŸƒ âš½ï¸ ðŸŽ¨


A Little Bit About Our Recruitment Process

Please do not hesitate to contact us (jr@candeno.com) if you have any questions or require further information.

Title: VIE - Sustainable Digital Data Analyst - Denmark (Ballerup)
Place: Ballerup, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Why Schneider Electric (SE)?

Join us, be part of creating a sustainable future with Schneider Electric's energy and digital solutions!

We empower everyone to make the most of our energy and resources, ensuring Life Is On everywhere, for everyone, at every moment. Along the way, we create and provide equal opportunities for everyone, everywhere. We continuously create an inclusive environment and welcome people from all walks of life. We are empowered to do our best and innovate, while living our unique life and work. Together, we dare to disrupt and turn our bold ideas into reality.

Where is the VIE Position ?

The position is located in Ballerup, Denmark, in international dynamic team.

What is the Position?

Drive Sustainable Transformation for Global Supply Chain to support Schneider Electric's Sustainability Goals. You will have the opportunity to work on a wide scope coverage in sustainability, great exposure in global team.

Which missions will you lead?

Responsible for collecting, analyzing, and interpreting large sets of data to identify patterns, trends, and relationships. This information is to make informed decisions and recommendations for improvement in various sustainability transformations. It includes but not limited to:

Be the owner of the Global Supply Chain Sustainability Data. The global Sustainable Cockpit is a digital platform that provides an overview of all GSC Sustainable Transformations through data visualization. As the owner of the Global Supply Chain Sustainability Data, the candidate will own the Sustainable Cockpit Platform, partnering with all the transformation program leaders, to make sure itâ€™s running stably and continuously improving based on program needs. This platform serves as a unique tool to inform all regions, functions and global teams on the Sustainable performance and trends and provides access to all layers of the organization. As the owner of the Global Sustainable Cockpit it is expected to play a crucial role which includes:


Strong data analytics skills and be able to interpret data accurately and make informed decisions based on the findings,
Have a good sense of data visualization and appealing charts to communicate complex data concisely,
Be familiar with various analytics tools and software, such as Excel, Tableau, Power BI, and Google Analytics, to analyze and present data efficiently.
Data Acquisition: Data analytics often need to acquire data from various sources, such as databases, spreadsheets, and external data providers. Need to be able to understand data structures and formats to ensure accurate and complete data collection.
Problem-solving and be able to think critically to identify issues and develop solutions.
Be able to work independently or as part of a team to achieve common goals.
Be able to communicate efficiently with developers, transformation program leaders and users across regions,
Be able to program manage complex and multiple workstreams efficiently and in high quality
Continuous Learning: Data analysis is an evolving field, and data analysts should be willing to learn new skills and adapt to changes in technology and methodologies.


Be able to increase efficiency and accuracy of Sustainable Data consolidation and reporting from other platforms such as LEAP, GlobES, Sightness etc. Be able to partner with other functions and data base owners to increase sustainable data quality and governance. Be able to provide data and analytics support for Management Report and during Quarterly Business Reviews, Annual Report and other performance reviews.

Support Sustainable Performance Gap Analysis and Decision making process in order to accelerate our transformations, be able to detect possible delays or issues at early stage to propose an improvement plan.

What are the qualifications we are looking for?

Education: Environmental engineer, sustainable development, environmental science

Work experience : 2 internships with experiences already is preferable

Skills:


English Fluent
Microsoft powerpoint, excel, word
Self-motivated
Strong ownership
Good communication
Strategic thinking


What's in it for me?


Opportunity to get international experience abroad
To improve your English
To work in multicultural and inclusive environment
Interesting remuneration, social coverage, accommodation
Opportunity to get a permanent position in the end of your mission


Let us learn about you! Apply today.

Why us?

Schneider Electric is leading the digital transformation of energy management and automation. Our technologies enable the world to use energy in a safe, efficient and sustainable manner. We strive to promote a global economy that is both ecologically viable and highly productive.

â‚¬25.7bn global revenue

137 000+ employees in 100+ countries

45% of revenue from IoT

5% of revenue devoted for R&D

You must submit an online application to be considered for any position with us. This position will be posted until filled

It is the policy of Schneider Electric to provide equal employment and advancement opportunities in the areas of recruiting, hiring, training, transferring, and promoting all qualified individuals regardless of race, religion, color, gender, disability, national origin, ancestry, age, military status, sexual orientation, marital status, or any other legally protected characteristic or conduct. Concerning agencies: Schneider Electric does not accept unsolicited resumes and will not be responsible for fees related to such.
Show more

Title: Data Engineer
Place: Ballerup, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
If you are passionate about leveraging Azure and IoT to make a real difference, then Novo Nordisk DD&IT has an opportunity for you. At Novo Nordisk, the digital journey is on, and we are committed to unlocking the full potential of digitalization, data, and IT to save more lives. Join us in driving cloud solutions that will make an impact and save lives. Are you ready to join a purpose-driven ride? Read on to learn more.

Is it your profile we are describing? Then we cannot wait to meet you. Apply below!

Whatâ€™s the role about?
As a Data Engineer, you will be a part of the Data Enablers department within Product Supply data Foundation.

Key responsibilities:



Design, develop, and implement data pipelines using Azure stack to collect data from various production systems for unified accessibility across edge and cloud applications,
Ensure security, high availability, and data integrity while designing and implementing solutions,
Collaborate cross-functionally with architects, security teams, end users, and stakeholders to ensure product suitability,
Guide the team in implementing best practices for data engineering and contribute to Agile events within Agile teams, such as sprint planning and review,
Participate in end-to-end activities from technical concept definition to solution maintenance and operations,
Design and implement optimal Azure Data Infrastructure and Delta Lake House, while engaging in software development activities including coding, reviewing, testing, and documentation to build stable and scalable data pipelines.




In this role, you'll serve as a trusted advisor, offering technical expertise on various projects for our business partners. You'll play a key role in improving technical architecture and solution integrity, collaborating with architects to ensure consistency. Additionally, you'll engage with end-user representatives to ensure the usability and functionality of the technology.

Which competencies to bring?
The ideal candidate for this position should meet most of the following requirements:



A masterâ€™s degree in computer science, engineering, chemistry, biology, or other relevant fields,
3+ years of experience as a Data Engineer within IoT and OT in a manufacturing space, preferably within regulated industries,
Solid understanding or hands-on experience within Azure â€“ For example: Azure Synapse, Stream analytics, Data Factory, KQL, Azure Data lake storage Databricks etc.,
Strong understanding of containerization principles and experience working with Kubernetes for deploying, managing and maintaining workloads that runs on the edge,
Experience working with SQL, Python or C#, Data Warehouse Experience, Big Data Analysis, building CI/CD pipelines, Azure DevOps, Agile Methodologies,
Strong mathematical, statistical, and problem-solving skills coupled with excellent communication skills and strong English fluency.




In this role, you'll thrive on exploring innovative technologies to address business challenges. Your outgoing and collaborative nature will drive you to find effective solutions while confidently advocating for agreed-upon strategies in the face of challenges. With exceptional stakeholder management, you'll skillfully communicate a compelling vision, translating it into ambitious goals with clear priorities. Structured and outcome-oriented, they exhibit agility and adaptability, ensuring effective response to changes in the organizational landscape.

The team waiting for you
You will be part of Data Enablers department within PS Data Foundation. Data Enablers department is responsible for continuously developing, scaling, and maintaining global production data platforms. These data platforms are designed to efficiently extract and standardize data from both production lines and IT/OT systems used in production processes. In Data Foundation, we strive to empower our colleagues in Novo Nordisk Product Supply to make data-driven decisions, continuously digitalize, and improve manufacturing processes. The team is very diverse both in terms of capabilities and background, with roles spanning from product owners, scrum masters, architects to hands-on data engineers and developers, and people from 15 different nationalities.

We are currently located in Ballerup and part of DD&IT â€“ a global community of 3000+ colleagues, driving digital, data, and IT. DD&IT partners with the business to support digital transformation and innovation in all parts of the Novo Nordisk value chain â€“ from idea to patient. We accelerate digital value creation through standardised, efficient, and secure technology platforms â€“ the foundation for everything digital in Novo Nordisk.

Be part of the Novo Nordisk family
Novo Nordisk is a global healthcare company headquartered in Denmark. For 100 years, we have been driving change to defeat diabetes and other serious chronic diseases. As a result, our treatments today benefit millions of people living with diabetes, obesity, and rare blood and endocrine diseases. We are proud of that.

We are proud of our people too, and we employ more than 57,000 bright and diverse minds in 80 offices worldwide. With us, your bright mind and commitment help us change lives for people worldwide. In exchange, we offer you a seat in a rewarding and purpose-driven culture where your professional and personal development is highly valued. That said, opportunities are many in Novo Nordisk.

Bring your questions
For further information, please contact Head of Data Enablers Anna Revva on +45 30 77 67 80.

17 June 2024

Show more
HTML:
If you are passionate about leveraging Azure and IoT to make a real difference, then Novo Nordisk DD&IT has an opportunity for you. At Novo Nordisk, the digital journey is on, and we are committed to unlocking the full potential of digitalization, data, and IT to save more lives. Join us in driving cloud solutions that will make an impact and save lives. Are you ready to join a purpose-driven ride? Read on to learn more.

Is it your profile we are describing? Then we cannot wait to meet you. Apply below!

Whatâ€™s the role about?
As a Data Engineer, you will be a part of the Data Enablers department within Product Supply data Foundation.

Key responsibilities:


  • Design, develop, and implement data pipelines using Azure stack to collect data from various production systems for unified accessibility across edge and cloud applications,
  • Ensure security, high availability, and data integrity while designing and implementing solutions,
  • Collaborate cross-functionally with architects, security teams, end users, and stakeholders to ensure product suitability,
  • Guide the team in implementing best practices for data engineering and contribute to Agile events within Agile teams, such as sprint planning and review,
  • Participate in end-to-end activities from technical concept definition to solution maintenance and operations,
  • Design and implement optimal Azure Data Infrastructure and Delta Lake House, while engaging in software development activities including coding, reviewing, testing, and documentation to build stable and scalable data pipelines.



In this role, you'll serve as a trusted advisor, offering technical expertise on various projects for our business partners. You'll play a key role in improving technical architecture and solution integrity, collaborating with architects to ensure consistency. Additionally, you'll engage with end-user representatives to ensure the usability and functionality of the technology.

Which competencies to bring?
The ideal candidate for this position should meet most of the following requirements:


  • A masterâ€™s degree in computer science, engineering, chemistry, biology, or other relevant fields,
  • 3+ years of experience as a Data Engineer within IoT and OT in a manufacturing space, preferably within regulated industries,
  • Solid understanding or hands-on experience within Azure â€“ For example: Azure Synapse, Stream analytics, Data Factory, KQL, Azure Data lake storage Databricks etc.,
  • Strong understanding of containerization principles and experience working with Kubernetes for deploying, managing and maintaining workloads that runs on the edge,
  • Experience working with SQL, Python or C#, Data Warehouse Experience, Big Data Analysis, building CI/CD pipelines, Azure DevOps, Agile Methodologies,
  • Strong mathematical, statistical, and problem-solving skills coupled with excellent communication skills and strong English fluency.



In this role, you'll thrive on exploring innovative technologies to address business challenges. Your outgoing and collaborative nature will drive you to find effective solutions while confidently advocating for agreed-upon strategies in the face of challenges. With exceptional stakeholder management, you'll skillfully communicate a compelling vision, translating it into ambitious goals with clear priorities. Structured and outcome-oriented, they exhibit agility and adaptability, ensuring effective response to changes in the organizational landscape.

The team waiting for you
You will be part of Data Enablers department within PS Data Foundation. Data Enablers department is responsible for continuously developing, scaling, and maintaining global production data platforms. These data platforms are designed to efficiently extract and standardize data from both production lines and IT/OT systems used in production processes. In Data Foundation, we strive to empower our colleagues in Novo Nordisk Product Supply to make data-driven decisions, continuously digitalize, and improve manufacturing processes. The team is very diverse both in terms of capabilities and background, with roles spanning from product owners, scrum masters, architects to hands-on data engineers and developers, and people from 15 different nationalities.

We are currently located in Ballerup and part of DD&IT â€“ a global community of 3000+ colleagues, driving digital, data, and IT. DD&IT partners with the business to support digital transformation and innovation in all parts of the Novo Nordisk value chain â€“ from idea to patient. We accelerate digital value creation through standardised, efficient, and secure technology platforms â€“ the foundation for everything digital in Novo Nordisk.

Be part of the Novo Nordisk family
Novo Nordisk is a global healthcare company headquartered in Denmark. For 100 years, we have been driving change to defeat diabetes and other serious chronic diseases. As a result, our treatments today benefit millions of people living with diabetes, obesity, and rare blood and endocrine diseases. We are proud of that.

We are proud of our people too, and we employ more than 57,000 bright and diverse minds in 80 offices worldwide. With us, your bright mind and commitment help us change lives for people worldwide. In exchange, we offer you a seat in a rewarding and purpose-driven culture where your professional and personal development is highly valued. That said, opportunities are many in Novo Nordisk.

Bring your questions
For further information, please contact Head of Data Enablers Anna Revva on +45 30 77 67 80.

Deadline
17 June 2024

We need to aspire to be the best company for the world and we know that this is only possible with talented employees with diverse perspectives, backgrounds and cultures. We are therefore committed to creating an inclusive culture that celebrates the diversity of our employees, the patients we serve and communities we operate in. Together, weâ€™re life changing.

Title: Associate Data Engineer
Description:
Do you love data and want to work with a modern data strategy and tool stack? If yes, then keep on reading.

Whatâ€™s the job about - and why it is attractive?

Grundfos is convinced that future competitiveness depends on the ability to apply Artificial Intelligence and Automation across the many different functions and markets we cover. This can only happen if we have the right data and work with data in a professional and modern way.

As a Grundfos data engineer you will work with the latest tools and apply your skills to realise the data strategy and need for data infrastructure in the product team you become part of. Each product team has a dedicated focus and portfolio of deliverables, but common for all is that infrastructure components and data modelling principles are guided by an enterprise view which expands the value of the data products you work with to other data consumers in Grundfos.

You will have several likable and very skilled peers you can discuss with and learn from. Maybe within your product team or maybe in the community of data engineers we have worldwide in Grundfos, and equally important you will have a management function which appreciates and understands the business of data.

â€œ This is your chance to become an important part of Grundfosâ€™ amazing journey into a digital future as well as becoming part of a great team and an inspirational environment where competent colleagues will support and inspire you,â€ Thomas Asger Hansen explains.

Your Main Responsibilities


Develop and implement data pipeline infrastructure for at least one of our Product Teams.
Take part in the development of our core data platform, which is based on a modern and advanced stack.
Implement data governance as an integral part of the DevOps work you will perform.
Learn from â€“ and participate in â€“ the data engineering SMEG.


What we would like you to bring to the team


A likeable and inclusive personality.
A masters degree in computer science or other relevant field.
Knowledge of data modelling and data documentation.
Knowledge of data storage technology like NoSQL, SQL, Graph DB or like.
Knowledge of Continuous Integration, Continuous Development, and CI/CD pipelines is beneficial and valued.
Experience with Microsoft Azure, Snowflake data warehousing, C# and Python is an advantage.
Willingness to learn about - and adopt - new data management software and platforms.


â€œOn a personal level, you have excellent interpersonal skills as you interact with colleagues and stakeholders on all levels. Thus, it is important that you have a positive, open and forthcoming personality, and we expect you to know how to coach and motivate others to do their best,â€ Thomas finishes.â€¯

Whatâ€™s in it for you?

Whether itâ€™s developing leadership skills or advancing your expertise even further, weâ€™ll support you with continuous learning and development opportunities, to help discuss and steer your long-term Grundfos career path. Youâ€™ll be welcomed from day one into an inclusive, trusting environment guided by six core values.

In addition, your day-to-day benefits include:


If youâ€™ll be working from your home office, weâ€™ll make sure you are well equipped with a good workstation. However, you are always welcome to our offices where you can engage, learn, and have fun with colleagues.
On top of it, flexible working hours and up to 3 daysâ€™ additional paid leave for volunteering of your choice.
Annual bonuses, health insurance, parental support, internal well-being consultants and programmes.
Access to the modern Grundfos Academy to pursue further both personal and professional development.
Diverse, inclusive environment with employee-led forums offering colleagues a safe place to connect and share openly.


Additional Information

If you have questions or want to know more about the position, please contact Director of Group Data & AI, Thomas Asger Hansen on +45 51 44 95 07. If this job sounds appealing, please send your resume by clicking â€œApplyâ€.

To dig deeper into the Grundfos universe, follow us on LinkedIn or Youtube, and to get to know some of your future colleagues and why they love working at Grundfos, check out Meet our people

We look forward to hearing from you.

Title: Analytics Engineer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
We are one of the fastest growing podcast & audiobook platforms in Europe and we are now looking for an ambitious Analytics Engineer to join our Data team and play a key role in delivering exceptional data solutions to individuals and teams across the organization.




Come and join us on our journey to enrich lives through listening.




This is the role

At Podimo, data is at the center of nearly everything we do; guiding decisions and fueling our business processes. This is where you come in!




In this position, you will join our BI & Analytics Engineering team, which is part of our global Data department. The team is responsible for developing and maintaining our company-wide data platform and works to enable data-driven decision-making across the organization.




You will be at the heart of the collaboration between data analysts, scientists, engineers, and business teams, and will be responsible for bringing efficient and robust data models, BI interfaces, and self-service solutions to life.




Our team offers a casual atmosphere with excellent opportunities for growth and impact, and you will in this position get the chance to play a key role in shaping and developing Podimoâ€™s data modeling and BI efforts.




Your main responsibilities are:

Work closely with data analysts, business teams, and data scientists to understand their needs and translate those into effective data solutions
Utilize dbt, SQL, BigQuery, and Looker/LookML to transform and model both new and existing data sources
Develop and maintain dashboards, visualizations, and self-service tools that enable business stakeholders to gain insights and make data-driven decisions
Provide data modeling expertise to team and department members through code reviews and pairing to help deliver optimal and scalable designs and queries
Promote the adoption of data solutions and interfaces by educating business users and data developers on their usage




This is you

We are looking for a colleague who gets a kick out of and takes pride in building awesome data solutions. You understand the concepts of working in a dynamic and fast-paced startup environment, and you thrive in collaborating cross-functionally with your colleagues across the company.




In more detail, you will thrive in this role if you have:

Some experience working with BI or analytics engineering
Proficiency in data modeling and knowledge of data warehousing principles
Strong experience with dbt, SQL, BigQuery, and data visualization tools (e.g. Looker)
A love for teamwork, continuous improvement, and learning
Excellent communication skills in English (written and verbal)

Naturally, being passionate about podcasts, audio content, and entertainment is a big plus!




These are the benefits

ESOP (Employee Stock Ownership Plan) for all employees, no matter where in the world you live.
Learning and personal development opportunities to help you thrive and enrich your skills in a fast-paced creator economy.
Up to six months of fully paid parental leave for all new parents - no matter how you identify or where in the world you live
Free online therapy sessions through We.Care.
Delicious lunch with great colleagues.
Unlimited child sick days and the opportunity to work flexible hours and remotely.
Opportunity to make an impact at a growing international company and see your work pay off immediately.




This is the hiring process

Please share your CV or LinkedIn profile. Weâ€™d love to hear why youâ€™re interested in the job, but itâ€™s not a must. If we move forward with your application, hereâ€™s what to expect:

An initial conversation with a recruiter to set expectations
A case conversation with the hiring manager, Martin Otto-Sidelmann, Director of BI & Analytics Engineering
A coffee chat with the Chief Data Officer and some of your potential future team members

We might tweak the process to keep things smooth and enjoyable. We'll be conducting interviews continuously, aiming for a start date around August or asap after that date.

Canâ€™t wait to hear from you!




This is us

Founded in Copenhagen in 2019, Podimo is a platform for podcast and audiobook lovers as well as audio content creators. Our app puts a world of podcasts and audiobooks at your fingertips. Our revenue-sharing model rewards creators for making content that people want to hear â€“ whether they have an established following or a niche audience.

We're a courageous and curious bunch. We recognize the value every individual brings, and respect our coworkersâ€™ ideas, opinions, and time. We approach our work with integrity and humility, and believe that we are better together. We have zero time for brilliant jerks.

Weâ€™re fiercely passionate about discovering, creating, and obsessing over great stories. We support our creators deeply, and have massive respect for their process as we help them bring their most exciting ideas and stories to life. We love what we do, but more importantly, we have a good time doing it.

We seek to build a company and culture that mirrors the diversity of the world weâ€™re living in. This means; diversity of talent, voices, ideas, and thoughts. That goes both for our brand, our content, our creators, and our teams.

You are welcome at Podimo for who you are, no matter where you come from, what you look like, or what stories you have playing in your headphones.




Equal Opportunity Employer

Podimo is an equal opportunity employer, and we believe in equal opportunities for all in our workplace. We donâ€™t discriminate based on race, colour, religion, disability, gender identity, sexual orientation, marital status, age or political orientation, no matter where we operate.

Title: Data Analyst (Supply Analytics team, Bangkok-based, Relocation provided)
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
About Agoda

Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodations, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting-edge technology that connects travelers with more than 3.6 million accommodations globally. Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 6,000+ employees representing 90+ nationalities foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership,â€¯enhancing the ability for our customers to experience the world.

Our Purpose â€“ Bridging the World Through Travel

We believe travel allows people to enjoy, learn and experience more of the amazing world we live in. It brings individuals and cultures closer together, fostering empathy, understanding and happiness.

We are a skillful, driven and diverse team from across the globe, united by a passion to make an impact. Harnessing our innovative technologies and strong partnerships, we aim to make travel easy and rewarding for everyone.

THIS ROLE IS BASED IN BANGKOK, THAILAND (WITH RELOCATION PROVIDED)

Location: Bangkok, Thailand (*Not open for remote work.)

Get to Know our Team:

As part of the Supply Analytics Team, you will be responsible for identifying new partners and opportunities, cultivating a relationship with them, and working together with them to deliver the best outcome for our end customers. You would also be responsible with managing the day to day interaction with the partner and working closely with other teams within Agoda to ensure the partners needs are met.

We design tailored business and product solutions with our partners and help them generate measurable value. Members of our team are empowered and supported to grow their market(s) or accounts. We develop win-win relationships and leverage Agodaâ€™s unique accommodations portfolio and tech solutions to bring our partners the advantages they seek. Utilizing our strong brand and resources, we build new channels to increase the visibility of Agoda, introduce more travelers to our great products and service and deliver significant revenues to the overall business.

The Opportunity:

As a Data Analyst, you will report directly to either the Senior Manager or Associate Director within the Supply Department and this will be an individual contributor role. You will be responsible and fully empowered to work with the partners on the ground. You will be supported by a team within the Supply department and work closely with other Team members within Agoda.

In this Role, youâ€™ll get to:


Translate internal briefs into analytical projects (to include refining the initial brief and asking the â€˜right questionsâ€™, working through potential hypotheses and storyboarding the output)
Use and analyze data from multiple large-scale data warehouses and present statistically strong analysis to a wide range of business stakeholders
Proactively identify opportunities for growth within supply and the wider business
Drive new analytical initiatives and projects aimed at improving organizational efficiency and shaping Agoda supply
Identify, support, and lead projects aimed at scaling up the way the Supply organization leverages on data, insights, and intelligence
Automate manual operational processes and present back on time savings gained through modernization of business operations


What youâ€™ll Need to Succeed:


At least 3-5+ years of experience working as an Analyst with experience in analytics/data science/insights/strategy/BI
Advanced working knowledge and hands-on experience in SQL
Strong knowledge and hands-on experience in data visualization tools such as Tableau (preferably)
Expert domain of data analysis and data visualization tools and software such as Excel, Python (or R)
Bachelorâ€™s degree ideally in a business or quantitative subject (e.g. computer science, mathematics, engineering, science, economics or finance)
A good understanding of statistical modelling knowledge or any machine learning technique knowledge (such as hypothesis testing, regression, logistic regression, random forest, etc.)
Good stakeholder management experience. Comfortable presenting to senior leadership and C-suite
Experience in conducting A/B testing experimentation
Strong experience in finding data insights and provide business recommendation to the business
A hackerâ€™s mindset â€“ the ability to build simple but clever and elegant solutions to new problems within significant resource, operational and time constraints through deep understanding of the business, creative problem solving, and a wide range of expertise in data, analytics, automation, programming, and prototyping
Excellent communicator with superior written, verbal, presentation and interpersonal communication skills
Data driven in both decision making and performance measurement
Extreme comfort in ambiguous, fast-paced environment
Ability to multi-task, prioritize and coordinate resources


Itâ€™s Great if you Have:


MBA or Masters in a quantitative subject (e.g. computer science, mathematics, engineering, science, economics or finance)
Program management certifications (e.g. PMI, PRINCE2) to compliment your program management experience
Asian market experience
Travel industry / e-commerce / tech / consulting experience

Title: BI Data Engineer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
AIMING FOR NEW HEIGHTS

At Scalepoint, we aim for the stars. We support insurers in their digital journey to automate and provide a superior customer experience. Our solutions are unique, and Scalepoint CORE was recently appointed the worldâ€™s best claims management solution!




We are looking for a talented BI Developer to join our team at our headquarters in Copenhagen and help us harness the power of data to grow our business.




WHAT KIND OF GEEK ARE YOU?

As a part of our BI setup you will become part of a team of great individuals who strive to build and improve a high-quality data foundation. If you are passionate about data and eager to make a significant impact in a collaborative and innovative environment, weâ€™d love to hear from you! Experience with the following would be a plus:




Expertise with data pipeline and workflow management tools (e.g., SSIS, Dbt, Dagster, Airbyte).
Proficiency in SQL and database design (SQL Server, PostgreSQL, etc.).
Programming skills in .NET and knowledge of engineering best practices, including Unit Testing and Mocking.
Experience with Multidimensional and Tabular models in SSAS, and a strong understanding of analytical concepts such as cubes, measures, and dimensions.
Hands-on experience with PowerBI API and PowerShell.
Python experience is a plus




WHAT TO DIVE INTO

As our new BI Developer, you will be part of an agile team where we volunteer for tasks, manage our own priorities, and collaborate with team members to achieve shared goals. You'll be at the forefront of data innovation, continuously improving our data architecture with emerging technologies. Your focus in the role will be to:




Design, Develop, and Maintain: Create scalable data pipelines and ETL processes to support our data infrastructure.
Collaborate: Work closely with data stakeholders to understand their needs and deliver high-quality data solutions.
Implement Solutions: Develop data integration and data warehousing solutions.
Optimize Performance: Tune data processes for maximum performance and scalability.
Ensure Quality: Perform rigorous testing and verification to maintain data quality and integrity.
Monitor and Troubleshoot: Ensure reliability and accuracy by monitoring data pipelines.
Document Processes: Maintain comprehensive documentation for data processing and BI systems.




WOULD YOU LIKE TO JOIN THE JOURNEY?

Before you answer this question, let us emphasize that we will support your need to succeed. You can expect a warm welcome from your colleagues, and we will pair you with a buddy, who will be there to help and support you beyond onboarding.




If you are interested, please submit your CV and three lines about why you are the right candidate for the job, as soon as possible. We receive applications and conduct interviews on an ongoing basis.




Donâ€™t hesitate to get in touch with our Scrum Master and Team Manager - Dorota Prusinska, at

dopr@scalpeoint.com if you have any questions.

Apply for this job




ABOUT US

Scalepoint spirit in everyday life

Come as you are. Thatâ€™s how we prefer it. You can easily leave dress codes, permanent lunch buddies, and corporate business attitudes at home. Our office is filled with kudos and high fives â€“ and we believe that everyone is doing their best.




We have employees from 11 nationalities across our offices in Copenhagen, Poland and Switzerland. 63% of us ride a cycle to work. 42% eat vegetarian meals during lunch. 38% are parents. And 52% don't regularly work out. But our sport and events team tries to keep us moving by offering activities such as climbing, mountain biking, running and padel tennis. However, we cannot change the fact that we have a very generous attitude to sweets and cake. But thatâ€™s ok; there's a lot to celebrate at Scalepoint.




We look forward to hearing from you!

We are seeking a highly skilled Senior SAS Developer for our client in the banking industry. Our mission is to deliver trusted, automated reporting solutions for our customers, financial supervisory authorities, and internal stakeholders, including the Group Leadership Team, Group Finance Management, Regulatory Reporting, and Risk Models. Title: Junior Business Analyst in Data Management - Digital Solutions
Description:
As a Business Analyst in Data Management, you will be the primary contact for Primeserv DK, the Danish aftersales organization, focusing on eChannels and process optimization. You will be bridging the technology and business to improve processes and the efficiency of our organization.




You will play an important role in:

Concrete tasks that the business analyst will be working with is:

Analyze business processes related to our eChannels and identify areas for improvements to enhance efficiency.
Translate business requirements into tangible actions and initiatives for IT and other development resources to support the business.
Lead initiatives related to digital transformation and automation of business processes.
Collaborate with IT and different business departments to successfully implement changes and improvements.
Manage internal and external stakeholders to gather requirements, resolve issues and identify opportunities.




In the beginning you will be working along a more senior member of our team, where you will in collaboration service our organization, and identify focus areas. With time we assume that you will take increased ownership of the area, where you will enter and possibly lead different relevant projects. You will become experienced in a complex organization that is working to reap the benefits of digitalization. We aim to train you in project and product management, and give you more responsibility along the way.




We imagine that you:

We imagine that you have a degree in Business administration, Information technology, Engineering or a similar field. You are structured and are capable of working independently with the ability to take ownership of your area of responsibility. You have a positive mindset and possess the ability to identify opportunities, with a strong drive to make a meaningful impact.




Ideally, you possess some previous work experience including stakeholder and project management from large corporations. You need to be able to work in a fast-paced environment and have strong analytical and problem-solving skills.




Additionally experience with the following tools is a benefit but not a requirement:

A database query tool, such as SQL Server Management Studio or similar.
An ERP system and its processes




In your application we would very much like to hear about your experience of how you took control of a situation and managed stakeholders. This can be in an educational, professional or private setting.




Welcome to Data Management

We are a team of 11 full-time employees, with different roles in making sure that our enginges, and equipment are updated. We enable the rest of the organization in taking important steps in digitization. We work from Copenhagen, Holeby, Frederikshavn and remotely. In addition we have 7 students who we trust with important tasks.




Unleash your potential: Join us towards a carbon-neutral future

At MAN Energy Solutions, we offer you an opportunity shape the future while achieving your career goals.




We understand that balancing work life and personal life can be a challenge. This is why we prioritize providing our employees with the best opportunities to achieve this balance.




In addition to flexible working hours, the option to work from home, and a focus on brain breaks during the day, we also offer over 7 weeks of paid time off distributed across vacation days, holidays, and flex days.




We focus on diversity and equality to create a creative and inclusive culture and believe that a mix of gender, nationalities, and different perspectives, drives innovation, creativity, and productivity in our organization. We are committed to our employeesâ€™ well-being, and you will get the opportunity to join different social activities clubs from yoga and fishing clubs to creative clubs.




At MAN Energy Solutions you can create, drive, build, and be a part of improving innovative energy solutions while achieving your personal career goals. Here you have opportunities for growth, development, and mentorship.




In 2027, MAN Energy Solutions will move to Trekroner in Roskilde. Here we will consolidate all our current locations on Zealand into one large site.




About MAN Energy Solutions

250 years of experience in advanced engineering
We deliver a unique portfolio of technologies and opportunities in the development of engines for use on ships and in power plants across the globe
We operate under the motto "Future in The Making" as it reflects our dedication to developing sustainable solutions and actively contributing to a carbon-neutral economy
We have over 15,000 employees worldwide. In Denmark, we are 2,200 passionate employees with more than 40 nationalities




Build your own future

Apply for the job through our homepage by clicking on â€œApply for positionâ€ and attach CV, an application letter and relevant documents. The application deadline is Saturday, the 10th of August 2024.

Weâ€™ll conduct interviews during the application period. If you have any questions, youâ€™re welcome to contact Ingi Ulfar Helgason by phone on 23701492.

More information about the company can be found at www.man-es.com




We encourage all qualified candidates regardless of gender, age, religion, disability and ethnic background to apply for this position. Assistive tools will be available when needed for example for dyslexia.




Show more
HTML:
As a Business Analyst in Data Management, you will be the primary contact for Primeserv DK, the Danish aftersales organization, focusing on eChannels and process optimization. You will be bridging the technology and business to improve processes and the efficiency of our organization.


You will play an important role in:

Concrete tasks that the business analyst will be working with is:

  • Analyze business processes related to our eChannels and identify areas for improvements to enhance efficiency.
  • Translate business requirements into tangible actions and initiatives for IT and other development resources to support the business.
  • Lead initiatives related to digital transformation and automation of business processes.
  • Collaborate with IT and different business departments to successfully implement changes and improvements.
  • Manage internal and external stakeholders to gather requirements, resolve issues and identify opportunities.


In the beginning you will be working along a more senior member of our team, where you will in collaboration service our organization, and identify focus areas. With time we assume that you will take increased ownership of the area, where you will enter and possibly lead different relevant projects. You will become experienced in a complex organization that is working to reap the benefits of digitalization. We aim to train you in project and product management, and give you more responsibility along the way.


We imagine that you:

We imagine that you have a degree in Business administration, Information technology, Engineering or a similar field. You are structured and are capable of working independently with the ability to take ownership of your area of responsibility. You have a positive mindset and possess the ability to identify opportunities, with a strong drive to make a meaningful impact.


Ideally, you possess some previous work experience including stakeholder and project management from large corporations. You need to be able to work in a fast-paced environment and have strong analytical and problem-solving skills.


Additionally experience with the following tools is a benefit but not a requirement:

  • A database query tool, such as SQL Server Management Studio or similar.
  • An ERP system and its processes


In your application we would very much like to hear about your experience of how you took control of a situation and managed stakeholders. This can be in an educational, professional or private setting.


Welcome to Data Management

We are a team of 11 full-time employees, with different roles in making sure that our enginges, and equipment are updated. We enable the rest of the organization in taking important steps in digitization. We work from Copenhagen, Holeby, Frederikshavn and remotely. In addition we have 7 students who we trust with important tasks.


Unleash your potential: Join us towards a carbon-neutral future

At MAN Energy Solutions, we offer you an opportunity shape the future while achieving your career goals.


We understand that balancing work life and personal life can be a challenge. This is why we prioritize providing our employees with the best opportunities to achieve this balance.


In addition to flexible working hours, the option to work from home, and a focus on brain breaks during the day, we also offer over 7 weeks of paid time off distributed across vacation days, holidays, and flex days.


We focus on diversity and equality to create a creative and inclusive culture and believe that a mix of gender, nationalities, and different perspectives, drives innovation, creativity, and productivity in our organization. We are committed to our employeesâ€™ well-being, and you will get the opportunity to join different social activities clubs from yoga and fishing clubs to creative clubs.


At MAN Energy Solutions you can create, drive, build, and be a part of improving innovative energy solutions while achieving your personal career goals. Here you have opportunities for growth, development, and mentorship.


In 2027, MAN Energy Solutions will move to Trekroner in Roskilde. Here we will consolidate all our current locations on Zealand into one large site.


About MAN Energy Solutions

  • 250 years of experience in advanced engineering
  • We deliver a unique portfolio of technologies and opportunities in the development of engines for use on ships and in power plants across the globe
  • We operate under the motto "Future in The Making" as it reflects our dedication to developing sustainable solutions and actively contributing to a carbon-neutral economy
  • We have over 15,000 employees worldwide. In Denmark, we are 2,200 passionate employees with more than 40 nationalities


Build your own future

Apply for the job through our homepage by clicking on â€œApply for positionâ€ and attach CV, an application letter and relevant documents. The application deadline is Saturday, the 10th of August 2024.

Weâ€™ll conduct interviews during the application period. If you have any questions, youâ€™re welcome to contact Ingi Ulfar Helgason by phone on 23701492.

More information about the company can be found at www.man-es.com


We encourage all qualified candidates regardless of gender, age, religion, disability and ethnic background to apply for this position. Assistive tools will be available when needed for example for dyslexia.

Title: Internship: Database System Development
Place: Odense, Region of Southern Denmark, Denmark
Description:
We are looking for an enthusiastic intern to join our team and help extend our current database system.

Responsibilities


Enhance and extend our existing database system into our robots utilizing MongoDB.
Collaborate with the development team to integrate new features.
Write clean, maintainable code with tests


Requirements


Good knowledge in a programming language (Typescript /JavaScript preferred)
Experience in working with databases (NoSQL is a plus)
Understanding of Object-Oriented Programming concepts


What You Will Gain


Hands-on experience with MongoDB and learn best practices for database design and optimization.
Improve your coding skills, particularly in TypeScript/JavaScript, and learn how to write efficient, maintainable code.
Deepen your understanding of OOP concepts and how to apply them effectively in real-world projects.
Learn industry-standard development practices, including version control, code reviews, and collaborative development workflows.
Enhance your problem-solving abilities by tackling real-world challenges and finding innovative solutions.
Gain insight into the software development life cycle (SDLC) and agile methodologies, and understand how to manage and deliver projects successfully.
Work closely with experienced professionals, receive mentorship, and build a strong foundation for your future career.

Title: Senior Quantitative Analyst
Description:
Join a world of energy as MFT Energy's new Senior Quantitative Analyst

In MFT Energy we trade energy to make markets efficient and to facilitate the green transition. We are looking for a Senior Quantitative Analyst to join our ambitious Intraday team with experienced colleagues, who strive to be the best every day.




The job of a Senior Quantitative Analyst

As our new Senior Quantitative Analyst, you will become part of a professional and dedicated algorithmic trading team. Our team contributes to developing autonomous trading strategies in the European intraday power market using cutting-edge technologies and trading methodologies.

The team consists of a highly diverse set of individuals, all with a common passion for data-driven trading, and with a goal to create the most sophisticated setup in the industry.

Your work areas will be within programming new trading strategies as well as supporting the improvement of our current trading setup. You will be reporting to our Head of Algorithmic Trading, Daniel Vibe.




Your key responsibilities

Research new market opportunities
Develop new trading strategies using machine learning and market knowledge
Contribute to existing trade signal and execution frameworks
Benchmark and evaluate external forecast providers
Optimize our active trade execution algorithms
Acquire and maintain data from external sources




Your qualifications and personal skills

Have experience from a trading desk - preferably within European Intraday Power
Industry experience with machine learning and/or statistical modeling
Skilled in Python and can write production-grade code
Excellent communication skills and a proactive approach
Strong analytical skills and an eye for detail
Have a curious mind and the courage to take on a steep learning curve
The ability to work independently and structure your workload
A positive and competitive attitude, but at the same time a valued team player
Fluent in English, both spoken and written, as our company language is English




Working in MFT Energy

You will be part of a young, global, and vibrant working environment in the heart of Aarhus. MFT Energy is a transparent and flat organization with entrepreneurship at heart. We have 163 employees working out of our headquarters in Scandinavian Center in Aarhus C and from our international offices in Turkey, Australia, USA, and Singapore as well as several remote colleagues working from all over the world. Our mission is to empower entrepreneurs to become the best â€“ we believe that this is done via a fair organizational structure, with the most competent people, based on the right values.




We offer:

A competitive and entrepreneurial work environment
Professional and committed colleagues with great ambitions
Great employee benefits and a people-centered leadership approach
The chance to one day have ownership within the company
A celebrative work environment, a modern workplace, and an entrepreneurial, professional culture.




Make the most of your talent! Join us!

If you think there is a fit between our values and your aspirations, we will be looking forward to receiving your application with your CV and likely also your diplomas. For questions, please contact career@mft-energy.com.




Start date: As soon as possible.




We will be screening candidates on an ongoing basis.

Show more

Title: Data Engineer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
LiveIntent is looking for an enterprising Data Engineer, full of ideas, with an interest in programming and large scale data processing, to join our highly competent development team in Copenhagen! Our team in Copenhagen is responsible for the development and deployment of the companyâ€™s next-generation technology closely collaborating with the companyâ€™s other branches in New York and Berlin.

LiveIntent Copenhagen started as a Danish start-up company in 2013 and was acquired by LiveIntent in November 2015. The team is led by people who have been with us since the start in 2013 and consists of a further approx. 30 new hires that have been added since the end of 2016. We develop and operate a very complex analytical data processing pipeline which is a basic component of all the company's products.

About The Job

The Compute Infrastructure team empowers data scientists and data engineers through a Scala data warehouse framework designed for data modeling and the creation of type-safe and easily testable batch jobs. Our team also orchestrates a compute environment that simplifies the execution of Spark jobs, facilitating the analysis of terabytes of data with ease and cost-effectiveness. The runtime environment is based on Hadoop clusters on EC2 spot instances, dynamically scaling up as required, ensuring high resource utilization and stability

What you will be doing as part of the compute infrastructure team:


Operate and implement new features in the framework and the services managed by the team
Engaging with data scientist and identify ways of improving their experience and productivity of using our framework and services
Identify and implement computational improvements
Making improvements and/or fixing bugs by submitting patches to open source projects that are in our stack. For example Spark, Hadoop, Airflow and many others.
Act as a office topic expert on Spark and Scala


Your Profile

You are interested in back-end technologies and architecture and are passionate about learning new things. You may also be interested in math, statistics, or adtech technology.

You Have a Degree In Computer Science, Software Engineering, Physics, Math, Or Chemistry. You Have Practical Experience With Actual Programming, And Preferably Also Have a Practical And/or Deep Theoretical Understanding Of Some Of The Following


Spark and/or other large scale data-processing framework
Programming in Scala or other JVM based language
Basic knowledge about Amazon Web Services (EC2, S3, Athena, etc)


You approach problems analytically and solutions pragmatically. You are full of good ideas, able to see opportunities and weaknesses in other peopleâ€™s ideas, and able to find ways to discuss ideas in a distanced and constructive manner. You love to go in depth with different topics and are curious about learning about things within new subjects. You want to understand and get involved with the problems the company is facing. You thrive in a dynamic environment where work priorities can change, and therefore tasks may not always be finished. You can hand over tasks, but prefer to finish them yourself. You are able to work independently and enterprisingly. When people come to you with a problem, bug or a question youâ€™ll want to help them immediately.

The Company

LiveIntent, one of the worldâ€™s largest people-based marketing platforms, connects 2,500 publishing and advertising brands with over 250 MM verified people every month across all types of media. With the anonymized email address at the center of its industry-leading identity graph, LiveIntent provides brands with solutions that help them monetize, acquire, and retain real people, even where cookies donâ€™t work. LiveIntent enriches a brandsâ€™ data, making it possible for them to deepen their understanding of their audiences, and more effectively market to people wherever they are present and paying attention. LiveIntent is home to over 250 people worldwide with offices in New York, Chicago, Berlin, and Copenhagen.

LiveIntent Copenhagen started as a Danish startup company in 2013 and was acquired by LiveIntent in November 2015. We develop and operate both an online, real-time service that receives billions of requests from all over the world and from other LiveIntent components, and an offline, batch-oriented analytical data processing pipeline that prepares data for the online service by processing billions of data points.

We Offer

You can look forward to being a key player in a challenging and dynamic developmental story where you will be part of a team with some of the industry's hottest talents. There will be rich opportunities to learn from others, and you will have the flexibility to dive into experiments on your own. We are passionate about new solutions, technologies and algorithms, but pragmatic in our choice of solutions.

We believe in freedom and flexibility under responsibility so that office hours can be adapted to your life as long as meetings are covered. If you need to work from home one day, it is completely fine, as long as you live up to what is expected. We are an international company, with frequent contact between the departments in Berlin and New York City. The position is located in our office in Copenhagen.

Does that sound exciting? If so, send us an application! We are a small office with a social atmosphere so your personal profile is just as valuable to us as your technical skills. A cover letter will therefore be greatly appreciated.
