Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Abacus Medicine is searching for a driven Data Engineer to join the Data Engineering team where you will play a pivotal role in building scalable and robust data solutions. Utilize your skills in Python, Apache Spark, Azure Databricks, Azure Data Factory, and Azure Data/Delta Lake, along with other cutting-edge technologies. We donâ€™t think it is mandatory to have experience with all tools, instead, we prioritize your eagerness to learn and grow within this role, as well as passion for the field of data engineering. Join us in driving our Data Engineering vision and explore the vast possibilities of a modern data tech-stack!




Your responsibilities as a Data Engineer:

Design, develop, maintain and optimize data pipelines that perform data extraction, transformation, and loading (ETL) processes from various sources, ensuring data quality and efficiency.
Work on projects in the field of data engineering that directly impact our data-driven initiatives. Relating to data integration solutions, data quality, storage optimization, upgrading our architecture, and more.
Stay up to date with emerging data engineering trends and technologies to further develop our modern data cloud platform.
Leveraging our scalable monitoring tool and cutting-edge data observability platform to monitor and troubleshoot data pipelines, identifying and resolving issues proactively and build solutions with the aim of reducing time to detection and time to resolution.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams and other data professionals and stakeholders throughout the business to gather requirements and design robust data solutions, merging the expertise from different domains to find the best solution for each data challenge.
Optimize big data storage and data retrieval processes.




The Tech-Stack

Some of the technologies and tools you will be working with are:

Azure Databricks
Azure Data Factory
Azure Data/Delta Lake
Python
PySpark
SQL
Azure DevOps
Monte Carlo, Data Observability Platform
Git
And more!




Are you the right candidate?

As a Data Engineer, you will play a vital role in our data infrastructure team, supporting the development, maintenance, and optimization of our data pipelines and platform. You will work closely with a talented group of data professionals, ranging from BI developers and data analysts to data scientists, gaining hands-on experience in data engineering best practices and cutting-edge technologies.

To succeed in the job, it is important that you are passionate, possess technical skills, and have a genuine interest in working with new cloud technologies. Your motivation to deliver high-quality data services, which serve as a foundation for impactful decision-making and advanced analytics across the organization, will be crucial to your success. You thrive in a dynamic and ambitious team environment and approach problem-solving with a creative mindset.

In Data & Analytics, we promote continuous learning and development and help our data engineers to expand their expertise and knowledge in various domains.




Qualifications and skills:

A Masterâ€™s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Data Science, or a related field.
Proficiency in Python programming.
Familiarity in working with source control such as git.
Basic knowledge of SQL.
Experience in data manipulation, data wrangling, and data cleansing techniques to ensure data quality and integrity.
Strong problem-solving skills with attention to detail.
Excellent communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work effectively in a team-oriented environment.
Proactive mindset with a continuous learning approach to keep up with evolving technologies in the data engineering field.
Good oral and written communication skills in English.




It is an advantage (but not a requirement) if you have knowledge or experience with:

Cloud platforms, such as Azure, AWS or GCP.
Azure Data/Delta Lake for efficient storage and processing of big data.
Apache Spark and Databricks for data processing and analytics.
Experience with PySpark.
Experience with Azure Data Factory, or familiarity with other similar data integration and orchestration tools.
Data governance and data modelling best practices
Understanding of CI/CD practices.

Join our team and be part of an exciting journey to unlock the power of data!




Your future colleagues

In the D&A department, we are responsible for developing and maintaining Abacus' datahub, as well as implementing our BI platform, facilitating data-driven projects, and developing advanced analytics models (ML). The team comprises 3 Data Scientists, 5 BI developers, 2 Data Analysts, and 4 Data Engineers, along with 3 team leads overseeing different areas of expertise.




Our team consists of individuals from diverse nationalities, expertise areas, educational backgrounds, and ownership responsibilities across our data platforms and services. This diversity creates a strong environment for collaboration, technical synergies, and support among units, all while maintaining a positive and motivating work environment.




In summary, our goal is to create innovative data-driven solutions for core business problems within a friendly and professional work setting.




Have we caught your interest?

If you wish to apply for the position, please use the apply link and attach your resumÃ©, cover letter and grade transcript. We do not accept applications by email.

Last application day is August 31st. Interviews will be conducted throughout the application period. The position is to be filled as soon as possible, and we process applications continuously.




If you have any questions, please feel free to contact Mariana Alves Monteiro, Team Lead for Data Engineering at mariana.monteiro@abacusmedicine.com.




We look forward to receiving your application!




Would you like to know more about us?

Follow us on Instagram and LinkedIn, to get an insight into everyday life at Abacus Medicine. For other job openings, check out our Career page.




Better Access. Better Healthcare.

At Abacus Medicine, our purpose is to improve global healthcare through better access to medicine. This has driven us to quickly become a global player in the parallel import industry and pharmaceutical services while not losing sight of our entrepreneurial mindset. Our company values; Innovative, Dedicated, and Caring, lead us on our way to continuously look for improvement and further ways to achieve our purpose. Join our 1,200 dedicated colleagues with more than 32 different nationalities in e.g. Denmark, Hungary, Germany, the Netherlands, the UK, Austria and Hong Kong.

Title: Snowflake Data Engineer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
We are looking for an experienced Data Engineer who wants to work with the Snowflake Data Cloud. You want to work with the latest in data engineering and have the desire and skills to learn new languages and services. Experience within Azure / AWS, Snowflake, ELT/ETL, Python, and SQL is a plus.

Are you our new Snowflake Data Engineer?

As a Snowflake Data Engineer at Intellishore, you will get the opportunity to be innovative, create lasting impacts for a wide range of customers, and excel in a culture of collaboration. We are not an industry-specific consultancy, so you should thrive in learning new industries and bring a healthy dose of curiosity. Two projects are rarely the same!

You will get the opportunity to influence and drive the development of Intellishore to make sure we deliver value to our clients across different industries and business areas. Working at Intellishore means working together with people representing other competencies than yourself and we take great pride in the development of all our Intellishorians. We focus on bringing together a broad mix of people to build a unique combination of expertise and backgrounds. The personal edge of every Intellishorian is what creates our distinct collective power â€“ that is our belief!

If this sounds like something for you â€“ Then keep on reading below

What are we looking for?

We Realize That Few People Are Experts At Everything. But If You Can Nod Your Head At Some Of The Following Attributes Then You Could Be The Person We Are Looking For


Work experience as a Data Engineer, building and maintaining performant data platforms for reporting and analytics
Implementing ELT/ETL models is something you are all for and might even be passionate about
The cloud you love the most is the Snowflake Data Cloud â€“ also as an â€œend-userâ€
You worked with data engineering services on Azure or AWS and have been giving multiple high-fives for your work!
A big enthusiast and some might call a connoisseur when it comes to SQL
Good understanding of data modeling principles
Relevant background in computer science and engineering, mathematical modeling, or similar



It would be a plus if you have experience with making it snow in the Snowflake Data Cloud with security, access, integration, etc.

To Succeed In This Role, We Believe That You


Love to be a team and you are one that takes ownership, builds cross-functional relationships, and is all about sharing knowledge
Dig being part of different teams, projects, and challenges
Value the importance of a great environment where productive work is done by communication and contributing constructively
Want to be part of a journey that is bigger than yourself but you are an essential part of it!



Why work for Intellishore?

1 | Challenging projects

Exciting and challenging Consultant role in data-intensive and strategic client projects

2 | Entrepreneurial work environment

Dynamic and entrepreneurial environment with kind & ambitious colleagues

3 | Courses & training

We will provide you with access to the necessary courses and certifications within the newest technologies (i.e. AWS, Snowflake, & Azure)

4 | Strategic seminars

Annual Strategic Seminar where you get to socialize with your colleagues whilst building the company for the future (we've been to South Africa, Japan, India, China, Dubai, Iceland, and Germany)

5 | Sustainable consulting

A sustainable consulting career with high levels of flexibility and a great and informal work environment

6 | Exciting growth journey

We are on a mission to redefine the world of data & analytics and we are constantly expanding our team and scope

Any questions?

If you are interested in applying for this position, fill out the formula below. Applicants will be invited to interviews on a rolling basis.

We acknowledge that a change in career path requires careful consideration and that timing is crucial. Therefore, you are always welcome to reach out as you see fit.

For more information about the position, please reach out to David Andreasen Lyngh: dly@intellishore.dk / +45 28 59 42 76

At the moment, we are only accepting applications from applicants inside of the EU or the Nordics.

Who is Intellishore?

Intellishore was founded in 2013 with the idea of providing clients with a seamless combination of strategic and technical support. Today, we are more than 60 skilled, entrepreneurial, and passionate employees from many different backgrounds; engineers, economists, marketers, and we even have a rhetorician (with a degree in economics, but still).

We are Intellishorians; a family, a unique collective of passionate professionals who have jumped at the chance to be part of a larger journey.

Title: Analytics Engineer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Unlock the Future of Sustainable Energy with Data Analytics!

We are currently undergoing an exciting carve-out process, rebuilding our entire data infrastructure along with associated data products. We operate exclusively on cloud-based solutions and implement everything in Microsoft Fabric, adhering to best practice data platforms.




Our Ambition: Ignite a Data-Driven Revolution

Our grand vision? To supercharge CM Biomass with data! We're not just talking about fancy reports for the higher-ups; we're democratizing data to enhance transparency, accessibility, and data-driven insights across the entire organization.




Your Responsibilities:

As our new Analytics Engineer, you're not just part of the team â€“ you're the cornerstone of CM Biomass's data-driven future. You will be working closely with the business to understand their needs and enable their visions with data solutions.

Here's what awaits you:

You will develop and document our Lakehous, the backbone of our data solution.
You will develop and implement data models and utilize cloud-based technologies.
Alongside the rest of the team, you will assist the business with ad-hoc analyses and continuous data insights.

Your impact matters! Here are our success criteria:

Ensure data reaches the right hands at the right time.
Engineer our infrastructure to be as scalable as a rocket, ready for our meteoric growth.




The Ideal Candidate:

We envision the ideal candidate to possess a technical educational background. Additionally, you should have at least a couple of years of experience and preferably have worked in an international company, gaining an understanding of diverse professional tasks and national cultures. Proficiency in MS SQL, Python and a deep understanding of Power BI are essential. It's also a plus if you are skilled in Azure Data Factory, ,and other exciting Azure applications.




It will considered a plus, if you have one or more of the following certifications:

PL-300 Power BI Data Analyst Associate
DP-203 Azure Data Engineer Associate
DP-600: Implementing Analytics Solutions Using Microsoft Fabric




On a personal level, we're looking for a candidate who thrives on creating structures and efficient processes, works in a planned and organized manner, and enjoys tackling diverse tasks within a dynamic, international, and entrepreneurial culture.




Join Us for an Exciting Opportunity!

Joining our team means immersing yourself in a growth company with a vibrant and unique culture. Our flat hierarchy, swift decision-making processes, and calculated risk-taking foster an exciting and enjoyable work environment with a strong sense of community and accountability. We value our traditions, from savoring delicious freshly baked goods from Halima to wearing shorts in the summer. Our renowned Friday bar is a hit among employees. We offer you substantial autonomy to shape your role and pave your path for growth and development. Located in the exclusive and inspiring surroundings of Klubiensvej in Nordhavn, Copenhagen, you will find yourself in an ideal setting to thrive both personally and professionally. Our corporate language is English.




If you are curious to learn more about this opportunity or, even better, ready to apply, please follow the application link provided below. If you have any questions, you are more than welcome to reach out to August Godballe, Data Architect at + 45 73 83 19 27 .

We look forward to hearing from you!




Please be advised that response times for applications may be extended due to the summer holiday period.




About CM Biomass

CM Biomass is the largest independent trader of wood pellets and the 3rd largest producer/trader, employing more than 226 dedicated professionals in 12 countries. We work with a variety of clients across several markets, trading around 3.3 million tons of industrial or premium-grade wood pellets per year, striving to decarbonize power and heat production.

CM Biomass has its roots in the family-owned Copenhagen Merchants Group, which still remains a minority owner. CM Biomass's majority owner is United Shipping & Trading Company (USTC), represented in 40 countries across various sectors, including oil & energy, shipping & logistics, risk management, car activities, IT, sustainable energy, and environment & recycling.

Show more
HTML:
Unlock the Future of Sustainable Energy with Data Analytics!

We are currently undergoing an exciting carve-out process, rebuilding our entire data infrastructure along with associated data products. We operate exclusively on cloud-based solutions and implement everything in Microsoft Fabric, adhering to best practice data platforms.


Our Ambition: Ignite a Data-Driven Revolution

Our grand vision? To supercharge CM Biomass with data! We're not just talking about fancy reports for the higher-ups; we're democratizing data to enhance transparency, accessibility, and data-driven insights across the entire organization.


Your Responsibilities:

As our new Analytics Engineer, you're not just part of the team â€“ you're the cornerstone of CM Biomass's data-driven future. You will be working closely with the business to understand their needs and enable their visions with data solutions.

Here's what awaits you:

  • You will develop and document our Lakehous, the backbone of our data solution.
  • You will develop and implement data models and utilize cloud-based technologies.
  • Alongside the rest of the team, you will assist the business with ad-hoc analyses and continuous data insights.

Your impact matters! Here are our success criteria:

  • Ensure data reaches the right hands at the right time.
  • Engineer our infrastructure to be as scalable as a rocket, ready for our meteoric growth.


The Ideal Candidate:

We envision the ideal candidate to possess a technical educational background. Additionally, you should have at least a couple of years of experience and preferably have worked in an international company, gaining an understanding of diverse professional tasks and national cultures. Proficiency in MS SQL, Python and a deep understanding of Power BI are essential. It's also a plus if you are skilled in Azure Data Factory, ,and other exciting Azure applications.


It will considered a plus, if you have one or more of the following certifications:

  • PL-300 Power BI Data Analyst Associate
  • DP-203 Azure Data Engineer Associate
  • DP-600: Implementing Analytics Solutions Using Microsoft Fabric


On a personal level, we're looking for a candidate who thrives on creating structures and efficient processes, works in a planned and organized manner, and enjoys tackling diverse tasks within a dynamic, international, and entrepreneurial culture.


Join Us for an Exciting Opportunity!

Joining our team means immersing yourself in a growth company with a vibrant and unique culture. Our flat hierarchy, swift decision-making processes, and calculated risk-taking foster an exciting and enjoyable work environment with a strong sense of community and accountability. We value our traditions, from savoring delicious freshly baked goods from Halima to wearing shorts in the summer. Our renowned Friday bar is a hit among employees. We offer you substantial autonomy to shape your role and pave your path for growth and development. Located in the exclusive and inspiring surroundings of Klubiensvej in Nordhavn, Copenhagen, you will find yourself in an ideal setting to thrive both personally and professionally. Our corporate language is English.


If you are curious to learn more about this opportunity or, even better, ready to apply, please follow the application link provided below. If you have any questions, you are more than welcome to reach out to August Godballe, Data Architect at + 45 73 83 19 27 .

We look forward to hearing from you!


Please be advised that response times for applications may be extended due to the summer holiday period.


About CM Biomass

CM Biomass is the largest independent trader of wood pellets and the 3rd largest producer/trader, employing more than 226 dedicated professionals in 12 countries. We work with a variety of clients across several markets, trading around 3.3 million tons of industrial or premium-grade wood pellets per year, striving to decarbonize power and heat production.

CM Biomass has its roots in the family-owned Copenhagen Merchants Group, which still remains a minority owner. CM Biomass's majority owner is United Shipping & Trading Company (USTC), represented in 40 countries across various sectors, including oil & energy, shipping & logistics, risk management, car activities, IT, sustainable energy, and environment & recycling.

Title: Business Intelligence Specialist (Student worker)
Description:
Candeno is currently looking for a Part-time Business Intelligence Specialist

Are you driven by the challenge of supporting a growing organisation's data analysis and visualisation? Do you thrive in an environment where innovation meets inspiration? Do you find motivation in designing and implementing dashboards that drive data-driven decision-making? If so, you might be our ideal BI Specialist.

The opportunity ðŸ¤©

At Candeno, we seek a thorough and solution-oriented part-time BI Specialist to strengthen our Finance and BI department. The focus will be on the presentation and visualisation of complex data through Plecto dashboards and reporting tools.

You will âœ…

Skills

As a BI Specialist, you will use your data-driven and analytical nature to develop and optimise our implementation of dashboards for reporting key performance indicators (KPIs) while using your communicative skills to convey data to internal and external stakeholders. You will report to our Finance & BI Manager and work closely with our Finance & BI team and other departments. You will also:


Develop and optimise organisational standards for data visualisation.
Create tailored financial dashboards and report tools for management and the board.
Ensure consistent reporting practices across the organisation.
Lay the foundation for data-driven decision-making in the organisation.
Extract, transform, and load data to build a robust semantic model.


You are ðŸ’™

We Are Looking For a Candidate With a Diligent And Result-oriented Approach To Managing Our Business Intelligence While Supporting The Finance Department With Other Tasks And Supporting Other Teams With The Function Of Operations. We Are Also Looking For a Candidate With


With a relevant education or experience in the field
Experience with MySQL and a solid understanding of databases.
The willingness to develop strong reporting skills.
The ability to analyse and communicate complex data convincingly.
Thorough and precise approach to task solving.
Proactive and solution-oriented approach.
Interest in driving projects within the BI field and identifying process optimisation opportunities.
Thrives in a role with many tasks simultaneously
The opportunity to work from our headquarters in Aarhus


We offer ðŸš€


15-20 hours a week, which will be tailored to match your studies, and large flexibility around exams and other important study-related deadlines
The possibility to work from home
A fun, informal and innovative environment
At Candeno, we value your well-being. We are committed to maintaining a healthy work-life balance and offer high flexibility. Your mental and physical health is important to us, and we strive to create an environment that supports it.
A balanced and delicious lunch from local Aarhus vendors ðŸ¥— and communal breakfast every Monday morning ðŸ¥ž
A Milestone program to celebrate our shared achievements ðŸ†
At Candeno, our passion is not just about what we do but also the heart of our strong social scene, which offers team-building activities, social events, and diverse company clubs ðŸƒ âš½ï¸ ðŸŽ¨


A Little Bit About Our Recruitment Process


Apply now! Our People Coordinator will contact you within three working days
Interview with Finance manager and People Coordinator + Case presentation with our Finance Manager and CEO
Walk 'n' Talks with potential colleagues


Please do not hesitate to contact us (jr@candeno.com) if you have any questions or require further information.

For more information or questions please contact us at jr@candeno.com

Title: International Consultancy: Market Research Data Analyst,12 months, Sustainable Markets Centre (SMC), UNICEF Supply Division, Part time, Remote/Homebased.
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
UNICEF works in some of the worldâ€™s toughest places, to reach the worldâ€™s most disadvantaged children. To save their lives. To defend their rights. To help them fulfill their potential.

Across 190 countries and territories, we work for every child, everywhere, every day, to build a better world for everyone.

And we never give up.

For every child, Love .......

As the largest single vaccine buyer in the world, UNICEF has a unique and longstanding expertise in procurement and logistics to help children in need. UNICEF procures more than 2 billion doses of vaccines annually for routine immunization and outbreak response on behalf of nearly 100 countries.

Through the Sustainable Markets Centre (SMC), UNICEF Supply Division seeks to positively influence the market dynamics to ensure commodities are fit for purpose, available, affordable, and produced by a competitive supply base, as well as to encourage product innovation of essential commodities to meet the changing needs of children in the SDG era. While SMC will coordinate the efforts of influencing markets across UNICEF Supply Divisionâ€™s different procurement centres and units, with each procurement centre playing a critical role in identifying and defining the procurement approaches required, SMC assists and facilitates this body of work with strategy design/review, market research, analysis, supplier financing, communication, leveraging partnerships, and promoting market information transparency and achieve sustainable markets.

As part of its broader commitments to information transparency and facilitating the free flow of information, UNICEF published in 2020 the COVID-19 Vaccine Market Dashboard, the go-to public resource for the latest information on the worldâ€™s COVID-19 vaccine market and the COVAX Facilityâ€™s vaccine deliveries. It received +700,000 unique page views since its launch and was archived in December 2023.

SMC continued on its efforts to foster market information transparency in the health space, in particular immunization markets due to its volume. UNICEF is the largest procurer of vaccines worldwide â€“ in 2023 alone, UNICEF procured $2.211 billion USD on vaccines/biologicals. In April 2024 UNICEF launched the Vaccine Markets Dashboard with the two-fold objectives of providing access to UNICEFâ€™s vaccine deliveries information and a holistic market landscape for various vaccine markets. Although the Dashboard currently covers a limited number of vaccine markets, it is to expand and include more vaccine markets where UNICEF plays a key role in procurement and supply.

In this line, SMC is looking for a consultant to contribute to the expansion of vaccine products and vaccine prices sections in the Dashboard. S/he supports efforts in gathering market intelligence, more specifically on vaccine types, manufacturer, prices, development and approval status etc. and translating it into the dashboard.

How can you make a difference?

Generate Relevant Market Intelligence


Perform market research on the agreed number of vaccine markets. The research should look into vaccine manufacturers, prices, pipeline, approval, and development status through media monitoring, desk research, internal sources etc. The exact vaccines markets for research are to be defined by SD, SMC, and other centers.
Create and connect data sources, import, and transform data for market intelligence. Translate data into informative visuals and reports.
Document, maintain and regularly update the collected information on vaccine markets and data sources
Perform ad-hoc data analysis. Given the request, this will include identifying the best way forward and methodology, collecting the information from identified sources (which may include ERP systems, existing dashboards, and external sources), organizing the information, performing the analysis, and presenting it in the most suitable format and platform.
With the ability to properly understand the business requirements, the consultant will conceptualize, develop, and implement business process and solutions that can result in relevant market intelligence, and improved data monitoring and/or reporting.


Maintenance, Administration, And Development Of MS Power BI Dashboards


Maintenance and administration of the Vaccine Markets Dashboard and other dashboards when needed. It includes ensuring daily operation of the dashboard, spotting technical / data errors and ensuring corrective actions are taken, and ensuring underlying data is refreshed as planned.
Improvement of data infrastructure for existing MS Power BI dashboard
Respond to queries (data extracts and reports) for Vaccine Market Dashboards and other dashboards managed by SMC
Development of new Power BI dashboard as necessary. It includes connecting to data sources, creating tables and data connections, creation of frames and visualizations, and overall administration of the Power BI dashboard (including operation and maintenance).
Update and maintain the dashboards traffic report when needed.


Reliable Master Data Quality


Ensure master data is reliable and quality assured.
Regularly perform benchmarks of information to ensure data is as comprehensive as possible.
Monitor the dashboards, and if/when needed, reach out to relevant stakeholders to implement preventive and corrective actions to ensure data quality.
Perform and automate a rigorous data quality assurance processes to ensure data quality and completeness.


Provide Documentation And Training


Ensure relevant documentation is in place, and provide a final report with all relevant data/materials/outputs produced during the assignment
The consultant shall provide all needed documentation related to reports/dashboards and design development as needed such as: data model diagrams, main query logic, etc. The consultant is expected to provide colleagues with initial training and documentation on the maintenance of the BI analytics dashboard, including data sources and data models.


The consultant will interact with UNICEF staff to receive any clarifications and guidance that may be needed. The consultant may also engage with external service providers to request inputs needed to develop the required deliverables. On a weekly basis, the consultantâ€™s work will be coordinated with the Market Research Officer. Each deliverable will be delivered in draft for comments and feedback before finalization.

The Consultant will duly inform UNICEF of any problems, issues or delays arising in the course of implementation of assignment and take necessary steps to address them.

All reports and results are to be submitted to the UNICEF in electronic form (*.pbix, *.docx, *.xlsx, *.pptx, and *.pdf or other formats accepted by UNICEF).

To qualify as an advocate for every child you will haveâ€¦


An advanced university degree (Masterâ€™s or higher) in Information Systems Management, Data Science, Statistics, Engineering, Economics, or other relevant filed is required.
A relevant first level university degree in the above areas combined with 5 years of relevant qualifying experience may be accepted in lieu of the advanced university degree.
A minimum of two (2) years professional work experience with proficiency in use of data processing, data warehouse, data reporting, data visualization, data analysis, business intelligence, and performance monitoring is required.
Good knowledge of vaccine markets in the development contexts
Strong skillset in MS Power BI and knowledge of DAX
Strong skillset in Excel, including complex formulas and pivot tables
Systems competent, preferable with knowledge of SAP, data warehousing, SQL and able to use the MS standard computer software
Good presentation skills and experience with communicating analysis results visually and in writing
Good knowledge of planning and/or project management principles and practices.
Fluency in English is required. Knowledge of another official UN language (Arabic, Chinese, French, Russian or Spanish) is an asset.


Desired Experience/qualifications


A high level of attention to detail
Proven ability to work independently
Knowledge and experience in market research and/or market data analysis is considered an asset


The consultant will interact with UNICEF staff to receive any clarifications and guidance that may be needed. The consultant may also engage with external service providers to request inputs needed to develop the required deliverables. On a weekly basis, the consultantâ€™s work will be coordinated with the Market Research Officer. Each deliverable will be delivered in draft for comments and feedback before finalization.

The Consultant will duly inform UNICEF of any problems, issues or delays arising in the course of implementation of assignment and take necessary steps to address them.

All reports and results are to be submitted to the UNICEF in electronic form (*.pbix, *.docx, *.xlsx, *.pptx, and *.pdf or other formats accepted by UNICEF).

For every Child, you demonstrateâ€¦

UNICEF's values of Care, Respect, Integrity, Trust, Accountability, and Sustainability (CRITAS).

To view our competency framework, please visitâ€¯ here.

UNICEF is here to serve the worldâ€™s most disadvantaged children and our global workforce must reflect the diversity of those children. The UNICEF family is committed to include everyone, irrespective of their race/ethnicity, age, disability, gender identity, sexual orientation, religion, nationality, socio-economic background, or any other personal characteristic.

UNICEF offers reasonable accommodation for consultants/individual contractors with disabilities. This may include, for example, accessible software, travel assistance for missions or personal attendants. We encourage you to disclose your disability during your application in case you need reasonable accommodation during the selection process and afterwards in your assignment.

UNICEF has a zero-tolerance policy on conduct that is incompatible with the aims and objectives of the United Nations and UNICEF, including sexual exploitation and abuse, sexual harassment, abuse of authority and discrimination. UNICEF also adheres to strict child safeguarding principles. All selected candidates will be expected to adhere to these standards and principles and will therefore undergo rigorous reference and background checks. Background checks will include the verification of academic credential(s) and employment history. Selected candidates may be required to provide additional information to conduct a background check.

Remarks

Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted and advance to the next stage of the selection process.

Individuals engaged under a consultancy or individual contract will not be considered â€œstaff membersâ€ under the Staff Regulations and Rules of the United Nations and UNICEFâ€™s policies and procedures, and will not be entitled to benefits provided therein (such as leave entitlements and medical insurance coverage). Their conditions of service will be governed by their contract and the General Conditions of Contracts for the Services of Consultants and Individual Contractors. Consultants and individual contractors are responsible for determining their tax liabilities and for the payment of any taxes and/or duties, in accordance with local or other applicable laws.

The selected candidate is solely responsible to ensure that the visa (applicable) and health insurance required to perform the duties of the contract are valid for the entire period of the contract. Selected candidates are subject to confirmation of fully-vaccinated status against SARS-CoV-2 (Covid-19) with a World Health Organization (WHO)-endorsed vaccine, which must be met prior to taking up the assignment. It does not apply to consultants who will work remotely and are not expected to work on or visit UNICEF premises, programme delivery locations or directly interact with communities UNICEF works with, nor to travel to perform functions for UNICEF for the duration of their consultancy contracts.

Place: Ballerup Municipality, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:

Forestil dig samtidig, at du igennem din unikke forretningsforstÃ¥else samt dine NAV15 og SQL kompetencer, er i stand til at bygge Power BI-rapporter, som gÃ¸r de data, der allerede eksisterer i ERP systemet lettilgÃ¦ngelige for forretningen.




Ligger disse forestillinger godt i maven hos dig, sÃ¥ er stillingen som BI Specialist hos Humac sikkert noget for dig.

Title: SAS Developer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Looking for Senior SAS Developer for our client in the banking industry. Our mission is to deliver trusted, automated reporting solutions for our customers, financial supervisory authorities, and internal stakeholders, including the Group Leadership Team, Group Finance Management, Regulatory Reporting, and Risk Models. The IT solutions you will develop provide the calculation of the Capital Adequacy Directive and Expected Credit Loss.

Key Responsibilities:

Â·Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Build and test IT solutions for capital adequacy and expected credit loss calculations.

Â·Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Utilize SAS (4GL and macro programming) to develop and implement reporting solutions.

Â·Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Collaborate with team members to ensure high-quality deliverables.

Â·Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Engage with stakeholders to gather requirements and present solutions.

Required Skills and Experience:

Â·Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Superior knowledge of SAS (4GL and macro programming).

Â·Â Â Â Â Â Â Â 6-7 years of SAS development experience.

Â·Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Strong programming and analytical skills.

Â·Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Knowledge of SQL and Python is an advantage.

Â·Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Practical experience with databases.

Â·Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Excellent communication and presentation skills.

Â·Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Thorough, independent, and team-oriented work style.

Â·Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Familiarity with SAFe, Agile methodologies, and principles.

Start Date:Â ASAP

End Date:Â End of April 2025

Workload:Â Full time, time and material

Title: Internship: Database System Development
Place: Odense, Region of Southern Denmark, Denmark
Description:
We are looking for an enthusiastic intern to join our team and help extend our current database system.

Responsibilities


Enhance and extend our existing database system into our robots utilizing MongoDB.
Collaborate with the development team to integrate new features.
Write clean, maintainable code with tests


Requirements


Good knowledge in a programming language (Typescript /JavaScript preferred)
Experience in working with databases (NoSQL is a plus)
Understanding of Object-Oriented Programming concepts


What You Will Gain


Hands-on experience with MongoDB and learn best practices for database design and optimization.
Improve your coding skills, particularly in TypeScript/JavaScript, and learn how to write efficient, maintainable code.
Deepen your understanding of OOP concepts and how to apply them effectively in real-world projects.
Learn industry-standard development practices, including version control, code reviews, and collaborative development workflows.
Enhance your problem-solving abilities by tackling real-world challenges and finding innovative solutions.
Gain insight into the software development life cycle (SDLC) and agile methodologies, and understand how to manage and deliver projects successfully.
Work closely with experienced professionals, receive mentorship, and build a strong foundation for your future career.
Show more

  • Collaborate with the development team to integrate new features.
  • Write clean, maintainable code with tests

Requirements

  • Good knowledge in a programming language (Typescript /JavaScript preferred)
  • Experience in working with databases (NoSQL is a plus)
  • Understanding of Object-Oriented Programming concepts

  • Hands-on experience with MongoDB and learn best practices for database design and optimization.
  • Improve your coding skills, particularly in TypeScript/JavaScript, and learn how to write efficient, maintainable code.

  • Work closely with experienced professionals, receive mentorship, and build a strong foundation for your future career.

Title: Senior Quantitative Analyst
Description:
Join a world of energy as MFT Energy's new Senior Quantitative Analyst

In MFT Energy we trade energy to make markets efficient and to facilitate the green transition. We are looking for a Senior Quantitative Analyst to join our ambitious Intraday team with experienced colleagues, who strive to be the best every day.




The job of a Senior Quantitative Analyst

As our new Senior Quantitative Analyst, you will become part of a professional and dedicated algorithmic trading team. Our team contributes to developing autonomous trading strategies in the European intraday power market using cutting-edge technologies and trading methodologies.

The team consists of a highly diverse set of individuals, all with a common passion for data-driven trading, and with a goal to create the most sophisticated setup in the industry.

Your work areas will be within programming new trading strategies as well as supporting the improvement of our current trading setup. You will be reporting to our Head of Algorithmic Trading, Daniel Vibe.




Your key responsibilities

Research new market opportunities
Develop new trading strategies using machine learning and market knowledge
Contribute to existing trade signal and execution frameworks
Benchmark and evaluate external forecast providers
Optimize our active trade execution algorithms
Acquire and maintain data from external sources




Your qualifications and personal skills

Have experience from a trading desk - preferably within European Intraday Power
Industry experience with machine learning and/or statistical modeling
Skilled in Python and can write production-grade code
Excellent communication skills and a proactive approach
Strong analytical skills and an eye for detail
Have a curious mind and the courage to take on a steep learning curve
The ability to work independently and structure your workload
A positive and competitive attitude, but at the same time a valued team player
Fluent in English, both spoken and written, as our company language is English




Working in MFT Energy

You will be part of a young, global, and vibrant working environment in the heart of Aarhus. MFT Energy is a transparent and flat organization with entrepreneurship at heart. We have 163 employees working out of our headquarters in Scandinavian Center in Aarhus C and from our international offices in Turkey, Australia, USA, and Singapore as well as several remote colleagues working from all over the world. Our mission is to empower entrepreneurs to become the best â€“ we believe that this is done via a fair organizational structure, with the most competent people, based on the right values.




We offer:

A competitive and entrepreneurial work environment
Professional and committed colleagues with great ambitions
Great employee benefits and a people-centered leadership approach
The chance to one day have ownership within the company
A celebrative work environment, a modern workplace, and an entrepreneurial, professional culture.




Make the most of your talent! Join us!

If you think there is a fit between our values and your aspirations, we will be looking forward to receiving your application with your CV and likely also your diplomas. For questions, please contact career@mft-energy.com.




Start date: As soon as possible.




We will be screening candidates on an ongoing basis.

Show more
HTML:
Join a world of energy as MFT Energy's new Senior Quantitative Analyst

In MFT Energy we trade energy to make markets efficient and to facilitate the green transition. We are looking for a Senior Quantitative Analyst to join our ambitious Intraday team with experienced colleagues, who strive to be the best every day.


The job of a Senior Quantitative Analyst

As our new Senior Quantitative Analyst, you will become part of a professional and dedicated algorithmic trading team. Our team contributes to developing autonomous trading strategies in the European intraday power market using cutting-edge technologies and trading methodologies.

The team consists of a highly diverse set of individuals, all with a common passion for data-driven trading, and with a goal to create the most sophisticated setup in the industry.

Your work areas will be within programming new trading strategies as well as supporting the improvement of our current trading setup. You will be reporting to our Head of Algorithmic Trading, Daniel Vibe.


Your key responsibilities

  • Research new market opportunities
  • Develop new trading strategies using machine learning and market knowledge
  • Contribute to existing trade signal and execution frameworks
  • Benchmark and evaluate external forecast providers
  • Optimize our active trade execution algorithms
  • Acquire and maintain data from external sources


Your qualifications and personal skills

  • Have experience from a trading desk - preferably within European Intraday Power
  • Industry experience with machine learning and/or statistical modeling
  • Skilled in Python and can write production-grade code
  • Excellent communication skills and a proactive approach
  • Strong analytical skills and an eye for detail
  • Have a curious mind and the courage to take on a steep learning curve
  • The ability to work independently and structure your workload
  • A positive and competitive attitude, but at the same time a valued team player
  • Fluent in English, both spoken and written, as our company language is English


Working in MFT Energy

You will be part of a young, global, and vibrant working environment in the heart of Aarhus. MFT Energy is a transparent and flat organization with entrepreneurship at heart. We have 163 employees working out of our headquarters in Scandinavian Center in Aarhus C and from our international offices in Turkey, Australia, USA, and Singapore as well as several remote colleagues working from all over the world. Our mission is to empower entrepreneurs to become the best â€“ we believe that this is done via a fair organizational structure, with the most competent people, based on the right values.


We offer:

  • A competitive and entrepreneurial work environment
  • Professional and committed colleagues with great ambitions
  • Great employee benefits and a people-centered leadership approach
  • The chance to one day have ownership within the company
  • A celebrative work environment, a modern workplace, and an entrepreneurial, professional culture.


Make the most of your talent! Join us!

If you think there is a fit between our values and your aspirations, we will be looking forward to receiving your application with your CV and likely also your diplomas. For questions, please contact career@mft-energy.com.


Start date: As soon as possible.


We will be screening candidates on an ongoing basis.

Title: Senior IT Support Analyst
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
IT Technical Support â€“ Join Marsh - the world's leading risk advisory and insurance brokerage firm

With over 45,000 employees across 130 countries, we empower Denmark's largest companies to navigate risks and seize business opportunities through our unrivaled expertise in risk management and insurance consulting. We are app. 150 colleagues in Denmark, eager to welcome you to our great organization.

As Senior IT Support Analyst you are on-site support to all our great colleagues and based in our modern facilities in Nordhavn. You will report to the Manager of the IT Support Team located in Sweden.

Please ensure that when applying, your CV & application is in English.

What you can expect:

Cutting-edge Technology: Work with a wide range of systems and applications, including Microsoft 365, ServiceNow, MoveWorks, Nexthink, Zoom and other Cloud based Technologies to support our local, Nordic, and global operations.

Collaborative Environment: Join forces with our Nordic teams to provide exceptional IT support to our local users in Denmark, ensuring smooth operations and seamless user experiences.

Diverse Responsibilities: From provisioning and maintaining workstations to managing mobile phones, you'll have a diverse range of tasks that keep you engaged and challenged.

Technical Excellence: Participate in technical operations and troubleshooting, leveraging your broad IT knowledge and familiarity with ITIL processes to deliver top-notch solutions.

Service-Oriented Mindset: As a customer-centric professional, you'll excel in communicating with users, providing timely assistance, and maintaining a calm and focused approach even in high-pressure situations.

What you will be rewarded with:


Collaborative and inclusive work environment that values diversity and innovation
Continuous learning and development opportunities to improve your skills and advance your career.
Competitive compensation and pension scheme
Global network of professionals providing opportunities for growth and mobility


We will rely on you to:


On-site support to our local colleagues in Denmark, primarily in Nordhavn but also our Aarhus office
On- and off boarding of colleagues
Prepare / maintain PC workstations.
Administer and prepare mobile devices.
Maintenance and operation of copy/print, local backup, and other operating systems
Participate in technical operational tasks, including troubleshooting.
Work with our Service Desk and asset management systems.
Carry out any other ad-hoc tasks as and when required.


What you need to have:


Speaks and understands English at a high level and can communicate in the Nordic languages
A minimum of 5 yearsâ€™ experience in a similar role in an international organisation
Solid knowledge of software and hardware
Knowledge of Microsoft 365 and Microsoft environment in general
Knowledge of standard operating systems such as Windows 10
Knowledge of ITIL processes
Knowledge of Copiers, printers, and AV equipment
Knowledge of ServiceNow is a plus.
Solid interpersonal skills and service mindset
Pragmatic, robust and solution orientated personality


What makes you stand out:


Experience with Support/Ticket systems and asset management.


Marsh is the worldâ€™s leading insurance broker and risk advisor. With more than 45,000 colleagues advising clients in over 130 countries, Marsh serves commercial and individual clients with data-driven risk solutions and advisory services. Marsh is a business of Marsh McLennan (NYSE: MMC), the worldâ€™s leading professional services firm in the areas of risk, strategy and people. With annual revenue of $23 billion, Marsh McLennan helps clients navigate an increasingly dynamic and complex environment through four market-leading businesses: Marsh, Guy Carpenter, Mercer and Oliver Wyman. For more information, visit marsh.com, and follow us on LinkedIn and X.

Title: Insights Specialist
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Why do we need you?

As our Insight Specialist, you'll play a pivotal role in our journey towards becoming a truly customer-centric company. Your expertise will drive our marketing strategies through thorough research and insightful analysis.

Your new team

Join our dynamic product marketing team, where your ideas and initiatives are appreciated, and you will receive trust and responsibility from your manager. The team comprises 11 highly skilled colleagues with diverse backgrounds, incl. a fellow Insight Specialist. Additionally, you'll be integrated into a broader Milestone group of research and insights specialists who share your passion.

Key Responsibilities

Research and analytics
Design and conduct qualitative and quantitative customer research projects, leveraging surveys, interviews, online feedback analysis, and 3. party data.Â 
Data retrieval and analysis from 1st party data.Â 
Analyze and synthesize data to extract actionable insights to inform decision-making across the Product Marketing team and broader Milestone.Â 

Project management
Assist in managing research projects, ensuring timely delivery within scope, and effectively communicating findings to relevant stakeholders.Â 

Upskilling and customer advocacy
Act as a subject matter expert and customer advocate within the organization.
Collaborate closely with colleagues and assist with insights projects.

To succeed in this role, we imagine you have:
Proven experience in customer insights, market research, or related roles.Â 
An analytical mindset with the ability to interpret large datasets.Â 
Quantitative skills incl. questionnaire building and analytics.Â 
Qualitative skills incl. planning and execution of interviews and observations.Â 
A commercial mindset and the ability to put insight into a commercial context.Â 
Excellent communication skills, translating complex data into clear, actionable recommendations and insights.Â 
Excellent organizational and project management skills and experience leading projects to completion.Â 
Proficiency in English, both written and verbal. Â 
Experience in the tech industry, particularly with SaaS or cloud-based products, is an advantage.


At a personal level, you are enthusiastic, thorough, and inclusive in your behavior and ways of working. You have a positive attitude, are self-motivated, and can work on several projects simultaneously.

We encourage you to apply.

Even if you donâ€™t match all the above-mentioned skills, we will gladly receive your application if you think you have transferrable skills. We highly value a mindset, motivation, and energy that aligns with our core values to ensure success for you, your team, and the wider Milestone organization.

Interested?

If this sounds like a good next step in your career, apply as soon as possible as applications will be reviewed on a continuous basis, but no later than August 4th. Â 

How to apply?

You will experience an inclusive and unbiased recruitment process where all employment decisions are based on qualifications rather than race, color, ethnicity, gender identity, age, sexual orientation, and religion. We advise you not to attach a cover letter to your application but instead, we encourage you to write a few lines about why you are applying for the position in your resume/CV. Additionally we recommend you notÂ to add a photo in your resume/CV.

Please note that the position is on-site at our headquarters in BrÃ¸ndby, Denmark, and requires that you hold a valid Danish work visa.

Title: Manager, People Analytics
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
At Genmab, weâ€™re committed to building extra[not]ordinary futures together, by developing antibody products and pioneering, knock-your-socks-off therapies that change the lives of patients and the future of cancer treatment and serious diseases. From our people who are caring, candid, and impact-driven to our business, which is innovative and rooted in science, we believe that being proudly unique, determined to be our best, and authentic is essential to fulfilling our purpose.

Join Our Team as a Workday Reporting Manager!

We are excited to invite applications for the position of Workday Reporting Manager to become a vital part of our People Analytics team within Global HR Operations.

About the Role:

As a Workday Reporting Manager, you will support ongoing business-as-usual reporting requirements and assist with internal Workday-related projects, including testing and documentation. You will collaborate closely with the HR Data Manager and external AMS consultants to enhance our reporting strategy, suggest improvements, and build new reports and dashboards as needed. Beyond Workday analytics, you will work with BI tools and serve as a business analyst, bridging the gap between stakeholders and consultants.

Key Responsibilities:

Your primary responsibilities will include:


Overseeing the end-to-end request process for new reports and modifications to existing ones, including requirement gathering, prioritization, testing, and delivery.
Managing AMS Consultants, ensuring regular progress check-ins and providing business context while challenging technical solutions when necessary.
Developing and maintaining reporting across all Workday modules, such as Human Capital Management (HCM), Recruitment, Payroll, Time, and Absence.
Maintaining the global reporting catalog, ensuring a comprehensive understanding of available reports and user access.
Creating and utilizing all necessary Workday calculated field functions.


Additional duties include managing complex projects from start to finish, collaborating with the HR Data Manager to promote data governance and enhance data quality and insights, and providing HR Reporting and Analytics to key stakeholders, including HR Business teams, Talent, Reward, Payroll, and Finance. You will develop a suite of monthly HR reports and metrics, build reporting dashboards, and respond to ad-hoc HR reporting requests.

Requirements:


Bachelorâ€™s degree with 5+ years of HR/HR Systems experience.
At least 3+ years of proven experience in HRIS reporting/Workday, working with advanced, matrix, and composite reports.
Strong understanding of the Workday security model, with the ability to navigate complex intersection-based security setups for reporting solutions.
Experience with Workday Prism or Adaptive Insights is desirable.
Experience within an HR discipline is desirable but not essential.
Proficiency with data visualization tools such as Power BI or similar.
Ability to work with both structured and unstructured data.
Strong stakeholder management, influencing, and organizational skills.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Self-motivated, with the ability to plan and deliver work independently.
Strong project tracking skills, including involvement in enhancements and upgrades.
Ability to maintain confidentiality, discretion, and attention to detail.


Important Note:

A Workday Certificate is a mandatory requirement for this role.

If you are passionate about delivering reliable and accurate information through innovative HR reporting solutions and have the skills and experience, we're looking for, we would love to hear from you. Apply now to be a part of our dynamic team!

About You


You are passionate about our purpose and genuinely care about our mission to transform the lives of patients through innovative cancer treatment
You bring rigor and excellence to all that you do. You are a fierce believer in our rooted-in-science approach to problem-solving
You are a generous collaborator who can work in teams with diverse backgrounds
You are determined to do and be your best and take pride in enabling the best work of others on the team
You are not afraid to grapple with the unknown and be innovative
You have experience working in a fast-growing, dynamic company (or a strong desire to)
You work hard and are not afraid to have a little fun while you do so


Locations

Genmab leverages the effectiveness of an agile working environment, when possible, for the betterment of employee work-life balance. Our offices are designed as open, community-based spaces that work to connect employees while being immersed in our state-of-the-art laboratories. Whether youâ€™re in one of our collaboratively designed office spaces or working remotely, we thrive on connecting with each other to innovate.

About Genmab

Genmab is an international biotechnology company with a core purpose guiding its unstoppable team to strive towards improving the lives of patients through innovative and differentiated antibody therapeutics. For more than 20 years, its passionate, innovative and collaborative team has invented next-generation antibody technology platforms and leveraged translational research and data sciences, which has resulted in a proprietary pipeline including bispecific T-cell engagers, next-generation immune checkpoint modulators, effector function enhanced antibodies and antibody-drug conjugates. To help develop and deliver novel antibody therapies to patients, Genmab has formed 20+ strategic partnerships with biotechnology and pharmaceutical companies. By 2030, Genmabâ€™s vision is to transform the lives of people with cancer and other serious diseases with Knock-Your-Socks-Off (KYSOâ„¢) antibody medicines.

Established in 1999, Genmab is headquartered in Copenhagen, Denmark with locations in Utrecht, the Netherlands, Princeton, New Jersey, U.S. and Tokyo, Japan.

Our commitment to diversity, equity, and inclusion

We are committed to fostering workplace diversity at all levels of the company and we believe it is essential for our continued success. No applicant shall be discriminated against or treated unfairly because of their race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy, gender identity, and sexual orientation), national origin, age, disability, or genetic information. Learn more about our commitments on our website.

Genmab is committed to protecting your personal data and privacy. Please see our privacy policy for handling your data in connection with your application on our website https://www.genmab.com/privacy.

Please note that if you are applying for a position in the Netherlands, Genmabâ€™s policy for all permanently budgeted hires in NL is initially to offer a fixed-term employment contract for a year, if the employee performs well and if the business conditions do not change, renewal for an indefinite term may be considered after the fixed-term employment contract.

Title: Senior Data Engineer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
My client is looking for a hands-on Senior Data Engineer with years of experience building and supporting large, cloud-first platforms. My is client based in Denmark, they are the leading provider of omnichannel payment and commerce solutions to global clients.




This role requires an amalgam of several different cutting-edge data skills. Primarily this is a high-performing data engineering role, focused on building out a robust, scalable data engineering platform. The ideal candidate has the background and foresight to architect this solution and create it. While the skills and detail to architect the solution are critical, the job will primarily involve building it out; coding the solution.




You will be part of a growing team that is developing an entirely new platform from the ground up. This will involve creating a data enablement platform. You will develop a data platform that will enable others with little technical expertise to easily generate their own reports and dashboards.

You will be a key member deciding what technologies they should adopt within the data team. The team is dynamic and will adopt and deprecate solutions as appropriate.




Please note this is a hybrid role but they are ideally looking for someone based either in Copenhagen, Denmark, or Sofia, Bulgaria.

Title: Graduate - Data Analyst
Description:
Are you eager to get into the emerging world of Data and work with the latest technologies? Do you have great attention to detail and strong analytical skills? How would you like to work for Leasing Company of the Year?

If your answer is 'yes' to all of these, keep reading.

Key Dates


Application open date - 5th June 2024
Application close date - 21st July 2024
Assessment centre date - 8th October 2024
Interviews - 17th and 18th October 2024
Start date - 18th November 2024
Length of programme - 2 years


Want to know a little about us?

At Novuna Vehicle Solutions, we're passionate about building a better tomorrow. Which is why we're lighting the way in the electric vehicle revolution. From family cars to HGVs, we're helping customers of all kinds on their journey to carbon-free mobility.

We're proud to be a Top 50 Inclusive employer. We're a signatory of the Women in Finance and the Race at Work Charter and we're DisabilityConfidentCommitted.

What does the role involve?

As a Data Analyst Graduate, you will be joining the Risk team within our Vehicle Solutions business unit. During the two-year programme, you will play an active part in working on cutting-edge projects, analysing data to uncover insights and trends, supporting with data-driven decision making across Vehicle Solutions. You'll get the chance to spend time in several key business areas, including Data Modelling, Data Quality, Data Visualisation and Data Stewards, so you'll certainly have plenty of opportunities to develop yourself as a professional, and potential leader.

Our office is based in Newbury but we're passionate about hybrid working,attendance at the Newbury office is a minimum of 2 days per week. On occasions, you may be required to travel to our Trowbridge office based on business requirements.

Some Of Your Key Duties Will Include


Design and implement analytics and build Power BI dashboards and visualisations for business functions
Model, reshape and prepare data using SQL and Power BI to optimise dashboard performance
Create reports to communicate your findings to stakeholders, providing insights that support business strategies and decision-making
Working with the wider VS Data Team, contributing to data modelling and report & visualisation requirements, testing and analysis activities


In addition to your role above, as part of the Novuna Graduate Programme you will have the opportunity to:


Graduate from our industry accredited Aspiring Leaders programme
Play an active role within our Corporate Communities, helping to drive engagement, inclusion and belonging
Access trained mentors who can help develop your technical skills
Meet regularly as a cohort with our CEO, and have contact with other Executive Committee and Senior Leaders in the business


Beyond this, you'll continue to grow your career at Novuna through development conversations with your people leader.

What are we looking for?

You'll have recently graduated and achieved a 2:2 or above in your chosen degree.

In an ever-evolving environment you will flourish by using your talent for spotting opportunities to make things better. You'll have the ability to navigate relationships using your interpersonal skills, think creatively, be adaptable and last but certainly not least, have a passion for learning.

We're Also Looking For a Graduate Who Can


Work with and collaborate with others
Plan their own day and prioritise work
Adapt to change quickly and positively
Think differently and outside the box


What can we offer you?

At Novuna we take our people promise seriously. If you join us, you'll have a chance to make a difference, opportunities to learn, and time to shine.

Our Offer To You Includes


Starting salary of Â£30,000, increasing to Â£32,000 in Year 2
Up to 15% bonus, linked to company and individual performance
Flexible hybrid working
25 days' holiday, plus bank holidays and the option to buy/sell 5 days
Full wellbeing package including BUPA, digital GP service, 24/7 employee assistance, plus wellbeing events throughout the year
Up to 10% contributory pension
Flexible benefits options such as cycle to work, discounted personal finance and insurance


Want to know what it's like to be on a Novuna Graduate Programme? See what some of our graduates have to say - Graduate | Launch Your Career with Novuna's Graduate Opportunities

What's the next step?

Interested? Start your application today and see what Novuna can offer you.

Novuna has been named one of the top 50 most inclusive employers for the fourth year running and this is also reflected in our recruitment process. We are committed to ensuring our application process is inclusive and accessible to all candidates.

We're DisabilityConfidentCommitted, so if you're a person with a disability, if you're neurodivergent, or if you have a condition that you believe may affect your performance during our selection process, we'll be happy to make reasonable adjustments to our processes for you.

Want to know a little about us?

At Novuna Vehicle Solutions, we're passionate about building a better tomorrow. Which is why we're lighting the way in the electric vehicle revolution. From family cars to HGVs, we're helping customers of all kinds on their journey to carbon-free mobility.

We're proud to be a Top 50 Inclusive employer. We're a signatory of the Women in Finance and the Race at Work Charter and we're DisabilityConfidentCommitted.

What does the role involve?

As a Data Analyst Graduate, you will be joining the Risk team within our Vehicle Solutions business unit. During the two-year programme, you will play an active part in working on cutting-edge projects, analysing data to uncover insights and trends, supporting with data-driven decision making across Vehicle Solutions. You'll get the chance to spend time in several key business areas, including Data Modelling, Data Quality, Data Visualisation and Data Stewards, so you'll certainly have plenty of opportunities to develop yourself as a professional, and potential leader.

Our office is based in Newbury but we're passionate about hybrid working,attendance at the Newbury office is a minimum of 2 days per week. On occasions, you may be required to travel to our Trowbridge office based on business requirements.

Some Of Your Key Duties Will Include

  • Design and implement analytics and build Power BI dashboards and visualisations for business functions
  • Model, reshape and prepare data using SQL and Power BI to optimise dashboard performance
  • Create reports to communicate your findings to stakeholders, providing insights that support business strategies and decision-making
  • Working with the wider VS Data Team, contributing to data modelling and report & visualisation requirements, testing and analysis activities

In addition to your role above, as part of the Novuna Graduate Programme you will have the opportunity to:

  • Graduate from our industry accredited Aspiring Leaders programme
  • Play an active role within our Corporate Communities, helping to drive engagement, inclusion and belonging
  • Access trained mentors who can help develop your technical skills
  • Meet regularly as a cohort with our CEO, and have contact with other Executive Committee and Senior Leaders in the business

Beyond this, you'll continue to grow your career at Novuna through development conversations with your people leader.

What are we looking for?

You'll have recently graduated and achieved a 2:2 or above in your chosen degree.

In an ever-evolving environment you will flourish by using your talent for spotting opportunities to make things better. You'll have the ability to navigate relationships using your interpersonal skills, think creatively, be adaptable and last but certainly not least, have a passion for learning.

We're Also Looking For a Graduate Who Can

  • Work with and collaborate with others
  • Plan their own day and prioritise work
  • Adapt to change quickly and positively
  • Think differently and outside the box

What can we offer you?

At Novuna we take our people promise seriously. If you join us, you'll have a chance to make a difference, opportunities to learn, and time to shine.

Our Offer To You Includes

  • Starting salary of Â£30,000, increasing to Â£32,000 in Year 2
  • Up to 15% bonus, linked to company and individual performance
  • Flexible hybrid working
  • 25 days' holiday, plus bank holidays and the option to buy/sell 5 days
  • Full wellbeing package including BUPA, digital GP service, 24/7 employee assistance, plus wellbeing events throughout the year
  • Up to 10% contributory pension
  • Flexible benefits options such as cycle to work, discounted personal finance and insurance

Want to know what it's like to be on a Novuna Graduate Programme? See what some of our graduates have to say - Graduate | Launch Your Career with Novuna's Graduate Opportunities

What's the next step?

Interested? Start your application today and see what Novuna can offer you.

Novuna has been named one of the top 50 most inclusive employers for the fourth year running and this is also reflected in our recruitment process. We are committed to ensuring our application process is inclusive and accessible to all candidates.

We're DisabilityConfidentCommitted, so if you're a person with a disability, if you're neurodivergent, or if you have a condition that you believe may affect your performance during our selection process, we'll be happy to make reasonable adjustments to our processes for you.

Title: Customer Data Analyst
Description:
Are you looking for a new challenge that gives you the chance to use your knowledge and passion for Data Analysis to take Customer Insights at Selfridges to the next level? Looking for a company that wants to help further your career as well as provide you with an exciting, inspiring, and fun place to work?

If the answer to all of these questions is â€˜yesâ€™ then youâ€™re just the kind of person weâ€™re looking for!

Selfridges has a brilliant opportunity within the Customer Analytics Team, reporting to the Senior Customer Analytics Manager. As a Customer Data Analyst, you will have the exciting and rare chance to work in a fast-paced environment, to help us take our business to the next level

THE ROLE

As a Customer Analyst, some of your main responsibilities will be:

Provide weekly and monthly reports on key customer KPIs understand the drivers of their performance
Providing actionable insights of the back of analysis completed on customer and transactional data, using SQL.
Work with fellow analysts to create accessible, relevant, and actionable reports and Power BI dashboards, using multiple sources of data.
Own projects end-to-end and manage the process.
Champion a culture of self service by ensuring your stakeholders are suitably skilled in how to use our analytics tools.

YOUR SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE

SQL knowledges and experience building Power BI or Salesforce Einstein Analytics dashboards â€“ Already experience using Power BI is a bonus
Proven experience dealing with large, complex datasets of different varieties (e.g. digital data, transactional data, marketing data) and evidence of being able to transform data into actionable insights
Strong Excel skills, including pivot tables and aggregation of data
Time management skills: Ability to meet deadlines while dealing with multiple priorities.
Passionate about the customer - you are passionate about improving the customer experience through delivering actionable insight
Impeccable attention to detail
A passion for solving new problems, learning new skills and furthering your understanding along the way.

Title: Data Analyst, Product Analytics
Description:
Bumble Inc. is seeking a skilled Product Analyst to collaborate with senior business stakeholders and product managers in providing data-driven insights across all stages of the product development lifecycle. This role will focus on experimentation, statistical analysis, data modelling and visualisation, as well as in-depth product analyses. This is a unique opportunity for an experienced analyst who enjoys a fast-paced environment and has a passion for contributing to helping the Bumble Inc. mission to foster kind connections.

Key Accountabilities


Be an analytical thought partner to a cross-functional team of engineers, designers and product managers. This will include providing analytical support across all areas of the product development lifecycle, from ideation and broad product strategy to analytics deep dives and experimentation.
You will lead experimentation across an area of the product. You will design and execute multi-step experiments to understand the impact of a feature or product change on user behaviour and business KPIs. You will interpret experiment results and translate them into actionable recommendations for a non-technical audience.
You will own event tracking for one area of the app, understanding which events are critical to track user behaviour.
You will create self-serve dashboards to ensure stakeholders have access to real-time insights.
You will provide actionable insights on product strategy and recommendations to your stakeholders, automating decision-making where applicable and providing tools and solutions that help enable self-service and scalability.
You will develop deep knowledge of the product domain, becoming an authority on its characteristics, drivers, and subsystems.
You will contribute to data quality related to the domain, proactively working with Data and Analytics Eng. and other teams to improve data collection and modelling.
You will create an environment of utilising data for planning and execution, always keeping in mind alternative and creative solutions to performance measurement across a variety of product initiatives.


Required Experience & Skills


Preference for a graduate degree in Mathematics, Engineering, Information Sciences, Economics, Finance, or STEM. PhD and Masters welcome.
You will have experience using SQL and python to solve data science, statistical and analytics problems.
I prefer experience working in similar dating, social, or gaming tech product industries or in financial services or high-data-volume industries.
You have experience working in a highly collaborative cross functional space and translating technical insights for a non-technical audience.
You have experience setting up experimentation, statistical measurement, and data collection in the product domain.
Strong experience creating data visualisations and self serve tools for a product forced audience.
You keep an eye out on the industry, understanding how the wider dating industry influences our product strategy.
You have experience working with complex data infrastructures and have experience partnering and guiding the work of data engineering to help facilitate ingestion, warehousing, and optimisation of databases.
3+ years experience in product analytics analytics, being able to elaborate on the business impact you have driven in your previous experience.


About You


Strong believer in Bumble Inc.â€™s brand vision and values
Engaging, inspiring and clear communicator. A proven track record of socialising and embedding analytical findings to drive business outcomes.
Understands and can demonstrate a data science skillset and use advanced analytical tools and visualisations to produce impact in an organisation.
Deep commercial understanding and a proven ability to create impact through the power of customer-led insights.
Comfort in operating in ambiguous and complex problem spaces, and helping cross functional teams to define the questions that help support product development.
A love of collaborating with colleagues and stakeholders to arrive at rounded and balanced perspectives in your work, a strong desire to learn from others
Commercially minded, with a keen sense of where insights can fuel growth.
Strong experience with python/SQL, visualisation tooling such as Looker/Tableau, and machine learning/data science tooling such as Streamlit/Count/Kubeflow.
Strong governance and data quality mindset.
