Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
Role - Junior Data Analyst

Location - London

Salary - Â£30k-Â£45k (DOE)




Join a revolutionary Financial services company based in the heart of London. Helping over 200,000 business across the UK and Europe overcome challenging events and increase profits.




They are looking for a Junior Data Analyst who is passionate about finance and leveraging data to drive business decisions. You will play a crucial role in analysing financial data sets, generating actionable insights, and supporting business operations through data-driven analysis.




Responsibilities:

Analyse raw financial data: assess quality, cleanse, and structure for downstream processing.
Generate accurate and insightful reports to support financial forecasting and market analysis.
Collaborate closely with the finance team to support analytical projects and business initiatives.
Provide actionable insights for business improvements based on data analysis.
Build interactive dashboards for senior stakeholders and clients to provide actionable insights.




Qualifications:

Bachelor's degree in a STEM field (Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering, Finance, etc.).
Basic understanding of data analysis techniques, statistical methods, and data visualisation.
Proficiency in a programming language (Python, SQL) for data analysis and reporting tasks.
Familiarity with data visualisation tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI) for handling and visualising financial datasets.




Additional Skills (Preferred):

Experience working with financial data or related domains.
Knowledge of financial market dynamics and trends.
Strong collaboration skills and ability to work in a fast-paced, agile environment.
Passion for learning and staying updated with the latest advancements in data analysis and finance technology.




Benefits:

Competitive salary package.
Annual Bonus
Opportunity to work in a dynamic and innovative finance environment.
Access to cutting-edge technologies and tools for data analysis.
Career development and growth opportunities within the company.




We would love to hear from you if you are a motivated Junior Data Analyst with a passion for finance and data-driven decision-making. Apply now to join our team and help shape the finance industry's future.

Title: Data Analyst (SQL/Tableau/Power BI)
Description:
Data Analyst (SQL/Tableau/Power BI)




Mobysoft is one of the fastest growing SaaS providers in the UK and has been shortlisted in the "Top 50 fastest growing technology companies in the North" for four successive years. Mobysoft provides predictive analytical software that has helped our customers deliver tens of millions of pounds in savings. Such is our success; customer numbers have doubled in little over two years and as a result weâ€™re looking for great people to join our exciting team.




We have also just won AI Project of the year at the Real I.T Awards- one of the many awards we are proud of !




Role overview




Data Analytics plays a key part in this mission, working to bring together, explore and make sense of disparate data sources, which combine to create compelling stories for our clients such as developing trends and next best actions.

This function will serve as:

1. A bridge between data engineering and data science, helping us to explore and develop initial hypothesis for new data products and services, including appraisals of new data sources.

2. As a data translator and narrative generator, working alongside our business intelligence (BI) specialists to shape and deliver compelling, data-driven insights through reports, presentations, visualisations and dashboards.

As such we are looking for a stellar Data Analyst (DA) professional to join our dynamic team, working with our most excellent data engineers, data scientists and our superb senior data analyst Verity.â€ SQL, Tableau and Power BI are required for this position.




What will you be doing?

We're convinced that the data analyst role is key to a high functioning data & insights team, playing a part in many aspects of our work, here are some of the key areas we will looking for this role to progress:




Data discovery. Evaluating new data sources and how they can enhance current/support new product propositions through appropriately designed experiments.

Data trust. Providing analytics on the reliability of existing data and in collaboration with our data engineers helping to productionise on going monitoring with benchmarks.

Feature generation. Working with our data science team to explore and develop new/improved data features.

Measuring success. Researching and developing appropriate measures of product efficacy and return on investment (ROI) in collaboration with our sector experts.

Strategic Analytics. Identifying our clients' and business' analytical needs, organising these into clear, actionable plans, and ensuring their effective execution.

Insight Navigation. Liaising with our clients (directly or through events, conferences, webinars etc.), to help support their data driven journeys, finding the most compelling, clean and clear approach to effectively communicating their data insights story.

Emerging technologies. Researching augmented analytics and related artificial intelligence (AI) approaches to enhance our output - helping to implement solutions where practical.

Evolving standards. Working with the full data & insights team to further enhance our systems of work.




â€œPlease note this is a professional, technical role, with no line management responsibilities. There will however be multiple opportunities to lead data engineering workstreams.â€




Why should you consider this role?

Alongside the work opportunities as described your development will be supported, you will be sensibly renumerated, we will provide a compelling benefits package and we are a great bunch of folks to work with - though we would say that!




What qualifications and experience are we after?

Honours degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Physics or similar quantitative discipline where data analytics plays a key role- ideally a(2:1+) honours degree
Ideally 4+ years of serious commercial experience working in a data analytics role.




What technical skills are required?

wrangling mastery- having the data shaping skills needed to deliver analysis across relational and non-relational data structures, working with structured, semi-structured and unstructured formats.
proficiency- very comfortable employing statistical techniques to solve commercial problems, including, hypothesis testing, feature transformations, dimensionality reduction, correlation analysis, regression analysis (multiple linear and logistic), time series analysis and Bayesian methods.
skills - adept in Python and its core data/analytics libraries (including in relation to working with Amazon Dynamo DB), alongside SQL, HiveQL, Scala. You will also have good familiarity with Git for version control and project management, alongside some knowledge of Linux/Shell.
data platform familiarity - previous experience of working with both Apache Spark and MapReduce data processing and analytics frameworks.
and reporting expertise - experience with Tableau, Power BI, Excel alongside notebooks for experiment documentation.

What experience and technical skills are desirable?

within AWS.
knowledge of VBA for efficient Excel work.
of graph analytics.




What else are we looking for?

to work effectively both as an individual (e.g., during remote deep work) and within a team - supportive, collaborative.
keen interest in data analytics - bringing to the team, new approaches, best practice developments, and analytical methods from other walks of life.
critical thinker and a problem solver.
proactive, detail focused, person who is curious and seeks continuous improvement both in our systems and their skills.
written and verbal communication, including effective communication with non-technical audiences.
individual who takes a keen interest in productivity, working to optimise their own output as part of a team that values this highly.




Benefits

Competitive salary and rewards package including: - Private Health care , 4 x salary Life cover, 25 days annual leave, increasing to 28 after 3 years service ,salary sacrifice pension scheme and much more ..




Inclusion

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, sex, gender, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process-please contact us to request accommodation. We offer hybrid roles, so weâ€™re happy to discuss flexible working!




If you are interested and would like to know more then please apply to simone.ryan@mobysoft.com ASAP . Thank you much

Competitive salary and rewards package including: - Private Health care , 4 x salary Life cover, 25 days annual leave, increasing to 28 after 3 years service ,salary sacrifice pension scheme and much more ..

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst: Â£30k-Â£60k â€“ London (Hybrid/Remote)




My client a leading financial service organisation are looking to build out their teams capabilities through the acquisition of a new Data Analyst. The ideal candidate will be responsible for gathering, processing, and analysing data to help drive informed business decisions. If you are passionate about data, possess strong analytical skills, and enjoy problem-solving, we want to hear from you!




This role will be operating in a standalone capacity and will see you liaising with C Level business stakeholders whilst relaying and explaining technical information to non-technical business teams. This role will also have a lot of scope for personal development with the successful candidate hopefully working their way up in seniority within the team.




This role will be based remotely, although travel into the London office would be required once per month.




All candidates must have the full right to work in the UK!




Responsibilities:

Collect and analyse data from various sources to support business objectives.
Develop and maintain databases, data systems, and data analytics tools.
Perform detailed data analysis and create reports to identify trends and insights.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand their data needs and deliver actionable insights.
Ensure data integrity and accuracy through regular data audits and validation.
Present findings and recommendations to stakeholders in a clear and concise manner




Requirements:

Experience in a Data Analytic role (preferably in financial services)
Advanced Excel skills
Power BI
Python (Desirable)
Experience presenting data and excellent communication skills
Knowledge, experience, or interest in AI capabilities




Benefits:

Competitive bonus scheme




If the above role is of interest and youâ€™ve got the required experience, apply with your most up to date CV for immediate consideration and interview!




Alternatively, if you would like to find out more about the position, reach out to me on 020 3920 8833 or at ethan.chesterfield@intechnologygroup.com

  • Develop and maintain databases, data systems, and data analytics tools.
  • Perform detailed data analysis and create reports to identify trends and insights.
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand their data needs and deliver actionable insights.
  • Ensure data integrity and accuracy through regular data audits and validation.
  • Present findings and recommendations to stakeholders in a clear and concise manner


Requirements:

  • Experience in a Data Analytic role (preferably in financial services)
  • Advanced Excel skills
  • Power BI
  • Python (Desirable)
  • Experience presenting data and excellent communication skills
  • Knowledge, experience, or interest in AI capabilities


Benefits:

Competitive bonus scheme


If the above role is of interest and youâ€™ve got the required experience, apply with your most up to date CV for immediate consideration and interview!


Alternatively, if you would like to find out more about the position, reach out to me on 020 3920 8833 or at ethan.chesterfield@intechnologygroup.com

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About the Company: A great opportunity to join a highly ambitious, London-based, food & drink consultancy on a mission to support our customers with expert data insight. They are one of the leading consultancies in the food and drinks industry, and provide expert consultancy through data and insight, powered by analytical thinking, outstanding expertise, and insights technology. They work with a broad range of clients emerging brands and operators and some of the most renowned businesses.




About the Role: They are looking for a Data Analyst to join their growing data team, this is more than a standard data role. This is an opportunity to work collaboratively.




Responsibilities:




Restructure and maintain data into a database-friendly multi-table format for all our product trackers and bespoke research.
Implement systems to help the optimization of data efficiency and data quality.
Acquire data from primary or secondary data sources to enrich our internal data.
Assist in the identification, design, development, and maintenance of new and existing data tools and applications.
Troubleshooting databases and BI tools to ensure minimal client disruption.
Set up and maintenance of automated data processes.
Track KPIs of our systems and processes.




Qualifications:




Previous experience working with survey data
Working experience in Python
Strong understanding of relational databases (Microsoft SQL Server).
Advanced Excel data handling and modelling.
Analytical and problem-solving skills to spot trends, errors and highlight / rectify.
Understand the process of acquiring, cleansing, and transforming data.
Dashboard building
Web analytics and behavioural tracking (i.e., Google Analytics)




Pay range and compensation package:35k-37k

Hybrid: 2 x days in London a week

Title: Business Data Analyst
Description:
About Inigo




We enable your ambition. We insure good people â€“ knowledgably, fairly, and efficiently. We combine our expertise with the best of science, data, and analytics.




Inigo's aim is to create an underwriting focused insurance and reinsurance business, concentrating on limited classes. We want to combine the best data and analytics that exist and build our own capability to generate insights to drive business decisions. At the top of our agenda is to create a diverse and open culture where we foster talent and provide opportunities to build a rewarding career in a company that is vibrant and at the start of an exciting journey.

We have a culture that is inclusive, fun, and constantly strives for excellence, we describe it as â€˜all inâ€™. Our values are:




Get Smart â€“ we ask questions, explore, learn, and continuously strive for excellence
Park the Ego â€“ we are welcoming and open, and embrace different thinking
Share the Passion â€“ we collaborate and communicate our expertise honestly and thoughtfully
Radical Simplicity â€“ we are transparent, focused and actively avoid complexity in how we operate




Aim of the role




The aim of the role is to support the actuarial reserving team as well as the finance team. The candidate will work closely with the actuarial and finance teams to support various analytical tasks, including data collection, cleansing, and analysis. The ideal candidate will have strong analytical skills, proficiency in Alteryx and Power BI, and the ability to communicate findings effectively.




The successful candidate will do this by:




Being the data manager and extracting, treating and cleansing data in order to have accurate and complete data for the reserving and finance process
Identifying and addressing data quality issues, including correcting data errors and capturing missing business information
Automating tasks in Alteryx or Power BI
Maintaining current Alteryx and Power BI models
Identifying opportunities to streamline data processes and enhance data quality though process and model improvements
Validating and reconciling data across multiple systems and providing reports to actuaries and management
Ensuring the data tools provide appropriate, complete and accurate data
Working with IT so they are aware of changes to tools and databases that may impact corporate systems or databases
Providing data to different stakeholders (Reserving, Pricing, Capital, Finance)




In addition to the above key responsibilities, you may be required to undertake other duties from time to time as the Company may reasonably require.




To do this, weâ€™re going to need you to bring:




Experience in data analysis for Non-Life business
Experience with dealing with large amount of data
High proficiency in Alteryx and Power BI
Strong attention to detail and accuracy
Excellent communication skills
Ability to work collaboratively with a variety of individuals in a variety of functions (e.g. finance, claims, underwriting, actuarial, operations)
Ability to deliver results under tight deadlines
Good problem-solving abilities

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Role: Data Analyst

Permanent role

Location: Birmingham, Midlands

Style: Hybrid

Salary: Â£42,000-57,000

One of our leading clients is looking for ambitious Data Analyst to join their Data Team and work closely with Business Partners and Enterprise Architects and support the Data Manager to understand the business challenges and provide data and analytics solutions.




As a Data Analyst you will be responsible for:




Data Engineering â€“ assisting with the design, development and implementation of ETL
User Experience Analysis â€“ understanding the data and identifying user experience requirements and designing goals
Business Intelligence â€“ assisting in the development, production and delivery of data insights and taking part in informed decision making
Continuous Improvement - providing support to the Data Manager to make sure that data analytics processes are robust, efficient and fit for purpose. Reviewing areas for automation and data quality
Risk Management â€“ providing support to the Head of Data and Data Manager in assessing the impact of potential risks over the implementation of data analytics across the business
Compliance with IT governance




The successful candidate for this opportunity would have:




Experience with Data Operations
Knowledge and exposure to data tools and technologies
Previous experience working IT or data role
Proficiency level of scripting languages (Python, SQL) for automation
Understanding of data management and frameworks, analytics and data optimisation
Problem solving skills
Ability to work with different teams across the business







If you feel you match the above requirements, then please apply with your updated CV. Please note, due to the number of applications we may not be able to respond to all unsuccessful applicants.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Who we are:




Nimble Approach are a rapidly growing Product & Tech consultancy who deliver value and enhance organisations. We pride ourselves on delivering great projects to multiple clients in different industries including Education, Government, Betting & Gaming, Utilities, Fintech, Manufacturing, Healthcare and more, so there is lots of opportunity to try out new things!

We believe in delivering value at pace and enhancing the organisations that we work with. This would not be possible without our amazing Nimble specialists who leave their mark everywhere they go. Our projects are diverse and different, just like our ways of working and our people. One of our key focusses is maintaining a strong culture of pragmatic, skilled, egoless people who collaborate to get things done and have lots of fun along the way.




We are committed to building scalable and re-usable data solutions to enable our clients to leverage their data for mission-critical business insights, driving decisions, and delivering value. To do this we employ a wide range of tools and technologies, recognising that the fields of Data Engineering, Data Visualisation and Data Science are swiftly evolving.

We currently have offices in Sheffield (our HQ), Leeds, Manchester & Bristol, however, a lot of us work remotely. We prefer for everyone to work however is best for them â€“ all we ask is that people go into the office a few times a month and for team / client meetings when required.




About the role:

You will have a solid foundation in Data Analysis and are capable of handling a wide range of analytical tasks. You can work independently and able to conduct in-depth data analysis, develop and implement statistical models, and present actionable insights to stakeholders.




About You:




Proficient in Data Analysis and Interpretation
You have the ability to open and report and identify queries, models and data flows using the Power BI skillset.
You are experienced with Python and are able to investigate notebooks and identify data flow through code.
You are experienced in financial reporting data - understanding financial data, sales ledger, general ledger, consolidations.
You are experienced with SQL and have the ability to perform Data Reconciliations across different systems,




If you think this sounds of interest, please apply with your CV.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Role: Data Analyst

Central London

Up to Â£70k + Bonus

Permanent




HL11367




Finatal is exclusively partnered with a Global Legal & Tech Advisory business in its second Private Equity lifecycle and is going through rapid growth, having exited at 4.5X. They are on a strong buy-and-build journey and are at the beginning of their data journey. They are searching for their first data hire to work across the organisation to drive a data culture and lead data-led decision-making through optimising reporting. Reporting to the CFO you will develop critical reports across finance and other areas of the business taking ownership of rolling out Power BI to the wider organisation.




Role:

Joining the business at the beginning of their journey you will use your strong technical ability to pull data from multiple sources including NetSuite to develop detailed analysis and give visibility to the C-suite.
You will have ownership of Power BI visualisation tool, ensuring it is rolled out efficiently and seamlessly across the business.
Developing intuitive Power BI dashboards and reports, presenting back to key stakeholders across the business giving recommendations and key insights that will optimise their decision-making.
This greenfield role will require you to work with the CFO to report back on key business questions and automate key financial reports transitioning from manual reporting for the FP&A team.
In the long term you will have the opportunity to step into a strategic role.




Requirements:

Strong track record (2+ years) in a Data analytics or BI role using Power BI for reporting and creating clear and automated dashboards.
Experience working on finance data or closely with the FP&A team using NetSuite is highly beneficial.
Exceptional stakeholder management experience, having worked closely with executives previously.
Experience in a small to medium business thatâ€™s fast-growing or private equity environment is preferred.
Bachelor's or Masterâ€™s degree in a relevant field.




If you are interested in this role or know someone who would be a good fit please contact Harriet Lander at harriet.lander@finatal.com

Description:
Responsibilities

TikTok is the leading destination for short-form mobile video. Our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. TikTok has global offices including Los Angeles, New York, London, Paris, Berlin, Dubai, Singapore, Jakarta, Seoul and Tokyo.

Creation is the core of TikTok's purpose. Our platform is built to help imaginations thrive. This is doubly true of the teams that make TikTok possible.
Together, we inspire creativity and bring joy - a mission we all believe in and aim towards achieving every day.
To us, every challenge, no matter how difficult, is an opportunity; to learn, to innovate, and to grow as one team. Status quo? Never. Courage? Always.
At TikTok, we create together and grow together. That's how we drive impact - for ourselves, our company, and the communities we serve.
Join us.

The GBS Analytics team partners with an array of cross-functional departments to provide bespoke analytics solutions to their needs, both internally and externally facing. Your work will play a guiding role in shaping decision-making around advertising strategy iteration and how we communicate this with our clients.

Role Overview
- This position will have a day-to-day focus on providing analytical and strategic guidance to TikTok's Ads Business with the primary objective of enabling Sales teams to make effective and data driven decisions
- The insight and analytics produced by this role will be shared with Sales and Product leadership to shape decision making and Advertiser Marketing Strategies on TikTok
- The role will interact and work with multiple cross-functional partners including GBS, Product, Marketing Science, Research & Insights and Strategy Teams
- This is an individual contributor position with high value impact to our business.

Responsibilities
- Conduct analysis using internal and external data (e.g. Customer, Revenue, Product, Market and Industry) to derive insights that will drive business decisions
- Develop deep understanding of TikToks Ads business, analysing business and product trends (incl. regional, channel and vertical performance), synthesise and communicate insights in a comprehensible way
- Identify opportunities throughout the marketing funnel to improve Advertiser acquisition, growth and retention opportunities and present recommendations to key decision makers
- Work effectively with cross-functional teams, driving results through extracting actionable insights and building strategic partnerships with key stakeholders
- Conceptualise, build, manage and maintain tools (incl. dashboards) that GBS teams can use to extract data and insights for daily business management in an automated manner

Qualifications

Minimum Qualifications:
- Experience analysing and deriving meaning from unstructured datasets
- Experience using both qualitative analysis (e.g. Hypothesis testing) and quantitative analysis techniques (e.g. Descriptive analysis)
- Experience in database interrogation and analysis tools, such as Apache Hadoop, SQL and SAS
- Experience in Data Visualisation tools, such as Power BI or Tableau
- Demonstrated problem solving experience with experience driving and delivering action based on data-driven insights and recommendations from data analyses
- Experience with digital advertising or ads monetisation

Preferred Qualifications:
- Experience in a tech or scaling business environment
- Experience in a professional sales environment

TikTok is committed to creating an inclusive space where employees are valued for their skills, experiences, and unique perspectives. Our platform connects people from across the globe and so does our workplace. At TikTok, our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. To achieve that goal, we are committed to celebrating our diverse voices and to creating an environment that reflects the many communities we reach. We are passionate about this and hope you are too.
Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Are you and experienced Data Analyst looking to progress your career with an exciting, dynamic and growing organisation? if so, I have a great role for you.




As part of the Data Science Team, the Data Analyst will play a key role in a variety of business intelligence and analytical projects. This role is crucial in extracting true value from our data and presenting insights in a meaningful and actionable way to the business. It is a highly visible position, frequently requiring presentations to the executive team and their leadership teams.







Main Duties and Responsibilities:




Lead and execute analytics projects using a combination of open-source and cloud tools, driving innovation and delivering actionable insights.
Work as part of a larger (scrum) team when required on larger scale projects and products.
Produces a variety of reports, graphs, summaries and presentations that convey analytic results and align with business needs
Performs diagnosis on root cause of data anomalies that are uncovered through normal course of analysis
Collaborate with product managers and designers to ensure the feasibility of product extensions and new products based on existing proprietary, quant and qual datasets
Work with outputs from Research and historical data to identify consistent and inconsistent product features and document precise requirements for improved consistency, diagnostic and explanatory power
Collaborate with designers, Tech colleagues and expert users to come up with engaging ways to visualise data and insights for non-technical audiences
Design, develop and produce novel ways to present and highlight important analysis from complex data sets, including joining across datasets which do not perfectly match
Collaborate with Product, Tech, Research and other Commercial / Internal stakeholders to understand and define new, marketable product (or extensions) from existing data
Create and present progress reports and ad-hoc analysis to the key stakeholders and teams
Constantly think about and explain to stakeholders how analytics â€œproductâ€ could be refined and productionised in future
Work with Tech colleagues to improve the Data Science workspace / environment, including providing requirements for Data Lake / Data Pipeline / Data Engineering colleagues
Expanding upon the internal tools and techniques that have already been developed
Be responsible for end-to-end Data Analytics lifecycle : analysis of data, from data cleaning to extracting insights and recommending production approaches
Responsible for the process of demonstrating value-add to stakeholders
Coach, guide, and nurture talent within the data science team, and wider Analytics community, enabling growth and skill development.




Person Specification:




Bachelors, Masters or PhD degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Statistics, Maths, Physics, Operational Research or a related quant / STEM field
Comfortable to work with uncertainty and ambiguity, from initial concepts through iterations and conducting experiments to find the right products / services to launch
Excellent problem-solver & strong analytical skills
Proven aptitude to learn new tools, technologies, and methodologies
Understanding of requirements for software engineering and data governance in data science
Proven ability to lead and mentor data analysts across teams.
Evidence of taking an analytics team or department on a journey from simple to Advanced Analytics
Ability to translate complex analysis findings into a clear narrative and actionable insights
Excellent communication skills, with the ability to listen, and collaborate with non-technical and non-quant stakeholders
Work with client-facing and Tech teams to make sure that they fully understand the right data is being collected with sufficient quality and stored in an easy to analyse / reporting format
A good grounding in data ethics
Experience presenting analysis and insights to audiences from varying skill sets and backgrounds




Nice to have:




experience working with market research methods and market research datasets

experience in the professional services or legal sector

B2B market research would be a significant advantage




Skills and Experience:




Delivering significant and valuable advanced analytics projects and/or assets in industry and/or professional services
Proven experience in data analytics and business intelligence
Proficiency in writing and optimizing complex SQL queries.
Proficiency in designing and developing Power BI reports and dashboards, with advanced technical knowledge in security, and re-usability
Previous experience working with a cloud-based data platform such as Microsoft Azure
Expertise in data analysis and deriving insights from data, with the initiative to deep dive into data and present findings to stakeholders
Comfortable presenting complex ideas to executive-level and technical stakeholders

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
At Gekko, our Data and Insight team are responsible for our reporting requirements and provide market research, trend analysis and strategic insight for our brands. We are recruiting for a Junior Data Analyst to join the team.

This role is ideally suited to someone with an analytical mind who gets a buzz from turning data into actionable insights.




Your Package

Â£22,425 per annum plus company bonus
22 days paid holiday (per annum) in addition to bank holidays
Holiday purchase or sell scheme
Access to employee Assistance Programme, Perkbox, Gym Membership







Your Role

The core responsibilities of this position are:

Monitor the accuracy and integrity of incoming data by becoming the gateway between the D&I and Client Services teams
Create, edit and maintain pivot tables in various forms from database views to facilitate quality checking and reporting
Produce insightful and informative reporting decks and dashboards with clear storytelling
Create and maintain data visualisations and dashboards
Design and produce questionnaires in multiple formats to collect and unlock valuable data from our field teams
Meet agreed deadlines for all projects, working individually and as a team to complete tasks effectively
Actively research brands and categories in the industry to expand your knowledge and that of the business




Do you have what it takes?

Our Junior Data Analyst role will be ideal for you if you have:

Google Drive experience
Demonstrable data analysis skills and experience
Awareness of SQL/Data warehousing and willingness to learn
A proactive approach to delivering valuable reports, using set guidelines and your own initiative to exceed expectations
Organisational skills that enable you to prioritise and set realistic timescales with stakeholders




Gekko, a leading field marketing and experiential agency, we value trust, insightfulness, and honesty in everything we do. As an inclusive employer, we encourage our teams to grow together, in a relaxed but professional environment

Title: Data Analyst - SQL and Python
Description:
At Radius, we provide best in class fleet and connectivity solutions to businesses of all sizes.




Our mission is to help businesses adapt to the future by building solutions for a more sustainable, connected future.




Our comprehensive portfolio of solutions includes fuel cards, telematics, telecoms, insurance, vehicle leasing, EV charging, business energy, and expense management.




We are proud to have over 400,000 customers worldwide, over 50 offices across 5 continents, and over 2,800 talented Radius colleagues.




Technology and data underpin everything we do and have a big part to play in our ongoing growth plans.




This is where you come inâ€¦




The roleâ€¦




Weâ€™re looking for a Data Analyst with SQL and Python experience to join our Group Data Science team.




The Data Science teamâ€™s main goal is to provide valuable insights to positively impact key business challenges like improving sales conversion, customer churn, etc. These insights are delivered by developing predictive models and analytical solutions while collaborating with business stakeholders.




The role will report to the Head of Group Data Science and will be primarily located at the groupâ€™s head office in Crewe.




Your responsibilities will includeâ€¦




Work with the data scientists and other data analysts to provide insights that aid strategic decision-making for sales, marketing, and account management functions.
Analyse customer and prospect touchpoints on Salesforce CRM and 1st party tools to identify trends that could help tackle key business challenges.
Help deliver targeted Sales and Marketing campaign data on Salesforce CRM through CRUD operations via API.
Work on a diverse range of initiatives for all of Radiusâ€™ business units - Fuel, Telematics, Telecoms, Insurance, Vehicle solutions, EV, and Energy.




What do we expect of you?




Minimum 1 year commercial experience working with Python and SQL for Data Analysis.
Passion for driving business impact through data and insights.
Good knowledge of Statistics and Applied Mathematics
Ability to communicate findings through presentations and dashboards.
Good organisation and time-management skills




What can you expect of us?




Your impact on Radius will be rewarded with the opportunity to develop and progress your career in many directions.




Youâ€™ll also have access to our competitive reward and benefits package, which includes:




Performance-related bonus scheme
Pension
Life assurance
Employee fuel card scheme
Electric Vehicle scheme
Employee assistance programme
Wellness and healthcare assistance via â€˜Help@Handâ€™ by Unum
â€˜Cycle to workâ€™ scheme
Free breakfast daily in the office




And of course, you will be part of a modern purpose-built space in Crewe that will provide you with an outstanding working environment complete with onsite gym, cafÃ©, games areas, and more!




Still curious?




If you feel we are a good match for each other, you can apply online now!




If youâ€™d like to understand more about the role or life at Radius before applying, then please contact our talent team via talent@radius.com.




Radius is an equal opportunities employer. We are committed to welcome people regardless of age, disability, gender identity, race, faith or belief, sexual orientation or socioeconomic background.







Note to Recruitment Agencies

We do not accept unsolicited agency CVs or candidate profiles. Any unsolicited CV or profile received by Radius will be treated as a gift and not eligible for an agency fee. PSL agencies should only send CVs if authorised to do so by the Radius talent team.

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
Commercial Intelligence Analyst




Location: Oxford, United Kingdom




Salary: Competitive Market Rate on offer




Hybrid Working Model (3 Days a week on site)




A global, rapidly expanding Energy Research client who provides clients with data-driven intelligence for strategy, portfolio management and investment decisions on the global energy transformation is on the look-out for a Commercial Intelligence Analyst to join the Commercial arm of their business.




You will work in a dynamic multi-national team playing a key role in collecting, processing and reporting key data supporting all aspects of commercial and operational activities. You will combine a strong analytical mindset, the ability to answer unstructured data questions, and interpersonal relationship skills with an interest in energy markets and the transition towards a more sustainable world.




This role would be ideal for a candidate at an earlier stage of their career who is looking to develop a skillset in analytics and reporting with a focus on commercial management.




Key Responsibilities:

Producing existing reporting regarding the Commercial Teamsâ€™ KPIs and sales activity, and producing new reporting to provide further analysis, clarity or to increase the efficiency of reporting production
Work with various stakeholders to produce clear, accurate analysis relevant to their needs
Provide bespoke analysis of commercial performance for one-off deep analysis
Administrate and keep various databases and datasets up to date
Working within the Commercial Systems & Intelligence team to improve administrative and operational processes, and to carry out some of those processes
Conduct market research and business intelligence to support the Commercial team




Required attributes:

A high level of numerical & analytical competence
Experience in analysing and manipulating numerical data
An ability to understand unstructured data questions to carry out analysis to provide a suitable answer
Experience with Microsoft Excel ideally including lookups; pivot tables; sumifs; countifs
An ability to effectively prioritise and manage your own time and tasks
Excellent organisation skills and a high degree of persistence and diligence
A can-do attitude and willingness to help wherever needed e.g. improving internal systems and processes
Ability to communicate and collaborate with both technically and non-technically minded parties
Outstanding written and verbal communication as well as interpersonal skills
Evidence of performing well in team-oriented environments
Enthusiasm and curiosity about the energy transition




Please reach out for further information:

joe@paritasrecruitment.com

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst

Initially a 6 months contract (Outside IR35, up to Â£420 per day)

Hybrid (1-2 days in client's office in Hindlip, Worcestershire)




We are currently partnered with a public sector client focused on developing new capabilities to align with their strategic vision of maturing their data function and migrating.




They are looking for a 'Data Analyst' with strong understanding of SQL analysis, data modelling, remediation plans; someone, who can identify data feeds and master records, and work with external partners to identify processes for correction on relevant systems.




Knowledge and Experience:

SQL analysis â€“ writing scripts to identify and profile data, as well as to move data as part of a data migration
PowerBI for analysis/visualisation preferable
Data modelling â€“ need to map data structures
Stakeholder management/engagement for internal and external stakeholders. Defining processes and requirements (in conjunction with the Business Analyst)
Identify and map all data feeds into the warehouse (ETL jobs, direct application updates, etc.)
Profile data volumetric, then measuring and quantifying data issues.
Propose remediation plan for records identified as missing / inaccurate in one or other system.
Execute remediation plan post governance and approval




It is essential that you have been part of a team responsible for data migration and highly desirable that you have worked across government administration or public sector. Also, having previously been SC cleared or currently having an SC clearance would be beneficial.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst - Â£45-55k - London/Hybrid




This digital production house that specialise in gaming are looking for their first in-house Data Analyst to join the business. They work with tech companies to provide data-driven insights and analytics that enhance player experiences and optimise game performance.




What will you be doing?




Collaborate daily with developers to apply and test analytics libraries.
Present metrics and analyses to guide smart game development decisions.
Use SQL, R, and Tableau to answer customer questions and dive deep into data.
Work with partner analytics teams at a top tech company.
Monitor key metrics like user retention and content update impact.
Build dashboards to visualise metrics and analytics.
Report on issues, analytics results and quality status.
Leverage game feature knowledge and player behavior insights for improvements.




Skills needed:




SQL experience & understanding of relational databases
Experience with a data visualisation tools like Tableau, Microstrategy, or Power BI
Games industry experience - supporting game development/release/live ops
Passion for gaming
Ideally some game development experience - typescript proficiency or C++ etc.
Strong communication skills & collaborative mindset

Data Analyst - Â£45-55k - London/Hybrid


This digital production house that specialise in gaming are looking for their first in-house Data Analyst to join the business. They work with tech companies to provide data-driven insights and analytics that enhance player experiences and optimise game performance.


What will you be doing?


  • Collaborate daily with developers to apply and test analytics libraries.
  • Present metrics and analyses to guide smart game development decisions.
  • Use SQL, R, and Tableau to answer customer questions and dive deep into data.
  • Work with partner analytics teams at a top tech company.
  • Monitor key metrics like user retention and content update impact.
  • Build dashboards to visualise metrics and analytics.
  • Report on issues, analytics results and quality status.
  • Leverage game feature knowledge and player behavior insights for improvements.


Skills needed:


  • SQL experience & understanding of relational databases
  • Experience with a data visualisation tools like Tableau, Microstrategy, or Power BI
  • Games industry experience - supporting game development/release/live ops
  • Passion for gaming
  • Ideally some game development experience - typescript proficiency or C++ etc.
  • Strong communication skills & collaborative mindset


If you are passionate about gaming and have the necessary skills and experience, I'd love to hear from you!


Apply now and I'll be in touch to arrange an initial call to talk through the details.


Please note that all applicants must have the right to work in the UK.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
BRAND NEW ROLE - DATA ANALYST - UP TO Â£60,000 SALARY + BONUS - LONDON - HYBRID - FOR A HOUSEHOLD NAME COOKING APP THAT HAS OVER 5 MILLION SOCIAL MEDIA FOLLOWERS




Required Experience




GCP
Google Analytics
Looker Studio
Mixpanel




This role is for a company that specializes in software/app development for cooking. If you are a foodie and are active on social media, then you will have definitely seen them.




They have over 5 million followers, their own cookbooks, and global brand partnerships with high-street brands.




This isn't just your typical full-stack role, maintaining the backend and front end! Here you will actually make a difference!




What will you be doing, though?




Well, you'll be a Data Analyst focusing on direct-to-consumer data and Product Behavioural Analysis using all the latest tech in GCP. Also, you'll be trying all the latest recipes and food in the office! What's not to like?




The Tech Team said to me this ISN'T the role for someone who likes a highly structured and direct environment, where there is lots of Red Tape.




They said this role IS for someone who is proactive and looking to learn and be the best Data Analyst they can be whilst making the business better!




And if none of this makes you want to reach out to me or apply for the role, they have an on-site kitchen with high-end chefs that will cook you anything you want anytime you go on-site!




This role also offers paid training schemes, flexible working hours, an enhanced holiday package, a bonus, health insurance, and cooking lessons ;)




Feel free to reach out to me anytime at d.corrigan@tact-it.co.uk

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
You will join the team in delivering insight and analysis which allow ClearScore to rapidly scale and deliver a seamless experience for our users. Analysts play a key role within ClearScore, driving strategy and key decision-making, which ultimately benefits our users, partners, and other teams within the business.

ClearScore has an amazing analytical community which includes Data Analysts, Scientists and Engineers. The community works collaboratively to ensure a landscape in which team members can develop their full potential and deliver maximum business impact.

ClearScore is both a free credit score and report service and the UKâ€™s leading consumer credit marketplace. Working in the Marketing Analytics team, you will play a key role in monitoring and reporting on campaign performance; supporting the marketing and CRM teams to run experiments to improve UX and monetization, and building analytics to support the leadership team in developing the overall strategy.

What you will be doing:


Build out new monitoring and reporting dashboards, using SQL and Domo
Work closely with our marketing teams across acquisition or retention (CRM) to help them understand the benefit of our marketing activity
Analyse AB tests and experiments to enable us to continuously improve our campaigns and user experience
Deliver in-depth analytics projects, using data to identify opportunities and to analyse and solve complex business problems
Support the ongoing growth of the marketplace, including carrying out analysis needed to launch new products, improve existing products and unlock growth across verticals


Skills We'd Love You To Have


You must possess advanced SQL and Excel skills. Knowledge of Python and analytical tools such as Amplitude is a plus
Experience using Domo or other data visualisation tools such as Tableau
Ability to plan and prioritise your own workload
You have a desire to learn and enjoy working collaboratively, with a desire to contribute to our culture.
You do not need to fit into a stereotype: we are really committed to closing our gender gap and are actively trying to create an environment where you, as an individual, can thrive.
Strong quantitative and numerical skills


Why ClearScore?

ClearScore is the UK's #1 credit score and report app. We are also present in South Africa, Australia and Canada, with more than 18 million users globally and growing fast. Someone joins ClearScore every 20 seconds. We have established relationships with over 50 of the main lenders in the U.K., and have been a trusted tool for customers to manage their credit and make better financial decisions.

Since October 2016 we have helped 1.8 million users take out a new credit card or loan. We are user-centric at our core and we believe in leveraging technology to enable positive financial choices. We are design-led and data-driven and we embed these behaviours in everything we do.

Our company culture is a fundamental part of all we have achieved. We believe in hiring smart, driven, passionate and diverse people who are keen on having a real impact in our organisation. We trust you to manage your own time so we offer flexible work and no fixed desk hours. We don't micromanage and we believe in measuring outcomes rather than effort. We have an inclusive culture where all, regardless of seniority, are encouraged to contribute with their ideas, look after their wellbeing and actively seek opportunities for career growth.

If you feel like this could be the place for you, apply and our Talent team will be happy to share more.

Benefits:


25 paid holidays and a â€œduvet dayâ€ on your birthday
Hybrid Work Environment: flexible work-life balance allowing you to thrive both in the office and from the comfort of your own space.
Private health and dental cover
GP office visits
Life assurance scheme
Up to 6% matched pension
Brown bags with guest speakers
Dog-friendly office
Daily breakfast and free snacks
Free sports and social clubs
Generous training allowance
Fast progression
Leadership-led training
Regular well-being events
In-house psychotherapist
Financial coach to help you plan and achieve your goals
Physical and mental health support through BUPA
No clock-watching culture
Generous maternity and paternity plans
Culture and inclusion representatives
Transparent pay structure and a career growth plan


Inclusion Policy

We are always looking for talented individuals to join ClearScore. We are an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for our people. Please see our People Policy Notice at https://www.clearscore.com/people-notice.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Title: Data Analyst

Location: United Kingdom (Remote/Hybrid)

Company: To&From

About Us: To&From is an innovative US-based startup transforming the gifting experience through advanced, AI powered technology. Our gifting copilot is leveraged by B2B customers to drive personalized, efficient and delightful gifting on their own sites. Our mission is to make gifting great wherever the customer is. Our dynamic team thrives on creativity, collaboration, and a data centric approach to building the best experiences across the commerce ecosystem.

Job Description: We are on the lookout for a talented and enthusiastic Data Analyst to join our team. This role is pivotal in expanding our gifting technology to a wider audience by building and refining models that enhance our services. The ideal candidate will have a solid understanding of the retail landscape, especially in merchandising and product hierarchies, and a good taste level. A start-up mentality is essential, along with experience in training AI models and proficiency in Tableau.

Key Responsibilities:

Develop and implement data models to support the expansion of To&Fromâ€™s gifting technology.
Analyse and interpret complex data sets to provide actionable insights that drive business decisions.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand business needs and translate them into data-driven solutions.
Leverage understanding of the retail landscape, including merchandising and product hierarchies, to inform model development and refinement.
Maintain high standards in data interpretation and presentation.
Create and maintain dashboards and visualisations in Tableau to communicate findings effectively to stakeholders.
Train and optimise AI models to improve the personalisation and efficiency of our gifting technology.
Stay abreast of industry trends and advancements in data analysis and AI.

Key Skills and Qualifications:

Proven experience as a Data Analyst, preferably within the retail sector.
Strong understanding of merchandising and product hierarchies.
Demonstrated ability to build and train AI models.
Proficiency in Tableau, and Looker for data visualisation.
Experience working with GCP data platforms, including BigQuery
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.
High level of accuracy and attention to detail.
Strong communication skills, with the ability to convey complex data insights to non-technical stakeholders.
Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, start-up environment.
A passion for technology and a keen eye for trends in the gifting and retail space.

Preferred Qualifications:

Experience working in a start-up or fast-growing tech company.
Background in e-commerce or gifting industries.
Familiarity with other data analysis tools and programming languages such as Python or R.
University degree or equivalent experience.

What We Offer:

Competitive salary and benefits package.
Opportunity to work in a cutting-edge, fast-paced environment.
Flexible working arrangements.
A collaborative and supportive team culture.
Opportunities for professional development and growth.

How to Apply: If this opportunity excites you, please submit your CV and a cover letter detailing your relevant experience and why you are enthusiastic about joining To&From to info@toandfrom.com

Application Deadline: July 1, 2024

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
ðŸŒŸ Data Insight Analyst at top Lloyd's market InsurerðŸŒŸ




Excellent Salary + Bonus + 31 days holiday + Excellent Benefits

Hybrid working: London Office (2/3 days a week in the office)




Are you passionate about data analysis, visualization, and driving business insights? Do you thrive in a dynamic, innovative environment? Look no further! Our Lloyds Market Insurer customer is seeking a talented and creative Data Insights Analyst to work directly with teams across the business to deliver the information they need.




This is an organization at the forefront of cutting-edge data services, capturing, transforming, and analyzing diverse data through their modern cloud-based platform, generating invaluable insights for their business. Now needing a Data Analyst to take this to the next level!




As the successful Data Insights Analyst you will need:




Essential skills:

Power BI report development (including DAX).
Transact SQL and Python/Scala scripting.
Stakeholder management and requirements capture.
General analytical and modeling techniques.
Data visualization and dashboard design.




Desirable:

Understanding of Lloydâ€™s Insurance market data.
Experience with Agile processes.
Data quality management expertise.
Familiarity with modern data processing technologies (data lakes, warehouses, reporting tools).
Knowledge of Microsoft Azure data and analytics tools (including Azure Databricks).




Role Highlights:

Hands-On Impact: Dive into data, collaborating directly with cross-functional teams to deliver critical information.
Analytical Skills: Design repeatable reports and create ad-hoc analyses to drive data-driven decisions.
Team Collaboration: Work closely with business teams, bringing their ideas back to the data team.
Continuous Learning: Explore new skills and innovative ways to analyze and visualize data.




Responsibilities:

Understand data requirements from colleagues across the business
Prioritize work within the Data Insights team.
Contribute to Agile project delivery.
Develop reporting and visualization solutions.
Collaborate on data engineering and architecture requirements.
Uphold data standards and governance.
Coach colleagues in data analysis self-service.
Monitor data quality and raise awareness of best practices.




Ready to make an impact? Apply now and your application will be reviewed swiftly.

Title: Marketing Data Analyst
Description:
Job Title: Marketing Data Scientist




Location: London ðŸŒ†




Remuneration: Hourly rate Â£35.58 ðŸ’¸




Contract Details: Temporary, until 28th February 2025 âŒ›




Working Pattern: Full Time (Hybrid Model) â°




Are you a talented Marketing Data Scientist looking for an exciting opportunity in the thriving tech industry? Our client, a leading organisation in the tech sector, is seeking a motivated and skilled individual to join their EMEA Marketing team as a Marketing Data Scientist. ðŸ“ˆ




Responsibilities:

Manage the workload of a large project or multiple projects to maximise impact and refine timelines in collaboration with stakeholders.
Exercise sound judgement in weighing input against anticipated impact and adapt to changes as needed.
Identify issues for defined problems, navigate unexpected complexity, and propose analytical and technical solutions.
Effectively frame and escalate issues to be addressed by managers and stakeholders.
Serve as a trusted partner within the team and with cross-functional teams, providing guidance and managing relationships with partners, agencies, or TVCs.
Contribute to shared team responsibilities and the broader analyst community, such as conducting interviews or presenting analysis findings.
Utilise expertise in data extraction and manipulation, dashboarding/visualisation, statistical analysis, predictive modelling, and research techniques to drive insights and solutions.
Develop strategies to drive incremental growth by addressing complex business challenges and collaborating with stakeholders across various functions.
Conduct market research and data analysis to influence business decisions, optimise performance, and deliver best-in-class execution.
Champion an inclusive culture, creating a supportive environment, role-modelling inclusive behaviour, and driving diversity change initiatives.
Provide ad-hoc research and data analysis support to senior leaders for specific data requests.




Skills/Experience/Education:

Strong knowledge of business operations and driving efficiency and effectiveness within organisations.
Excellent consultative skills to understand stakeholder needs and provide tailored analysis and recommendations.
Proficiency in dashboarding to link, report, and analyse metrics based on available data.
Ability to convert real-world business problems into trackable metrics and generate meaningful insights from data analysis.
Familiarity with experimental design principles and best practises.
Good understanding of the tech industry landscape, including key players and technology trends.
Experience in marketing analysis and applying analytical methods to generate actionable insights.
Project management skills and ability to plan and execute projects effectively.
Knowledge of statistical analysis methods to evaluate data adequacy and draw inferences.
Strong storytelling and presentation skills to communicate data-driven insights in an engaging manner.
Technical acumen and eagerness to learn and apply statistical and mathematical concepts.




Our client offers excellent perks, including hybrid working arrangements, pension contribution matching, employee discounts, and comprehensive well-being support. ðŸŒŸ




If you are passionate about leveraging data to drive strategies and make an impact in the tech industry, we would love to hear from you. Join our client's innovative team in London, and be a part of shaping the future of EMEA Marketing. Apply now! âœ¨




Please note that only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.ðŸ’¼

Description:
Analyst - Customer Flexibility

Location: Castleford

Directorate: Energy Systems

Job Ref No: R6646




Do you have what it takes to play a key role in shaping the electricity distribution network of the future and be at the heart of achieving net zero?




We are Northern Powergrid, and we are responsible for powering everyday life for 8 million people across the North East, Yorkshire and northern Lincolnshire. We are a diverse team, creating a smarter, more flexible electricity distribution network that will enable our region to decarbonise and meet the needs of our customers now, and in the future.




Distribution System Operation (DSO) involves us delivering an increasingly smart and flexible energy system for our customers that delivers a greener grid, with maximum resilience at minimal overall cost.




This is an exciting opportunity at a time of significant and fascinating change within the energy sector. As an Analyst reporting into the Head of System Flexibility, you will be part of the System Flexibility team involved with delivering customer and network flexibility solutions to help develop and operate our network more efficiently.




Along with a competitive salary up to Â£35,000 we also offer great benefits such as;




â€¢Enrolment into our double-matched pension scheme

â€¢25 days holiday plus bank holidays

â€¢Bonus scheme â€“ up to 10%

â€¢Agile working arrangements




We are excited to hear from candidates with a passion for our company and the energy industry and a desire to succeed. Apply now and weâ€™ll be in touch.




Key Responsibilities




The successful candidate will:




â€¢Working across the organisation to gather information

â€¢Producing reports and data for internal and external audiences

â€¢Prepare documents (presentations and outline written documents) and develop in line with colleaguesâ€™ input.

â€¢Maintain effective communication and working relationships with key internal and external stakeholders

â€¢Supporting the wider team with general administration to ensure the achievement of monthly deadlines and department performance

â€¢Contribute to industry wide market development with other DNOs by representing Northern Powergrid on ENA Open Network working groups.




Does this sound like you?




â€¢Team working is essential in this role to develop and implement new solutions. You will be part of a high-performing team, leading change

â€¢Confident decision-making skills

â€¢Problem solving is a must when faced with the scale and pace of change facing us, not to mention the number of exciting challenges

â€¢Deliver quality outputs to required deadlines, accuracy and attention to detail with the ability to research, digest, analyse and present material clearly and concisely

â€¢Excellent verbal and written skills, with the ability to effectively communicate with stakeholders from across the business and wider industry

â€¢Analytical and data driven, using your skills to drive forward our analytical capability and data management




What qualifications and experience should you have?




â€¢Educated to degree level in a relevant subject

â€¢2 A Levels or NVQ Level 4 or HNC

â€¢IT and Analytical experience

â€¢Ideally some experience working in the energy sector (but not essential)

â€¢Ability to use appropriate IT applications effectively (including Outlook, SharePoint, Word, PowerPoint and Excel

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst - Â£30K-Â£40K - Cumbria - Hybrid




My client is looking for a Data Analyst to work with the large and complex datasets associated with their financial comparison products. The role has a broad remit encompassing analysis, interpretation, and prediction. The Data Analyst will also bring statistical rigor to their product teamsâ€™ efforts as they continuously enhance comparison products.




Role




Dive into complex datasets and extract actionable insights, e.g.
Identify customer segments across our comparison services where no or very few quotes are provided.
Analyse the conversion funnel data to improve the click to sale conversion to make recommendations on segments that are being poorly served, and
Utilize multiway statistical techniques to identify trends and correlations.
Facilitate discussions with the wider business to gain insight into pain points, problems and opportunities where analysis could help us with these either for business or for our partners/customers.
Support AB/MVT test plans and assessing results independently.
Assist with new provider due diligence and performance issue investigations.
Use of analytics tools/applications to undertake multi factor analysis to generate robust, accurate analysis to inform decision making.
Pro-actively work with stakeholders and colleagues to find ways for continuous evolution and improvement of the use of data/insight, to ensure solutions are best in class, and that value is continually generated from the data asset.
Create clear and concise reports and visualizations.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to drive data-driven decision-making.




Skills




Proven experience as a Data Analyst, handling large datasets and performing statistical analysis.
Proficiency in data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI, Qlik).
Strong SQL skills for data extraction and manipulation.
Familiarity with Python, R or similar for data analysis.
Experience in filtering and cleaning complex datasets to provide actionable insights.
Experience working within the Financial Technology industry will be helpful.




Benefits




27 days holiday plus public holidays
Performance rated bonus
Enhanced pension
Generous private medical care
Sickness and insurance benefits
Share schemes.




If this sounds like your next role, apply today!

Title: ESG Data Analyst
Description:
ESG Data Analyst - Data Science - Investment Management - up to Â£110,000




Our client, a leading Investment Management organisation based in the City of London, are looking for an ESG Data Analyst to join them on a permanent basis. You will be joining the ESG Data team and assist in the development of a Data Science model.




The successful candidate will be responsible for progressing the automation of ESG data production, analysis and systematic integration with other systems currently being utilised by the business. Alongside this, you will be enhancing ESG data through improving data quality and transparency as well as devising innovative approaches for ESG data analytics and insights through building robust data orientated solutions in Python.




The ideal candidate will have a strong analytical mindset and demonstrate strong problem solving skills. You will also have experience working within Investment Management or a similarly regulated industry.




Key Skills:

3-7 years experience working as an ESG Data Analyst.
Strong knowledge of Python and building data orientated solutions for businesses.
Knowledge of ESG metrics is highly beneficial.
Experience working with modern data tools (e.g. Tableau, Jupyter Notebooks, Pandas etc.)
Exposure to machine learning approaches such as neural networks and generative AI is desirable
Experienced working in the Investment Management industry

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Join an insurtech, scale-up company with a fantastic culture and great branding.
Sit under the Head of Analytics.
Faced paced business with a strong data maturity.




Join a fast-paced scale up with an exciting USP and an amazing team!




What youâ€™ll be doing

Sitting in the retention tribe in this exciting company, youâ€™ll be working to better understand customers. Youâ€™ll be helping customers who struggle to get fair car insurance, and then youâ€™ll be helping the company to retain those customers.




Youâ€™ll be using customer data to better understand when and how to best communicate with their customers; better understand who the customers are and why theyâ€™re buying from the company. Youâ€™ll be diving into the customer experience to understand the customer lifetime value, looking at marketing analysis and better understand the customer demographic by diving into trends and patterns.




Theyâ€™ve got a high-performance culture and amazing career opportunities while also having low egos throughout their cross functional teams. Unlike others, this insurance company prides themselves on having great customer service and an incredibly data driven environment. This company are revolutionising insurance by introducing technology driven environments into the insurance world. Want to be part of the revolution? Youâ€™ll join a mature data team and help to bridge a gap in the team during a transition of one of their main team members, youâ€™ll be coming in to assist with the handover and fast paced work.




What experience youâ€™ll need to apply

3+ years of experience working as a Data Analyst
Excellent SQL experience
Looker experience
Ideally experience with DBT, or a similar data modelling tool
Experience with Snowflake
Experience working in start-ups/scale-up companies
Ideally working in a fintech or insurtech




What youâ€™ll get in return for your experience

Theyâ€™re offering a salary of up to Â£84,000 for the right person, plus bonus and excellent benefits! Please note there is a requirement of two days a week in the office.




What next

Apply using the above link or send your CV over to Tegan!

Title: Insights Analyst
Description:
We are looking for three Insights Analysts to join our Digital team at Harrods. This role will sit within the Loyalty & CRM Insights team, led by the Senior Loyalty & CRM Insights Manager. This is an exciting opportunity that will support the areas of Partnerships, Campaign and Loyalty.




About The Role




As the Insights Analyst you will use your creativity and initiative to help internal clients to bring customer insight and relevance to their communications and promotions, and to truly understand what we can learn about the customer using analysis and evaluation. This role will sit within the Loyalty & CRM Insights team, led by the Senior Loyalty & CRM Insights Manager




You will:

You will work with stakeholders across CRM and Loyalty to support in designing reporting, campaign planning, and making suggestions on how we can improve on current campaigns.
Responsible for bringing project work together and developing new ways of looking into our campaigns
Responsible for determining short term performance, tracking KPIs, longer term projects, and working with a variety of stakeholders
Measuring impact versus control groups, A/B tests, and determining and explaining uplift where possible




About You




The successful candidate will have good knowledge of Excel, PowerPoint and SQL, and preferably experience of using Google Analytics too, ideally you will have a background in Statistics, Mathematics, Science or Marketing. We are also looking for someone who has the ability to translate insights from a complex analysis into easy to read insights for a technical and a non-technical audience




You will also;

Previous Stakeholder management skills
Experience using customer or consumer data
Some understanding of targeted and personalised Loyalty and/or CRM activity/ Marketing
Keen attention to detail
Passion for utilising data




About Us




Harrods is one of the worldâ€™s leading luxury department stores and weâ€™re becoming a destination for top designers, and the most sought-after brands from around the globe. Our combined mission is to make visiting our iconic Knightsbridge store one of the worldâ€™s most inspiring shopping experiences.




Our Promise to You




Help us make the impossible possible for our customers and weâ€™ll do something remarkable for you. As well as offering a friendly environment to inspire your best work, we provide abundant opportunities and support to build an exceptional career across the varied specialisms of our business.




In return, youâ€™ll receive an excellent benefits package, including a company pension, flexible working, 25 daysâ€™ holiday, and your birthday off, up to 33% in-store discount (including across our food hall and restaurants) and a season ticket loan.




Uniquely You




At Harrods we believe the personality and authenticity of our people sets us apart. We celebrate and invite applications from all cultures, backgrounds, tastes, and experiences and are proud of our culture where people from all walks of life can grow and thrive. What makes you unique makes us exceptional.




If you want to know more about our people and our culture, search #TogetherHarrods on LinkedIn, Facebook or follow us on Instagram @togetherharrods.




Harrods reserve the right to close applications early if we receive a high number of applications for this role.

Title: Data Analyst
Company: Pelican Procurement Services - An Avendra Group Company
Description:
You will be joining our Tendering team and your role is internally referred to as Tender Support. Our team supports the growth and retention of our UK clients. Your role will be to provide support to Pelicanâ€™s tender team throughout the tendering process. To work closely with internal stakeholders and directly with clients and suppliers. To provide administrative support with public procurement tenders, update and publish notices and ensure that we are supporting clients to remain legally compliant.




You will come from an administrative, analytical background. You will have dealt with suppliers and customers as part of your role. You will enjoy building strong internal and external stakeholders. We are looking for someone with a creative commercial mindset who loves learning everyday and is open to coming up with creative ideas to help our customers.




What's the job

Support the supplier tender submissions process, ensuring submissions are acknowledged and appropriately managed within agreed systems and timescales
Contribute to the delivery of a programme of professional, transparent, and impartial supplier tenders, request for quotations and direct negotiations
Support with price comparison exercises and project fact finds
Partner with Tender Managers in pre-tender supplier engagement sessions
Liaise with the Pi (purchasing intelligence) team to ensure that the successful supplier can provide electronic invoice line data in the correct format and timelines
Liaise with internal and external stakeholders to ensure a smooth contract mobilisation
Supporting with post award supplier engagement to create a new contract pack
Post award â€“ supporting in various administrative tasks relating to public procurement contract management, publishing of notices, tender portal management and coordinating with internal stakeholders




Skills and qualities:

Highly commercial
Strong creative learning mindset
Good verbal and written communication skills
Excellent relationship building skills
Very organised and methodical
Analytical thinker and numerate
Microsoft Office - Excel, Word and PowerPoint
Must be able to use VLOOKUPS, Pivot Tables, Conditional Formatting and Formula
Demonstrable experience of meeting targets & delivering client satisfaction
Comfortable with some UK travel
Wants to develop a career within professional procurement services




Equal Opportunities

We are an equal opportunities employer and we are determined to ensure that no applicant or employee receives less favourable treatment on the grounds of gender, age, disability, religion, belief, sexual orientation, marital status, or race, or is disadvantaged by conditions or requirements which cannot be shown. Please inform us of any required adjustments you may need during interviews.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Client: A well-established luxurious French brand in the UK

Job Title: Master Data Analyst

Job Type: FullTime




Job Description:

The Master Data Analyst will keep product data accurate and organized, create rules for managing this data, and set up reports to track data quality.
They'll work with the IT team to get data from the system, help set up a new data management tool, and ensure all product information is consistent.
They will also support the planning manager with important data tasks

Key Responsibilities & Actions:

Provide reporting on Product Data KPIs: Accuracy, Completeness and Timeliness.
Liaise with Data owners to maintain product database, implement controls and compliance metrics to reduce data issues and improve data quality. Working in collaboration with: Commercial, NPD, Newness/Gifting, Portfolio, Supply & Production Planning Teams.
Identify and leverage opportunities to continually improve the quality of data management systems, processes, and standards.
Work alongside IT System team to improve efficiency of data management, maintenance, systems and reporting.
Work alongside Sku Creation to ensure data is input correctly and in full, investigate route cause of data errors.
Currently, master data management is done using Microsoft Excel and Microsoft Dynamics 365- The company is looking to implement a PIM system in the future.
