Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst

Salary: Â£35,000 - Â£45,000 DoE

Hybrid - 3 Days a week on site







Overview:

Our client based in Leek, is on the lookout for a data analyst!

The company is an exceptional place to work, boasting an outstanding culture where colleagues feel proud to be part of the team. Recognised for the best approach to health & wellbeing in the UK in recent awards, this inclusive and socially responsible employer is dedicated to supporting everyone to perform at their best.




This is an exciting time of growth with significant investment in systems, people, and processes, all focused on putting customers at the heart of everything they do.




If you have a logical, analytical mind, this could be just the opportunity for you!




Job description:




The Data Analyst provides expertise in the development and maintenance of business reporting. They maintain knowledge of data to provide management information, request fulfilment, and incident management support. Working behind the IT Service Desk, the Data Analyst fulfils requests and resolves incidents according to agreed service levels, managing internal customer expectations and acting as a positive representative of the department.




Key Responsibilities:




Develop and maintain MI reports to meet business and regulatory requirements.
Maintain documentation such as data dictionaries to enable business users to create and interpret MI reporting.
Interpret requirements and develop applications to meet business needs.
Provide advice and guidance to internal customers in response to queries submitted to the IT Service Desk.
Manage routine maintenance such as data erasure procedures.
Diagnose and resolve incidents including investigation and troubleshooting.
Implement standard changes and fulfill service requests.
Provide technical support to IT projects by contributing to solution research, design, and implementation.
Maintain technical knowledge and awareness of industry developments.
Perform other duties as may reasonably be required.




Person Specification:




Knowledge of configuring data warehouse or data management applications.
Expert understanding of relational databases.
Proficiency in writing and interpreting Oracle PL/SQL or T-SQL.
Experience producing graphical reporting using data warehousing or similar applications.




Benefits:




Contributory Stakeholder Pension Scheme.
35 hour working week
Minimum of 23 days paid holiday per annum plus bank and public holidays.
Life assurance of four times your annual salary
Onsite gym available to employees.




Please note - this position is unable to offer visa sponsorship, applicants must have full right to work in the UK




due to the requirements of this role, applicants must be within a commutable distance to the Leek office.







If the above sounds like an environment in which you would thrive, we would love to hear from you! Looking to interview for this Role ASAP, so if you think you could be a good fit, Apply today!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Confused.com is the UK's first comparison platform for car insurance. We've been helping customers since 2002 by empowering them to make better decisions around insurance and financial services. Our mission is simple: take away the confusion when comparing financial products and services to help you save time and money.

We're part of RVU, a group of online brands (including Uswitch, Tempcover and Money.co.uk) that empowers people to make confident decisions across a range of household services.

About the role

We're looking for an Analyst to work with our search platform team, whose goal is to drive organic growth for Confused.com by supporting our in-house SEO function. We're looking for someone who can help make the best use of our data to generate insight and optimise web assets in order to capture ranking traffic. The search platform team sits within our customer & marketing platform guild, who enable marketeers to improve their customer relationships and their ability to market quickly and effectively.

Our work requires familiarity with search data, a number of different analytics and database tools, as well as technical expertise to mine big datasets and a natural inquisitiveness to uncover stories within our data.

As an Analyst, you will be a crucial member of the team, working closely with the search marketing and content teams to understand performance, identify opportunities and surface new data points that will enhance the quality and accuracy of our content. Part of the role will also involve working with the PR team to respond to data requests, in order to build positive relationships, showcase our expertise and have a positive impact on our reputation as a customer champion.

You will be responsible for translating the requirements of your stakeholders to bring ideas to life and deliver on the business strategy, whilst also building up a reporting toolset to allow stakeholders to â€˜self-serve' wherever possible. You'll also be able to build up a strong contextual knowledge of our data and our industry in order to proactively identify new opportunities to improve our performance, whilst acting as a data champion for the search marketing team by:

Visualising - Using strong visualisation techniques to create detailed engaging dashboards and reports to present performance trends and your search insights to relevant teams and business stakeholders.
Investigating - Diving into our search and in-house data to understandÂ  performance, highlight where improvements could be made and sharing that insight with the relevant marketing teams to action.Â 
Enabling - Providing training guidance and support on how to understand data / reporting and promote self-service to improve overall analytical capability and autonomy across the business.
Researching - Keeping up to date with macroeconomic factors,market and search trends, while being able to interpret this accordingly to understand and measure the impact on our business performance.
Translating - Act as an analytics translator to bridge the gap between our engineers and our business stakeholders, to apply business context to our data products and deliver clearly understandable insight to our operational teams.
Analysing - Use your digital marketing and analytical skills to analyse competitor strategies to gain ranking insights and to help prioritise actions off the back of it

What you'll bring to the role:Â 

You're self-directed, passionate aboutâ€¯data, and focused on delivering the right resultsÂ to help solve customer and business problemsÂ 

Effective communication, data storytelling, and relationship building skills. Capable of independently identifying stories in the data and presenting to both technical and non-technical stakeholders

Familiarity with the financial services industry, and a good understanding of key drivers in the price comparison market

Experience and understanding of search metrics, with a sound knowledge of the levers which can be used to improve search performance

Create professional standard dashboards and reports, driving engagement from stakeholders with the ability to clearly convey messaging around performance trends.

Ability to lead by example and be a positive influence on the team around you, demonstrating good practice in reporting, visualisation and analytics, while supporting the development of our data culture

Solid technical skills with SQL (preferably with Databricks and BigQuery), Tableau (or other visualisation tools), Google Sheets, Google Search Console and Google Analytics tools

You don't need to tick off everything on this list - so don't let that hold you back from applying. There are plenty of opportunities to learn with us!



Benefits



We want to give you a great work environment. We want to contribute to both your personal and professional development, and give you great benefits to make your time at Confused.com even more enjoyable. Some of these benefits include:

A competitive salary and bonus package
Employer matching pension up to 7.5%
Hybrid working, and a "Work from Home" budget to help contribute towards a great work environment at home
Annual leave of 25 days (excluding bank holidays) which will increase with length of service (up to a maximum of 30 days) and additional leave options
Excellent maternity, paternity and adoption leave policy, for those key moments in your life
Employee Assistance Programme (EAP), Simply Health Scheme and access to the Calm app.
Regular events - company-wide events with insightful external speakers as we want to make sure our colleagues continue to feel connected
A healthy learning and training budget, as well as the chance to go to conferences around the world every year
Private medical scheme

**As a tech company that strives to get better every day, we use Metaview during the interview processes to record and transcribe interviews so the interviewer can focus on the conversation rather than note-taking. This also helps us to continuously improve the quality of our interviews and your experience. This has no bearing on the assessment of you as a candidate and you can opt-out at any time, just let us know before your call.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
As more and more companies move onsite, remote opportunities are drying up.




However, if you're a Data Analyst this organisation will offer fully remote to those living in the UK!




They are a UK based SaaS company, specialising in building software used by every size of organisation & industry imaginable - making them a very secure & financially stable outfit.




Their products also directly aid companies with reducing their carbon footprint, so this is a very eco-friendly business.




This Data Analyst position involves interpreting data, analysing results using statistical techniques, and providing ongoing reports, including visualisations.




You should have the following:




â€¢Bachelorâ€™s degree in Data Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Information Management, or a related field

â€¢Proven experience as a Data Analyst or in a similar role

â€¢Proficiency in SQL and experience with complex SQL queries

â€¢Strong knowledge of statistical techniques and concepts

â€¢Proficiency in using data analysis tools and software (e.g., Excel, Python, R)

â€¢Experience with data visualisation tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI) is a plus.




The salary for this Data Analyst role is Â£45,000 plus fully remote of course.




Please apply now or contact me - reuben@techmunity.io

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About CloudKubed:

CloudKubed is an innovative digital and cloud transformation consultancy. We are trusted by our customers to deliver significant technology transformation programmes within both the public and private sectors.

We're a down-to-earth team with a passion for delivering successful outcomes for our customers. As we continue to grow, we are looking for ambitious individuals who share our values and want to be a part of this exciting journey.

About the Job:

As a Data Analyst, you will join our technology team and play a vital role in delivering data-focused solutions to our clients. You will be proficient in analysing data, developing data models, and using industry-standard data analysis tools. You'll work with our clients and internal teams to define data analysis standards, practices, and common data models. You'll play a key part in driving the Technology and Data practice forward, providing thought leadership and support to others.

Key Responsibilities:


Analysis of complex data sets to identify tends, patterns, and insights.
Develop conceptual, logical, and physical data models from business processes.
Conduct business workshops to gather requirements and translate them into technical solutions.
Define and implement data analysis standards, practices, and common data models including data lineage, data ownership, and stewardship.
Use industry-standard data analysis tools to create visual representations of data.
Work collaboratively with clients and internal teams to ensure successful delivery of data solutions.
Provide thought leadership and support in data analysis.
Understanding of big data and data lake concepts, management of data life cycle, GDPR, ISO, FIHR



Requirements


Proven experience in data analysis with a strong understanding of conceptual, logical, and physical data models.
Ability to define analysis standards, practices, and common data models.
Proficiency in RDMBS architectures and the ability to synthesise complex data problems into logical models and physical solutions.
Strong knowledge of and experience with reporting packages, databases (SQL, etc.), and programming (XML, JavaScript, or ETL frameworks).
Knowledge of statistics and experience using statistical packages for analysing datasets (Excel, SPSS, SAS etc)
Capability to conduct business workshops and gather requirements.
Excellent data visualization skills with the ability to represent complex ideas graphically.
Experience in developing data models and data workflows, particularly in the finance sector.
Familiarity with a variety of data analysis approaches, tools, and model repositories.
Demonstrate the skills of python, pyspark, and MLOps , cognitive analysis


Desirable Requirements:


Experience working with a technology consultancy.
Strong knowledge of metadata management and related tools.
Strong interpersonal and communication skills
Microsoft Certified - Azure Data Fundamentals or similar
Adept at report writing and presenting findings.
Ability to work under pressure and meet tight deadlines.
Advanced troubleshooting skills.
Proficiency in tools such as PowerBi, Synapse, Tableau, BOXi, Erwin, Purview.
Experience working in the public sector.



Benefits

What we offer you:


10% Performance related bonus
Flexible & remote workingâ€¯
Private Healthcareâ€¯via our partner Vitality Health.
Training & Certificationsâ€¯
Regular events & meetupsâ€¯
You will be provided with training and the opportunities to grow your career within an exciting and ever-evolving industry.â€¯
Annual Leave 28 days per annum (+Bank Holidays)â€¯
Enhanced Company Sick Pay


We are committed to promoting equal opportunities in employment. You and any job applicants will receive equal treatment regardless of age, disability, gender reassignment, marital or civil partner status, pregnancy or maternity, race, nationality, ethnic or national origin, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation.

Title: Customer Data Analyst
Description:
Embark on an exciting journey with Virgin Red! As a Customer Data Analyst in the Virgin Red team, you'll be at the heart of our customer-focused revolution. This role isn't just about data analysis; it's about shaping the future of loyalty, marketing, and product development. Be the storyteller behind our data, empowering our business decisions with your insights.

Join us in this dynamic, diverse environment where your initiative and curiosity fuel innovation. Experience the thrill of meaningful work, flexible hours, and a range of benefits designed to enhance your professional and personal life. Discover the Virgin way â€“ where your dedication opens doors to endless opportunities.

Our Virgin Family

Join the Virgin Group â€“ a diverse collective driving change, enhancing customer experience, and having a blast. We're daring, disrupting industries from finance to space, united as part of the Virgin Family.

Virgin Red rewards customers who live the Virgin lifestyle. Earn Virgin Points across our vast partner network, unlocking everyday rewards and exclusive experiences. As the Virgin network hub, we foster deeper customer understanding, opening doors for partners. Bold, distinctive, customer-centric â€“ that's Virgin Red.

Tell me more


Enable the business to make decisions based on data driven insights by collating and analysing information from multiple sources and providing a logical and coherent story.
Build dashboards and maintain reports with metrics to help the business understand and optimise the programme, marketing activity and product development through a member-centric lens.
Work with the team to deliver analytical projects to understand loyalty, value, lifecycle, cross-group and omnichannel engagement.
Carry out ad hoc analysis and communicate findings in a concise and timely manner.


What Youâ€™ll Need


Experience in a similar role, or perhaps you may come from a BI Analyst or BI Developer position.
Visualisation fundamentals & tools, such as Tableau or Power BI
Experience building dashboards that enable business users to answer their own questions.
The ability to communicate complex results in a way that is easy for a variety of stakeholders to understand.
Experience running analysis to answer business questions by data mining, quantitative and statistical analysis with large volume customer data and/or web/app behavioural data.
Proficient coding skills in SQL (Python advantageous but not essential)
Initiative & curiosity - something doesnâ€™t look right in the numbers? Why is that?
Good commercial acumen and understanding of how to link business objectives to measurable KPIs and project briefs.


The extra details

Role type: Permanent

Location: London hub & your home space

Working hours: Full time - We embrace flexible working. Let us know what hours empower you to be at your best both professionally and personally, weâ€™ll try to find a perfect match for you and us.

Benefits: Dive into a fast-paced, evolving workspace, where your hard work and dedication is rewarded. Fancy unlimited holidays and weekly yoga? That's the Virgin way. We champion inclusion, wellbeing, and purposeful points strategies. Further benefits include flexible working, healthcare, dental schemes, pension contributions and an employee rewards scheme.

Closing date: 15 July 2024

Some of the attributes that define a Virgin person just canâ€™t be quantified in words. We pride ourselves on welcoming people from all walks of life, with all sorts of skill sets. Most recently, we successfully campaigned to add â€˜Dyslexic Thinkingâ€™ as a skill on LinkedIn. Any uniqueness is a strength and will be considered an asset to our workforce. If there is something you would like us to consider, to tailor the hiring process to the way you work best, please donâ€™t hesitate to let us know.â€¯

Excited to make each day rewarding? We'd love to learn more about you!

Title: HR Data and Reward Analyst
Description:
Job Description

Permanent, full time vacancy

Monday - Friday, 9am - 5pm (flexibility Required)

Life at Next


Â£30,000-Â£35,000 (dependent on experience)
Competitive bonus scheme
Â£450 per season clothing allowance
25% discount on Next merchandiseÂ·
Up to 15% off Brands including Nike, Adidas, Ted Baker, Converse & North Face
Up to 75% discount at our staff shops
Contributory pension scheme


Based within the large HR team at our flagship Elmsall Distribution Complex, we are looking for a HR Data and Reward Analyst to join us.

Next is one of the UKâ€™s best known high-street retailers and one of the most established online. Behind the scenes we are at the cutting edge of Warehousing and Logistics, employing more than 9000 people across our distribution centres.

Life at Next is full of variety and challenges but our continued success is dependent on the expertise, passion and adaptability of the teams across our distribution network.

Letâ€™s take it on!

Reporting into the HR Data Team Leader, the Data & Reward Analyst will be responsible for providing regular reports and data insights to various stakeholders across Next, along with a range of activities associated with people data.

This role will support the full project lifecycle; collecting business requirements, sourcing the relevant data and analysing this to provide key and actionable reports and insights. The range of current and upcoming projects is diverse and the HR Data & Reward Analyst will support on key people initiatives including salary benchmarking, employee bonus payments and HR people metrics,

Title: Data Engineer
Company: Change Digital â€“ Digital & Tech Recruitment
Description:
Data Engineer

Location â€“ Leeds

4 days from home â€“ 1 day in the office.




Change-Digital are working with a forward-thinking, modern approach Financial Services Client based in Leeds. The have a fast paced, energetic environment like a start-up but also have the financial security of a larger bank. They are a technology first business and have lots happening in tech.




This is a great opportunity to become a part of a growing Data Engineering team and play a vital role in executing our clients Technology strategy by guaranteeing data precision, uniformity, and dependability.




Role Responsibilities:




Ensuring the upkeep of current data pipelines by anticipating problems and promptly addressing any incidents with professionalism.
Creating new pipelines to meet business needs or to enhance the stability of the current system.
Collaborating with different departments within the business to establish the necessary criteria for upcoming projects, including requests for pipelines and ETL processes.
Taking charge of monitoring crucial operations and processes.




Desired qualifications & experience:




The ideal candidate will have extensive experience within Data Engineering and have a high level of knowledge in AWS and SQL.




Skilled in utilizing SQL databases like Postgres and Athena Presto SQL, with a strong proficiency in Python to construct, manage, and coordinate data pipelines throughout the organization.
Documentation and deployment - Capable of delivering changes in a structured way to guarantee that they undergo testing, approval, and deployment following established business procedures (using GitHub). Documentation needs to be both coherent and accessible to a broad range of audiences, including those with technical and non-technical backgrounds.







If you are looking for your next career move and have some of the skills listed above, please forward your latest CV for immediate consideration.

Title: Purchasing Data Analyst
Description:
Bradford

Â£28,000 - Â£32,000/annum

Our client is looking for a Purchasing Data Analyst that has a focus on creating files with pricing data, lead time, due dates and cost pricing. The ideal person will be data-minded and can identify areas of concerns or improvement.

Description

Ensure that prices are kept up to date and accurate, deal with all aspects of the stock database including verifying new stock records and inactivating and re-sourcing obsolete ones.

Produce reports covering product data, including, but not limited to, pricing, sales, stock levels and replenishment.

Market research on pricing position, collating findings and implementing change based on evidence.

Support wider Purchasing team with other tasks, such as handling internal queries, processing acknowledgments, resolving discrepancies and maintaining compliance paperwork.

Support the Purchasing Manager in line with the companyâ€™s purchasing cost reduction strategy.

Manipulate data in Excel to create files with clear pricing data. Maintain up to date system data for suppliers, lead time, due dates, batch sizes and cost pricing.

Administration support to purchasing team

Sharing best practice or identifying any areas of concern and opportunities for continuous improvement.

A successful Purchasing Data Analyst should have:

Computer literate with a working knowledge of Microsoft Word, Excel & PowerPoint.

A good knowledge of Microsoft Excel is essential.

Previous SAP experience is advantageous.

Basic understanding and use of currency conversions, Margin & Profitability.

Experience of managing and manipulating large amounts of data.

The Offer

Â£28,000 - Â£32,000 per annum.

25 days plus 8 statutory Bank Holidays.

Company pension scheme.

Company Sick Pay Scheme and Death in Service benefit.

DONSM

Title: Data Privacy Analyst (GDPR)
Description:
TransUnion's Job Applicant Privacy Notice

What We'll Bring

We Are TransUnion:

TransUnion is a major credit reference agency, and we offer specialist services in fraud, identity and risk management, automated decisioning and demographics. We support organisations across a variety of sectors including finance, retail, telecommunications, utilities, gaming, government and insurance.

What You'll Bring

We're looking for a Data Privacy Analyst to deliver data protection best practice, data governance, and data management.

Day To Day Youâ€™ll Be


Ensuring new and existing products/services comply with regulations, in particular the General Data Protection Regulations (GDPR).
Supporting with the preparation of risk assessments relating to data use, including Data Protection Impact Assessments (DPIAs), and Legitimate Interest Assessments (LIAs).
Reporting on risks, issues and performance to the Senior Data Privacy Manager.
Monitoring data incidents and assisting with investigation and root cause analysis.
Engaging with a range of stakeholders to improve data protection and data governance, and ensuring they are adequately supported in their roles as Data Stewards and Data Users.
Maintaining the data asset catalogue.
Helping to ensure the use of data assets adheres to the Data Governance Framework, relevant policies, standards and controls.
Serving as a point of escalation for data governance, data management, data quality and data use issues, working closely with stakeholders to improve the value of data assets, while maintaining compliance with regulations.


Essential Skills & Experience


Knowledge and understanding of the GDPR / Data Protection Act, as well as other relevant legislation and regulations.
Financial industry experience.
Strong interpersonal skills, with the ability to interact with a variety of technical and non-technical business stakeholders.
Ability to articulate a business issue without resorting to technical language.
Organisation and time management
Analytical and problem-solving capabilities.
Knowledge and experience of information life-cycle management.


Desirable Skills


Educated to degree level, or otherwise suitable experience
Privacy credentials (e.g. CIPP)


Impact You'll Make

Whatâ€™s In It For you?

At TransUnion you will be joining a friendly, forward thinking global business.

Benefits

As well as an excellent salary and bonus scheme or commission scheme (if joining our sales teams) our benefits package comes with:


26 daysâ€™ annual leave + bank holidays (increasing with service)
Global paid wellness days off + a bonus day off to celebrate your birthday.
A generous contributory pension scheme + access to the TransUnion Employee Stock Purchase Plan.
Private health care + a variety of physical, mental and financial fitness wellbeing programmes such as access to mindfulness tools.
Access to our diversity forums and communities so you can get involved in causes close to your heart.


TransUnion â€“ a Place To Grow

If thereâ€™s something on the list of essential / desirable skills that you canâ€™t quite tick off, donâ€™t let that put you off applying. We are open to exploring training and development opportunities for the right candidate to ensure you are successful.

We know imposter syndrome is real, lets confront it so we can continue to grow and thrive together

Flexibility At TU

We recognise that our people need the freedom to balance their day-to-day lives with their work. This is why weâ€™ve set out to create inclusive and flexible policies and practices for you to accommodate all your responsibilities and needs: children, family and beyond. If the role is advertised as full time, donâ€™t let this stop you from applying. Let us know if youâ€™re looking for a part time or flexible working arrangement and we can discuss this with you.

Additional Support

At TransUnion, weâ€™re committed to fostering an inclusive and diverse workplace where all individualâ€™s talents and perspectives are valued. When you apply for a position with us, youâ€™re not just joining a team, youâ€™re becoming part of a community that celebrates differences and embraces equality. We understand that everyone has different needs, which is why we offer a range of reasonable adjustments to our recruitment process. Please let us know if you require any reasonable adjustments to help you through the application process or to attend an interview with us by contacting ukrecruitment@transunion.com

Interview & Hiring Process

Most of our recruitment processes are virtual, so youâ€™ll get to know our hiring managers and teams over the phone and through video. If we need you to attend a physical in person interview your recruiter will inform you of this.

We do not accept any unsolicited CVâ€™s from recruitment agencies.â€¯ If you are a recruitment agency on our PSL our talent team will contact you directly should we require any assistance.

Find Out More About Life At TU UK

https://twitter.com/TransUnionUK

https://www.linkedin.com/company/transunion/life/

This is a hybrid position and involves regular performance of job responsibilities virtually as well as in-person at an assigned TU office location for a minimum of two days a week.

Join Our Team as a Business Reporting Analyst!




Do you want to work for a business who are rapidly expanding, passionate about progression and reward their employees for their hard work and successes?

This role will keep you on your toes and has a lot of elements to it. Here is a flavour of what youâ€™ll be doing day to day:

Generating Business reports for end-users and producing user-friendly reports for review

Technical understanding and experience with Fleet Management or Maintenance systems (Service Geeni preferable), AS400 database, CRM and call centre tools.

An ability to prioritise and multi-task, and work to tight deadlines.
Strong written and verbal communication skills.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Job Type

Permanent

Closing Date

26/07/2024

Schroders Personal Wealth aims to improve the way financial advice is offered, by making it more affordable, accessible and powerful for more people. We want to change lives for the better.

Schroders Personal Wealth aims to improve the way financial advice is offered, by making it more affordable, accessible and powerful for more people. We want to change lives for the better.

An exciting opportunity has arisen to join the Schroders Personal Wealth (SPW) Data Engineering team, based in Leeds city centre (hybrid). The role will be critical in delivering the Technology strategy for SPW, ensuring data quality, consistency, and reliability. Delivering this strategy will also provide ample development opportunities, in particular progressing our new Data Lakehouse and implementing an iPaaS solution throughout 2024.

Location | Leeds, West Yorkshire

Salary | Â£50,000 - Â£55,000

Key Responsibilities:


Maintenance of existing data pipelines; pre-empting issues and responding to any incidents in a timely, professional manner.
Development of new pipelines as per business requests or to stabilise the current operating environment.
Liaising with other areas across the business to help define requirements for new projects, including both pipeline and ETL requests.
Implementing and owning the monitoring on key processes.



Core Skills/Competencies


Languages - Expert in SQL (Postgres, Athena Presto SQL) and proficient in using Python to build, maintain and orchestrate data pipelines across the business.
Amazon AWS - Experience using a serverless approach primarily utilising Lambda Functions, Glue (Jobs, Crawlers, Catalogues), Step Functions, SNS (notifications), SQS (queue service) and S3 (object storage).
Data Engineering - Demonstrable experience (> 2 years) working within a Data Engineering function, building data pipelines in a cloud native environment with an in-depth understanding of best practice.
Communication skills - Able to communicate and engage with the business in a non-technical way to gather/replay requirements and ensure successful and timely delivery.
Documentation and deployment - Experience delivering in a controlled manner ensuring changes are tested, approved and deployed in accordance with agreed business protocols (GitHub). Documentation should be clear and easy to understand for all audiences (technical and non-technical).



Preferable But Not Essential


Infrastructure as Code (IAC) - Experience with Terraform (new/future infrastructure) and experience with CloudFormation (legacy infrastructure).
Integration Platform as a Service (iPaaS) â€“ Any experience working with an iPaaS would be preferable, particularly MuleSoft.



We understand not everyone will meet 100% of the requirements, however we encourage you to apply if you think your skills are a good fit for this role.

The Next Step...

Click on apply and complete your application. If you have any questions, please contact the Hiring Manager on this advert.

You belong hereâ€¦

At Schroders Personal Wealth, we embrace individuality and encourage diversity of identity, experience, and thought.

We actively strive for inclusive behaviours and actions across our company and our work, including making appropriate adjustments for disabilities, long-term health conditions or neurodiversities to ensure equal opportunities for all.

We understand not everyone will meet 100% of the requirements, however we encourage you to apply if you think your skills are a good fit for this role.

The Benefits And Perks...

In addition to a competitive salary, we offer these enticing benefits to employees:

Generous Holiday Entitlement: Enjoy 30 days of annual leave plus bank holidays, with the option to purchase 5 additional days.

Company Pension Contribution: A matched pension contribution of up to 15% of your base pay if you contribute 6%.

Additional Cash Allowance: Receive an extra 4% cash allowance that can fund various optional benefits, including Paid Sabbatical Leave, Dental Cover, Critical Illness Insurance, Gym Membership, or an electric/ULEV car.

Health & Wellbeing: We offer company-paid Private Medical Insurance, Life Insurance, and Health Screening.

Financial Advice: Access to free financial advice to help secure your financial future.

Car Allowance: Up to Â£9,000 annually if your role demands over 10,000 business miles a year.

Annual Bonus: Eligible after 3 monthsâ€™ service, based on company/individual performance.

To find out more go to https://www.spw.com/careers-at-spw/rewards-and-benefits

The Next Step...

To join a dynamic team and contribute to our mission of changing lives, click "Apply" to complete your application.

26/07/2024

Schroders Personal Wealth aims to improve the way financial advice is offered, by making it more affordable, accessible and powerful for more people. We want to change lives for the better.

Schroders Personal Wealth aims to improve the way financial advice is offered, by making it more affordable, accessible and powerful for more people. We want to change lives for the better.

An exciting opportunity has arisen to join the Schroders Personal Wealth (SPW) Data Engineering team, based in Leeds city centre (hybrid). The role will be critical in delivering the Technology strategy for SPW, ensuring data quality, consistency, and reliability. Delivering this strategy will also provide ample development opportunities, in particular progressing our new Data Lakehouse and implementing an iPaaS solution throughout 2024.

Location | Leeds, West Yorkshire

Salary | Â£50,000 - Â£55,000

Key Responsibilities:

  • Maintenance of existing data pipelines; pre-empting issues and responding to any incidents in a timely, professional manner.
  • Development of new pipelines as per business requests or to stabilise the current operating environment.
  • Liaising with other areas across the business to help define requirements for new projects, including both pipeline and ETL requests.
  • Implementing and owning the monitoring on key processes.


Core Skills/Competencies

  • Languages - Expert in SQL (Postgres, Athena Presto SQL) and proficient in using Python to build, maintain and orchestrate data pipelines across the business.
  • Amazon AWS - Experience using a serverless approach primarily utilising Lambda Functions, Glue (Jobs, Crawlers, Catalogues), Step Functions, SNS (notifications), SQS (queue service) and S3 (object storage).
  • Data Engineering - Demonstrable experience (> 2 years) working within a Data Engineering function, building data pipelines in a cloud native environment with an in-depth understanding of best practice.
  • Communication skills - Able to communicate and engage with the business in a non-technical way to gather/replay requirements and ensure successful and timely delivery.
  • Documentation and deployment - Experience delivering in a controlled manner ensuring changes are tested, approved and deployed in accordance with agreed business protocols (GitHub). Documentation should be clear and easy to understand for all audiences (technical and non-technical).


Preferable But Not Essential

  • Infrastructure as Code (IAC) - Experience with Terraform (new/future infrastructure) and experience with CloudFormation (legacy infrastructure).
  • Integration Platform as a Service (iPaaS) â€“ Any experience working with an iPaaS would be preferable, particularly MuleSoft.


We understand not everyone will meet 100% of the requirements, however we encourage you to apply if you think your skills are a good fit for this role.

The Next Step...

Click on apply and complete your application. If you have any questions, please contact the Hiring Manager on this advert.

You belong hereâ€¦

At Schroders Personal Wealth, we embrace individuality and encourage diversity of identity, experience, and thought.

We actively strive for inclusive behaviours and actions across our company and our work, including making appropriate adjustments for disabilities, long-term health conditions or neurodiversities to ensure equal opportunities for all.

We understand not everyone will meet 100% of the requirements, however we encourage you to apply if you think your skills are a good fit for this role.

The Benefits And Perks...

In addition to a competitive salary, we offer these enticing benefits to employees:

Generous Holiday Entitlement: Enjoy 30 days of annual leave plus bank holidays, with the option to purchase 5 additional days.

Company Pension Contribution: A matched pension contribution of up to 15% of your base pay if you contribute 6%.

Additional Cash Allowance: Receive an extra 4% cash allowance that can fund various optional benefits, including Paid Sabbatical Leave, Dental Cover, Critical Illness Insurance, Gym Membership, or an electric/ULEV car.

Health & Wellbeing: We offer company-paid Private Medical Insurance, Life Insurance, and Health Screening.

Financial Advice: Access to free financial advice to help secure your financial future.

Car Allowance: Up to Â£9,000 annually if your role demands over 10,000 business miles a year.

Annual Bonus: Eligible after 3 monthsâ€™ service, based on company/individual performance.

To find out more go to https://www.spw.com/careers-at-spw/rewards-and-benefits

The Next Step...

To join a dynamic team and contribute to our mission of changing lives, click "Apply" to complete your application.

You belong hereâ€¦

At Schroders Personal Wealth, we embrace individuality and encourage diversity of identity, experience, and thought.

We actively strive for inclusive behaviours and actions across our company and our work, including making appropriate adjustments for disabilities, long-term health conditions or neurodiversities to ensure equal opportunities for all.

Schroders Personal Wealth operates under the Senior Managers and Certification Regime as a solo-regulated firm and if this role is classed as a Certified Role under that regime you will be subject to enhanced vetting and will have a number of additional conduct and regulatory duties to adhere to, as well as certifying at least annually that you are fit and proper to perform this role.

Title: Data Visualisation Developer
Description:
Weâ€™re looking for a Data Visualisation Developer to join us in Bradford.

This is hybrid working â€“ 2 days in the office, 3 days remote.

As part of the continued growth and diversification of Liberty Shared Services (LSS), which acts as a centre of excellence with specialisms in Finance, Accounting, People and Legal, we are looking to hire the role of Data Visualisation Developer, to support Google Cloud Platform (GCP) activity across various OpCo brands, such as Virgin Media O2 and Atlas Edge.

As an ambitious, dynamic and experienced Data Visualisation Developer, you will fully utilise your experience in GCP, Python and dbt to develop and maintain scalable Looker dashboards and reports, that integrate with various data sources. You will collaborate closely with Data Engineers, Analysts, and various stakeholders to deliver actionable insights that drive business decisions and enhance our data capabilities.

As we become world leaders in redefining the shared services market through our technology-led transformation, there has never been a better time to join Liberty Global, where as a Data Visualisation Developer you would be ideally suited with proven experience in a similar role with a desire to develop your career with a global market leader.

What will you be doing?



You will leverage your expertise in data visualisation to design and implement data models, create and manage LookML projects, where your experience with GCP will be crucial in managing and optimizing our cloud infrastructure.
Fully utilising your skills in Python and dbt, you will build robust data transformation workflows, develop and maintain Looker dashboards and reports, and design and implement efficient and scalable data models.
You will integrate Looker with various data sources and ensure the consistency, quality and reliability of data across all reports and dashboards, as well as troubleshoot and resolve issues related to pipelines and implementations.
Staying updated with the latest industry trends and best practices in data analytics and visualization, you will implement new ways of working across your areas of responsibility.


We Tend To Look For People With



Proven experience as a Data Visualisation Developer, Data Visualisation Engineer, BI Developer, or similar.
Strong proficiency in Looker and LookML, although PowerBI and Tableau specialists with the appetite to learn Looker and LookML will also be considered.
A solid understanding of Google Cloud Platform (GCP) and its services.
Proficient in Python for data manipulation and scripting.
Strong SQL skills and experience with relational databases.
Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills.
The ability to work collaboratively in a team environment and communicate effectively with stakeholders.
Familiarity with version control systems like Git.


Whatâ€™s in it for you?



Competitive salary
25 days annual leave with the option to purchase 5 more
Access to well-being and mental health benefits such as the Calm app, personal medical, critical illness cover and dental insurance
Matched pension contribution up to 10%
Access to our car benefit scheme
Access to our online learning platform to continue to develop and grow your career with us
The chance to join an innovative, fast-paced and passionate team


Who We Are

Weâ€™re building Tomorrowâ€™s Connections Today, bringing people together through the power of our technology.

Liberty Global is a world leader in converged broadband, video and mobile communications and an active investor in cutting-edge infrastructure, content and technology ventures.

With our investments in fibre-based and 5G networks, we play a vital role in society, currently providing over 85 million fixed and mobile connections and rolling out the next generation of products and services, while readying our networks for 10 Gbps and beyond.

Weâ€™re creating national champions, combining the best broadband and mobile networks under brands such as Virgin Media-02 in the UK, VodafoneZiggo in The Netherlands, Telenet in Belgium, Sunrise in Switzerland, Virgin Media in Ireland and UPC in Slovakia.

Liberty Global Ventures, our global investment arm, has a portfolio of more than 75 companies and funds across content, technology and infrastructure, including strategic stakes in ITV, Univision, Plume, Lionsgate and the Formula E racing series.

Our scale enables us to transfer knowledge and expertise across our operations and investments, creating a dynamic family of brands united in the pursuit of innovation and excellence.

And weâ€™re prioritising diversity, equity and inclusion in our workplace and communities while reducing our impact on the environment. We are using technology as a force for good, for our people, our partners and the planet.

Liberty Global is an equal-opportunity employer. We embrace diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for our people. We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process.

Weâ€™re 100% committed to having a workforce that represents every part of our society. So, weâ€™re keen to hear from candidates of all backgrounds and circumstances.

If your application is successful, your personal data may be used for a pre-employment screening check, which will be performed by a 3rd party provider (Sterling), on behalf of Liberty Global. Depending on the vacancy and applicable law, a pre-employment screening may include employment history, qualifications, contact information, right to work, and other information (such as media information) that may be necessary for determining your qualifications and suitability for the position.

You can read more about how we process your data here Privacy & Security Policy - Liberty Global, and If you wish to exercise your privacy rights please contact: Peopleservices@Libertyglobal.com

Title: Digital Forensic Analyst
Company: MD5 Ltd - evidence you can trust
Description:
MD5 Limited, based in Normanton, West Yorkshire are excited to announce the opportunity for a Digital Forensic Analyst(s) to join one of the UKâ€™s leading digital\ eForensic organisations.

Our clients include Law Enforcement and Government Agencies, Corporate and Legal firms. Casework may involve dealing with data of a sensitive nature which may be offensive and distressing (e.g. Images of Child abuse).

The role will cover all aspects of digital forensics\eforensics and the successful candidate will be responsible for acquiring & investigating a wide range of electronic evidence.

Desired Key Skills:

â€¢ Have excellent knowledge of digital hardware, experience in different file systems & operating systems artefacts;

â€¢ Knowledge of the laws & principles of computer forensics & electronic evidence

â€¢ Be meticulous, have a highly analytical and enquiring mind, excellent communication skills and able to convey complex technical issues to a lay audience in writing & verbally

â€¢ Familiarity with forensic softwareÂ 

â€¢ Able to work independently but also as a good team player

In return MD5 offers:

â€¢ Long term career prospects & personal development

â€¢ Good working environment

â€¢ Competitive salary

â€¢ Pension scheme

Appointments are subject to successful security vetting criteria and medical clearance.

MD5 is an equal opportunities employer and is particularly eager to encourage staff progression and development.

Please email your CV with a covering letter to Geoff@md5.uk.com

Title: Online Data Analyst
Description:
TELUS International AI-Data Solutions partners with a diverse and vibrant community to help our customers enhance their AI and machine learning models. The work of our AI Community contributes to improving technology and the digital experiences of many people around the world. Our AI Community works in our proprietary AI training platform handling all data types (text, images, audio, video and geo) across 500+ languages and dialects. We offer flexible work-from-home opportunities for people with passion for languages. The jobs are part-time, and there is no fixed schedule. Whoever you are, wherever you come from, come join our global AI community.




We are hiring freelance (English speaking) Online Data Analysts for a project aimed at improving the content and quality of digital maps, which are used by millions of users globally. The job would suit someone who is detail-oriented, likes doing research and has a good knowledge of national and local geography.




This is a freelance position on a flexible schedule - you can work in your own time whenever work is available. You will be completing research and evaluation tasks in a web-based environment, eg verifying and comparing data, determining the relevance and accuracy of information. You will be provided with guidelines for each task, which need to be followed. The project offers a variety of tasks, and work is paid per task.




Requirements

Full Professional Proficiency in English
You must be living in the United Kingdom the last 2 consecutive years
Ability to follow guidelines and do research online using search engines, online maps and website information
You must have familiarity with current and historical business, media, sport, news, social media and cultural affairs in United Kingdom
Being open to work across a diverse set of Task Types (e.g. Maps, News, Audio tasks, Relevance)
Applicants must be 18 years or over.




Working on this project will require you to go through a standard recruitment process (including passing an open book assessment). This is a long-term project and your work will occasionally be subject to quality assurance checks.




Why Join the TELUS International AI Community?

Earn additional income with flexible hours to fit your lifestyle
Better work-life balance
Be your own boss
Complimentary Well-Being package encompassing a wealth of well-being resources.
Be part of an online community




Payment

Rate of pay per task is inclusive of reading task guidelines. Payment will be issued in accordance with the terms of the contributor agreement upon successful completion of tasks.

Whatâ€™s next?

If this sounds like a role youâ€™d be interested in taking on, please apply below.

https://jobs.telusinternational.com/en_US/careers/PipelineDetail/Online-Data-Analyst-United-Kingdom/21429

Title: Pricing/Insight Analyst
Description:
Are you experienced in analysing market trends? Proficient in Excel and confident in presenting data? Are you looking to advance your data analytics career with an employer who values their team? One that's been awarded 'Large Business of the Year' at the Yorkshire Post's Excellence in Business Awards? If so, then you're in the right place!

Zenith is an award winning, market leader in the fleet industry, and we're thrilled to offer an exciting opportunity for a Pricing/Insights Analyst to join Our Pricing & Risk team. This position is a chance to be at the forefront of providing critical data and insights that drive decision-making processes. For over 30 years, Zenith has been at the pinnacle of offering intelligent vehicle solutions in the UK, making it a distinguished and innovative employer in the field.

You will be our specialist in conducting in-depth analyses to set vehicle residual values, providing insights to both the Client Relationship Team and Zenith's valued customers. Your work will have visibility at the highest levels, including presenting your findings at quarterly committee meetings to board members. The role offers significant opportunities for personal and professional growth, including travel to manufacturers and occasional international trips, making it an ideal setting for an ambitious candidate looking to make a meaningful impact in their career.

What's the Role?


Deliver analysis into market trends to assist the business with setting accurate Residual Value (RV) and Maintenance (SMR) budgets.
Manage a relationship between Zenith and our key Manufacturers & Data providers.
Attend Manufacturer car launches and gather data to identify potential risks & opportunities.
Presenting data at RV and SMR committees
Provide accurate and detailed analysis of key market trends to enable data driven decisions to be made within Risk Committees
Analyse data and make recommendations for New Business tenders and large adhoc queries.
Provide key analysis with people in all areas and levels of the business.


What can you offer?

This position is made for someone with experience of market trends analysis of large sets of data. If you have a track record of producing detailed reports and feel confident in presenting to senior management, this could be the perfect next step in your career. Zenith values proactive people who are not just thinkers but doers - those willing to bring fresh ideas to the table and drive improvements.

The good stuffâ€¦benefits!


Salary up to Â£35,000
Company car/Annual car allowance
Company Bonus on top of salary
Agile working / Hybrid working after successful probation period.
24 days holiday, which increases with length of employment
Your birthday off!
A great pension contribution by Zenith (6.25%)
Private Medical Insurance as standard
Life Cover
Access to our own Zenith GP â€“ on site and virtual for self and immediate family
Massages on site
Zenith AA breakdown cover
Excellent referral scheme if you recommend a friend to us
Sports and Social club - Company/Team activities
Free parking
Onsite bistro
Equality, Diversity & Inclusion networks
Perks at Work â€“ save money on everyday essentials with access to shopping discounts


Flexible Benefits Include


Buy / Sell Holidays
Critical Illness cover
Dental Cove r
Cash Plan
Cycle to Work Scheme
Tech scheme
Season ticket loans


So, if you want to be part of a great team, in a busy, profitable, growing company, then what are you waiting for? We can't wait to hear from you!

We want to positively encourage differences in Zenith and believe it is critical to our success as a company. Zenith is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace that seeks to recruit, develop and retain the most talented people from a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. We therefore encourage applications from all genders, races, religions, ages and sexual orientations, as well as parents, veterans, people living with disabilities, and any other groups that could bring diverse perspectives to our business.

#zenspot

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
The role will be critical in ensuring data quality, consistency, and reliability for SPW. The role will also provide ample development opportunities, in particular progressing our new Data Lakehouse and implementing an iPaaS solution.

Location | Leeds, West Yorkshire

Salary | Â£50,000 - Â£55,000

Key Responsibilities


Maintenance of existing data pipelines; pre-empting issues and responding to any incidents in a timely, professional manner.
Development of new pipelines as per business requests or to stabilise the current operating environment.
Liaising with other areas across the business to help define requirements for new projects, including both pipeline and ETL requests.
Implementing and owning the monitoring on key processes.


Core Skills/Competencies


Languages - Expert in SQL (Postgres, Athena Presto SQL) and proficient in using Python to build, maintain and orchestrate data pipelines across the business.
Amazon AWS - Experience using a serverless approach primarily utilising Lambda Functions, Glue (Jobs, Crawlers, Catalogues), Step Functions, SNS (notifications), SQS (queue service) and S3 (object storage).
Data Engineering - Demonstrable experience (> 2 years) working within a Data Engineering function, building data pipelines in a cloud native environment with an in-depth understanding of best practice.
Communication skills - Able to communicate and engage with the business in a non-technical way to gather/replay requirements and ensure successful and timely delivery.
Documentation and deployment - Experience delivering in a controlled manner ensuring changes are tested, approved and deployed in accordance with agreed business protocols (GitHub). Documentation should be clear and easy to understand for all audiences (technical and non-technical).


Preferable But Not Essential


Infrastructure as Code (IAC) - Experience with Terraform (new/future infrastructure) and experience with CloudFormation (legacy infrastructure).
Integration Platform as a Service (iPaaS) - Any experience working with an iPaaS would be preferable, particularly MuleSoft.


We understand not everyone will meet 100% of the requirements, however we encourage you to apply if you think your skills are a good fit for this role.

The Next Step

To join a dynamic team and contribute to our mission of changing lives, click 'Apply' to complete your application.

You Belong Here

At SPW, we embrace individuality and encourage diversity of identity, experience, and thought. We actively strive for inclusive behaviours across our company and our work, including making appropriate adjustments for disabilities, long-term health conditions, or neurodiversities to ensure equal opportunities for all.

Benefits And Perks

In addition to a competitive salary, we offer these enticing benefits to employees:

Generous Holiday Entitlement: Enjoy 30 days of annual leave plus bank holidays, with the option to purchase 5 additional days.

Company Pension Contribution: A matched pension contribution of up to 15% of your base pay if you contribute 6%.

Additional Cash Allowance: Receive an extra 4% cash allowance that can fund various optional benefits, including Paid Sabbatical Leave, Dental Cover, Critical Illness Insurance, Gym Membership, or an electric/ULEV car.

Health & Wellbeing: We offer company-paid Private Medical Insurance, Life Insurance, and Health Screening.

Financial Advice: Access to free financial advice to help secure your financial future.

Annual Bonus: Eligible after 3 months' service, based on company/individual performance.
Show more
HTML:
The role will be critical in ensuring data quality, consistency, and reliability for SPW. The role will also provide ample development opportunities, in particular progressing our new Data Lakehouse and implementing an iPaaS solution.

Location | Leeds, West Yorkshire

Salary | Â£50,000 - Â£55,000

Key Responsibilities

  • Maintenance of existing data pipelines; pre-empting issues and responding to any incidents in a timely, professional manner.
  • Development of new pipelines as per business requests or to stabilise the current operating environment.
  • Liaising with other areas across the business to help define requirements for new projects, including both pipeline and ETL requests.
  • Implementing and owning the monitoring on key processes.

Core Skills/Competencies

  • Languages - Expert in SQL (Postgres, Athena Presto SQL) and proficient in using Python to build, maintain and orchestrate data pipelines across the business.
  • Amazon AWS - Experience using a serverless approach primarily utilising Lambda Functions, Glue (Jobs, Crawlers, Catalogues), Step Functions, SNS (notifications), SQS (queue service) and S3 (object storage).
  • Data Engineering - Demonstrable experience (> 2 years) working within a Data Engineering function, building data pipelines in a cloud native environment with an in-depth understanding of best practice.
  • Communication skills - Able to communicate and engage with the business in a non-technical way to gather/replay requirements and ensure successful and timely delivery.
  • Documentation and deployment - Experience delivering in a controlled manner ensuring changes are tested, approved and deployed in accordance with agreed business protocols (GitHub). Documentation should be clear and easy to understand for all audiences (technical and non-technical).

Preferable But Not Essential

  • Infrastructure as Code (IAC) - Experience with Terraform (new/future infrastructure) and experience with CloudFormation (legacy infrastructure).
  • Integration Platform as a Service (iPaaS) - Any experience working with an iPaaS would be preferable, particularly MuleSoft.

We understand not everyone will meet 100% of the requirements, however we encourage you to apply if you think your skills are a good fit for this role.

The Next Step

To join a dynamic team and contribute to our mission of changing lives, click 'Apply' to complete your application.

Title: Junior Developer
Description:
Purpose




At MQube, we're passionate about innovation and technology. We're a dynamic and innovative FinTech company committed to creating cutting-edge products that meet the diverse needs of our clientele. Our goal is to push the boundaries of technology and deliver exceptional solutions to our customers. We're excited to invite a highly motivated Junior Developer to join our team.

Â 

As a Junior Developer at MQube, you will be crucial in developing and enhancing our software products. We're looking for individuals genuinely interested in computers, engineering, and building products that people love. Your passion, drive to solve problems, and ability to think critically are more important to us than your specific programming skills.

Â 

Job Role Accountabilities




Work closely with stakeholders to understand business requirements and help translate these into technical requirements for other team members.
Identify and develop solutions to system problems and test their suitability

Â 

Examples of Key Activities




Collaborate with senior engineers and product managers to understand project requirements and objectives
Participate in the design, development, and testing of software products using languages such as Go, C#, Java, TypeScript, or other relevant languages.
Write clean, efficient, and maintainable code in your chosen language.
Contribute to product feature brainstorming and creativity.
Assist in optimizing and fine-tuning software applications for performance.
Stay up-to-date with the latest industry trends and technologies through research.
Troubleshoot and resolve software defects and issues.
Provide support for product deployment and post-launch activities.




Key Relationships




CTO Close working

Graduate Developers Close working

Senior Developers Close working




Corporate Accountabilities




Ensuring conduct which is consistently and continuously in accordance with FCA Regulations
Always acting with integrity and ensuring all customers are treated fairly.
Complete all mandatory training as and when required.
Consistent adherence to and understanding of all policies, procedures, and obligations of the firm as part of its first line of defense of the firm.




Qualification, Skills, Knowledge and Experience




Essential

A Level or equivalent in IT

Minimum C-grade in both English and mathematics

Desirable

Any STEM subjects




Skills and Knowledge

A genuine interest in computers, engineering, and building products that people love.
Strong problem-solving skills, critical thinking, and a passion for solving complex challenges.
Excellent communication and teamwork abilities.
Eagerness to learn and adapt to new technologies and concepts.
High attention to detail and a commitment to producing high-quality work.
Minimum of a C-grade in both English and Mathematics or equivalent qualifications. Higher grades are preferred.

Â 

Additional Skills (Preferred)

Familiarity with software development tools and frameworks in your chosen language.
Experience with version control systems (e.g., Git).
Knowledge of data structures and algorithms.
Understanding of user experience (UX) principles.
Experience with web development, mobile app development, or other software domains.

Â 

Benefits

Competitive salary.
Training and mentorship opportunities.
A friendly and collaborative work environment.
Career advancement possibilities.
Health and wellness benefits.
Flexible work hours and remote work options, with an expectation of spending a reasonable amount of time in our Leeds office.

Â 

Education Opportunity

Â 

We are excited to offer our Junior Developers the opportunity to further their education and skills through a Level 6 Digital and Technology Solutions apprenticeship. This apprenticeship program will be conducted in partnership with either Leeds Beckett University or Sheffield Hallam University, providing you with valuable academic and practical experience. We are committed to supporting your professional development and growth.

Â 

How to Apply

Â 

If you have a genuine interest in computers, engineering, and building products that people love, along with a passion for solving problems, and have achieved a minimum of a C-grade in both English and Mathematics, we encourage you to apply for the Junior Developer position at MQube. To apply, please send your resume detailing your qualifications and motivation for this role to jo.liggett@mqube.com

Â 

MQube is an equal-opportunity employer, and we welcome candidates from all backgrounds to apply.

Purpose


At MQube, we're passionate about innovation and technology. We're a dynamic and innovative FinTech company committed to creating cutting-edge products that meet the diverse needs of our clientele. Our goal is to push the boundaries of technology and deliver exceptional solutions to our customers. We're excited to invite a highly motivated Junior Developer to join our team.

 

As a Junior Developer at MQube, you will be crucial in developing and enhancing our software products. We're looking for individuals genuinely interested in computers, engineering, and building products that people love. Your passion, drive to solve problems, and ability to think critically are more important to us than your specific programming skills.

 

Job Role Accountabilities


  • Work closely with stakeholders to understand business requirements and help translate these into technical requirements for other team members.
  • Identify and develop solutions to system problems and test their suitability

 

Examples of Key Activities


  • Collaborate with senior engineers and product managers to understand project requirements and objectives
  • Participate in the design, development, and testing of software products using languages such as Go, C#, Java, TypeScript, or other relevant languages.
  • Write clean, efficient, and maintainable code in your chosen language.
  • Contribute to product feature brainstorming and creativity.
  • Assist in optimizing and fine-tuning software applications for performance.
  • Stay up-to-date with the latest industry trends and technologies through research.
  • Troubleshoot and resolve software defects and issues.
  • Provide support for product deployment and post-launch activities.


Key Relationships


CTO Close working

Graduate Developers Close working

Senior Developers Close working


Corporate Accountabilities


  • Ensuring conduct which is consistently and continuously in accordance with FCA Regulations
  • Always acting with integrity and ensuring all customers are treated fairly.
  • Complete all mandatory training as and when required.
  • Consistent adherence to and understanding of all policies, procedures, and obligations of the firm as part of its first line of defense of the firm.


Qualification, Skills, Knowledge and Experience


Essential

A Level or equivalent in IT

Minimum C-grade in both English and mathematics

Desirable

Any STEM subjects


Skills and Knowledge

  • A genuine interest in computers, engineering, and building products that people love.
  • Strong problem-solving skills, critical thinking, and a passion for solving complex challenges.
  • Excellent communication and teamwork abilities.
  • Eagerness to learn and adapt to new technologies and concepts.
  • High attention to detail and a commitment to producing high-quality work.
  • Minimum of a C-grade in both English and Mathematics or equivalent qualifications. Higher grades are preferred.

 

Additional Skills (Preferred)

  • Familiarity with software development tools and frameworks in your chosen language.
  • Experience with version control systems (e.g., Git).
  • Knowledge of data structures and algorithms.
  • Understanding of user experience (UX) principles.
  • Experience with web development, mobile app development, or other software domains.

 

Benefits

  • Competitive salary.
  • Training and mentorship opportunities.
  • A friendly and collaborative work environment.
  • Career advancement possibilities.
  • Health and wellness benefits.
  • Flexible work hours and remote work options, with an expectation of spending a reasonable amount of time in our Leeds office.

 

Education Opportunity

 

We are excited to offer our Junior Developers the opportunity to further their education and skills through a Level 6 Digital and Technology Solutions apprenticeship. This apprenticeship program will be conducted in partnership with either Leeds Beckett University or Sheffield Hallam University, providing you with valuable academic and practical experience. We are committed to supporting your professional development and growth.

 

How to Apply

 

If you have a genuine interest in computers, engineering, and building products that people love, along with a passion for solving problems, and have achieved a minimum of a C-grade in both English and Mathematics, we encourage you to apply for the Junior Developer position at MQube. To apply, please send your resume detailing your qualifications and motivation for this role to jo.liggett@mqube.com

 

MQube is an equal-opportunity employer, and we welcome candidates from all backgrounds to apply.

Title: Business Systems Support Analyst
Description:
Location - Dewsbury

On-site, Permanent

We are a leading temporary works specialist and have been at the forefront of our industry for over 60 years, with a reputation built on engineering and service excellence. We deliver the right temporary works solution for our customers, whatever the scale or complexity of the project. Our customers include civil engineering and construction contractors, asset owners, and consulting engineering firms through to small builders.

We are currently looking for a Business Systems Support Analyst to support our growing IT team, this is a fantastic role that will allow the successful candidate to upskill and develop through the company, you will find more details below.

Benefits


A competitive basic salary
Company bonus scheme
Great health and well-being packages
A fantastic pension scheme


Key Responsibilities


Investigate, analyse and provide solutions to issues identified within software and ensure issue is managed through to conclusion.
Conduct root cause analysis and implement corrective actions to prevent future occurrences of technical issues.
Provide technical support to end-users.
Define and Prioritise development tasks and pipeline.
Configuration and administration of core systems.
Ensure Incident, Problem and Change Management processes are followed to ensure efficient and effective resolution of technical issues and provide a first class service to the business and its customers.
Conduct systems testing and ensure the quality of business systems, including testing new software releases and patches.
Develop and maintain technical documentation, knowledgebase articles and training materials.
Help with technical solution designs and integrations.


What You Need


Minimum of 2 years supporting ERP and/or CRM systems
Advanced SQL (Structured Query Language)
Microsoft Office applications
Attention to detail
Written and Verbal communication skills
Ability to work independently and as part of a team


Interview Process


Initial telephone / Microsoft Teams call, the line manager or Human Resources may conduct this
Interview â€“ In person, held by the line manager
Final Stage â€“ JOB OFFER!


Environmental Social & Governance

Our ESG (Environmental, Social and Governance) strategy is brought to life through our ESG Champions situated throughout the company, our champions create solutions for the hottest topics in each area of our strategy. We are always looking for more recruits, if successful in securing a role at Mabey Hire Ltd, you could be a future ESG Championâ€¦

Mabey Hire STEM Education Programme

In 90 minute after-school clubs, our team of STEM Ambassadors help children aged 10-13 improve their awareness and perceptions of the engineering and construction sectors. Using LEGOÂ® Education materials and our bespoke â€˜mission mat,â€™ students explore six core topics which challenge their mathematical, problem solving and strategic thinking skills.

Now you know whatâ€™s on offer, if you are interested in this position or require more information, please contact Sean Kildunne at Mabey Hire Ltd - recruitment@mabeyhire.co.uk

Title: Senior Data & Analytics Engineer
Description:
At Jet2.com and Jet2holidays weâ€™re working together to deliver an amazing journey, literally! We work together to really drive forward a â€˜Customer Firstâ€™ ethos, creating unforgettable package holidays and flights. We couldnâ€™t do it without our wonderful people.

As our new Senior Data and Analytics Engineer, youâ€™ll have a major impact on helping us achieve our goal. You will work as part of a multi-disciplinary, agile, data delivery team focused on the delivery of innovative, robust, and efficient data solutions to complex business problems. You will work alongside a team of passionate data professionals including other data and analytics engineers, test engineers, data scientists and data visualisation specialists

Youâ€™re probably now asking: Whatâ€™s in it for me? As our Senior Data and Analytics Engineer, youâ€™ll have access to a wide range of benefits including:


Remote working
Annual pay reviews
Access to a generous discretionary profit share scheme



Donâ€™t just take our word for it check our reviews on Glassdoor!

What Youâ€™ll Be Doing


Youâ€™ll be responsible for delivery of complex data solutions including the ingest of data from a wide variety of data sources into our analytics platforms (typically cloud-based but some work on our on-premise data analytics platforms)
Youâ€™ll drive a data-first culture both within the data team and across the business by supporting continual learning and development within your team and data enablement activity across the wider business.
You will demonstrate a passion for data and encourage a similar passion within your team. As part of a data-first culture you may also be involved in supporting production data assets (not on a first-line basis).
Cleansing of data and modelling of data into our enterprise data warehouse for consumption by both technical users and non-technical business users



What Youâ€™ll Have


Youâ€™ll have a strong understanding of SQL and be comfortable reading and writing complex SQL queries
Ideally, youâ€™ll have experience working on the design and data modelling stages of data warehouse projects and be comfortable with conceptual, logical and physical data modelling techniques as well as dimensional modelling techniques
Experience using cloud data warehouse technology would be beneficial - Snowflake (preferred), Google BigQuery, AWS Redshift or Azure Synapse
Youâ€™ll have experience working with data from a wide variety of data sources including different database platforms, flat files, APIâ€™s and event-driven data feeds



Join us as we redefine travel experiences and create memories for millions of passengers. At Jet2.com and Jet2holidays, your potential has no limits. Apply today and let your career take flight!

Title: Infrastructure Engineer
Description:
Infrastructure Engineer

Hybrid working - West Yorkshire/North of England (Occasional site visits required)

Competitive Salary




We are currently looking for an Infrastructure Engineer for a client going through a complete IT and Infrastructure transformation. You will be joining an established and close knit team of Analysts and Engineers, not just keeping the lights on but helping them completely upgrade to a modern day infrastructure estate. Some examples of the projects that they are undertaking are:




On Prem to Cloud (Azure)
Migration onto Office 365
Moving onto Azure AD
Moving onto SD WAN (Next generation Networks)
VOIP / Telephony upgrades and implementation
MFA
Enhancements to Security and anti-virus/spam




The successful applicant will have experience in the below;

2-4+ years as 3rd Line/Infrastructure Engineer or Analyst.
Expert across Windows OS, including strong MS Exchange and Office 365 experience.
On Prem and (ideally) exposure to Cloud hosted Infrastructure and Applications (Azure).
Experience/Exposure to other Tech (Including but not limited to); Active Directory, Anti-spam, Anti virus, Server management, DR planning and execution, file serve management, patching, hardware management, database ops, network design, MS 365 and more.
Familiar or ITIL Certified.
Excellent communication skills and stakeholder/3rd party management.




They are looking for passionate, can-do, positive people, that love working with technology, have a real passion for devices, equipment and fixing problems. Someone who wants to take the initiative to find solutions.




If youâ€™d like to hear more then please get in touch!




Please note the client DO NOT currently offer sponsorship for this position.
